Ratings.comment: would not take again. grades too heavily and pretests are not helpful for midterm.
He asks your oppenion on a subject and then grades based on HIS oppenion, not questions from the book.

Took this as an online class.  Not very helpful, most of the grades on the assignments were based on his opinion of your opinion not any facts or from readings.  Just read textbook, answer questions online, do his quick quizzes and you will be fine.  Exams are easy.

This professor would not allow me to sign up for her class because I have a disability. I am registered with the disabilities services office at OSU and have gained clearance to have my classes recorded so I may attend them remotely. She refused to do this and told me I could not take the class. Professor Kammi Schmeer discriminates!

If you get the option to not to take her, go with that. Her lectures are mainly her spin off to most everything she talks about. Very boring class. Forced group work that doesn't reinforce anything related to class.

I really enjoyed this professor. She was very clear in lectures. Very nice lady. I thought it was an easy class and i never did any of the readings. I just went to class. I would take another one of her classes.

This lady was awful. her class was 100% her spin on things, even if she stated it against statistics. She is the most female biased teacher there is. Her class is easy to the point of making you feel stupid, she missed class without informing anyone, and regularly showed up late. terrible

This lady is the worst. She failed me because she "lost" my exam and told me I had to find it. Uh... With no way of proving I had taken the exam (& no opportunity to retake it), she failed me. The class was so easy & it's so embarrassing that I got an E in it. Rude.

She was a good professor. She allowed ample room for questions and comments during her lectures, which was great for some light discussion. You should keep up with the readings because they reinforce main ideas and some are on the tests. Grading was very fair...not difficult to get a good grade if you put in the effort.

She was an amazing teacher!  I would not say it was an easy A, you have to earn your grade, but she made the class very interesting.  Her lectures are engaging, and she shows a few videos, and has some guest speakers come in.  You need to buy both books, and READ them both, but you will feel like you learned a ton by the end of the quarter!
I thought she was really nice, the reading questions were helpful to study for exams and they are not comprehensive.

I would give a 5 star. His class is very easy, consists of only papers, but one thing is he was not prompt with responding to emails all of the time, and the papers were for completion so it was a lot of hard work for no reason.

Lectures were recorded; really interesting, but lengthy. Weekly discussion board posts take up a good chunk of your time -- do a little each day. Quizzes and exams are simple and go over topics said in lecture. There are 5 big assignments throughout the semester -- easy, but time-consuming. All in all an easy class, just devote your time to it.

I loved this class. As an asynchronous, online class, it was very well organized. Lectures and the class, in general, were super interesting in my opinion. There are weekly discussion posts and quizzes. There are also 5-6 "assignments" you complete over the course of the semester that are pretty simple. Overall an easy but interesting class.

Same assignment schedule week by week. Easy-to-follow content and lectures. She is very good with responding to questions and concerns throughout the class as well. Do the readings, even though some are a little too long, in my opinion, and watch the videos and you'll be fine. I'm able to get the assignments for the week done in about 3 hours.

Dr. Klainot Hess was super helpful. Fast response times on email but you do have to do some work for this class. Always manageable though and the quizzes weren't hard just had to make sure you did all the materials.

She formatted this class so well for an online course during a pandemic, I really respect her for that. I was rarely confused on anything because she was so straightforward and thorough with concepts. The midterm and final are pretty easy if you use the study guide and learn your vocab terms, quizzes as well! I enjoyed watching the videos she links

Dr. Klainot-Hess could not have done a better job carrying out this course during these difficult times. While the content is not necessarily easy in itself, she made the work as straightforward as possible. Strongly recommend.

I'm in this class right now and its super easy... attendance does count (you can only miss 2 classes until your grade lowers), but besides that the course content is pretty interesting and shes soooo chill. Super easy A class :) Only thing that could be better is that sometimes in class she talks too fast and its hard to write down notes
Inflexible and uncaring.
Rachel is just a TA but she made this class much easier to get through! If you get her you will do fine

Edwards made a mistake in my grades, I asked her about it, she said she would fix it and then never did. She also assigns massive writing assignments for no reason. Didnt feel like a learned much, she just likes assigning work.

Dr. Little Edwards is the best professor Ive ever had. She is so interesting and engaging and focuses a lot on class discussion, which I loved. I got close to many people in the class and learned a lot about them in our discussion. Dr. Little Edwards is insightful, thoughtful, and passionate. I would take any class she teaches.

This class stressed me out the entire semester! Your grade is based on the midterm, final, a book report, and a research project. There are a ton of reading assignments due before each class and you are expected to participate in class discussions over the readings, so be prepared to talk. This class requires a lot of work, but it's doable.

Ive taken many tough classes and am not afraid to work hard. prof edwards was awful. Unresponsive, no-show to scheduled office hours without communication, refused to grade on carmen so she could have more control but we did not have access to any grades until 3 weeks after the semester ended. Does not care about her students success. awful.

I wish I would've known to go to office hours before I failed the first exam and book report. This class is very difficult for a gen ed, but if you go to her office hours and show that you care, she will respect you and give great feedback. Exams are impossible. I worked very hard to get my C+ up to an A-. Huge research project. Lots of reading.

This class was way too much work for a GE. The research paper was time consuming and 30+ pages, although it helped that it was a partner project. There are opportunities for extra credit. She was slow to grade, and I was worried what my grade would be going into the final because I was missing very important grades. Not super responsive to emails.

I was nervous going into the class based on reviews, but it wasn't THAT bad. Reading before lecture and participating during lecture is important. Also do well on projects/papers/exams because there are only a few. Two opportunities for EC. Group research project is time consuming but manageable. Won't know your grade until after semester ends :/

I was terrified going into this class because I read reviews, but Dr. Edwards was nowhere near as tough as I expected. Class is heavily based on daily readings and discussion, so definitely go to class and participate if you want a good grade. Not a lot of grades but stay on top of the work, pay attention to lectures, and study and you'll be fine.

Stay away!!! My final is in a week and we have THREE grades in Carmen. She rarely responds to Carmen emails and is unhelpful and unclear in what she wants. The midterm was hard and Im expecting the final to be hard. Attendance taken every day. Very little grades in Carmen and I have NO CLUE what my final grade will be (a week from the final).

Dr. Edwards puts a lot of emphasis on the importance of your individual ideas (being a "scholar"). The exams are not terrible but are based heavily off of the daily readings, which are assigned before every class. She does a good job making the class relevant and engaging. The research project is very time consuming, however.

This Intro Sociology course was designed to highlight the Honors distinction. A formal research project and analytical book review served as the only other grades besides a midterm and final. Dr. Edwards stressed the importance of scholarship and became irritated if the class did not actively participate.

She seemed to really care about the subject she was teaching and was nice enough after class, but probably the toughest grader I have ever had. Never responded to emails, didn't use Carmen for accurate grades so you'll have to wait until grades are finalized to know what you received, & reading was super excessive. Nice lady, but I don't recommend

After 12 weeks, Dr. Edwards still has not posted a single grade for the class. Participation is taken for every class, and there are no grace days. Criteria for grading is unclear--the midterm was not bad, but she did not give us any hint as to what would be covered. Lots of reading and lecture heavy. Too much work for an 1100 class.

Honors sociology is a class that I expected to be easy, but in reality, Dr. Edwards is a very hard grader, and it was difficult to scrape by with an A-. Biggest advice: Do the extra credit presentation. You have to email her to sign up. Its on the syllabus but she won't tell you, so be ready! Also, participate a lot and go to lecture. It matters!

My advice is stay away. Took this expecting an easy writing 2 course but ended up doing a huge research project with a ton of field work. Most unclear grading criteria in the whole world and very disorganized. Takes forever to grade stuff. Find a different writing 2 GE to take. This class shouldn't even count for it
Nothing spectacular by any means.  She is an okay professor but is somewhat uniformed about current events, which is surprising for a sociology instructor.

I really like Professor Edwards. She was very nice, helpful, and straightforward. There were a couple papers, a midterm, a final, and then a big final project that was a lot of work, but not that hard. The midterm and final were not that easy, but she didn't grade too tough on the project. I recommend this class, even as a GE.
She doesn't grade fairly in any of her courses. It's almost like she's on a power trip with assigning students grades.

Unfair grading, even for grad school. Only grade we had going into the final project was an activity worth 2% of our total grade. Gave no indication of our standing during the course or what was expected for the final project. Worked my butt off on 50+ page final project only to get a B.

I agree with the comment below me. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS... UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES! She makes an intro class into something it shouldn't be. So much work! Possible to get a good grade, but you have to do bogus bonus work, and a lot of it! Not to mention, you get a ticket (and a point) every time you raise your hand, ie youre treated like a baby

Her class was far to difficult for a 100 level sociology class even honors.  She also graded very hard.  It is not that she wasn't fair.  She offered a so large an amount of extra credit that if you did the work you got a decent grade.  Still it's intro sociology I shouldn't have to work my butt off.

Edwards was such a great professor and made the class interesting and thought-provoking. We talked about everything from religion to gender inequality. The work load was tough because there were 2 major papers, exam essays, and she can be a tough grader b/c she knows what she's talking about. Fortunately she offers a lot of extra credit.

Her lectures were clear and somewhat interesting, but there was a lot of work, including one major reasearch project and paper (10 pages plus 18 pages of field notes in paragraph form). On the bright side, she does offer quite a bit of extra credit. The subject was pretty interesting to me, but this class decreased my liking of sociology.

Her class lectures feel like something out of freshman year in high school but she grades like a beast. Her participation sucks when you have a big class and she doesn't call on you. I would not recommend this class, way too much writin for 100-level, But she is nice so if you get stuck with her go to her if you need help. And do the extra credit!!

I thought the class was easy...provided you do the readings and participate in class. The ticket system she has (you get a ticket everytime you talk in class and you need thirty by the end of the quarter, whereas extra are bonus points) was really, really stupid. But it wasn't hard to achieve, it just felt like high school. I enjoyed the class tho.

Ok first of all, this class was fun, and the professor was amazing.  The people that commented before seem to be misguided.  Sure, she uses tickets, but if you pay attention and actually get involved in the class, those are easy to get.  Plus, there is almost 10% extra credit available.  I would highly recommend this professor to everybody!

Worst teacher I have ever had. She is unfair, gives way too much work, and thinks her class is way more important than it is. She is teaching nothing but grades like it's for your life without explanation for why you lose points. More work than all my other classes for the year. Evil, evil lady. Stay far, far away.

Class based heavy on discussion and participation based on getting tickets, which would work well except that I wasn't given a ticket every time i said something, so I had to "participate" more than others.

She's a nice lady, but her class was awful. In class, we just took notes from an overheard and  it was straight forward, but her tests were really hard. I had to write longer papers for this class than I did for English and she grades those hard too. I wouldn't recommend her, she seemed to think everyone was an established sociologist sometimes.

Nice enough lady, not a very good class. Treats you like children while you're in class, but then grades hard on midterms and papers. Too difficult for what it should be. She will help in office hours, however, if you don't need this class, I'd stay away.
If you have to take sociology never take this woman's class.  She demands a ridiculous amount of work for a 100 level class and grades incredibly unfairly.
Not a great teacher. She also taught on some things with questionable scientific backing like home birth, which seemed unrelated to the class

She cares that her students learn, but she doesnt respect them. No technology during class and no chance of recovery after midterm. Exams are hard because she makes the vocabulary on the multiple choice test your IQ not your knowledge of the course. If you dont go to class and participate every day and read every reading, dont expect an A.

Slides are on Carmen but you must attend class to fully understand. She goes over information that is not described in slides. This is common sense, but don't surf the net or text; she will call you out. Studying is required. Easy A or B. YUE IS AWESOME!! Don't print anything while she's teaching in recitation, that's RUDE. I felt bad for her.

Dr. Colon is really nice and wants to make sure that you understand. There are 4 hw assignments that take up a lot of time but are easy to get good grades on if you take the time to do the calculations correctly. Her multiple choice is killer. Her exams are what made me get a B. Attendance isn't mandatory but she's good at explaining what she means
I very much enjoyed her class.  There are two 5-7pg papers and a final, no midterm. She's kind of a tough grader and there are lots of readings, but I definitely recommend this professor.

she is great!!you do not have to be good in math to do well in her class! she gives alot of examples so that you understand. 4 assignments through out the quarter which was not bad and a midterm and a final. TAs were really helpful also!

class is boring but its stats so thats not her fault, seemed interesting in teaching and making sure everyone understood what she was talking about, graded a little hard but if you go to class and pay attention it shouldnt be that bad

she's not super friendly, but she's not mean. there's a take-home midterm that was at least two page essays for four questions based on lectures and readings. there's tons of reading. its a good class, but she could do a lot more with it to make the class more interesting...
Literally the EASIEST class. Show up, do the bare minimum, and you will get an A. Laurie is so sweet and really cares, has great lectures, and is so accessible outside of class 12/10
Professor Michaels is super sweet and nice. Class is really what you make it but should be an easy A no matter what if you do the assignments. Several extra credit opportunities.

Laurie Michaels was one of the most delightful professors Ive ever had. She set incredibly clear expectations for every test and paper, and never assigned lengthy and challenging readings. She is so lively and passionate during lectures that I never even wanted to skip a class. Would definitely take a course with her again.

Laurie is literally one of the nicest people I have ever met. She is mindful of providing dozens of extra credit opportunities and honestly you would have to make an active effort to do poorly in her class. I failed the first quiz and still ended with over a hundred in class because of all the extra credit. Take methods with her!
The course is very simple, you work on your research paper all semester with quizzes in between she offers PLENTY of extra credit. no reason to not pass with an A.

This was a great class! I took the 8 week summer session of the class. We had interesting and lively discussions about real-life issues. Laurie is a great instructor; there are slides of each lecture posted on Carmen. She gives study guides for the exams; the exams are word for word from the study guide. There is also a 4-6 page paper.

If you have to take this class (required for soc majors), make sure to take it with Laurie! The content is pretty boring, but she does her best to keep it interesting and usually always lets us out of class early! There were 4 very easy quizzes and she gave us great study guides for each, then offered up to 11% for extra credit. She's awesome!!

Professor Michaels did an excellent job teaching this class, especially since it was at 8:00am . She always had a lot of energy and really tried to keep things interesting even though the content of the class was dry. You work on one long research paper throughout the semester and she gives lots of feedback before you hand it in

She was super sweet and knew what she was talking about. Grade is made up of 5 quizzes (super easy), attendance (I missed at least 6 times and got full credit), and a final paper that you work on the whole semester so if you go to lab, this is not hard at all. This is required for sociology/crim majors so I highly suggest taking it with her!

Laurie gave a ton of work but is an easy grader. This class was mandatory for my major (sociology) and the material is prety dry but she made it enjoyable and (somewhat) fun. She is always prepared and her lectures are very interesting. If you have to take this class, take it with laurie
Super helpful and nice

Laurie teaches a class that is mandatory for Sociology majors. Definitely take it with her if at all possible. She is super young, but also knows what she's talking about. The readings that are assigned are pretty much optional, because the only thing you do with them is have discussions with your fellow students about them.

Laurie was super sweet! She was very quiet, but was a very good lecturer. She kept students engaged by asking questions and kept it very interesting. She's very approachable anytime you need help with something. She gives mini pop quizzes over the readings but drops the lowest two scores. Overall great teacher.

After class, he posts a summary of his lectures plus the questions on the exam come from those summaries and from the book almost exactly. You need to show up, do the minimal work, and listen to exactly how he wants the project.
Real lecture, if you dont read you wont pass. Doesnt give homework or worksheets or notes.

Ryan was very engaging. He loved when the class would participate. We would sit & debate about real court cases and he always had good feedback.. I would've got a better grade if i read the textbook more. Exams definitely test your ability of applying what you know. DEFINITELY go to class. If you miss class you might get really lost. TAKE NOTES!
Professor Ryan is Amazing. He knows the material very well. And he is a very good looking man.

Easy to pass, easy materials, and caring professor. Just remember to take some notes during lectures so that you can understand the material because not every single thing on exam is on the slides provided. He also gives general extra credit so don't worry about getting an A if you pay attention in his class.

I really enjoyed Ryan's class. Some of his exams questions are tricky but if you study the study guide he gives and pay attention in class, you should be fine. Lots of discussion during his lectures which was nice. I learned a lot in this class.

Ryan was a great professor. The class was very interesting and covered a wide range of topics surrounding law and its implications on society. Exams are very straightforward, and frequently in lectures, he will point to things that will be on the exam. Discussion is an excellent part of the class because everyone is allowed to have their opinion.
Fantastic lectures filled with debates over cases and decisions surrounding law. He is a great guy. Would recommend if you are at all interested in law and or an easy A.
Easily one of the best profs Ive had! Class is lecture based and exams are easy as long as you study the lecture slides! Recommend taking one of Ryans classes for sure!
Good prof, most lectures are discussion based which keeps things interesting. Participation does not matter though which makes it nice. Exams aren't hard as long as you study the lecture slides.

One of the best professors Ive had. Super funny and relatable and makes the material interesting. Exams arent hard and readings are pretty interesting. I wish I had him for every class! I wouldnt want to skip class even if attendance wasnt mandatory.

Ryan is an awesome prof. Many of the classes were just class discussions based on topics like affirmative action, juries, eyewitness testimonies, etc. Very funny and, if you actually show up to lecture, the tests are extremely straight forward. Posts slides on Carmen, but they don't have much info so you have to go to lecture, but he makes them fun

Dr. King, one of the two best professors in the Soc and Crim department at OSU, guaranteed. Engaging, original lecture content. You do need to keep up with the weekly Carmen readings, but no textbook. Easy to go to class because the lectures are interesting. And Dr. King is H O T!!!!

Great teacher. Your grade is made up my 1 quiz, 1 paper, and 3 exams. The final is not cumulative. Gives study guide for the exams and its all straight from the notes he gives on powerpoint. Pretty easy class and makes it interesting.

What a fantastic teacher.  I love his class. Easy to talk too, laid back class and clear grading criteria. Many people stayed after class each time just to learn more from him. Tests are off the review guide and paper is straight forward. Take him if you can!

Took this after changing my major into Soc. and this class made me more sure of my decision.  I thoroughly enjoyed all the lectures I came to, he was focused, informative, and very engaging.  I just missed out on an A because of a poor participation grade on in class writings . Tests were very straightforward as well.  Wish he taught more undergrad

Ryan is my favorite professor I have had at the college level. I've taken him for Crime Control & Prevention as well as Intro to Law. He is a cool, smooth guy that makes lectures enjoyable. Good sense of humor and he knows his stuff. I would highly recommend Ryan to anyone. This university needs more professors like him.

Professor King has been one of my favorite professors at Ohio State so far. He makes the class really enjoyable and he is funny. He relates everything back to the real world with stories from his life and if not can think of something everyone can relate to. Makes sure you know what is on the exam, there is no guessing. Take his classes!
extremely rude emails, only grades a handful of things, didn't post the class content until multiple days after classes started, lectures are long and boring
There's nothing to talk about. His emails always make you feel rude and disrespectful. He may have something to say about terrorism, but make sure you're really interested.

This professor grades very very hard with no feedback given on how to improve your writing. If you email or message him, he is very dull with his response and sometimes comes across as rude. As a student in his class, I felt discouraged as a writer and student in general - especially given the circumstances right now.

I don't want to say he's a bad professor, but it's clear that he can't give a good grade. He was as exacting as if the undergraduates he taught were experts in the field. He gives very low marks and never explains how to get better grades. His lectures are interesting, but you have to be smarter and know more than him to get a good grade.

Professor Crenshaw's class is challenging and he is sorta intimidating at first, but he is caring and genuinely wants students to succeed. One 12-15 page research paper, two exams, and a peer review make up the final grade. Reading the textbook is necessary. Come to class because slides aren't posted online, and most exam material is from lecture.

Don't take this class if you want as much as a halfway easy gen-ed. He makes this class way more difficult than it needs to be, with few resources. You have long lectures everyday that count towards a midterm and final worth 50% of your grade. He asks obscure questions and grades way difficult. Then a paper worth 25% of your grade with no guidance

This class is graded off of three exams, BUT he curves every exam AND curves the class. You absolutely must read every chapter and article he assigns because anything from them can be on the exams. Go to class too because he will occasionally give out test answers when there is low attendance. Very generous with partial credit. Overall good.

Crenshaw is one of my favorite profs I have ever had. His class was informative and just the right amount of challenging. However, his tests are difficult. Dont expect to do well at all if you dont study. Also, he will check that you did the readings. There are always questions on his tests about them
If you read and attend the review sessions it is very easy. I watched many people struggle in his class but take good notes and it will be easy.

I really enjoyed taking this class with Professor Crenshaw. He is extremely knowledgable about the topic of terrorism. Three tests determine your grade, which require a lot of studying, but if you go to class and do the readings, then they should be pretty fair. If you are looking for an interesting class relevant to today's world, this is the one.

3 tests determine your grade. Tests are typically 2 essays, accompanied by fill in the blanks and short answer questions. No word banks are given, and you have an hour. While he believes he is fair, most would disagree. The questions are straight forward by require you to remember a months worth of lectures and readings.

VERY knowledgeable about the study and history of terrorism. Tests are somewhat fair, but you have to really work for an A. LOTS of textbook and online readings that he WILL put on the exams. Only 2 midterms and a final. Great instructor though. I thought his crude sense of humor was hilarious but it might be offensive to a number of people.

Good professor, fair grader. Has randomly pre-assigned attendance days to ensure people come to class. Tests are tough but very fair. There is a paper due the last day of class 12-15 pages which, while difficult, really shows what you know and what you have learned in the class.  Only a mid-term, and a final based on lecture, readings, and videos.
He has a great sense of humor in some aspects, but at times, I thought he went a little too far.  However, I don't think he meant any harm with those particular jokes.
I thought he was a great instructor, although I wouldn't advice poor students to take his courses (he sets a high bar).  The lectures were clear, and the tests completely fair.  Two thumbs up!!

This class is ridiculous!!  Do not take it, he is the only teacher that doesn't use Carmen, so nothing is posted online, you are screwed for notes if you miss a class.  Also, when reading off his lengthy slides, its impossible to keep up (note taking) let alone absorb what he is saying. This class was frustrating to say the least!

Crenshaw is very knowledgeable about the topic (terrorism) and the classes are usually interesting and engaging. he uses a lot of video/documentary, so it's not just him babbling for three hours. A lot of students were complaining about the exam, but I went to all the classes and I got a B+ EASILY. Go to class and take notes... It's easy.
I think he gives great seminar.  Fair, but willing to give enough guidance so that you don't get lost in the material.  Really enthusiastic about theory, which I appreciated!

Lectures were interesting and tests were fair, but paper assignments did not teach me anything.  Little direction was given and papers were graded based on achieving his desired order and information.  In a 2nd writing class, zero attention was focused on actual writing. Peer grading helped only if you were lucky to get in a good group.

I don't know what these other people are talking about.  He made the course interesting, and his grading was fair (yes, tough, but fair).  I learned alot, and I hope to take another course from him in the future...don't listen to whiners.
The lecture material was very interesting, the papers , impossible.  He has a lot of awesome knowledge but his crappy attitude ruined the class.

He's a decent enough guy and presents the class material well, but his grading system needs a total overhaul. Just because a student doesn't cover the precise topics in the precise order that he expects (neither of which he tells us), doesn't mean the paper should recieve a horrible grade. To be fair, he does pad the final grade with busy work.

Dr. Crenshaw was great in the terrorism course. Very funny and made going to class pleasant, informative, and beneficial.  I learned a lot from him.  Tests were not hard if you went to class.  Overall a great guy.

What are these people smoking?  He gave us a third of the exam during review, and told us yesterday that more than half the class made an A or B on the exam! Good class so far...not easy, but interesting.

The class lectures and content are interesting and easy to follow, but the papers and exams are difficult.  Prof expects EXACT replication of his own views and opinions on articles and does not give any idea of what to study for the exam.  Also, will not even entertain the idea of re-grading anything; somewhat pompous and rude about this issue.
Unclear in paper assignments, peer reviews are worthless because no one knows what's going on.

It's not a hard class if you go to class and take good notes.  Most of the material on the tests is over stuff from lecture.  I ended up with an A in the class without doing any of the readings.  He's a cool guy, too.
awesome teacher!
He's great!!
No Comments
Pretty funny guy. Had 1 midterm, a paper, and a final. Must attend class!
No Comments
No Comments
great teacher, smart guy

I strongly recommend not taking a course with this professor. I'm currently writing this review while sitting in his class, which I just dropped after two days because I decided I can't spend the entire semester with this instructor. He is very rude and condescending in his delivery of the material. Do yourself a favor and take a different class.

I feel like all the other reviews are kind of too harsh. For a new professor, he wan't that bad. He cared about us and wanted us to do well. There were a few papers and if you asked enough questions, you would understand. Kind of disorganized but will not a harsh grader.
Tough class and confusion around some expectations but with effort I did learn a lot.

The worst instructor I've ever had. Constantly left class wondering why this is the education I'm paying for. Constantly wasted class time. Never responded to emails. Unclear about every aspect of class (material, schedule, plan, grading, questions). Got mad/aggressive when we didn't understand things but expected us to respond perfectly.

Terrible professor that obviously does not care about his students. Seems like his entire class is created in one night. Everything is disjointed and never gives clear grading criteria (0 rubrics or guidelines), but expects students to respond perfectly to his assignments. Slow grader, terrible communication, seems confused about his own courses.

The worst professor I have had in my 4 yrs of college. Will not give direct responses to questions, very unorganized PowerPoints, very unorganized plan for syllabus and assignments, gets angry at students when they don't respond the way he wants. Does NOT properly explain anything. leaves students feeling very confused. Do not take his classes

He is the worst professor I have ever had. He literally doesn't answer your questions he just leads you on with more unanswered questions. He sucks at lecturing, he goes super fast and expects people to participate but yet makes you feel dumb when you don't give him the response he wants.

Ian is probably the worst professor I've ever had. Clearly has absolutely no idea what he is doing and sits in class and reads out of the textbook. Doesn't answer emails even after being called out. Gets overly mad when students don't read the textbook, but he sits in lecture and directly reads out of it.
DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!!
Great teacher that really cares about her students.

Mary is the best professor I've had. She is incredibly kind and understanding, so it's okay to miss class- but the material is SUPER important to get. Plan on going every lecture. The readings and topics can be difficult, but she is a phenomenal and engaging lecturer. Always well-prepared. Fascinating class! Fair grading.
just dont take it if you have other hard classes. she deducts points on not having comma on the essay.

One of the most genuine professors I've had at OSU. She really showed that she cared about us and adjusted the syllabus and assignments to make it as easy as possible for us during the pandemic. The assignments and exams are very easy as long as you do the readings and listen to the lectures (she goes over the reading's main points in lecture).
Dr. Reiter's class is so interesting. She is extremely knowledgeable about the topic and amazing at her job. She is funny and so helpful. Highly recommend.

As an online class Professor Reiter was terrible. She just assigned reading in the book, made us take a quiz after every chapter (15) and had 3 exams. She does not give extra credit and did not record lectures.

She is so fun and you can tell she genuinely cares about her class and students. She has tons of experience and stories and is very easygoing. She posts the learning objectives which follow the textbook, so studying for exams is very easy and she definitely isn't trying to trick you in the exams. Highly recommend taking her.

Mary is one of the funniest and most engaging professors Ive had thus far. The class is very lecture-oriented and requires you to read the textbook in order to do well on the exams, but if you study then you should be fine! Shes very passionate and knowledgeable, and its an extremely interesting class to take assuming youre interested in law!

A sweet,Lovely woman, shes really a gem and wants all her students to succeed. Show up to class, all the tests are based on the readings and lecture notes. If you want an A,SHOW UP to class. The material is hard to follow but if you ask for her help she will make sure you have a clear understanding of the material. The tests r all multiple choice

I had this professor for Statistics in Sociology and he was great, so I was surprised by this class. Tests have 4 short answer questions (100+ words each) and 2 extended response questions (400-600 words each) and 90 minutes is allotted. There are no passes given for attendance and you learn all the information from research articles he provides.

Great professor, I had to retake this class from taking it with Adam Long. The class is set in a much more digestible fashion. Less tests, more well rounded tests, and more realistic expectations. I only got a C plus but getting an A in this class is definitely plausible if you can retain information from readings better.

Professor Zheng was one of my favorite professors I have ever had! He is so knowledgeable about so many different areas of sociology and is always willing to explain difficult concepts. There aren't a lot of assignments and he is a very lenient grader.

I took this class in a completely online format. Would recommend taking in person if at all able, would be much more interesting and interactive than the recorded lectures. Format was easy enough with discussions every other week and quizzes in between. Quizzes are pretty easy, but discussions are 500-1000 words and you need to know the content.

This class was a good one to self-teach. I found the lectures to be excessively long, although homework was only due every two weeks. Instead of listening to the lectures, I just downloaded the notes and reviewed those. In written communication, he comes off as uncaring and sarcastic, but may just be the aspect of relying on written communication.

The lectures were prerecorded many years ago, so the current events he talks about aren't current. But; the lectures are very easy to understand, and give you all the test answers. Every 2 weeks there is a 9 q test and a discussion post due, thats it. He makes his political views very clear, which I personally dont mind. The TAs do all the grading.

well, I take the online class, so the workload is bearable, just a bi-weekly quiz and discussion from week 1 to week 14. no final no midterm. he definitely loves to give a lot of reminders but that's cool and pretty helpful.

So yeah, he's funny and lectures are great. Lectures barely connected with the quiz questions especially around midterm. All dandy and nice in the first 4 weeks. He will send many reminders for homework. Assistants will point out your grammatical errors and have some in their own comment. This is more work than I had to put in for major classes.

This is an easy GE class. He throws candy in class, gives good lectures that are easy to remember, and all you have to do is show up. There are random attendance checks that he does throughout the semester that makes up a small part of your grade. And then you're only graded on one midterm and then the final.

One of the few professors who makes a student want to go to lecture. He passes out candy, chats with you if you're early, tells cheesy jokes, etc. The class is 1/2 basic sociology and 1/2 rural soc. It's fun and if you pay attention you'll do good.

Extremely nice guy, makes the material interesting. Attendance isn't graded except for a few random attendance checks, but he only posts a few selected slides online so it's good to make sure you're there usually anyway. Just pay attention during class, and review the selected slides once before exams and you'll be okay!

No point in putting a bad rating since they just take them back off but here goes. Professor Donnermeyer is a narcissist that likes no opinions other than his own. This leads to very annoying lectures but the class is all multiple choice so it is easy to get an A.

I really enjoyed taking this class. Dr. Donnermeyer gives candy out before every lecture. However, I attended every class and studied for all of the exams like crazy and still didn't do very well. He's a super nice guy, his tests are just unnecessarily difficult.

Dr. Donnermeyer really makes you come to class. Pretty boring material but is great at explaining things. Only grades are attendance checks and 2 tests (midterm and final). Extra credit but only by means of extra random attendance checks. Free candy is always a plus.

Joe is really chill and literally brings candy every day. Attendance checks are mandatory but you only need a few so once you get them you dont have to go. Tests are medium difficulty, most students ended up with an A or A- so not bad at all. However only grades are attendance and 2 exams so it can be hard to recover from bad midterm.
Dr.D is so amazing!

Just attend the class, totally easy A+. He is very nice... 24 points just attendance and 30 on midterm and 46 on final.. No essay questions, no homework... Must take this class.... He always throw candies to his students and the TA is very nice... Just show up and respect him... He even give you selected slides for midterms and finals.. Take him!!!

Dr. D is a one of a kind professor. I wish other professors were like him. There are random attendance checks but he passes out candy at almost every class session. Simply do what he says and you will pass with no problem. He is flexible too, if you have to miss a class session for a legit reason just you let him know ahead of time & your a-ok!

Hands down the best professor I've ever had. Though I wasn't entirely interested in the material, he made it fun and easy to understand. I was very impressed. Easy class overall, attendance was important for some test questions, but I looked forward to class.

Dr. Donnermeyer is an amazing professor.  The class is a super easy A, just show up and take the tests and you're set.  He is really funny and uses this to make the class interesting and keep the students' attention.  I would highly recommend taking his class; and if you get the chance to talk to him, he is such a nice guy.

Dr. Donnermeyer knows most are in his class for a GE so he doesn't make the class difficult. Midterms are super easy with questions that all come from his slides in class. I went to every lecture, typed notes onto his provided slides on Carmen, studied the night before, and did great. There are 7 random attendance checks and NO TEXTBOOK WHATSOEVER
The most fun I have had in a collage classroom setting. Joe is Teaching because it is what he loves to do and it shows. Wish I could take again.

Kind of professor that knows you're taking his class for a GE credit. Nice guy, reminds me of the dude from Up. Has 7 random attendance checks and your allowed to drop 2. So once you get the fifth you can stop going. He posts review slides before the MT's which you can read through, take the exam and get an A. Recommended if looking for easy A

Absolutely LOVED this class. I wish I would have discovered Rural Soc prior to my senior year. Joe is an amazing professor with so much knowledge on the topics. He's hilarious, grades fairly, class is easy and he gives candy every day. LOVE JOE!
I loved this class. It was pretty simple, but at the same time it was pretty interesting. He is a great teacher and he keeps class fun.

I took this class my first freshman quarter. My grandmother died halfway though the term. A week after she died, I let him know I wouldn't make it to class when I attended office hours. He told me I could only use my dead grandmother as an excuse for so long, in those exact words. I wanted to withdraw from the class right then and there. Beware.

One of the top 3 professors I had at OSU. Very very easy class.  He is incredibly knowledgeable about the subject matter and tried to make the class as interesting as possible- field trips, activities, etc. If you are at all curious about the Amish, definitely take this class with Prof. Donnermeyer!
Good

Donnermeyer is a great professor. He knows his class is very easy so he makes it as fun as possible. And he does a great job at doing that! He jokes around and gives out candy everyday. He only has two midterms which are easy and the final is easy as well. The notes are in class only so you have to go. But it is well worth it. Take this GE!

I'm taking RS1500 this semester and love it! Some of the material is boring, but he's such a great professor it makes up for it. He brings candy to every lecture, is quick to email and I haven't opened the book yet. Attendance is not mandatory, however there are random attendance checks throughout the semester. Definitely recommend this class!

Very easy class. He says to use the textbook, but it's not needed at all. Attendance is mandatory, but I barely paid attention and just copied notes from power points and did great. The subject itself is often boring, but it's not difficult at all.

This class was horrible, basically you listen to him rant about stupid stuff the entire time and he tells you how he is superior to you. Unfortunately, attendance is a large part of your grade so you have to listen to his rants. Only positive part is he passes out candy, class is very easy though.
Lectures were entertaining. Donnermeyer is extremely nice and funny and wants his students to do well.

Awesome guy! Very easy class and he turns a very dry subject into an entertaining one. He throws out candy to his students during class so he keeps you on your toes. I highly recommend taking his course for the GEC requirement!

Extremely easy A. Two hours outside of class is all thats needed the entire quarter. No homework or essays. Just multiple choice tests. Donnermeyer is kind of annoying. He tells the same stories multiple times, and its easy to tell he wants you to think he is intelligent. I don't feel I learned anything in the class. But it's a GEC so who cares.

Easy A. Don't buy book as he will tell you that he only tests over what he says in lecture. Attendance isn't mandatory, but random checks are worth 30% of the final grade. You'll want to go anyway because he keeps the class entertaining and ONLY tests over the lecture. He gives out candy every day, don't be surprised if he hits you with it.

He is awesome the most entertaining class of my quarter. He always has candy to give out if you answer questions and his tests are very simple and straight forward. He wants everyone in his class to do well. As long as you go to class and pay attention you will do well. Easy A.

Really nice guy I really like how he brings candy to every class. He tells funny jokes and just makes the class fun. He makes the it easy to take notes by sending you some of it in an email. Overall one of my Favorite Profs
Really nice guy I really like how he brings candy to every class. He tells funny jokes and just makes the class fun.

THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER!! He is so entertaining, keeps class interesting, engaging, and hilarious. I learned a lot from him, had a great time doing it, and didn't have to study my butt off to do it. Just make sure you go to class and look over your notes before class in case of a pop quiz. Final exam was 40 questions, only took me 15 min, easy A :)

Donnermeyer's great! Perfect GEC or substitution for Soc 101. "Pop" quizzes carry a lot of weight, but they're easy if you pay attention in class. Reading the book helps for understanding the material, but it's not necessary. I loved Joe!

Class is out of 100 points, 21 points dedicated to attendance, with four 13 point quizzes (takes the best 3 out of 4) and a 40 point final!  An easy A as long as you go to class and read over notes once before a quiz.  Great teacher, sort of reminds you of a lovable grandpa.  A genuinely nice guy.  Tells a lot of stories somewhat relevant to class.

Joe is crazy! Most lovable professor on campus! I'm not exactly sure if what I am learning is of any importance to me outside of class, but he is the only professor that keeps my attention for the whole 2 hours and that is hard to come by. Lectures and quizzes are straightforward. Go to class to ensure an A, but its not like you won't want to.
GREAT class. He obviously loves what he does, and it shows. He keeps you interested the whole class period. The biggest thing is to attend class and an A will be a piece of cake.

One of the nicest professors on campus! He makes his class extremely easy and interesting. There isn't a midterm and the quizzes/final are extremely easy as long as you attend class! I would recommend this class to anyone!

Prof. Donnermeyer is a great professor. He handed out candy every class meeting, made taking notes simple w/ his packet, and made the quizzes/final passable to anyone who attended class and studied the material moderately. I would recommend this class to anyone. (It's counts for 2 GEC categories)
Prof. Donnermeyer is like everyone's favorite grandpa. He literally passes out candy on a daily basis. Keeps information exciting and easy to follow. I would reccommend this class to everyone!
Fantastic! really goofy, but very fun. Very knowledgeable of subject and though it was the first time this class was taught, it was great and will be even better next time. Take it, seriously.
Absolutely love him. One of the most enjoyable and easiest class so far at OSU. Just go to class and you will get A. He literally told me the answer when I asked him about a question on the final.
Kinda kooky, but easy to understand. He words his questions awkwardly, but if you go to class and take notes, you'll get an A.
Rural Soc is super interesting, esp. the way Dr. Donnermeyer teaches it! Not a class I even wanted to skip. The group project is fun too :) take the class!
He is definitely my favorite professor so far. I loved going to class, never skipped even once. I'm not into studying, and I easily got an A. :) TAKE HIS CLASSES!

One of the easiest classes you can take at OSU. Just show up to class (quizzes and attendance checks) and you'll guarantee yourself a B+. He's a goof, but knows his stuff. Really nice guy. Throws candy to the class every day.
One of the best prof I've ever had at OSU. Loved his class, actually looked forward to going!! Really knows his stuff.

He's a really nice guy, lectures are really clear. I never bought the book and still got an A; I just take decent notes. Class is really easy - if you show up every day (random attendance checks/easy pop quizzes) and don't get at least a B+, something is seriously wrong with you. If you still have a social science GEC, I recommend his class!
Very funny...He makes everything very clear. Every morning he gives everyone candy which is great. Gives pop quizes, so u have to be there on time.
Joe is an easy prof!  Go to class and you'll do well.  Nice guy and accessible.
Easy and somewhat interesting. Go to class, take some notes, you'll do well. Don't have to use the book at all.
Tell stories too much and tells the same jokes over and over again.  Does not know how to stay on topic which can be irritating.  On the other hand, easy class if you attend.

Donnermeyer is an AWESOME PROFESSOR!! this class was extremely easy but you must go to class every day!! He will do random attendance checks and pop quizzes. He lectures from slides and if you pay attention you'll do fine on quizzes. If you need a sociology credit, i'd definitely reccommend taking this class!!

EASY CLASS, if you go to class everyday there is no reason you shouldn't get an A. But you have to go everyday, unannounced quizzes and attendance checks. Group and individual projects which are easy and final was cake.
No Comments
Donnermeyer is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He makes the class VERY fun and enjoyable.  I reccommend him to anyone!!
No Comments
This man is amazing :) I highly recommend.
Awesome class! He throws candy to his students!

Joe's class was by far the easiest and most interesting class I have taken at OSU.  He's a great guy who knows what he's talking about and gives his students candy daily.  Don't buy the R.S. 105 book.  I never opened mine.  Just show up and take notes.  Bottom line, Joe is my hero.

Very intelligent professor, actually knows what he's talking about (compared to some chem. teachers), no need for the book, just study notes a little bit and you'll do fine, thats how I got my A!(He loves the Amish, if you know anything about them, talk to him about it, may be some points for ya!)
Great teacher.  Jokes are a little old and sometimes I cant tell if they are jokes or not.  TAKE THIS PROF
Mr. Donnermeyer is a great teacher who is helpful and considerate of his students.
This man ROCKS! Take Rural Soc. 105!
Great class, very interesting discussion without alot of work. He relizes most his students have other much harder classes to worry about. He also likes to give out (and throw) alot of candy.

Joe is overall a good professor except for 2 things...he likes to go off on tangents and DON'T TAKE AN INCOMPLETE WITH HIM, as (at least for grad students) his policy is to give a b- as the highest grade.
He is awesome! If you have to take Soc., take Rural Soc. with him! Very easy and informative! Don't need to read, just go to lecture and you will do great! :)

I really enjoyed Dr. Jacquets rural sociology course. I took it in the middle of the pandemic and he tried his best to keep us safe, even though it was in person we always met outside when the weather was good and did his best to include via zoom classmates who couldnt make it to class. The course discussions were really fulfilling and thoughtful

Professor Jacquet's lectures were a bit boring, but going to them was still very helpful for getting the notes required for the reading response papers. He assigns four reading response papers throughout the semester, which are graded fairly easily. If you study for the midterms and the final, you should have no problem with this class.

Anna is one of the most caring professors I've had. She treats you like an equal, she's interested in hearing feedback, and she wants to teach you if you want to learn. She is lecture heavy and assigns readings before class that you don't HAVE to do, but this is so that you can have a good class discussion and class will be less dry for sure.

Prof Jenderedjian seems super sweet and knows what she's talking about. This class was not my favorite, but the exams weren't too bad as long as you understand the material. The group projects could be a lot, but my group was good so I'm thankful for that. Lectures can be a little dull.
If you don't understand her class it is because you are not listening. Easy A if you participate.
Dr. Jenderedijan is the best professor I've ever had at OSU. She is cute and funny. If you reach out to her, she will be understanding if you don't understand something or miss an assignment.
Her lectures are fun even though the topics were a bit boring. Fair grader- you get what you put in. Some of the assignments were interesting.
Lots of extra credit, easy As if you paricipate.
Very nice lady. She gets confusing because of the language barrier and she is also very quiet. Her lectures did not make sense to me, or to anyone in the class. I dont recommend her as a professor
Do not take her class because her class is poorly organized and you do not know what she is talking about.

Took 6-8 weeks to grade essays that we turned in. Feedback was limited, and too late to incorporate on future assignments. Grades for essays seemed arbitrary, since feedback was limited to highlighting random sentences. Content was not engaging albeit easy. Notes and discussion boards were unnecessarily complicated due to requirements. Don't take!

Professor Ostroot was an amazing professor this year. She made intro to sociology very easy. I was very scared of taking this class since it had a lot of reading, but the chapters were very fun to read. There were about two understand papers and they were easy to do, if you understood the readings. Highly recommend!

I took the summer intro to sociological theory class and it was fully online. It made it very easy to learn because I could listen to the lectures multiple times and listen to them as I did things like cooked dinner. Everything was open note and very straight forward. I highly recommend taking this class with her
This class was super easy. Mostly discussions with two papers. Very easy grader

I found this instructor very helpful and quick to respond to any questions I had. There are a couple papers but as long as you pay attention to reading and lectures you should get a good grade. Professor Ostroot kept everyone up to date with weekly announcements, offered concise lectures on the weekly reading and I appreciate her approach to soc.

Very kind professor. She has clear assignments and instructions for them and is a fair grader. There were four quizzes and two papers throughout the course in addition to the final paper. Attendance is mandatory for credit, but if you are unable to make it she will give you another assignment to complete and is very understanding.

Absolutely loved this class because of Ashley Ostroot. She was very understanding and caring especially during the pandemic. We were allowed to drop assignments. Also, the lecture videos were done very well and it made watching them more enjoyable.

This class does count as an writing GE, so it "alot" of writing. A discussion post every week, 2 exams, and a 6 to 8 page paper. The exams were not hard as long as you watched the lectures. As long as you listen to her revisions and take some of her advice (which was always good) your papers will be fine. She also a very down to earth person.

Story was one of the most engaging and sweet professors I've ever had. She told us attendance was not mandatory and if we needed to take mental days off we could. Her lectures were organized & engaging. She gave detailed study guides and was very easy to get in contact with. Her exams were not hard & her content was very interesting. Do take her!

Professor Edison gives real life examples in the lectures. She is also straight up but animated, which makes her lectures engaging and clear to understand. Her study guides and lectures made also me feel very prepared for homework and exams.

it was hard to listen to his lectures because they were SO BORING. His exams are hard for no reason. There was a lack of communication between him and the TA causing grades to constantly be questioned by multiple students. It's boring and after talking to other students about research methods in different classes, you do so much more work with him.

I was sad with I returned to OSU to hear Dr. Taylor is no longer on main campus:( He made a hard, boring subject cool and useful. I have used what I learned in his Theory in other classes and even some at work. Dr. Taylor was one of the reasons I came back to finish my degree. We need more teachers who really give a damn like Dr. T. One of a kind.

Dr. Taylor's sociology of poverty class is incredible. For on online course, he created a great and open environment for sharing and respect. He treated us like adults and professionals. I appreciate that he gave examples and feedback that help in other classes and even outside of class. Highly recommend. One of the best teachers I have ever had.

I have never met a teacher like Dr. Taylor. He has written a lot of books but refused to require the one he wrote for our class because the publisher was charging students too-much for it! That kind of integrity is rare. It took me several years to finish my degree with work and family. Dr. T is one of the reasons I stuck it out.

Cool taking the class with the guy who actually wrote the textbook. I'm not a great student, but he was always patient and available to answer questions. Quick to respond to emails. Some of the online material was a little old but made sense. Unlike a lot of professors, Dr. Taylor cares about teaching and helped me graduate!

Dr. Taylor practically taught me how to write. Professionally, anyway. I just finished my degree, and he's one of the reasons. I used skills I learned in his class in most other classes and even in my job. Always quick to reply to emails, and just a caring teacher. A REAL teacher.
He is a caring professor but provide too much readings for each week. But overall it is easy to get an A if you do those assignments carefully.

I took this class online. The grading is so unclear. The only explanations for what he is looking for on the papers are in old announcements from past semesters that he has left on the Carmen page. It made it unnecessarily confusing to complete assignments that should have been more simple. Gave no feedback on grades for written assignment.
Professor Taylor is a good professor to take, and as long as you do your reading and show up to class chances are you'll pass. Overall a nice guy, just make sure you do your work and you'll be fine.

Dr Taylor is one of the most caring professors at OSU. He genuinely cares about his students and recognizes them as HUMANS that have lives outside of the classroom. The class was very easy and the exam questions and answers are all easy to search. He will work with you as long as you communicate your needs to him. Highly recommend!

Took his online soc class. Do not blow off the papers until last minute! He actually reads them and thoroughly grades them based on things like grammar, punctuation etc. The midterm and final aren't bad, but the written assignments are what will bring your grade down

Professor Taylor.. Hmm let's just say that if you want a good grade in his class and you are okay with not learning a ton, he's your guy.  He cancelled class for the last 3 weeks this semester.  He is not structured by any means.  Pretty good at getting grades back on time.  If you truly care about the material, don't take him. want a easy A? SURE

I took Sociology to prepare for the MCAT's Social Behavior section. Professor Taylor is a great professor. He is passionate in his research but he did not prepare any of the premeds well for the MCAT. Overall an easy A but not great for MCAT prep.
He was a good guy- I approve

Easiest online class by far. Took it as part of my minor requirement. Super laid back & pushes due dates back if you need. A little hard to contact but there's honestly no need to that much. Just turn in all assignments and you'll get an A
Highly recommend this class. Jim is a really nice guy and is very clear up front with what is expected of you.

Attendance is an element that will help raise your grade. He gives very in-depth study guides and if you have the "highest percentage" in the class before the final than you can opt-out the final. If you barely try and barley come to class but do the work you will get a C+ like me!!!
One of the best teachers I've had at OSU.  Really great guy who is always willing to help.  Cares about his subject and his students.

Jim Taylor is an average teacher. He is a nice guy and the class is relatively easy. He cancelled class more often than we had it or had substitutes show a movie. Kind of like high school all over again. However, if you are genuinely interested in the material, don't take him. He is boring as hell. I am writing this as I am in the final class.

Very good instructor! Very smart and always willing to help! Must say the best instructor at OSU! The material is complex but he makes you understand. If you have issues in class its your own fault! Great guy over all!
Good teacher, easy exams, and for how boring social theory is he made it interesting.  stupid movies though

Great class.  Fun teacher.  This guy offers something for everyone (lecture, group work, films, relevant songs).  You can tell that he's put a lot of work into this class.  I wouldn't say the class is easy, because it requires a lot of work.  It's fun and his styles forces you to learn the material.

Easiest class I have ever taken at Ohio State.  The final was optional!!!!  It could only improve your grade if you decided to take it.  And the the midterms were so easy, just read the book and memorize a few things and you're set.
Great teacher, EXTREMELY easy if you pay attention & go to class....don't even need the book.  You can't beat an optional final and tons of extra credit!
Class is a little dry, but he was more than willing to work with students and assist in understanding the material.

Jim is GREAT!!  he is very clear, concise, approachable, and most of all nice.  He is extremely fair and more than helpful.  This is the 2nd class I've had with him and he's awesome.  Just a real cool cat.

Jim had a rough quarter with his motorcycle accident and all, but none the less, he did a good job in teaching soc 611 and hes a great guy in general. The group work and field trips subjected us to multiple aspects of the American prison system.

I don't think I learned anything at all in this class.  It really isn't worth going.  His tests were not over anything we learned in class or anything that someone would remember from reading the book.  I think I knew about 20% of the questions and somehow got an A.  I don't get it.

wow.. maybe something happened to him b4 this quarter, because he sucks! he never TEACHES, just  makes us sit in stupid little groups.. his test was NOT over what he told us to study, and he treats us like we're taking a 100 level class, not 300. STAY AWAY. oh.. and not hot! he's like 5' tall!

This is the best crim. course I've taken.  Jim seems to genuinely care about his students, and is always available to answer questions.  But, the best thing might be his letters of recommendation.  He helped me land my first real job.  God bless Mr. Taylor!

I think that Mr. Taylor's class has been a great learning experience.  He treats us like adults, and covers topics thoroughly.  His exams and quizes also seem very fair, but some people don't care for the group work.  And, it doesn't hurt that he's so darn cute.
No Comments

Good guy and fair grader; helps students out on a regular basis; the only people who complain are the ones who don't study; tests are more than fair and he makes sure to get rid of trick(y) questions.

Jim was awesome...I think he cancelled class more often than we had it.  He gave tons of extra credit.  He sent out a lot of emails to keep people informed of stuff.  If you missed class, he'd let you borrow his notes.  Overall, great, great teacher.
Fun teacher.  I don't think that soc will change my life, but Jim always amde himself available and helped me find a job!
Not the easiest class, but I've learned a lot.  Mr. Taylor is very approachable, and always seems willing to help - even off the clock.
Who hired this hillbilly?  Seriously, this guy can't teach to save his life, and makes a boring subject even duller.  Also, he dresses like he's 7 years old.

I have nothing favorable to say about Mr. Taylor, unfortunately.  He gives terribly dull lectures, has you perform pointless exercises, gives confusing tests, and never answers e-mails. Loves to hear himself talk and looks down at you when you ask a ?
She is such a lovely lady very polite and well spoken !

Absolutely clueless. She gives no guidance and no rubrics for any assignments and then gives you a bad grade saying the assignment submitted didnt reach her expectations, as if you knew what they were. You can ask all you want for guidance or rubrics. She will not make them and then claim you never asked. Take the class with another professor.

Brenda is pretty funny. She talks really slowly and writes random things on the board as she goes. Attendance isn't mandatory. A lot of the time she let us out 15 or 20 minutes early for no reason. Very laid back. Exams are take home. Posts a lot of random articles on carmen that are related to topics.

This is not a hard class. They have take-home exams and a lot of group projects. The teacher is also very forgiving and willing to give you extensions to the due dates if you ask for it.   Her lectures are a little boring, she uploads her notes online.

extremely easy, she posts notes so no need to take notes in class but come to class. Attendance will make or break your grade. I usually bring my laptop to class b/c her lectures are boring. Her exams are "take-home" as well as class essay assignments. Just do the best on every assignment. Sadly she does give group class work.

I just really enjoy her classes; her dry sense of humor keeps even Theory entertaining. Don't skip class just because she makes the notes available, her commentary during lecture makes writing the take-home essay exams SO much easier. Only con: I looooathe in-class group assignments

it's an extremely easy class. i showed up maybe 7 or 8 times out of the 20 or so times of the whole quarter and pulled a B. i don't like how she doesn't do the grading scale of A, A-, B+, B, B-.. but instead she just does A, B, etc. very nice lady, but doesn't answer questions that great and does nothing in class but read off notes she puts online.
very easy class, she has a hilarious sarcastic sense of humor that you would not expect, tests are take home, i thoroughly enjoyed everyday of class

Great teacher; grades pretty easily as well; takes attendance but she claimed that it was only for the office of financial aid and not for class..barely did the readings, just skimmed the chapters. Learned a lot and was able to apply info from other classes; great prof. !

Very easy class but sometimes too boring to go to. Can't miss too many because she takes attendance. Exams are take-home and the class notes are posted online. She grades fairly easy and she is very sweet. She brought snacks for us. We watched a lot of gang movies which made the class bearable to attend. Her experience gives a unique perspective.
I graduate next quarter and I wish I knew her earlier. The class was really easy and she was always willing to help!!EASY A!!
She is a sweet old lady with a good sense of humor.

Easy class.  Brenda is straightforward with her expectations and midterm and final are take home.  Long research paper is required, but as long as you cite sources you will get a good grade.  Nice lady, funny too.  Take any class with her that you can; it's an easy A and you can learn a lot if you try.

alright, the actual class is not soo interesting. but prof. is very nice, willing to help, and tries to make the class interesting. she always brings in current articles and loves videos, which aren't bad. her lecture notes are straight from carmen, with blanks to add extra notes. she is a good prof. overall though. would recommend.
Brenda rocks the house, stop being arrogant retards... She is very intelligent and has a great personality.  She is very easy for most classes but tough for some depending on which you take

2nd time in her class bc i needed an easy A.  She is more interested in teaching upperlevel courses and really tries to pull in interesting material.    don't expect the most exciting class but she really tries to have interesting discussions with the class, entertain you with good movies, and she might even bring you treats.

wicked boring.  attendance was mandatory, and now i know why---because nobody would go if they didn't have to.  she put the notes up on webct, and then classtime consisted of her reading directly from those notes.  very easy though...hard not to get an A. two take home tests and a paper.

very easy, if you need an easy A, i recommend taking her... all the assignments are group work and the exams are take-home. other than that, her lectures are boring and pointless... i didn't learn anything from her in this class, only from doing the readings
i didn't learn a  thing and there was no point in going to class her notes were online.  she was so boring.  everything was take home.  i got an A but i would rather learn something and get a B.
She's kind of an airhead. Actually, a lot of an airhead. Her voice is annoying, too.

Dr. Whiteside is awesome, would highly recommend her class to anyone looking for an unstressful environment where you will actually learn something! Participation matters but she makes the classroom environment low-key and not stressful which actually contributed to a lot of my learning in this class despite being anxious to speak in class.

Professor Whiteside is one of the most caring professors I've ever had. She makes for an un-stressful class with clear instructions and is very good with communication if you need help or an extension. She puts mental health first, all professors should be like her! Exams are open note.
Absolutely loved Professor Whiteside! she's an amazing person, and easily accessible outside of class. You can tell she cares and knows what she's talking about it made the class easy.

Great class, would 100 percent take again. This class has helped me thrive in many other classes and has given me great knowledge about society. Jasmine was very nice and funny, she is very fair with grading and explains what she expects in a concise way.
Easily accessible outside of class, genuinely interested in what she teaches. Clear grading criteria. Thoroughly enjoyed this class.
Prof. Nzitatira cares alot about student success and is more than willing to help satiate student's curiousity. Only a few short papers. Would reccomend

Emily is a great professor. Runs a super laid-back classroom, is funny and makes class fun to attend. Exams are not bad at all and their content is laid out clearly in her study guides. Attendance not mandatory but she does random (fun) activities in class that you get full credit for as long as you show up for class. Occasional reading quizzes too

Ms Shrider was easily my favorite professor this semester.  She was really funny and loved to keep a light mood during class by sharing fun current events or telling a funny anecdote about what her dog did the night before.  She does randomly give out attendance points for class so go every time!  Class is easy A if you go to class and study slides
This is probably one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. She's a really easy grader, and doesn't take attendance. The tests are exactly based off the powerpoints so make sure to study those.
Nice teacher and helpful when I seek for suggestions. A little bit harsh on paper but if you pay attention, A is not hard

Slides aren't posted online so come to class. Gives plenty of time to copy them. Exam questions come right from jeopardy review and lecture slides, and you're given essay questions ahead of time. Had him for Urban Soc - Don't buy the textbook, you won't need it. And just get an audio version of Creative Class to make it way easier to get through.

The best professor I have had so far at OSU. Really cares about his students and knows them each on a first name basis. The class was very easy as long as you came to class and took notes. Highly recommend wish he taught more classes.

Passionate about the subject matter and takes your feedback very seriously. Always very helpful in explaining topics and assignments. His assignments are very manageable and most of the material is interesting enough. There is a large final paper but he gives you guidelines on where and when to start and what your progress should look like. Helpful
He's a really great teacher. He's also the nicest (and most attractive) teacher I've ever had. Go to class and you'll do fine.

Dan was great. He taught well and was helpful if you had any issues or questions. He's laid back and lenient with late papers. He is a fair grader. Be sure to attend lecture, because they aren't available on Carmen. Recitation is fun, too.

The professor used one book which is "The Rise of The Creative Class" for Richard Florida. You also are required to read an article weekly, which he posts on Carmen. This class is basically about "Social Class". It also talks a bit about Gender and Race.

Good professor, great class. There are plenty of readings but grades mostly revolve around brief memos (short papers) and projects. Participate, do all the assignments, and put decent effort (dont be sloppy), and make sure to apply concepts from class in you work, and youll do well. Very kind and willing to listen to students.

We have a lot of things to read in class, but you don't have to read to participate in class. She is never very clear about what she wants from you on exam essays or on papers for class. She is extremely nice and requires one office hours section with you so she can get to know you better!

I needed an Intro to Sociology credit for my degree. I took the only one available to me. Her entire class is lecture based, she doesnt allow interaction. I also wasnt able to get any type of response from her when I would email with questions. She only has 4 grades the entire class. One of which is a paper that she gives a misspelled prompt for.

literally I have never been in a more insane class. 0 time actually spent teaching "material", you can literally just read the book and then be thorough on the tests and be fine. I can't even believe that her final paper assignment for us (one of THREE GRADES TOTAL) didn't have a rubric or anything, just one line of misspelled "prompt"
This class was honestly one of my favorites this semester. Dr. Spears is hilarious and she made lectures so much more enjoyable.

She's funny and chill. I really enjoyed her class, watched lots of videos/documentaries and the exams have like 60ish questions, all multiple choice, but there's opportunity for extra credit and the test aren't that hard anyway. Great teacher.

Only graded by 3 tests and 3 essays so if you dont do good your grade will tank. Showed up late and watched a lot of movies( law and order svu one class). Tests were harder than they needed to be and contained content that she whizzed through in the PowerPoint. More than half the class didnt show up the entire semester.

All you need to know is what's on the power points, which she'll either read that to you, or she'll get off topic and go on tangents. Also, she thinks that just because she has AHDH that everyone else's experience with it isn't valid. She seems to think that her experience is the end all be all only diagnosis.

Never have I seen a teacher more off-topic. The problem isn't that she's not a decent person, it's that she spends all of 15 minutes teaching. Partway through her class, I stopped going and started taking notes from her power points (posted online). Within two weeks I was three chapters ahead of everyone else and doing better by a letter grade.

Sociology of deviance. Thought it would be interesting but the lectures felt dated and boring, and she was always off topic so we got behind and the dates for the midterm and paper deadlines were always changing. Papers were super easy but it's hard to tell what you need to study for the exams which was frustrating and can really affect your grade.

Prof. Spears is clearly very interested and passionate about the subjects she teaches, but she gets so wrapped up in telling stories and talking about current events that is takes up A LOT of class time.
