As a result, we were WAY behind the syllabus and she flew through several classes worth of material on the last day before the final.

Dr. Spears is one of the most inspiring, stimulating professors I know. She knows what she's talking about. Classes are largely discussion and lecture based, always a joy to attend. She's best talked to in person; go to her office hours for questions and concerns. She makes your life easy if you try, but expect to be challenged to think critically.

I've taken several classes with Stephanie Spears. She is pretty clear cut on what she wants. You don't have to show up to class but it does help when it comes to writing the final papers and on the exams. She is a fair grader. The lower level classes have multiple choice exams with an essay while the upper level courses are take home essay exams.

Had her for sociology of law. Only had 1 paper and 2 exams. Easiest class possibly ever at the 4000 level. I am looking forward to having her again this semester because she really cares about her students succeeding and like someone else said, she basically hands you an A.

Professor Spears was great she showed up late maybe three times all semester coming from teaching at C-State it seems pretty reasonable.  Reading is not mandatory and she categorized them all according to the exam questions they pertain to. Not sure what more you could ask for she basically hands you an A.

She is always late, she is rude to students. The tests are hard and if you try to talk with her about it she laughs at you. She never stays on topic she just rants about her ridiculous opinions the entire class. And if you disagree with her opinion, you will regret it.
Doesn't answer emails. Comes late to class. Boring lectures, most of the time she goes off topic. Exams are hard and she thinks it's funny. A monkey can do a better job than her.

Prof. Spears is the most interesting prof I have ever had.... She shows up to class 20 min late and dismisses us 20 min early, so a 55 min class with her is pretty short needless to say. She goes off topic and rambles on about political matters which have nothing to do with the class. I got A-'s on her papers, cite a lot!! Attendance not mandatory

Spears is an easy prof. You can either go to class or not, she doesn't care. It will show in your take home tests, but if you have the book to refer to, you will be fine. Yes, she is unorganized, but those that go to class know what's going on. Most assignments are pushed back anyway, so you can't be mad about that!

ONLY TAKE HER CLASSES IF YOU'RE A GRADUATING SENIOR. Graduating seniors don't have to take the final. I wish I would've known this. The exams are take-home so they're easy just time consuming. Attendance isn't mandatory but do go to a few lectures so you have stuff to talk about in the exam questions.

The class isn't difficult, but the professor is horrible. She is constantly going off-topic on things unrelated to the class, and takes a ridiculously long time to grade anything. The class is disorganized, and most of the stories she tells seem to be blatant lies. The powerpoint are jumbled and full of errors, so you have to teach yourself.

Avoid taking her class if you enjoy learning. The material is not presented in class and her grades seem arbitrary. Attendance does not matter because she discusses current events and does not teach the subject of the class. Only two written tests and one paper, but the questions are out of left field due to her not teaching the subject in class.

Spear's class is awful. I can't describe all of her shortcomings in less than 400 characters, so here's a few of them. Her lectures consist of  jumbled reading summaries and tangentially related personal anecdotes. She ends class early, starts class late, shows movies for multiple class periods, and cancels. I want my money back.

She is very unmotivated. If you want someone to actually teach you something useful, do not take the class. She can be funny at times, but sometimes I felt like she was trying to be a stand-up comedian rather than a professor. She is not that tough of a grader. You'll get a decent to good grade if you use a ton of detail in her assignments.

Readings are on Carmen. Has a take home midterm & final which are  just really long papers that require you to cite everything from the readings. Class sucks. Basically makes fun of students, but its not mandatory. She pushes due dates back on everything. Her lectures are off topic. Wouldn't take again. Easy to get a B if you try, hard to get an A.

She's very disorganized and vague, doesn't respond to emails, really. Gets off topic very easy. Midterm and final were take home, which is nice. Honestly, I barely went to class and just went into MASSIVE detail on the take home exams and pulled an A. Overall, class didn't take a lot of effort, just a long night before an assignment was due.

I'm not sure how I feel about her classes. If u enjoy structure & organization, I'd say stay away. If u don't mind chaos & disorganization in exchange for a decent grade, then take it. She is horribly disorganized from her lectures, to the syllabus, to her slides. She also does not respond to emails & is amused by confused students.

Professor Spears is amazing. She really cares about her students and really wants them to succeed. She is by far one of my favorite sociology professors on campus. She helped me a great deal in understanding the material. Her goal is truly to make you successful!

I really enjoy this class. The readings were short, interesting and discussed in class. Two exams, both take home and one paper. I like the set up so much that I am taking TWO of her classes next semester.

Stephanie has opened my eyes to a whole new world of how I think about males and females and the struggles that both sexes go through. Her class was very good. We had great conversation about certain topics. And the article readings she picked were SURPRISNINGLY VERY GOOD. I loved the class all the way to the end. Great Teacher!

Maybe she is completely different in her other classes. I loved her. She's decently funny, and she has been really sensitive to the fact that the semester conversion has been overwhelming. She pushed back our exams and papers realizing we were stressed out. Understands we have other obligations.

Her manner is bored and haughty in person. She talks down to people when they ask questions during the test. It's a shame, because she probably was a good teacher at one time but now seems burnt out. Her homework assignments are fun; tests are confusing and designed for nit-picking. If you don't have to take this class, don't take it.

She is one of the most egotistic, rude, and useless professors at Ohio State. She is constantly complaining about something and always patronizes the students who attend. She will say 'I know none of you want to be here'...if we didn't want to be there we wouldn't have shown up like 3/4 of the class. Do NOT take her! I promise you will regret it.

She doesn't really care about teaching the subject material, takes weeks to get any of the grades in, and writes tests aimed more at 'gotcha' questions than to determine if the student has absorbed the material. Made extra credit just for those that didn't do assignments nobody else could get it. Waited until after we all did it to tell us. AWFUL

Okay people, she is NOT funny at all. All she does is make fun of other people and tries to get the class to laugh. I find myself sitting there with a straight face, trying not to scowl at how annoying she is. It's a wonder that only 25% of the class shows up. She does not know how to write a multiple choice test at all. Overall, bad prof.

If you read the book you will do fine on the multiple choice section of the exam. Essay part is take home and easy. Don't bother showing up because she always goes off topic to make fun of a past student or to try to make you feel dumb for having an opinion. Her power points are always misspelled which I found annoying. Ask for help won't get

You learn a lot and the tests are take home so you have a week or two to get them done and ask questions in class. I barely read one of the books and didn't but the other one and still managed to do well so the readings can be missed if you go to class.

This professor is awesome. Learned TONS. She's an easy-ish grader but her assignments are somewhat abstract concerning the law. Overall I really enjoyed her class, she's one of the best professors in the department I think(maybe OSU). She has a Phd in soc and a Law Degree. Very knowledgeable. She's hilarious, she makes idiots look even dumber.

The worst professor I have had at OSU. I took sociology 210 online and not only did she cancel office hours every week, she made tests that were absurd. All of her questions are poorly worded and the tests are so carelessly made that there are a ton of spelling mistakes. Do not take her classes unless you want to be misguided and get no help at all

Class is not mandatory, but I HIGHLY recommend going. Not only is she interesting, your test grade heavily relies upon being able to use in class experience and knowledge. If you are insecure, don't talk in class. However, if you can take criticism being active in class will help you learn a lot. Great class!!

I'm on my third class woth her. She's just as helpful as any other college professor, excepts she helps me to stay awake in class because she's a riot. Her tests really are from the book, and she will make fun of students, but ALL in good fun. Take a joke children.

Professor Spears has once again made my life better than ever.  Her class was not ambiguous.  The previous comments make no sense.  You can't NOT do well in her class.  Go to class, listen to her opinion, and when you write your essays, include her opinions as a suggestion for change.  Third class with her, third A.  You all just need to try.HEkkK

I have taken 6 of her classes, you have to have a sense of humor. Reading/writing and discussion intensive. Her classes are an exercise in real life: if you disagree and especially if you are having trouble -- say something! She will help, but you have to help yourself. Don't get frustrated. Just communicate and work hard and you will succeed.

Well, lets say I had a 4.0 in my major until I took this class, and I graduate this quarter.  My very first B, and it was from no lack of work, since all of my take home exams were 18+ pages ( for 3-4 questions).  She is a very interesting lady, and her lectures can be interesting, but USELESS.  Took away absolutely nothing but a blow to my GPA.

very disorganized. lots of readings never touched. lots of unsubstantiated opinions and anecdotes thrown around and called smart. attendance was a waste, but she often announces dumb rules in class so you have to attend or else you miss that due dates have been moved, etc.  seniors don't have to take exam (1/4 of the class).  Lame and disappointing

2 take home exams and final paper. If you put in the work she will reward you. Attendance is not mandatory but alot of questions/answers for exams will be covered in class. She will push you but you will also come away with something.
So far, so good. She encourages discussion and students' opinions, has a good sense of humor, and keeps things interesting. Great professor!

Make sure to write down verbatim what she 'reads' in class. it will be on the test. She changes her tone when it's something important./she likes students to argue with her. She seems angry. I do not like Sports - don't take 655 if you don't love sports. It was torture for me. She doesnt use email or Carmen well.

Dr. Spears's 209 class was really easy if you paid attention in lecture and kept up on the readings. ATTENTION: She told us in the last lecture of the quarter that when she puts her glasses on during lecture she is reading straight from the midterm or final. Just go to lecture and take notes when her glasses are on!! Easy A!!!!
Very interesting. You learn a lot of helpful things especially if you?re going into law.

This course is best suited for the self-sufficient, highly motivated, over-achiever.  Ask a question and you'll receive a very short response or none at all.  Offer an opinion in opposition to her own and you'll be shut down.  Also,she offers very few explicit expectations so you will have to go above and beyond if you want to ensure all are met.

If there is someone else to take you would probably be better off going with them. I'm suprised, yet not, at some of these posts. She isn't like the worst professor at OSU but definitley not your best choice if you know what I mean.
yeah shes really bad very tough for soc / crim / crim jus majors AVOID for gec DEF AVOID these other posts are right
AVOID HER - SERIOUSLY - DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HER YOU WILL MORE THAN LIKELY REGRET IT COMPLETELY!!!

She NEVER responds to emails, and I dont know why. Surely she sees them. Im tempted to just keep emailing her the same question until I get a response. Seems disorganized and apathetic, but the class was easy. Felt like I shouldve got more out of it. Shes good for 209, but I dont think Ill take any more of her upper level classes. She's tolerable.
Rude. Didn't respond in e-mails with QUESTIONS. Grades were ambiguous. Class discussion is pointless because its all about opinions of her and the classmates.

She's really bad. As a freshman, I really regret taking her. She rambles on about stuff that is irrelevant - her tests are pretty difficult compared to my other classes. She posts notes on Carmen which test material comes from but class is a JOKE in regards to what is actually taught. About 50% or less attendance rate. Seriously, don't take her.

Being totally HONEST-I have her now for 209(Criminal Justice).She sucks as a professor. W/ all her fake stories she rambols on about I never know when 2listen. She claims shes had every criminal justice/etc. job under the sun. She hates e-mails,DOESNT respond,IS RUDE &REALLY MEAN 2 ppl when askin for help,Makes u feel stupid n should stop teaching!

I think that the earlier comments are absolutely vulgar, to be honest.  You have to be insane to not do well in her classes.  Her lectures are more of a break from studying, something students should naturally do on their own anyways.  I got an A in SOC209Sp08 and the class was very easy.  Just go to class for fun, she's interesting!  HEkkK

This was the worst professor I've ever had. She rambled, she was rude, and she constantly passed opinion of as fact and would get in arguments with everyone. All the students I talked to in the class hated her. I wouldn't recommend taking her for this class.

I'm surprised by all the earlier comments. I went to most of her lectures, found the outlines she gave very helpful and her side stories/movies interesting, and generally really liked the class. The 15% paper, which I only got a 60% grade on because I can't write to save my life, killed my grade but I still did enough on exams to get a C overall.

If you are pre-law, you should definitely take her classes.  I took 2 of her classes in undergrad.  At the time I didn't see what her lectures had to do with anything, and I thought her exams were much harder than they needed to be, but it really prepared me for law school.  Law professors teach just like she does, but to a much more harsh degree

I am taking my 3rd class from this professor (210, 410, and 509).  She tests from the book, so you know exactly what to expect and therefore should get an A.  And attending class is like seeing stand-up comedy mixed with good class discussions.  If you're pre-law (or on even thinking about it) she is great!

Not a good professor, and not a nice person. She insults the views of students. Lectures had absolutely no relevance to the material on the exams. She talks about herself and tells pointless stories. Exams are based solely on the book, and are fairly difficult for a low-level class. The text reads like it was written by a 5-year-old...a stupid one.

Professor Spears is not a good professor. She never taught anything. She would just give us  these "helpful" outlines that were right out of the book and read them to us. The tests were pretty hard and have deceitful questions. We would watch movies that had nothing to do with what we were reading in the book. I'll never take one of her classes aga

Prof. Spears clearly does not care to help her students, she is abrasive, rude and hates to get emails regarldess of the reason. She acted like her outlines were so helpful but they came right out of the book, no point in going to class unless you like to be bombarded with her political views.

This is my second class that i have taken with Professor Spears and I love her. The class is interesting and even though she does not take attendance I encourage people to go every class becasue it is interesting and fun. Her tests can be challenging, but you learn a lot and come ot of the class knowing so much. I reccommend this class to everyone!

Really easy class. Don't bother taking notes it all comes out of the book but she's hilarious. If you're a conservative republican don't bother taking the class she'll hate you, and if you have a comment to make you'd better know what you're talking about or she'll make you look like an idiot.

Probably the worst class I have ever taken.  She was sarcastic and demeaning to all students who tried to participate.  Wasn't an extremely hard class but take it from someone else.  She uses the class as her personal soap box to spread her views rather than teach.

This professor is TERRIBLE. She is very lazy and hardly teaches anything for the tests during class; she just tells her own personal stories that only partially relate to what you're learning.  There are 3 tests (multiple choice, 1 short answer) and one 4 page paper.  TESTS ARE STRAIGHT FROM THE BOOK - DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME GOING TO CLASS.

She did not show up the first day of class leaving 150 people clueless, rather unhelpful when asked a question via email, sarcastic (can come across as mean), and the exams are 75+ multiple choice questions that are somewhat confusing.  On plus side, she will give out the exam essay question (worth 10 points) ahead of time and brings in movies to w
Spears is sarcastic and comes off as mean. She is also very unclear and will hold it against you. I would not take her again.

Dr. Spears is a great teacher. All of her lectures are overviews of the book. The material is really interesting and she is funny. A little blunt and come off mean. The book is a great read ( i just read the summaries at the end of each chapter) Don't need to go to class all of the time if you read the book. 3 tests and one 4-5 page paper on anythi

Dr. Spears is extremely entertaining, and her grading is relatively fair for exams being all take home. As said before, the class itself is completely a waste of time and what time that was spent in class, was unorganized at best. She's a great person, just needs to organize the flow of her classes better

Class was relatively easy. Lectures were just discussion of the readings, no pressure. She definitely tries to keep lectures entertaining. Rarely do will you stay all class period. She does expect a lot on the midterm and final, which were detailed take home essays based on all of the articles. Would recommend overall though.
Her lectures are very interesting, but they usually don't have much to do with the actual class material.
Great professor.  Extremely entertaining, funny, easygoing.  Made class enjoyable.  Exams were easy if you studied.

The class is an easy A if you read the book. Every question on the test, except the essay, comes straight out of the book. We watched a movie in class for our essay question. Class itself is completely pointless, so don't lose any sleep over it. Just make sure you get the essay question for the exam and you'll be fine.

I liked the class. Her lectures really dont have much to do with the class, but they are interesting.  She took attendence, which was ridculous b/c it was a huge class. But the tests are easy if you just read the text.  Remember, we ARE in college... teachers arent always going to spoon-feed you the material.. just take some initiative
Easy class. Her lectures are pointless, so don't even bother taking notes. If read the book you'll do fine on the tests. Not my favorite class, but definitely not the worst I've ever had.
I did not listen to a word she said in lecture because she makes no sense!!  If you memorize all the vocab and go to recetation and read the book youll do fine, you will just hater her as aprofessor
she doesnt go over anything on the test. you have to read the book, the entire book, if you want to pass.

Most evil rotten prof. ever in the history of OSU.  My TA rocked though.  She babbles endlessly about pointless and sometimes offensive material.  I took my laptop to this class every lecture and either did my Russian homework or watched movies.  Complete waste of time and money.  I'm stupider for having taken it, despite not paying attention.

I was really looking forward to this class but came away from it very dissapointed. She doesn't really teach very well because she just reads from the text and then goes off on random tangents. As said above, you don't have any notes because her tangents go nowhere and it is hard to connect them to the text.
Dr. Spears is a horrible teacher! She reads pretty much out of the book and tells stories that have nothing to do with the topic. She has made it almost impossible to get a decent grade in the class.

Dr. Spears is tough! She tells stories and you are responsible for tying those stories into the text. Too bad she never explains the text in order for you to tie them together. She may be funny, but being funny doesn't help at test time when you have ZERO notes to study because she has merely told stories all quarter.
It is a complete waste of time to go to her lectures i didnt listen to a word she said and did fine... the tests are directly from the book...memorize all 125 vocab words and youll at least pass

Could not STAND the class.  The first week was alright but it is downhill from there.  Attendance Policy is RIDICULOUS, lectures are pointless so bring a pillow, SHE BASICALLY LIKES TO HEAR HERSELF TALK.  Try to get a more organized prof, that actually might be able to teach you SOMETHING!!!!

Not very good at lecturing but follows book closely. Sometimes funny (if you're not a Conservative), but her grading style is unpredictable at best. Tests were essay (2) and you had one long paper. Grading seemed arbitrary.
No Comments
a relitivley easy class, she's really funny and gives good examples of the text, she wants us to have fun, and wants us to want to be there... make sense haha?

I had her over the summer and loved her class.  She is funny and entertaining, makes the class worth going to... she does tell pointless stories sometimes, but she usually has a point and most of her examples are realistic situations that make the material easier to understand.  I highly recommend taking her class!
Funny as hell, seriously would go to class for the entertainment value.  Followed the book so the tests were easy.  Got an A and didn't try very hard.

I loved her, I felt she was a breath of fresh air in professing. Liberal but if you get to know her, she supports and has studies many areas of social society.  Along with a Law Degree. Interesting lectures and different outlook on society.
Terrible at lectures.  She just rambled on and on with stories and was very sarcastic with the students.  If she did not like you then to bad for you.

hated 391, so i gave her another chance with 509 and still hated it...all she does is tell stories that incorporate her opinions. if you are a republican, i advise against taking her classes. if you enjoy longwinded, unsupported arguments, you would probably like her. i agree with the comment that you get ridiculed for voicing your opinions
Fun for me.  I definitely would take her again.  Funny, but the topic is really interesting.
Follows the book so its easy to study and uses real life examples that are interesting and fun. Very funny & entertaining lectures, highly recommended!!! :)

She is not personable and is unwilling to help when you ask quesitons.  I took the class because I was very interested.  The only things I learned in the class were from the readings.  As an instructor she is worthless.

Very difficult to follow, random lecture anecdotes. It came time for the midterm and I only had 6 pgs of notes  to study from and I was there and paying attention everyday. Ahhh!!!!  Will attack you in class if you do not make intelligent comments relevant to class.  Readings are interesting.
Bad teacher.  Tested on things that she never covered and weren't covered in the book.  Wanted students to participate but then rediculed them for talking.
She made the class really fun and the tests weren't too bad either. Just read and you'll do fine. Great professor!!!
easy class
She should be a comedian.
If you are interested in learning about Spears' opinions, take this class. If you are interested in learning about deviance, take someone else.

Pedantic, condescending, pretentious. Be prepared for sermons instead of lectures. Her opinions and factoids are facile and obvious, yet she sadly regards them as intellectual gems.  Her methods are better suited for high school than college.
One of the better profs ive ever had!
Funny teacher. Read the book because the tests are all based on that. Lecture is worthwhile. You'll enjoy this class. But the book is key.
Liked pepole to "argue with her" but always made anybody who made a comment look stupid.  Worst prof. ever!!!

A very unhelpful and irresponsible professor.  She teaches her biased and innapropriate opinions and does very little to actually help students.  She often teaches false facts and cancels classes.  The worst professor I've had thus far.
I have taken four classes with her and I have liked each one. She has strong opinions but she tells the best stories.
she is really funny teacher, you learn more than just sociology.  All the tests are essay so if you are good at b.s. this is the professor to take.
She made totally rascist and inappropriate comments.  She's perpetuating the stereotypes she says we're supposed to be working against.  Always too busy to talk.  Even the TA's said they hate her.
good teacher...makes u earn your A

She is a *****... for being a sociology teacher and proclaiming about social constructs and the bariers they produce due to the prejudices which develop, she is highly hypocritical in opinions of certain groups which totally discredits her as a professor
If you are ever going to take any classes in sociology get DR. Spears.  She is pretty funny.  Lets you go early and her style is easy.  2 tests, a paper she helps you write and a final.
No Comments
No Comments
awesome
No Comments

Take this class. Hollie is SUPER impressive and so GENUINELY nice. The class consists of weekly topics in international criminology, an op-ed assignment, research paper, and a group project with a non-profit in Columbus. The experiential learning with US Together was something I never would've gotten to do. Even if you have no background, take this

Definitely one of my favorite professors here at OSU, and one of my favorite classes. I would definitely take her again. She's a very good speaker, and the content is very interesting although it can be depressing. She's also nice to look at.
Best professor I have ever had, very clear instructions, very knowledgeable on terrorism, her research focuses on genocide, always willing to talk to students

Prof. Brehm is awesome. She seriously cares about her students. Going to class is required, she has little in-class things every other class. She also gives extra credit frequently too for going. This class has a mini group presentation (5 min. not hard), 2 reflection papers, a book review & one long final paper. She grades very fairly though!

Great teacher with social skills as well!  Very young and passionate about her research, yet still puts tons of effort into making each class interesting and engaging.  Clear rubric for papers, and fair grading.  Had three short answer quizzes, two one page papers, and one 10 page paper final.
Out of all my scc prof he was the best.

After 2 tours even I wouldn't teach Social Problems during that election! The snowflakes complained that the Trump supporters were allowed to talk, but Prof was respectful and gave everyone a fair shake. I read another comment that he wouldn't be 'wrong', but he taught from the books, which were evidence based, not textbooks. What can he do?

No text book, but used 4 regular books. More interesting and cheaper than a text,  but heavier reading assignments (2 chapters per class).  Easy to pass, hard to get an A. No lecture slides, lots of class discussion. Overall, it was a fun class I'd take again.

What Professor Jordan lacked in organization he made up for in a wide breadth of knowledge on the subject matter. As a right-leaning student, I usually feel out of place in social science classes. Professor Jordan did a great job of playing devils advocate and ensuring all views were given equal consideration.

Really enjoyed this course.  Took it for credit towards my entrepreneurship minor, as well as for a gen ed for engineering.  Basically discuss current events and then relate it to books that you read.  For grades we had to write one paper, give a 5 minute presentation, come to 2 class periods with questions over the reading, then a final paper.

I really enjoyed this class, especially covering current events. This really helped me apply the theories we learned. Several other students complained about the lack of lecture slides, but I found it refreshing. This allowed me more freedom to pick out and discuss what I thought was important, rather than being told the important parts.
Overall, fun class. Learned a lot about gender and how it applies in everyday life. No lecture slides, so sometimes can be hard to know what is important. All in all, I'd take it again.

I honestly learned nothing.  90% of the class was him talking about his views on  politics and the Michael Brown case.  No powerpoints, no lectures, no organized course work.  He assigns readings and then rarely talks about them.  We talked about FaceBook posts.  If you want to get something out of this class, don't take it with him.

Absolute worst instructor I've had during my 4 years of college.  I  do not recommend taking this class if you have any prior knowledge of gender, especially if it's in line with feminist theory. The entire class is taught like a #notallmen FB page, all while completely leaving out genders outside the binary in the curriculum. Disappointed.

The class was mandatory, but professor did good getting lots of people to participate. Enjoyed the subject matter and learned a lot about work. Was a bit slow in grading, but the feedback was useful. If my Soc 101 class had been this fun I may have majored in it.
Engaging and willing to play devil's advocate to make students think and compare both sides of topics. Helpful and easy to talk to. Brings in good life experience for subject taught.

One of the most horrible professors I've had at OSU. He shoves his unsupported  views in your face and is not open to discussion about them. There is no strutter to the class and his grading is extremely subjective.

Professor Thompson is very kind, and encouraging. Her class is mostly group discussions, with two exams, one project, and you have to participate 5 times over the semester. Ultimately, the class is interesting and well structured. However, the readings can be long and tedious.

Andrew was the very definition of "meh" as a professor. The only two things I really have to say about him is that he is a very fair/easy grader, and make sure you go to class to get the notes, because they're not online.

Dr. Martin is the chillest professor I have ever had. His exams are crazy easy and even though he has a final paper and a final exam, you basically write all of the final paper in recitation throughout the semester and he will tell you word-for-word what to say for some parts. He does do assignments in class for participation. SUPER EASY CLASS.

its only the 2nd month of classes and this class is extremely hard I'm very lost the final research paper is on strikes and thats what the class is based on, I already want to drop it. Recitation sucks as well
This is literally the easiest class ever.  Andrew even tells you how to correct your papers for a better grade if you need to improve your scores.
Great professor, easy, willing to help with anything, gives extensions if you contact him
Andrew is a very nice professor. He will answer any and every question you have and is overall very helpful. He seems to be an easy grader. I highly recommend him.

Andrew's a nice guy, and he grades quickly and very fairly. He's got a good sense of humor and responds to emails incredibly fast.   While his rubrics and tests are clear, he doesn't describe assignments well. Very repetitive, mind-numbing lecture. It's offputting that the course totally revolves around his research, but not a bad option overall.

Dr. Martin is one of the best profs I've ever had. He is easy-going (I slept through class one day when we were supposed to turn in an assignment and he left me turn it in that afternoon with no point deductions) and nice. He can be a bit confusing with assignments, but he tells you exactly what will be on the tests.

Great teacher. He makes everything clear and I liked the class a lot. Shouldn't be a hard class as long as you show up and read the textbook. He doesn't use slides so make sure you go to class. I learned a great deal from him. Highly recommend.
He is a very good teacher and I liked him a lot. Yo will learn and he will reward you with a decent grade if you show up... Good teacher!!!

He's truly one of the good guys.  If you take Andrew Martin, you're taking a course with a passionate guy that loves his kids. He's always in a good mood and while he's not super easy, he wants you to learn. He's also the prof. who will nearly always return your e-mail more quickly than you would ever expect.

He is very passionate about what he teaches and even though his field may not appeal to everyone, he makes the information interesting. He is extremely helpful and he gives very clear notes. As long as you go to class and the recitations there is no way you can fail.
He is a very clear teacher who does a good job of making sure the class understands the content and the assignments.
Class is boring but easy to get through. Final paper is not fun, very boring, he is not particularly helpful with the outline, tells the class multiple things

Not a bad class at all.  Lectures are a boring but just go and you will get an A.  As for the final paper, make sure you start it early.  The literature review and other things can be done way ahead of schedule.

Andrew is great. He loves to help. He responds to emails very quickly. Yes, his lectures are boring, but he does his best with the material he needs to cover. The final paper on strikes was a drag, but I learned some new things. I'd take his class again.

Very slow lecture.He could probably finish a lecture in 30 minutes if he went at a normal speed but with the multiple repeatings he stretches out to over an hour.  Everything is clear since he does take forever. Bring some coffee to stayawake, final paper on strikes is boring. Someone should tell him not to drink in the middle ofa sentence annoying
Great prof! Likes to help whenever possible. Good lecturer. Final research proposal only on strike activity so kinda on the yawn side of interesting.

He's a pretty good teacher. He's a newer professor, so he's still getting the hang of lecturing and whatnot, but he does pretty well with making things clear by using examples and exercises to show us how it can  be used. Only thing I don't like is for the research paper at the end, he makes you do it on strikes, nothing else.
His was the first stat course I took and he opened a whole new world for me! Great teacher!

The lectures were hard to follow and often useless.  the tests were primarily T/F which made them tricky. He does curve the tests and the class so that helps with the final grade I did end up with an A-.
tricky
Terrible, terrible, terrible!  The exams were terribly written and he didn't know how to give a lecture if his life depended on it.  Not a very nice guy either!

Interesting material, but boring lecture and he gets  so off topic and it gets annoying. Although the tests are multiple choice, they are so hard and unclear, the hardest MC test i've taken, and this is just a 100 level class!
I basically want to stab myself when I A: see him B: hear his voice or C: think of him.
Tests were very hard and VERY opinionated.  Kind of an ****

Lectures aren't so bad, but where are these midterm questions coming from?  Be a little clearer.  Last time I checked, it was a 101 class.  Some interesting material, but impossible for him to stay on topic.
Good lecture but very hard tests - must go to lecture to do well on his tests.  Very interesting material though

The multiple choice questions on the test should be more clearer.  It's not an essay question so it shouldn't be open to interpretation.  But overall, he's a nice guy.  Really funny, and he looks like the professor in the Waterboy. LoL
Does it annoy anyone else the way he test the mic by blowing hard into it?
Good Teacher, gets off topic though
for a sociology teacher, he is not very sociable.  pretty good teacher but not an understanding man.  tests were difficult and he isnt very helpful and doesnt really want to answer questions.
Great lecturer although his tests seem to be a little difficult for the material. He asked some really abstracct questions. Not bad overall.
I don't know how anyone couldn't find this class incredibly easy.  This was the first one I had at OSU and Dr. Schwirian left a great impression of the university on me.  Funny guy, great lecturer.
Didnt like to help students. Material was easy to understand but the exams were hard. I never knew where the questions came from.
Easy, makes jokes in class.. only one I don't have trouble staying awake in.
annoying and biased... teaches a 101 level course like an upperlevel one

I took this class as a GE. There are lots of assigned readings, but if you skim through them you will easily be able to complete the weekly reflections. During COVID, the lecture part of the class was done through podcasts and discussions were mandatory live attendance. Topics were very interesting and relevant to today's society!

Michelle is the best professor I've had at college. Her classes are always interesting and relevant, and she cares about the material as well as the students. An amazing person and even better professor. Would recommend taking all of her classes!!!
She is a very easy grader.

She made the class half lecture-based and half-discussion based. The topics she went over were always very interesting and class discussions were often cut short by time. As long as you go to class and complete assignments (there was about 1 per week), youll get a good grade.

Michelle is incredible! She is very kind and strongly encourages creativity. Her course is relatively easy and she cares for her students. She extends deadlines for those who needs it and she is honestly the model professor when it comes to teaching during a time like the pandemic.

Professor Oyakawa provides amazing feedback for her students. The course had a lot of work and was very writing-heavy, but there were a ton of resources available for studying and extra credit opportunities. Highly recommend!

I took an online class with her and there was a decent amount of work. But, the work was easy, she is an easy grader, and gets grades back fairly quickly. HOWEVER, this class has an insane amount of political bias. She just posts her points of view, and doesn't leave room for any other beliefs. I regret taking this class more than any class at OSU

A lot of work but an easy grader. Each week probably took me 4-5 hours which is the most an online class has ever taken. Weekly quiz, discussion, and assignment usually 2-3 readings and online lecture to listen to. In order to do well on the quizzes, you need to do the assignments.

Michelle is a great professor and I would highly recommend her to anyone. She takes out time to explain things further if students are confused. Her class is discussion based so there are pop quizzes. Sometimes there were a lot of reading assignments but you could find summaries so you didn't actually have to read the chapters.

Michelle's classes are discussion based, which makes class really entertaining and fly by. Beware of pop quizzes, make sure you read or look up spark notes! Midterms are really easy since she gives you the best study guide known to mankind with everything on it. Easiest sociology professor so try and take her class!
Prof. Oyakawa explains the course load well and is knowledgable in her field. Her lectures were always very interesting to me, and I think she's a great teacher!

I LOVED Michelle! She was so down to earth and funny. She made me really enjoy going to class. The class was very interesting and she always related the readings to lectures. Does give pop quizzes, but is very good at hinting when she will give them. Facilitates discussion in class which helps you to understand the concepts even more. Best class.

Nice enough guy, but the workload for the class was very overwhelming. His lectures were good, but the material was tough to understand. We had to do discussion posts for 12/18 classes on readings and a scripted group play for our final. Wish he had made adjustments because of COVID-19 especially with our group project.
Hannah would not give one point to change a letter grade and makes false claims about attendance.

Don't take him!!!! His tests don't revolve around the book. He takes forever to grade things so you wont know your grade until the end! He will put you into groups for discussions and you have to decide on a leader each week to submit the work and you must communicate or you are stuck doing the work all the time.

Took this class online.  There are 3 exams throughout the semester, the last one is not cumulative.  If you know the notes and have the book for reference, the exams are not bad.  The 5 assignments are easy for some free points.  There is a discussion part of the class that as long as you participate, you will do well.  Just follow the syllabus.

Awful, never take this class. Doesn't grade assignments until weeks after they were due. When he does grade them he doesn't tell you what you did right or wrong. Powerpoint slides do not help you with the assignments for the week, or the tests. Not easy to contact and if he does answer it's not very helpful.

Had him for an online class; all we ever got him from was two emails reminding us to participate in the mandatory weekly discussions, which he never participated in. Didn't give feedback on assignments until several weeks after they were turned in, so if you were doing them wrong, you just keep doing them wrong. Will actively avoid him in future.

This class was so boring. Powerpoint after powerpoint. Movie days were like heaven and they were still boring. He will help you if you are struggling and teaches all the information well its just very boring.

I know sociology is boring but he brings up interesting concepts in his lectures. DO NOT READ THE CHAPTERS. Save you hours if you just read the chapter summaries at the end of each chapter. Did that got an A. Never spent more than 25 minutes studying for a test
This class is based upon pop quizzes, two five page papers, a midterm, and a final. With some participation grades.

The class was great. He's very clear, VERY kind. I learned a lot in this class, w/o having to break my brain in the process. Exams are not hard, if you like m/c. Just know your notes, and know the key facts of the Readings. I'm not good at m/c so the first exams I got 84%. boo. but took above advice & got 96% on the 2nd. End grade=A. & Go2class!!
Great prof. No powerpoints, just teaches what he knows. Good examples. Will take as much time as is needed to clarify material. Good class discussions, great sense of humor.
Professor Matthews was always available to help me with any questions and worked hard to help me understand the material

I would avoid this prof if you can. he refuses to use any technology whatsoever and just talks for two hours, making it impossible to do well if you don't go to every lecture and take great notes.  exams are all over the place and hard to study for b/c he gives no guidance at all.  also never at office hours making it hard to improve...avoid!

This guy is a huge dick.  I was going to graduate this quarter but Greg thought it would help me out if he failed me.  So my life is over thanks to him. Tests are based on lecture and little out of the book. Make sure you go to class.  Even my fellow students who went to his class barely passed. Do not take his class!

The material wasn't hard, but it was extremely time consuming. There was a ridiculous amount of reading and two paper essays. His lectures were difficult to keep up with because he read from his notes and expected everyone to write a 1000 words a minute. He never used a projector and very rarely used the chalk board. I would avoid him at all cost.

Natasha is a good professor and cares about the class content. You do not need a traditional textbook, but there are two books that you will need to read for the first exam. My only issue is that the exams are essay-based and you will need solid writing skills to do well which is annoying in a sociology class. 2 exams and a final group project.

She is very nice but almost too easy, she gives A's for just giving any effort on projects and tells you what is going to be on exams. After figuring those out I never read or really tried since I knew I would get an A so didn't get much out of the class

Natasha is a new professor here but she was very amendable to students. She made several adjustments as the year went on to accommodate learning styles. She gives you several options in regards to your coursework so you can kind of determine how you want to approach the class. There are extra credit options for the exams

I really love having Alex as a professor and I would love to have her again. You don't have to get a textbook and she only takes attendance through a couple in class assignments. You have two exams and the a final paper which was really fun to write (any topic related to criminology). 10/10

Love hate relationship with her but Im going to be completely honest she should not be a professor she knows the material however she just does not know how to teach she goes up there and simply reads off the slides word for word thats it goes extremely fast also she also gives pop quizzes but in no disrespect she is not qualified to do that

I LOVE ALEX! She is an incredible professor who really cares about making sure that everyone who takes the class is able to pass. She offers tons of extra credit and several assignments. Her exams are not difficult if you review the study guide and most times you can get away with not reading the assigned texts. You can tell she really loves crim!!

You're graded on 3 exams, a paper outline & essay on a topic of your choice, & a 5 minute presentation on that topic. There's readings you have to do before class but they're mostly short & interesting & she gives 12 pop quizzes on them, 2 are dropped. A little boring, probably because it was at 930am, but still enjoyed taking her class.

Alex is a super chill instructor who cares about her students and does a really good job engaging everyone and making sure people are learning! She's really passionate about criminology and it shows through her lectures. There's ample time to work on the 7-9 page paper and she gives good feedback and suggestions to improve.

Alex made this required course SO easy. Her review guides for exams were almost verbatim. She has randomly assigned in class assignment days where she asked about the readings but since they are only supplementary articles that are short, they are easy to keep up with. Throughly enjoyed attending her class.

One of my favorite professors for my major requirements. Class is a mix of lecture, video examples and group discussion. She has assignments in class worth points so you need to show up regularly to get an A.

Slides have title then 1-3 word bullets which she minimally explains. Unscheduled in class writings over the readings that can be bland and lengthy. Shows a lot of YouTube clips especially on John Oliver. Exams are semi-difficult due to the fact that it covers particular parts of her lecture, videos, and what is on the slides.

Really enjoyed Professor Mumtaz. Only graded assignments were weekly discussion posts and midterm and final. All of these assignments are minimum word required papers, with the discussion posts being only 300. She's very enjoyable. Attendance is not mandatory, and all the material you need for the posts and papers are available on the Carmen page.
Lectures are extremely boring but attendance is not mandatory. She is nice... but refused to bump my grade by .2 and is not lenient at all. The midterm and final is writing heavy.
Not particularly fond of her lecture style. Can be boring and not very engaging.  Grades a bit tough on papers and open answer questions on quizzes or exams.

She was nice, lenient with attendance, and grades fairly easy.  However, at the end of the year I had a family emergency and had asked for 24 hr extension. She told me no and that she was on a tight timeline. 3 days later she said she was done grading the graduating seniors and was starting on everyone else's and didn't grade mine for 4 more days.

Dr.Lopez is pretty chill professor overall and really cares about what he is teaching. There is minimal work per week in which there was typically a discussion post and one reading quiz per week. There is also quite a bit extra bonus points/percentage points that can help boost your grade.

Lectures were pre-recorded and often had him going on a tangent for half of it. Quizes and discussion boards every week that were pretty easy. Some discussions are time consuming because you had to watch a movie and his lecture to complete. Easy A if you put in the work.

This class was very easy and straightforward, just a discussion post every week with reading/video lectures. The final exam/paper was optional which was pretty nice. He is very down to earth and sometimes curses during his lectures which I guess could be viewed as a negative thing but I didn't really mind.

There was a discussion board and a chapter quiz due every week. There were two tests, and the third one was optional. The class offers a lot of extra credit, and as long as you do the work, you'll be fine.
easy class for a GE the homework was simple and straight to the point and the professor seem VERY passionate about this class. As long as you put some effort into the class you will be fine.

I really enjoyed this course. There's lot of assignments that go into the online class, prof lopez was super caring and charismatic and you can tell he is concerned and interested with the content and our grasp of it. Totally recommend for someone who wants a passionate professor and needs an online course to bump up hours/busy work

The professor is engaging, with funny lectures. Exams focus on lectures and quizzes, so stay on top of watching them. Unstuck AI was a great study aid along with the textbook. Overall, a solid class worth taking.

SOC 1102 with Steve is an easy A in my opinion. Each week is a similar set up with a chapter reading, chapter quiz, recorded lecture, and a discussion board. If you keep up with the work you will easily pass the class.

Lopez was a good introductory teacher. I took the course online and he was very prepared for weekly assignments. The discussions were pretty heavy and with the proper amount of time, you should get a good grade in this course. The book is covered by CarmenBooks, but there is a chapter a week and a quiz along with a discussion post. Heavy reading
Professor Lopez is a great guy and you can tell he cares about his students a lot. Overall the class is really easy if you do the readings and watch the lectures. I definitely recommend him!

Since it was an online class I rarely interacted with the professor and more so the TA. I got good feedback on my papers. The class was interesting but can be time-consuming. There are lots of articles to read and videos to watch.

Took his intro to sociology course online and it wasn't too bad. He is a funny man in his lectures. Exams are over lectures and quizzes so make sure you watch the lectures. Weekly discussion post and a quiz. Really not a bad class and would take again.
He cares about his students but makes the class very political. He cusses in his lectures (a lot) which I find unprofessional

Loves his topic but may love himself more.  He is entertaining but I got the impression he liked to hear himself talk.  If you have a question, good luck.  He can be rude if you need clarification.  Not great if english isn't your first language or social science doesn't come natural to you.
Great person, teaches a lot about the realities of the world in a way that is not too pessimistic and easy to understand. Very solid instructor
Professor Lopez is a easy professor just do the work on time and you will be fine.
Seems like a cool guy. Never interacted with him as I took it online.

Great class, Dr. Lopez was hilarious in his lectures- which was needed because they are an hour +! as long as you take good notes from the readings and actually watch those lectures you will get a better grade than B

Great professor! His lectures are interesting even if they can be long and he does a really good job of simplifying extensive topics so you understand them. You do watch quite a few documentaries throughout the semester. If you do the work you should get an A.

It was not easy for him to get high marks in his classes, and there were not many homework assignments. If I did one wrong quiz, my overall gpa would drop by 0.5! This is very anxious for a student who hopes to maintain a+, because any mistake in quiz will have a great impact on the overall gpa

Super funny and clearly loves sociology. His lectures are funny, most content id from textbook.1-2 chapters per week, a lecture video, and a discussion post. You will get all the points if you do the work. There are 2 midterms and 1 optional test and essay at the end of the year, as well as a discussion for extra credit.
Super easy intro level soc class, if you do the reading necessary (there isn't much) the class will be a breeze. The only way you could get a bad grade is if you literally do not put any work in.

I really enjoyed having Dr. Lopez as my professor. He made the lectures interesting and he was very enjoyable to listen to no matter what subject matter we were learning. The workload was very light with a discussion post and quiz every week and two exams total. I highly recommend taking this class.

The other reviews of this professor are incredibly misleading and I regret listening to them. You will spend more time listening to him complain about Fox News and Rush Limbaugh in lectures than you will actually learning about sociology. I highly recommend taking this class with another professor. His recorded lectures are a complete waste of time
the weekly discussion boards usually required a lot of reading, watching long lectures, watching documentaries, etc. very time consuming

Steven Lopez is a professor who truly cares about what he's teaching and teaching at large. He was very passionate in his lectures about every chapter we learned and was receptive to student comments. 2 mandatory exams and both were easy. Discussion posts were graded very leniently - just show effort and thinking. Weekly quizzes were easy.

theres a quiz, discussion and lecture assignment due every week, must submit discussion by saturday or 2 points are taken for "late" work even though the due date is sunday. make sure to watch lectures for midterms/finals because he often had questions pertaining to what he says in lecture.

I took this class all online and he would post one 1 hr prerecorded lecture, a weekly quiz,and a discussion post per week. As long as you spread the work out throughout the week it was manageable and a good option if you need credit for SOC1101.If I had to be picky, the quizzes being due on Friday and the discussion posts on Saturday was not ideal.

I really enjoyed this course. Lectures did get a little boring at times (not the professors fault, just the information itself.) He incorporates stories and examples that help you understand the material better. The quizzes and discussions are pretty easy as long as you listen to lectures. A very easy but beneficial introduction course!

He was great! His lectures were engaging, we didn't have too much homework each week besides a weekly write-up and an easy post test. Grading criteria was very clear, and he follows a routine that's easy to get used to since it's the same every week. As long as you do the assignments, you'll succeed in his class.

One of my favorite classes and professors this semester by far. You can tell Dr. Lopez is really passionate about the subject. Funny guy and a good lecturer. There are weekly discussion posts and quizzes. Lectures are normally anywhere from 1-2 hours but super interesting if you like the subject. Pay attention to lectures and take good notes.
Best professor Ive had at OSU so far. Lectures and content are entertaining, its an easy A and I only spent a couple of hours per week on coursework.
this course is totally a nightmare for non-native speakers, and he usually speak rudely in class

He's a really good teacher and lecturer, but he does go on tangents and he's slightly insufferable to sit through. He lets his opinions be known and thinks he's right about everything. He also cusses a lot, which just isn't needed. But he is very passionate and for an intro GE, the class is pretty easy and mildly interesting.

Great dude, and a great lecturer. Took this class online asynchronously and still felt connected with him. Definitely not afraid to be opinionated but keeps class pretty light. Lectures were decently long (1-2 hours/week) plus documentaries were often assigned and you had to read a 30 pg-ish long chapter/week, but it was skimmable. 10/10 prof
Really interesting and funny guy. He's knowledgeable. Quizzes, tests, and discussion posts are all pretty easy, at least for the online version of this class.

Steve is absolutely incredible at everything. So much passion. I want to take every single class with him. His class also isn't super difficult as long as you do the approx. hour-2hour notes and lectures each week. (class taken asynchronously).

Class was pretty easy, weekly quizzes on the chapter, use quizlet or read the chapter to study and youll pass. Discussion posts sometimes have a lot to watch/read but you could probably pass those too by skimming. Exams were like quizzes + Qs on what he said in lecture so at least watch those. Otherwise not hard and pretty interesting!

Professor Steve was a great professor! His lectures are long but most certainly entertaining to watch. Hes a great guy with a good personality. Homework's are not hard just do the readings and ATTEND LECTURES OR WATCH THE LECTURES HE HAS UP. The tests aren't hard just make sure you listen closely to his lectures. Pay attention and youre fine!!!!!!

Steve is the best professor I have had at OSU. Please watch his lectures because they are very funny and interesting. His answers to all of his tests and quizzes come from lecture. He is so funny and you can tell he really does care about his students. Highly recommend his course, I had to take his class as a pre rec but I highly recommend it.
I wish I wasn't graduating so I could have him again. His lectures are so engaging and he has an amazing worldview. I learned a lot and I recommend everyone takes this class. He's hilarious too.

loved this class! one of my favorite classes. Steve did a really great job presenting all the material in a way that was intriguing and easy to understand. you can tell he really cares about his students and is passionate about what he is teaching. The workload was not extensive and the textbook was used weekly. There is extra credit available.

Steve is so funny and I feel like I learned a lot from taking his class! The quizzes are based on the reading but the exams have material from reading, and lectures so make sure you watch the videos and do the readings.

Class set up: lots of reading because you have a quiz every week, 2-hour lectures (you gotta watch it because it's on the test), classwork on top of it, and class discussion. Took it online and was very work heavy but worth it. He is a very caring and funny professor. If you use all the material given and watch all the lectures you will get an A!

Steve is an amazing professor, he is very enthusiastic and passionate about the lecture material and keeps class fun. He is absolutely hilarious, which makes his lectures that much better. His weekly tests are solely based on chapter readings, but the exams vary between lecture and book heavy. Take his class!!!
He was so chill about almost everything. Definitely recommend if youre trying to take sociology.

Professor Lopez is awesome! He was so caring and really understood how the state of the current world was putting a strain on us students. He would occasionally randomly exempt a discussion if there was a week that he felt like we were stressed out and even made our final paper and exam optional! Overall, this class is a fairly easy GE and he rocks

This class has been one of my favorites this semester. With the online learning environment he was super understanding and worked with students to help relieve stress in the tough times. He made things optional to remove unneeded stress but to allow students to help their grades if they needed/ wanted. I would highly recommend this professor/class

Steven Lopez is an amazing Professor and is the best professor I have had at OSU. He doesnt hold back about the countless societal issues we have in America and he will definitely curse a lot while explaining it. He is hilariously insightful and I would definitely take his class again!

He is very passionate and lectures get pretty interesting. Downside is that his slides arent very detailed so showing up to lecture is key. It makes exams so much easier. There are 3 papers but they arent so bad. Pre-tests are on carmen and unlimited attempts. He was also very understanding during the whole pandemic.

He really cares about his students and is passionate about what he teaches. He posts lectures and required movies/ readings on Carmen but I would recommend going to lectures. I went to every lecture before corona and got B on the exams without studying. Discussions are easy. And the 3 page essays arent terrible.

Dr. Lopez was hands down the best professor to have during the pandemic. He is so caring and constantly altered things according to student feedback during quarantine. His class is very easy and the lectures are interesting, so I feel bad about not paying more attention. Crammed about 1-2 hours morning before exams and it was all good!
Most interesting Gen. Ed I've taken at OSU, makes grading guidelines very clear and manageable. A few easy papers and quizzes, and some easy multiple choice exams if you listen to the material.
Steve is just a great guy. I was in his class amidst the corona virus pandemic and his genuine care for his students was so refreshing especially compared to other professors.

I learned so much from this class! You can tell he's very passionate about what he teaches. There were 3 3-page reflection papers which were super easy, and the exams weren't difficult as long as you showed up to class. You can skim the textbook and be fine.

Dr. Lopez is phenomenal--do what you need to do to stay on top of things and you will learn a great deal! Dr. Lopez wants you to succeed and goes the extra mile to make sure you learn in class. The lectures are always worth going to, and the readings are not difficult.

Steve is the man! If you have the chance to take his Sociology class, DO IT! The lectures can get a little long but they're interesting if you pay attention and you'll learn a lot of useful stuff. Just don't talk to other students during class because he'll single you out and embarrass you. It's hilarious to watch tho just don't be an idiot!

Great professor! Very passionate and genuinely cares about issues in the field. There are quizzes on Carmen, but theyre really easy and you can take them until you get a better grade. Regarding exams, skim the suggested readings and watch the movies; some questions are from lecture. Papers are easy. Sometimes boring and long. Def recommend!

It is definitely a good course for everyone to take to learn more about the world today. I ended up with over 100%, so it is an easy A if you show up, pay attention, and do the assignments. You can take the online quizzes as many times as you want and only need to know key concepts from the readings (which are easy).

Enjoyed this class so much I decided to minor in sociology. He does say important things in lecture but if you miss a couple you'll still do fine. Definitely at least skim the readings and watch the movies because content from them he didn't talk about is on the exam.
Great teacher but boring content

The class and the professor is okay, but I found it hard to understand exactly what I was going to be tested on when it came time for exams. He does easy pre-tests for each chapter that boost your grade and you write a couple papers throughout the course. Overall, pretty good and I'd recommend

Professor Lopez is awesome. He teaches with respect to the topics while also being super funny and engaging. He puts things on exams from lecture, so make sure to go. He clearly really cares about what he is teaching and wants the best for students; I highly recommend taking his class.

Not many grades in the class other than a few short discussion boards, papers and three exams. The class is low stress and as long as you basically show up you'll get an A. Steve is a cool dude and really chill. I definitely enjoyed his class and felt like it was easy to learn without being worried about grades.

If you have to take Intro Soc, take Steve's class. He's really funny, gives easy tests, and there's plenty of bonus. For each of the exams, I started studying the day before and averaged above 100%. Just show up to class and take decent notes, and you'll be fine. Worst part about the class was having to write 3 papers, but they weren't awful.

He is a hilarious guy who is super caring & knows a lot about sociology! You technically don't have to go to lectures since he posts them, but sometimes there are test questions based on stories he tells in class, so skip at your own risk. There's a few papers that are graded toughly by TA's, tests are kind of difficult, but overall an easy class!

Steve makes this class challenging; you get the grade you earn. With that being said, with a little effort it's not that bad. His lectures are amazing and even in a big class (mine had 400 people) he still interacted with the students. The exams are half lecture and half textbook, so you have to go to class and read in order to do well.

Good at lecturing but sometimes gives 2-hour films to watch and write a paper. It is time-consuming. The second film was very bad low quality, and it was a miracle for me to finish it. He needs to care more for his students in regards to this. Otherwise, he is a respected professor PS: Be aware, he uses bad words. He does curse every other class

I took this class for a GE requirement and had a great experience. He made lectures interesting (although did sometimes go on tangents) and used lots of real-world examples. If you pay attention in class and do the pre tests, the midterm should only require minimal studying. The papers were also manageable. Overall, I would recommend.

Personally, I loved Steve - I thought he was hilarious and he tried hard to make his lectures interesting. The class draws on real life things so it can really put things into perspective. Go to class because the 3 exams are 50% textbook and 50% lecture but the lecture stuff is most important so take good notes. I was very sad to leave his class.

Hes literally the best sociology professor ever. I didnt like the subject going in and love it now. He makes the class so real world and so everything you learn is useful. Hes so caring towards his students and even his syllabus is funny so thats all that needs to be said. If you dont go to lecture you wont do well so go. Its fun anyways.

This class is a pretty easy A as long as you try your best to pay attention in class. Sometimes it is extremely difficult to focus because his lectures tend to be very boring. There are 3 midterms in this class which do not require much studying for. Furthermore, he offers a lot of extra credit and make sure to bubble in your name on the scantrons!
Fantastic professor. Keeps things interesting. Good Hockey player.

Professor Lopez is very passionate about sociology and when you sit in one of his lectures you can easily tell he loves his job. Sometimes lectures got boring but lectures are naturally boring. Hes got a great sense of humor to keep you engaged and exams are 50/50 lecture and book, recording lectures made studying easier.

Midterms are part textbook information and part lecture information. Paying attention in lecture and understanding what he says is important. He tends to ramble and go off on tangents. Lecture slides don't cover everything he talks about.

Exams are 50% reading material and 50% lecture material so if you actually pay attention in class and take notes, it will be an easy A. There are many chances for extra credit, and the exams aren't hard if you review (even the night before). Steve is hilarious and tries to make his lectures interesting.

Steven had me laughing so hard at his lectures. I found his outgoing personality and sense of humor to be hilarious. This was the first time I have actually enjoyed being at a lecture. He loves cussing up a storm and it is amazing. Overall, great class, and it was very enjoyable to listen to Dr. Lopez.
Good dude

Dr. Lopez was a great professor to have. He takes a subject that might not be that interesting and finds a way to make it more engaging. Weekly quizzes and exams make up your grade. The first exam is mostly based on the quizzes, the second is half quizzes half lecture content, and the third is lecture heavy. Easy exams as long as you prepare

Exams are 50% lecture, 50% book. However Steve tends to go on tangents about things that dont seem relevant to the subjects, but we were never tested on those subjects. I was expecting this to be a relatively easy A, but I actually had to work quite hard for the grade received.
Great professor. As long as you pay attention to lectures you are fine. Post quizzes are also good review material for midterms.

Mr. Lopez really looses himself in what he is teaching. He is clearly very passionate about the topic enough to relate a lot of what he talks about to himself and his own life, which gives real world examples. Besides his teaching methods, his personality is one that you can connect with and at the end of the day, you would grab a beer with him.

Exams are half textbook half lecture. Really cares about you learning the information and sets you up for success. Pre-Tests you can get all 100% as he allows you to retake them until the deadline and they're all online and open book/notes.

Professor Lopez is a fair teacher! Pre-tests are book related and really easy. He is more on the liberal side, and he's pretty adamant about checking the syllabus before emailing him otherwise his responses are typically annoyed tones. But! Overall his exams were super easy and I did learn quite a bit in this GE.

Dr. Lopez is one of the best professors I have ever had. The topics of the class are really interesting and there is not much work for the class. Tests are about 50% book, 50% lecture, and the book questions are given on his website, which makes studying much easier. Definitely would recommend taking his class, especially if required for your major

Dr. Lopez really cares about this subject and his class. He is a good professor and makes the class interesting. Tests are easy if you study for them and the online pre-tests answers are straight out of the book (I recommend getting the online textbook for these). Easy to zone out or skip class but even if you do you will still probably do well.

Dr. Lopez was extremely interested in what he was teaching. His class was very lecture heavy which at times made it hard to stay awake, but he often had videos or movies to watch in class which I enjoyed. Extra credit is offered on each test and if you study the practice tests before an exam its easy to get a good grade. Best professor Ive ever had

Steve is such a great guy, he truly cares about what he is teaching and even though you don't necessarily have to go to class in order to receive an A, his lectures are so interesting you WANT to go. Makes the class so easy if you pay attention to what he's saying. He is so laid back and in general just a cool guy 10/10 recommend taking him

Steve knows what he's talking about. Just ask him and he'll tell you himself. The class is easy. Take the post test on canvas and there's 2/3 of your test. If you disagree with him in lecture, however, you'll wake a bear and he'll start to cuss up a storm, stating he's trying to be funny but is in reality a giant man-child.
Easy GE class. Lectures are interesting and straight forward. Not too much work involved.

Because it's an intro level course I didn't expect it to be difficult, but you'll definitely need to attend lecture and study for exams. Steve is a great teacher, although sometimes rambles a bit during lecture (even though he claims he rambles for a reason).

Lopez is an excellent professor. His class is pretty easy. Exams are lecture heavy and post-chapter test heavy. He's very liberal which makes sense because it's a sociology course, so I really don't know why people are shocked about that in these reviews. I would highly recommend him, very straight up, passionate about what he teaches, pretty funny

He is a real funny guy and knows what he is talking about. The only problem is that his exams are from the textbook and what he says in class, so if you fall asleep there is a lot of catching up to do, or find a  friend that takes good notes :-)

This guy must love the sound of his own voice, because all he does it talk and go off on tangents, making it really hard to pay attention. He's also really liberal, so stay away if you consider yourself anything other than Uber liberal. Other than that, super easy class. Show up, do the pre tests and you'll pass easily.

Lopez is a cool guy and I enjoy his teaching but honestly unless this your first ever soc class, you're gonna be so bored.  His tests make it possible to get extra credit so that's nice. Drops lowest 4 quizzes. He's pretty funny, but uber liberal so if you hate that, don't take his class. lots of chances for extra credit, even tho my TA sucked
Few assignments in the course. Lopez demands respect from everyone, which is understanding. Book is automatically used in this course.

He puts out many mandatory readings which is kind of a bummer but he is honestly a great professor with outstanding lectures. He provides SEVERAL bonus opportunities. During my time with him,he gave 12% bonus to our final grade. Granted, it was due to some issues with the grading. Nonetheless, a 3-5% bonus curve with him isn't out of the question

STUDY POST TESTS! & DO YOUR PRE-TESTS.  He focuses his class mostly on the economy and hardly on any other aspect of sociology. Be prepared to watch documentaries and know info from them. Oh, and the GRAPHS. Study them long and hard because he will pull from them. Overall, nice but I personally did not get what I expected and will not take again.

Steve was a great Sociology professor. Attendance isn't mandatory, but 50% of exam questions are pulled from lecture. Three exams (no final), three reading reaction papers of around three pages, and a decent amount of homework assignments that you can always get 100% on. Funny guy and he gave us a ton of extra credit at the end. Easy A.

This was a really easy class if you put in the effort (which honestly wasn't that much).  20% of your grade is from homework which you can always get 100% on, 60% from 3 midterms, 15% from 3 papers, and 5% from random attendance checks.  No final! Steve is a great professor and a really chill, funny guy.  Interesting material too.
Steve's lectures were interesting and he was funny so it made class enjoyable. If you need to take Intro to Sociology 1101, I would highly recommend this class!

As long as you attend lectures, read the book, and pay attention, this class is an easy A. At the end of the semester he also offers extra credit to help boost your final grade. Overall, he really cares about his students succeeding and is a great teacher! I'd for sure take this class again!

Very easy class and great professor as long as you do the homework. In 1101 homework goes right along with book almost in order and each homework is worth 25 points when tests are only worth 60. No final exam and only 3 exams. Half of test Q's are pulled straight from homework Q's. Everything about the class is made simple and not intended trick u

Dr. Lopez is the best!!! I don't think I would have enjoyed this class if it weren't for him. He is great one on one and in lecture and is HILARIOUS! He makes class fun and interesting, but make sure you read the textbook and alternative readings. It is not hard, but 50% of exams are from outside his lectures, and 50% from lecture. Take his class!

Steve gives super interesting lectures and seems to really love sociology and genuinely wants his students to do well. Super easy tests and you learn things that are actually useful. Steve is hilarious and easy to pay attention to even during long lectures, this class is easy and really interesting. Definitely recommend!

Lopez seems to truly love sociology and that is what makes the class great. Super easy, exams are not hard if you take the post-tests and listen to lecture. Would definitely recommend, this is by far my easiest class and my favorite professor.
I play Tetris and Bubble Shooter during lecture, don't do the readings and I still have over 100%.
His lectures are incredibly interesting and he is very enthusiastic about what he does.

Steve is one of my favorite professors I've  had at OSU. He works hard to encourage students to think for themselves, and is always willing to talk in his office. His class is among the fairest classes i've ever taken. Your grade directly reflects the amount of effort you put into your work.
