His lectures are straight from his notes, but you better show up to class or else you will miss half the problems in the exam.  His class is easy and he is really chill.

This dude needs to realize that its sociology 1101 not a upper level course. Takes himself way too seriously. His exam averages are a 78%, that's unheard of for a GE. Way too much effort for a intro class. He doesn't curve/round up grades because its "against his principles" ok dude. Wouldn't recommend if you want a clear cut A.

Great professor. Very enthusiastic about the subject. There is a fair amount of homework, but the lectures are awesome. He's very entertaining and its very easy to pay attention to him. Favorite professor of the semester.

What a nice guy.  Even in a giant lecture hall he makes everyone feel like they are important to discussion. Funny, personable, clear, and knows his stuff. Easy GE with really interesting subject material. Take it.

Loved this guy, great lecturer, easy tests if you go to class. Don't really need the book ( I only ever skimmed it the night before a test) but the inquizative assignments are straight from the book and then those questions tended to be on tests. Overall would take again.

Class is a little harder than it should be for an introductory course, but nowhere near impossible! You have to learn to study for his tests. Study vocab from textbook, lecture notes, and really focus on studying Inquizitives. He pulls a lot of his text questions from that. Will need to study for his exams more than you'd originally think.

Steve was one of the best teachers I have ever had. Very passionate and straightforward. If you skip class you miss a lot of clips that are on the tests. If you study the slide and online homework you will get an A in the class. Gives a good amount of extra credit but does not round grades. Most points come from tests. You dont really need the book

There were 3 papers and 3 non-cumulative tests (last one is final). Everything is straight forward and half of the test questions come from lecture and the others are from homework/textbook. Online homework due twice a week but you can always get a 100%. Textbook helps with homework. Lectures are interesting and clear. Easy A with moderate effort.

Steve was an awesome lecturer, the 1 1/2 hour lecture was long but he kept the student's focus the whole time. He is really passionate about what he teaches and cares about his students. As long as you put forth a minuscule effort, he will be willing to help you a lot more. His tests were basic as long as you attended class. Loved this professor.

Steve is a pretty cool dude! I really enjoyed the content of the class and he made most of his lectures pretty interesting. While there were a few boring days, I feel more knowledgeable about the world after taking his class. He assigns homework almost every week and there are a few papers but nothing too bad. Overall fair, easy and a good class!
The tests were about 50% direct questions from the homework. If you do the InQuizitive assignments and study the lecture notes, you'll do fine. Also, Steve is a great guy and a great teacher.

Pretty tough. For tests he expects you to recall from your reading, in-class lecture, videos, graphs, slides and what he says. Also he expects you to remember his opinion for some test questions. Lectures are extremely boring and long. Definitely a tough class to sit through. Reading the book and going over the slides before tests help.
Professor Lopez makes the long morning lectures interesting with his humor and interesting videos.  If you go to class, take good notes, and do the online homework the class can be an easy A.

Steve is a great professor. He is very friendly, funny, and approachable. While his lectures are long (I had 80 minute lectures), he makes it enjoyable with his lighthearted humor. While this class is very manageable, if you don't show up it will be tough. As long as you make an effort to attend lecture and do the homework, you'll be fine.

Lopez is a good bet for taking this class. Not spectacular, but provides interesting lectures and does a good job of keeping the lectures interesting. If you read your book, about 2 hours every week, and go to lecture, expect an easy A. He's your peanut butter and Jelly

Don't skip lecture since a big portion of his midterm questions come directly from charts and graphs he went over in lecture. He also has in-class writing assignments that are worth a decent portion of your grade. Midterms are pretty easy if you just go to class and do the online homework.

Such an easy class. Tests and papers were very easy. Lectures were interesting but  despite what he says, you don't need to go in order to do well on the exams.(But he does do participation grades periodically) Ended up giving the class 5% extra credit.
Very knowledgable and made the class interesting with 3 different films and real world references. Loved this professor and would take more classes with him.

Great guy, makes his lectures very interesting and you can tell he is very passionate about the material he lectures. As long as you do the work and go to class you should be okay! Definitely would recommend this professor

Exams are over very tiny specific details in lecture, so if you don't write down EVERYTHING you are screwed. very few grades in the class so very hard to get a good grade if you don't get an A on the exams (which is almost impossible).
He's kind of boring, but you need to go to class because half of the exams are from lecture and in class videos! It's easy if you GO TO CLASS.
SO HARD. Makes the content impossible and 90% of the tests are on lectures. Take with a different prof

Dr. Lopez makes an introduction to sociology class much harder than it needs to be.  My roommates were in different sections and barely had any homework, and their tests were a joke compared to mine.  I had to sit in the front row, take very fast notes and still struggled on the tests.  He tries to trick you on them.  Too many small details!!!
I like the class and it is informative, but there's always a lot of homework that doesn't help for the exams. He also lectures really fast, so it's sometimes hard to keep up.

I liked Dr. Lopez's passion, and I did like that he related the class to current events. The only things I didn't like was that he came off as a little biased at times and the in-class activities used to check attendance were usually stupid and pointless. However the class is pretty easy so don't be scared off by how serious he makes it sound.

Is a fun professor who clearly enjoys teaching the subject matter.  He likes to make class as interesting/ relevant as possible while still covering the necessary material.  Not a very difficult class as long as you go to lecture (he gives insight on exam questions that are not on the posted slides) and turn in your 2 observation projects on time

This guy is fantastic. He is a passionate speaker, and really knows what he's talking about. I found myself deeply engaged in what I would have otherwise dismissed as boring, dated writings. He's very humorous and encourages everyone to form their own opinions. He's also great at repeatedly underlining things on the chalkboard. It helps, trust me.

One of the best professors at Ohio State.  Very willing to help you understand the material.  Very interesting and insightful, has a lot of great things to say, very worth your time to go to class. Class has 2 essays and weekly quizzes.  Gives you the essays for the exams a week in advance.  Definitely take him if you get the chance.

He is an awesome professor.  Although at time i had difficulty understanding Theory he did the best he could to make it as clear as possible.  Hes not there to see how many students he can fail.  He wants everyone to put in a little bit of time, do well, and learn.  I would DEF take him again!
He's a nice guy, but if he doesnt like you he makes it known. Helpful, and a fair grader.

He's the man.  Most helpful professor on at this university.  Theory is boring but he does his best.  Lets students talk and voice their thoughts and opinions on the readings.  Course focuses on Marx, Weber, and Durkheim

Awesome professor. He made every effort to help us understand the questions on the final. He allowed to prepare an outline for 1 of the 3 questions given a week in advance and will give feedback if you ask for it. Theory is boring to me, but I was genuinly interested during this class. Do the reading assignments for easy points!! Take 488 w/ Lopez!
nice guy and helpful

I definitely recommend him for 488 from what I have heard about other 488 profs. There is a lot of reading, but he makes it easy to keep up with your grade and is always willing to help. I LOVED that the tests were essay... you can actually prove you learned something, unlike those stupid multiple choice tests the Soc profs always love.. ugh

In general, I enjoyed his class. The good thing is that there is no paper and 20% of your grade is class attendance and participation. His tests are all essay (1-2 questions) and there is quite a bit of reading. However, he grades very fair and I highly recommend his class.
Class was very helpful. He doesn't make you do tons of definations like the others. You really learn alot about theory and his tests are essay.
out of all the Soc 488 teachers, he's the best!
You could not ask for a better teacher than Steve Lopez.  He has a perfect combination of attributes - brilliant, very funny, and genuinely caring.  A talented young prof who is on the rise.

Great professor. He is enthusiastic about the subject and has a good sense of humor. I remember that once his lecture included an article from The Onion . . . A few of the readings were boring, but most were good.

When she teaches she clearly knows what she's talking about and is so nice. 3 essays over the semester that are pretty easy and fun, but make sure to read before class because there are pop reading quizzes. Only like 20 pages a week or less to read and basically no other assignments. Gives lots and lots of extra credit, I would highly reccomend!
A bit of a dry lecture style. Says "Um" non-stop which can be distracting.  Not particularly engaging and a bit boring. Friendly enough though.

The lectures are not mandatory, but if you want to do well, you have to attend the lectures and take notes. The class is based on 4 exams, which are 10 short answer questions on paper, a term paper, and a few homework assignments. He does not post anything on Canvas other than his note outlines. Take detailed notes if you take this class!

Grading is roughly 2/3 exams (4 of them) and 1/3 paper with some reading responses sprinkled in. Makes jokes during the lectures which can be funny. There are few resources outside of the lectures so  make sure you go. Easy grader and gives helpful review before each exam. Not a quick grader.

His class provided a good opportunity to learn about interesting topics. He is an interesting guy who adds humor into his lectures. He provides extra credit on tests and is not a tough grader. There are 4 tests and a paper, but the tests are not bad if you go to the review lecture. Would recommend, especially to help fulfill the Citizenship theme.
Interesting and engaging.  Shows interest in his students.

He is a great professor. There is an analytical paper due at the end of the semester. I would advise you to write it as soon as possible as it is worth a hundred points out of the 280 points total. The quizzes are straightforward so long as you watch the lecture videos. Overall, it was both an intriguing and easy course.

The material isn't super interesting, but I thought he was very funny and made it entertaining, so I enjoyed the class. Kinda a tough grader and takes a while post grades. There are 4 exams, 1 paper, and 4-5 reading responses, so you need to do well everything to get a good grade. I took this class as a GE but I really enjoyed it.

Attendance is not mandatory but you must go to class if you want a good grade. Exams are written, 10 questions, 50 points total. Your answers have to be word for word what he says during lecture or you won't get full points. There are 4 exams, 2 papers, and 5 reading responses. Be prepared to be patient as he takes 3-6 weeks to grade papers/exams.

The class consists of constant lectures, mainly an outline where he details everything needed. He also gives study guides and goes over them a week before the exam and is even diligent with due dates. Overall, he is a great professor and even tries to crack jokes once in a while. However, sometimes, the lectures are a bit tiring and boring.

You almost have to be in class to understand anything but if you are it's well explained. Always goes over what will be on the test and what to study. Once gave extra credit for just being in class because few people showed up.

Dr. Stotik loves sociology and is a great lecturer. Initially, I thought this class was going to be a boring GEN ED, but I thoroughly enjoyed this course. The exams are not too difficult if you attend all lectures. The exams are specific so make sure to take notes during the lectures.

Professor Stotik is a pretty nice guy! Once a week, there is a lecture or two via Zoom, along with a reading, a paragraph or two response to the lecture/reading, and a quiz. Overall, this class is very relaxed and doesn't involve much work. Professor Stotik tends to make the lectures interesting, even if they're over Zoom!

I took SOCIOL 2367.02 online for my advanced writing credit. Stotik had interesting lectures that kept me engaged and interested. Around 4 essays and weekly quizzes which were all graded easily. Highly recommend
Attendance is not mandatory, but if you want a good grade go to class and take notes. Tests and papers are simple, and his lectures are amazing.

Dr. Stotik is an amazing teacher and very friendly guy. He is very humorous and has students laughing the whole class. The information is very interesting. Never bored in class. Tests are very fair for those who attend and take notes. I wish I could have him again.

Dr. Stotik was a wonderful professor! He was extremely engaging and shared stories of his travels. I took this class as a GEN ED but I was pleasantly surprised because I thoroughly enjoyed the content. There was rarely any homework but it is essential to attend class as the tests contain mostly content from the lectures

This man is a legend. 100% would take him again. As long as you write down what he says and keep them in bullet points for the exam (he does a review sheet a week before to give you notice on what to focus on for the exam). This man is what I hope all professors turn out like, wish he was a little more tech savvy but he's very flexible.

He was very quick to respond to emails! He was very lenient with assignments/quizzes when things came up. I took this as a second session asynchronys class so we relied on the textbook but as long as you read everything was very simple. (Bonus if you get the online book makes finding things so much easier if ykyk) Overall easy A id take again!

The class overall was alright, there were 4 reading responses and 2 essays that were basically free points as long as you do what he tells you to do, the exams were a mixed bag as he tell you what will be on the test and there aren't that much hard materials but he would throw in some stuff that were from the lecture and not on slides.

The class is graded off 4 exams, 4 reading responses, and 2 additional papers. There are no rubrics for papers and grading is very inconsistent. All assignments have 2-3 sentence instructions leading room for error, which leads to a bad grade. Lectures were terrible, as they were just broken notes. I would stay away from him/this class.

He is not tech savvy so tests are on college ruled paper so you have to write during the exam which is annoying. Do not take his class if you wanna fail. lectures are boring and waste of time. He doesn't take attendance and the exams are graded pout of 50 points. there is 1 final paper thats 100 points

his lectures are boring. there are 3 exam,1 final,13 discussions,1 paper. Exams are 5 questions and you have to answer in essay like answers. I thought I was doing great on my exam until he gave me a 8/50 and I asked him why and he said because u didn't throughly explain. But I studied off of his study guide so I was confused. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

Jeff is a great man and lecturer, but disorganized. Class is light with only 1 discussion post per week. There are 3 opinion papers that he'll give you an A on if you follow his directions. Tests are super hard, VERY specific short answer response that must be a paragraph each. Super hard to get an A on tests. Still probably the easiest of 2367s.

Grades are pretty test heavy.  He's not super tech-savvy, so your study guides and lecture notes are Word docs with 100 words on them. But the tests are exactly like the study guide, just know you have to write as many details as you can remember in order to get a good grade. Most of my learning was outside the classroom instead of his lectures

Jeff is really nice and cares about his students. For this class you have weekly discussion posts and 4 exams but they aren't that hard, so as long as you watch the weekly lectures and take notes you'll get an A.
Nice guy.  Not too much work for a writing class.  Sometimes lectures were boring.  Show up to class and you'll do well.

Jeff is a nice and easygoing professor and gives interesting lectures. Class grade is made up of 4 exams, 3 papers, and 10 weekly discussion posts. Papers are gradely leniently but you need to study for the exams. Use the study guide he gives! Overall an ok class and not a hard A.

Overall, I enjoyed this class and was fascinated by the material. It was sometimes hard to want to watch the long lectures, but it was worth the watch. 2 2-page papers, a weekly discussion post, 4 10-question short response tests, and one term paper (7-10 pages). Did not provide feedbacks on papers, but did not grade them hard.

Dr. Stotik has a very dry humor and tends to go on tangents, so his lectures are very interesting and funny. You have to complete a few papers and his exams are short answer responses. Overall, you probably don't have to attend class to do well but the lectures can be helpful for specific exam questions. Absolutely would recommend him.

Good ole Jeff is so nice and really cares about his students. His lectures are interesting, even when he goes off on tangents. He grades his essays pretty easily and is lenient. He looks for specific answers on his tests, but theyre not bad at all, you always know what information will be on the test because of his study guides.

Took this class back in Fall of 2020, so it was a hybrid class. I meant to type in SOCIOL2367.02, but Rate My Prof doesn't allow decimals. Gave me 100% on all of my papers and I didn't even complete all the readings. If you need an easy 2nd year writing and want to learn a bit about metroplitan cities (like CBus), this was a good class to do so in.

Weekly discussion posts, one final reflection paper, four tests. This class was very laid back and the lectures were very interesting, I actually enjoyed coming each week. Dr Stotik was cool and understanding throughout the semester - I would recommend taking this class!

Great dude. Had him for deviance too, very casual classroom environment, lectures aren't mandatory, but this class gives you what you put into it. It can absolutely be a blown off easy A, but you can learn a lot if you pay attention and participate

You don't really have to go to class, attendance isn't mandatory but it will help on tests. I show up to classes, took very little notes and got 100% or above on every tests. All tests are formatted the same and he essentially gives you the test questions beforehand.

Liked him so much I'm taking another one of his classes. Super cool guy, sometimes gets a little distracted but I didn't mind. Tests are easy as long as you take notes. Missed like 2 points all semester, very clear what was expected.

I took this class as a gen ed for my major, and it is the easiest class I have taken thus far. I only went to class for about the first month of the semester, and I haven't gone since then because lectures are not required to do well; I have a 100% in the class right now. As long as you use the notes he provides for the tests, you will be fine!

I did not even lose one single point from any assignment or exam in his class throughout the semester. As long as you write essays clearly and based on questions, you will get full points. Exams cannot be even easier. Dr. Stotik is also a very friendly and hilarious person in class, and I like talking with him.

Honestly, there isn't anything to say about Professor Stotik. There are 6 papers due throughout the year, but they were each only 2 pages double-spaced. It might be nice to attend lecture, but his exams come directly from his notes and he will occasionally include things from the readings he assigns but not very often.
I think he is a good instructor and very energetic. Besides, I think relating to the current events is useful. Going to the lecture is necessary.
If you do the basics, go to class, read etc, you'll get a decent grade. Lectures were usually interesting, sometimes humorous. He is really into what he's teaching.

Slides? No. Specific lecture? No. Interesting Knowledge? NO. Whatever, like he shows everything that won't be connected to exams. He is kind, so I really don't want to give him a bad grade, but he gives NO materials to review. Yes, I mean, 0 materials. You won't know why you get a bad grade although it seemed right, grading depends on him, fully.

Jeff is clearly very passionate about the subjects he teaches, but he gets so wrapped up in telling stories and talking about current events that is takes up A LOT of class time. As a result, we were behind the syllabus and he flew through several classes worth of material. Also he posts the study guides like 2 days before the tests

worst professor i've had at ohio state. she is rude, doesn't teach well, belittles students daily, and is just generally emotionally unstable while also being terrible at her job (coming from a Dean's list student). She caught one student cheating on their exam and punished everyone in the class, while also yelling in a condescending way
Hard tests. Sucky personality. Inserts own opinions. Seemed dismissive when I went to office hours.

Never gave good feedback on homework and didn't really seamed like she cared too much about teaching. We mostly did group work in class, she wouldn't teach the materials, but we had to teach ourselves.

You dont really learn much about sociological theory in this class like the course description says. She gives a bunch of reading and then doesnt teach or explain any of the reading during class. Also she seems like she does not really care about have a connection with her class which is something that I kind of look forward to in a teacher

Does not grade very well, if you miss points shes very vague about why you missed points and will not really explain what it is you need to do. Her lectures are really boring, she doesnt have anything prepared and relies on the students to know exactly what is happening and to carry on class.

I took her 4 week 1101 class (doesn't show up on the course code). It was incredibly easy. She came across as rude in her announcements, but I never saw her in person so I didn't care. Has bad grammar. The discussion posts were easy even if you skimmed the papers and textbook. Worst thing was you couldn't go back to ?s on exams

had her for about 5 classes, hated every second of it. rude and belittling, extreme amount of reading and papers and no care for a student's workload. took three of her classes at one time and she had two essays due on the same day for each class and only had a week to complete them.

If you need to take this course and struggle with statistics or math, use a different professor. She is impossible to reach outside of her limited class time, her office hours are also not easily flexible/accessible. After getting 2 tutors, I realized she made the material more difficult than necessary, especially asking students w/ other teachers

I'm taking Kristi's Statistics course for Sociology and I feel inclined to rate her because she is one of the most understanding and caring teachers I have ever met. After COVID-19, she has gone out of her way to help. The assignments graded most heavily are the exams and the homework. Midterm was a challenge, but homework is very straightforward.
she does not teach students, you have to teach yourself and attend lab to learn in this class

Kristi's class was a real joy to take. Though heavy on in-depth readings each week with corresponding discussion questions, a couple of those grades are dropped so you can catch a few breaks. Definitely challenging and interesting to anybody interested in sociology. TA's helpful. Exams require very little study if you've been paying attention.

Kristi had great online lectures, which led to great notes, which then led to easy assignments. Only had to study twice for this class. Enjoyed her in class lectures too, even if they weren't necessary besides the attendance.

I did not enjoy her class at all because she professes her opinion more so than the actual material. She teaches from one perspective and does not really like to see any others. She's also a bit crazy... I would have liked this class much more if she made it more modern and relatable. A lot of outside of class, busy bs work.

The class was very easy, however, there were many assignments. Many assignments could be dropped. It was half in class and half online which I preferred. Dr. Williams was a bit wacky at times but lectures had some important information.

Very easy class, if you half attempt to do the work, you'll get an A. It's a hybrid class, so the lecture videos are online and followed by a quiz on Canvas. I never actually watched the lectures, just copied the notes and the quiz was easy. Discussion questions are hard and the reading are way too extensive.

I enjoyed Sociology 1101 with Professor Williams. The exams are straightforward (info is directly from lecture video slides, online quizzes, and discussion questions). The discussion questions require a lot of reading; I would consider them the most difficult part of the course. The class is interesting and not bad overall if you put some time in.

Prof Williams seems like a nice enough person, but as an instructor she puts no work into the class. The lecture videos were recorded in the past and in class she tries to get people to argue about controversial topics. When she grades the project she does not grade fairly and will release her wrath on you if you question her.

Online lectures were the only thing that you needed to take notes on, because the class lectures were a repeat of the online ones. She assigns a TON of reading that is graded extremely tough by her TAs. The tests are easy and they are mostly made of quiz and discussion questions so as long as you study a little and do the homework, you are fine.

Dr. William's class was a hybrid class, meaning half online, half in-person. There were "lecture videos" given at the beginning of the week, followed by an easy quiz regarding the video. Later in the week, we met in class and went over discussion questions. If you are considering taking this class as a GE, do it. Dr. Williams is great

This was a hybrid course. Really boring in-class lecture, most people left after she took attendance. Tests are all definition based, you don't even need to fully watch the video lectures, just get the definitions from the slides and you'll be fine with the quizzes and tests. Discussion questions are super hard and the TA's grading are tough
Great teacher. Is very engaging and makes classes so incredibly easy for you as long as you put even half the energy into things that she asks you can do very well here.

Dr. Williams is an absolutely amazing professor who teaches the material very well. Attendance is mandatory as every class you answer a question and turn it in for participation points. The class is pretty easy if you just do the work and the hardest part is the discussion questions because the readings can be difficult but they are interesting.

Very easy class and very forgiving grading. Could get by with a B by doing the bare minimum and an A if just a little work is put in. Dr. Williams herself seems passionate about Sociology. Lectures were never really great or horrible, pretty average.

Online quizzes, that are open note from the online lecture videos, and there are 4 attempts for each quiz. 2 lowest quiz grades get dropped. 11 sets of 4 Discussion questions, one set due each week. Highest 6 grades on discussion sets are kept. 3 midterms and an optional final exam, only the 3 highest exam grades are kept. Exams are multiple choice

Tests are very straightforward. The questions mainly come from the online quizzes and discussion question answers (which she gives you in class). Class is once a week and she takes attendance. Drops many assignments. Three tests and an optional final, lowest test is dropped. Super easy and she's very nice. Highly recommend for an easy A.

Prof Williams was such a highlight in my first semester. She is interesting, and she runs a well-structured class. She makes lectures interesting and enjoyable. The only part that sucked was discussion questions, but she has a system where she only takes your top 6 scores out of 11. I love her and would take her again in a heartbeat. She cares!

The sociology class I took was half online and half in class. Very easy class. Kristi will literally do everything she can to help you out with grades. Honestly there is no reason that anyone should get less than a B in this class.
Dr. Williams is a good professor who is very passionate about what she teaches. The class is very easy, with minimal work. Highly recommended.

Took the hybrid class and there wasn't too much work. A lecture video and easy quiz every week and 4 discussion questions based on articles, total of about 4 hours along with class once a week. Not too tough of a grader. 6 discussion questions, 3 quizzes, and an exam dropped at the end of the semester.

I was in the hybrid class and it was pretty easy. There was a lecture video with a quiz due once a week and four discussion questions due once a week. She drops 6 discussion questions, 3 quizzes, and one exam- therefore making it very hard to fail.

I was in Prof. William's hydrid sociology course. Half of the lectures were online and the other half were in person. I think this method of teaching is perfect. You can work at your own pace, as long as you turn everything in on time. Every week there is a lecture video/quiz and discussion questions which take about 3 hours to complete. Recommend.

You can tell that Professor Williams really cares about her students and the subject that she teaches. However, for this being a GenEd class, it is a significant amount of work and not an easy A. In class sessions once a week, and other than that about 2.5 hours of work. An hour for the lecture video/quizes and about 1.5 hours for discussion posts.

Loved Professor William's Intro Sociology class. It was a lot of online lecture videos at your own pace- she didn't ask you to do much work, just to do good work when she did, and it wasn't stressful, just interesting. Would take any class she taught.

Kristi uses her position of power to pollute the weak minded individuals that take her class. While the subject is Sociology, she doesn't hesitate to put forth her liberal agenda in every lecture. You basically leave the class feeling like white men are the biggest cancer to society. This is a Sociology class, not Socialism class, Kristi. Stop.

Tests are heavy on lecture stuff, which sucks because her lectures don't make sense half the time. Inquizative is used for homework, which is also useless because none of that is on the exams. Honestly this class is fine for a GE, but it was my worst grade of the semester and I'm in much "harder" classes. Some of my friends did great though so idk.

Sitting through her class was absolutely terrible. The only reason I went to lecture was to sign in to TopHat in case I had a 'borderline' grade at the end of the semester. Not clear on assignments and most of her assignments are busy work that were not fulfilling.

Professor Williams is easy to understand, and she goes over the reading in class. The exams are heavily based on lecture, so make sure you go and pay attention - you need the book for homework. The homework was on Inquisitive and it can be time consuming, but you can just search for answers in the textbook.

Very nice professor. I've never taken stats in my life and this was such an easy course. Very boring lecture so I rarely attended, only really went to recitations and still did really well. For my class there was a required purchase of MindTap for $90 but that came with the e-textbook for weekly online quizzes for easy points! I highly recommend

Amazing professor! Very down-to-Earth and to the point in her lectures. The class is very easy if you attend lectures and take notes, because all of her test questions come STRAIGHT from the notes. She is very understanding and is always open to learning about students during office hours. If you have to take SOC 1101 for GE or major TAKE HER!
LONG and boring lectures. Just write down the notes and you'll be fine on the test. The homework is easy and not necessary for the tests. If you miss class she wont give you the notes for that day.

Tests based completely off her notes. Show up and copy down everything she puts up. Then go right back to yikyak. You dont need to listen to her, UNLESS she puts up graphsdatamedia, which you can't really copy but there is high % it'll be on test. Pay attention to that!! And she randomly does in class assignments to make sure you're there.
BORING lectures but easy class. Going to class isn't mandatory but she has pop up activities that she takes for participation that will help with points later on.

Reading all the other reviews coming into this class I figured this would be amazing and easy. While Kristi definitely is a cool person, her lectures can get quite boring. And her tests are not as easy as everyone makes it out to be, but if you do review notes well enough, you shouldnt have much trouble. Just make sure to go to class for the notes!

Definitely one of the easier, but not the easiest, class i've taken my first semester of freshman year. This section of Sociology is hands down easier than any of the others, which require way more work (papers, exams harder). Also, the final is optional, but taking it won't negatively affect your grade. The exams are straight from the lectures.
Not an easy A. The exams are not as easy as everyone says. You must go to class to get the slides because she does not put them online. She rambles on during lecture which makes it very long.

very easy to understand, material isn't hard at all. the tests are really easy, only 40 multiple choice, and there is an optional final. you do need to go to class because she puts questions directly relating to lecture on the test. textbook is free, and i didn't read it at all and was fine, just went to class.

Highly recommended professor! Dr. Williams is very engaging and passionate about sociology. She is fun to listen to with her comical sidebars, and I learned a lot of eye-opening information. With that said, this class is not as easy as people say. Got A by the skin of my teeth (0.1%) thanks to her extra 1%. Take it seriously. Great prof & class tho

Kristi was an awesome teacher. i learned a lot and she made the class super easy. TAKE THIS CLASS FOR SURE!!  Attendance is only mandatory if you want participation points, and they help because the only points in the class come from exams and discussion points so the more points you get, the better. Great prof though!
I loved this class. It was one of my easier classes and the information was interesting. If you want an easy A, take this class with her!

Professor Williams is great. Her exams are largely based off of lectures, so if you take notes from her PowerPoints you will do well. Clicker points are rewarded based on participation in class, not on correctness. Blog Postings that you are assigned are graded on completion. Overall, it was an easy and interesting class.
Overall, she is a good instructor.But sometimes I can't figure out what the midterm and final want to test. So it made me spend a lot of time to memorize the whole textbook????

the class isnt hard but not that easy. decent amount of reading. exams were from lectures and readings, sometimes random tid bits from the book appeared so you had to read the entire chapter each time. the only negative thing is that slides in lecture have to much info, and she talks so much about each slide that its hard to type/write and listen

the best teacher you could get for this course. she is so nice and helpful. goes through the examples step by step so no one gets left behind. has powerpoint slides on carmen, but have to go to class to fill in a few blanks. take her if you have to take this class.
Excellent!  She made states easy and understands that no one really cares/wants to be there.  She is very realistic and extremely nice!
She is a great teacher. She is fun and always brings up great examples when explaining how to do the problems.
Good teacher. Fairly easy course. Well organized class.  Tests are basically from the class notes.
fantastic teacher

Dr. Long is very passionate about what he teaches, so even though it can be very boring, he does his best to make it interesting. There were 12 quizzes, 4 exams, a very strict no technology policy, and attendance is mandatory. He sets very clear expectations for the class which is nice. If you put in the work/pay attention, then you should be ok.

Amazing prof and engaging/ hilarious lectures. Long readings (40-80+ pgs) that go with 12 quizzes that make up the majority of your grade. The class & prof seems intimidating at first but is actually quite easy and fun if you put the work in to study and pay attention during lecture. Has a strict no technology policy so be prepared to write notes.

I would highly recommend this course for those interested in sociology or who see themselves furthering their education in the subject. For people like myself, who are just trying to fulfill a course requirement this professor is not for that. This course is lecture heavy. FYI: 10 points are taken from your following exam per class missed.

He is a great teacher that a lot of people really won't like. Not an accommodating prof, but if you work hard, read everything, and don't get distracted, you will learn so much from his fluid, knowledgeable lectures. If you want an easy A, take someone else, if you love theory and are legitimately interested, take him. 4 exams, 13 quizzes

Pros
-Well-researched and passionate about sociology
-Humorous/interesting lectures (subjective)
-Grades are usually representative of effort
-Gives subtle hints for the test in lecture

Cons
-Rigid grades + fast-paced lectures
-Difficult tests
-Tedious readings (~40 pages/week)
-Extreme work load compared to other professors that teach intro socio

Dr. Long's teaching style is not for all. First, he doesn't allow any electronics in his class, so no phones, ipads, or computers to take notes. Second, if the 27 page syllabus doesn't scare you, tests being worth 200 points will. Be prepared for quizzes due on a random tuesday at 8 pm (really dumb time that makes it so ppl forget about it). :(
Professor Long has a phenomenal understanding of what he teaches.  It is up to the student / class to be engaged.  There is a lot to learn from his expertise.

Adam Long was the worst professor I ever took. His exams are unnecessarily complicated. He has a savior complex thing, where he thinks he is accommodating but he is not. You have to always show up to class or he will take 10 points off your exam. If you have the option to take another professor for this class please do.

I feel like he is unfairly criticized.  Yes, he can come off as demeaning as times but his lectures are extremely informative and I learned a lot.  You can tell he is very passionate about what he teaches and if you take good notes and study you should be fine.  Note that there is a lot of reading every week.
You learn so much from Dr. Long if you actually do the things youre supposed to do. If you dont, the class is hard and would definitely suck

Class was far too much work for a 3 credit hour/3000 level class. I wasn't prepared to spend so much time on it so I ended up with my lowest grade in college ever. He is a passionate teacher but it was so hard to take this class online. Listened to 3+ hours of lectures/week + hours of reading. Tests used Proctorio which is bad for anxious people.

I took this class in AU20 but i noticed all the negative reviews and thoroughly disagree. As long as you attend class, study even for a couple days before the exam (I recommend more), read the assigned readings, then you should do fine. Intensive professor but you learn a lot. He is quite knowledgeable on sociology. May be best for soc majors tbh.

This is the second course I have taken with Dr. Long, the first being SOC3306. Many are rating him quite unfairly. Yes, the classes are difficult and he expects you to read and study thoroughly but I cant help but feel the people complaining are used to very laid back soc pedagogy. This class forces you to actually learn and you will learn a lot

Not sure why he has such low ratings. I think Adam Long is an amazing professor. Throughly explains the material is a way for students to understand. He is one of the best lecturing professors I have encountered so far at OSU. He doesnt just read from the slides like most professors and really engages with the class.

This prof has been the worst experience of teaching I have had at Ohio State, I can see why the guy makes less than $20 bucks an hour. Expected to read over seventy pages of information a week, then only asks you ten specific questions over the entirety of the chapters. Tests are just as convoluted.

The class is listed as a 3000 level course but could easily be a 4000 level course. He requires students to make a discussion post and take a quiz once a week and has 4 tests. Easily one of my least favorite professors

I really enjoyed this course, especially the lectures! The weekly assignments are easy, as long as you read the text and follow the syllabus. There's a lot of material to cover, though, and the exams are incredibly challenging! This was an online course, but Dr. Long was accessible and he always responded quickly to my emails.

Took the class SP21. Always responds to emails with no help at all, just a grouchy retort. Never accessible outside of office hours. Does not actually care about students and never seems to have any sympathy whatsoever. Tests are weighted TOO highly on the grading scale for the class. I have not had a positive experience with him thus far.

Preface: Took the class online during SP21 as well as SOCIOL5450. He is not flexible at all, even though he thinks he really is (and will constantly tell you he is). Difficult tests (too many points for tests), unique learning style that doesn't really line up with mine, material was all given to me so that was nice- good PPT's. Lots of reading.

Avoid at all cost! Terrible communication, send out maybe one announcement all semester. Takes days to respond to emails & is incredibly condescending. Test questions intentionally worded to confuse you which drops your grade on material you know. You basically have to teach yourself the entire course. Made my fav subject a miserable nightmare.

Adam Long is the worst teacher that I have ever had at Ohio State. He is extremely condescending and not accessible at all. Once it took him 6 days to email me back about a tech problem with an exam, and when he replied he tried to blame the issue on me. He makes no attempt to teach the course content, then expects you to be an expert for exams.

If you feel like reading 70 pages and listening to a lecture audio fro 2-3 hours every week then this is your guy. Literally makes everything 100000% harder than it has to be. I've heard good things about his in-person classes but stay away from his online class!!

Professor Long obviously knows what hes doing & is passionate about the material he teaches but thats all! He communicates the material well but does not connect to students. His lectures have a ridiculous amount of info and his exams are overly difficult even if you generally understand whats going on in the class. I would not recommend AT ALL.

Please do not take this teacher if you don't have to! Probably one of my worst professors I ever had to the point I had to drop the class. He's very strict when it comes to learning his style of learning and does not respect his students. He demands respect but doesn't give it to his students. He was not helpful and ignores any question you ask.

Dr. Long is an intellectual with a very distinct learning and teaching style. He is interested in what he teaches, which makes it fun to learn, but his style simply isn't for everyone. If you have trouble understanding readings and terminology on your own before having lectures, this definitely isn't the class for you.

Adams tests are super tricky which sucks because the class is incredibly interesting. Test questions came down to one word mix ups so be careful when reading questions. There is one extra credit opportunity.

Exams have trick questions, has you read 30+ pages every class for quiz prior to lectures, quizes change days randomly half way through semester, never responds to emails, show no respect to students, entire class uses the textbook, quiz week 1 before you can get your book shipped to you, will yell at entire class for asking questions, avoid if can

Professor Long puts in his syllabus that he cares about helping students, but then blames the students when more than half of them are getting Ds and Es in his class. There is more reading than necessary, and you cannot access the lectures until after the weekly quiz, meaning you're teaching yourself the dense readings.

Does not understand that we are in the middle of a PANDEMIC. Makes everything unnecessarily difficult. Format of class is backwards and makes no sense--gives you 24 hours to complete reading and a quiz before he even lectures on it. Lectures are ridiculously dense. The most frustrating professor I've ever had.

He is the worst professor at Ohio State University. If I could rate him lower than 1, I would. Purposely ask's trick questions on exams to confuse you. He does not allow technology. I felt like I was in high school because he kicked people out for having their phone on the desk. Unfathomable amount of information in lectures. All around terrible

Dr. Long requires a lot of reading and mostly lectures during class. As long as you show up to class and do the reading you should do well. He cares about his students and wants you to do well. Oh also, no technology in his class. His honors classes are harder with more reading and two long papers, avoid for honors.

He tells you how to pass at the beginning of the semester. Gives you a lot of bonus. If you do everything he offers you, you will learn a lot and get an A. You have to go to class or you lose points. I loved this class. I think this is a great smart guy. I would recommend this class to everybody
Only the test count towards your grade but does offer bonus points. READ THE SLIDES TO STUDY FOR TEST!!! He's a bit rough but genuinely interested in what he teaches, not an easy class.
Demands respect but won't respect you as a student. Very hard to work with as far as absences etc. Has a very strict no-technology policy which I guess works for some.
Hard class but worth all the effort. One of the best professors I ever had and plan on requesting him again for future classes. All tests and quizzes are multiple choice

I would never take a class with him ever again. He is extremely over the top. You could not use anything that could be distracting to him. The material is lengthy and at least for me, it did not work out while taking other classes. I had to study weeks and weeks before the test, to even attempt to get a decent grade. thmain point do no take him.

I was scared of this professor on the first day because he made it seem like the class would be difficult and his syllabus seemed super strict. Now that I've finished the class I can say he is my favorite professor I have had at OSU and this was my favorite class. It's not difficult to do well if you pay attention in class and read

Long is a prof who demands respect. Don't take him if you're not okay with his no-technology and mandatory attendance policy, but I think it's worth it. He really cares about the success of his students and does a great job of making class material super engaging. Exams aren't too hard if you pay attention in class and complete weekly exams.

This was the first class Ive had in a long time that I looked forward to going to, despite a very strict no technology rule. He is a fantastic lecturer that, in my opinion, makes up for some of the negatives like the strict attendance policy and tricky exams. He does offer 40 points of extra credit built into the class.

Mixed opinion. I love his teaching method (read, quiz, go over, test) but I strongly dislike him as a person. He is incredibly rude. If you miss more than 2 classes, you will lose points on your final grade. I had to fight him for half of the semester and go to the head of sociology because I had to have emergency surgery and he wouldnt excuse it.

If I have to tell you anything about this class, is don't take this with a chronic health condition that causes you to miss more than two classes. Even with accommodations, you will maybe get one extra day to miss. And if you miss more than those two days, prepare for points to come off your midterms for missed days even if you pass the midterm.

Dr. Long is a great professor. These reviews initially scared me but I ended up really enjoying this class. It isn't a blow off class -- you will need to read a lot every week and show up to lecture but it's necessary to understand the material. If you do what you need to do and treat the class like an upper-level college course, you'll do well.

Guys..... this class was ridiculously boring. HOWEVER, it is so necessary if you plan to pursue a masters in social work. I shouldve paid more attention. Yes, hes a hard grader. But all of the information is necessary. I feel that I short changed myself by not taking it seriously. He is very clear in his expectations and does respond to questions

Dr. Long is the professor that all of your high school teachers warned you about. He's tough and the class isn't an easy A, but it's definitely possible to excel if you put in the work. He clearly conveys information on the material and is willing to elaborate when questioned. He's an excellent lecturer and great at making you think critically.

I loved his class, but I could also see why some people wouldn't. Don't take his classes unless you really care about the material and are willing to put in effort. I did well, but I wouldn't have if I didn't do all the readings, pay attention in class, and study for the tests. He also cares a lot about attendance and rule following type stuff.

A lot of people hate him, and he definitely was very hard, but I enjoyed his lectures and I liked him as a person. The class was interesting; it's a LOT of work, but if you put in the effort you can get an A. There are 40 bonus points built into the class, and there are 2 long papers and 2 exams. Very hard, but he's passionate and a good teacher.

Adam is a good professor but can be a little arrogant sometimes. Weekly reading assignments can be long but DO THEM! It really helps with retaining the material in the class. Exams aren't too bad but he loves to put trick questions on them. Overall tho, it is clear that he loves teaching the class and is knowledgable on the subject.
Extremely intelligent but can be tricky. I wasn't a fan of his testing/grading style but all in all was a great professor who forces you to see both sides.

Don't expect to miss more than 2 classes and keep a good grade. I got a 180 on my final but because I missed 2 classes extra than given due to illness, & he took 40 points off it. He cares more about you showing up even when you're too ill to than your actual safety or health. Also the weekly quizzes don't even matter on the actual tests.

Dr. Long is an amazing lecturer. He is extremely difficult and you have to put in the effort, but you will be rewarded for hard work. Lots of reading and the quizzes and exams are difficult. Definitely recommend making a friend in the class and studying outside of class! He makes class interesting and is very easy to talk. Would recommend.

so inspirational. i absolutely love the way he presents the information. he is so passionate about the material and even though its political, he presents it in a way that you listen regardless of your political party. he only lets you skip twice though. i studied two hours before the exams and got As.

I know hes been deemed a hard professor but if you put in the work, you are easily rewarded. Four exams and lots of reading. His lectures are inspiring and have taught me a lot. If youre like me and excel at memorization, this class is for you. Easily one of my favorite classes i have taken here. Do not miss class. He takes that seriously.

One of the most difficult sociology classes I've ever taken, but 100% worth it. He makes you work for your grade but if you truly do everything he asks (which is a lot) you'll do well. There's tons of reading, attendance is definitely mandatory and you have to pay heavy attention while he lectures or else it's very easy to get lost. Loved the class

Each test seemed to be filled with trick questions. He wants you to learn his testing style more than the material, it seems. There was once even a quiz question about the footnotes of the readings. Ridiculous number of quizzes & tests for a 5000 level course. Grades wont reflect hard work. Avoid this class if you can.
He's condescending. Just the type of dude who immediately turns you off.

Dr. Long is a great lecturer, but his test and quiz questions were really nit-picky and overly specific, often about random information that wasn't very relevant to the overall idea. Lots of memorization. The grading scale made it difficult (if not almost impossible) to get an A. The class averages for tests were almost always mid to low Cs.

He only gave tests and quizzes in class. They were way too hard. He will not curve on grades. Class average on tests were in the 70's ! He still wouldn't give extra credit or help students. Just kept telling us to count our points towards our grades. He was more worried about his SES scores and lectured us on how we should grade him .

Very tough class. There are 4 tests, all very specific and nit picky. The tests are all multiple choice but they are the most obscure and random questions. I attended every class and still only got a C. Not impressed with his teaching methods and especially not his tests

Your grade only consists f Tests and quizzes, both of which are VERY difficult. I did learn a lot from this class and it was very interesting to me but it's extremely hard to get a good grade in this class. He makes no effort to help your grade and seems to only care about himself. I do not recommend!
You have to put in the work but you do learn a lot!

I will not take any of his other classes. The only way to show your work in class is through Quizes and Tests that are extremely hard! No bending on grades, and no other ways to show that you know the material. It's all about the points when you ask about the grades. Shame he isn't more diverse letting students show him how they know the material

Dr. Long is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. He is very passionate, tries his best to be fair and help you out. The way he presents information is very objective and thorough and makes you feel like you have the whole story. He's funny too. His attendance policy is no longer nearly as bad as the earlier comments made it out to be.

Unprofessional preofessor cares only about his SEI.  He is very stringent and not willing to have common ground with students concern only to his own policy and obsessed with SEI.  Miss class for a day, it one unexcused absent. But, if life emergency then if you miss another it is 20 points deducted. I feel like this professor likes to micromanage

This class was one of my favorites during my time at Ohio State. Dr. Long knows how to deliver the information in a way that will truly help you understand the content. Before class there is always reading and a quiz, which can get tiring, but it makes lectures a LOT easier to understand. Highly recommend this professor.

Knows how to teach in a way that works. A lot of note taking but good notes. He knows the content and encourages great conversations. Gives both arguments in lectures. Doesn't post powerpoints but doesn't need to. A lot of reading, but only necessary to do paper and for exams. Try to keep up on them as best you can though if you're struggling.

Dr. Long is a very nice professor. He is very passionate about his work and are willing to share his passion with students. Yes, this class requires a lot of reading and efforts. But like other people said, it is college. You should prepared for things like readings and papers. This course is also very inspirational.

Dr. Long is tough, but fair, & that's what makes him respectable. Yes the class has a heavy reading load, but like others pointed out, it's college, get used to it. He's very passionate about the subject, & every single person in class paid attention because he was so into it. He is very willing to answer questions & holds discussions during class.
Very rude and condescending person, makes you feel that education is not even worth it anymore. I regret this.

Yes, there's a ton of reading. However, that's the only assigned work in the class (besides a paper). In college reading is to be expected. You can do fairly well on the quizzes with just skimming the text. Dr. Long is super inspirational, and you can tell he is passionate and caring about both students and the topic.  Lecture is mandatory.

A lot of the comments about Dr. Long's class is about the work load. Yes, it's a lot, but if you're coming to college expecting every class to be a cake walk, maybe college isn't for you. Doing well in the class is all about time management. He is very willing to work with students to come to a working compromise as to how to improve the class.

If you have any intentions of graduating... DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! You will have a quiz nearly every week (over nearly 100+ pages). You have three exams worth a significant amount of the overall course points. However, every class missed (excused or not) will automatically cut your grade on the exam by an entire letter!!!

Perhaps the most insane  class I have ever taken, absurd on every level.  More work load than my other 6 classes combined and a lower grade. The guy knows his stuff but this is far from an intro class, so stay away if you can.  This is the most civilized I can be about this class. A letter grade off the test for every class missed, come on!

The work load was ridiculous. Hard to study for exams with how much information there is. This class made me want to change my major. You miss one class and your grade tanks. Reading quizzes are online but even with doing the reading and having the book in front of you, you can still fail! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

Dr. Long really knows his stuff, but he expects you to know it just as well as he does... This is an intro class but feels more like a grad level class. I loved his lectures though. He was very informative and genuinely cared about the subject.  Paper was ridiculous with overly specific criteria and over Spring Break. Exam averages were below 60%

This was one of the most difficult classes I have taken that has the word "intro" in the title. Dr. Long acted as if this was a higher level elective with the amount of reading and reading quizzes. The exams are full of tricky questions. Doesn't post notes on Carmen and doesn't provide study guides. Requests for help pretty much went ignored.

Extremely difficult class to keep up with. He has his own specific "values" and does not take constructive criticism well. Reading quizzes every week and claims they are to help you but the questions are in his own words, difficult to understand, and often trick you. He expects you to read difficult material and teach yourself the information.

This class assigned 50+ pages of readings from two books per week (sometimes 150 pages).. Get ready to recite extremely detailed information that is impossible to remember or to take notes on. Does not post slides/lectures on Carmen, does not support students with problems. Get ready to write non-stop during lecture. BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!

A lot of work for just one week. Boring documentary that you MUST watch, a lot of long readings and long lecture videos. Every discussion has to be 350 word and you'll respond to someone and it must be 100 words; alone with a quiz per. She doesn't respond to emails.

Huda is an easy grader who gives interesting lectures about how immigrants and migrant policy have shaped the US. 1 EASY 100-150 word discussion post a week, 1 EASY midterm you can easily get over a 100 on if you study the slides she gives, and 1 paper for the final.  Easiest and most interesting class ever. She drops your lowest grades too.

You could tell he cared about his students and was very laid-back. Not many assignments, ~4 writing assignments and an exam or two. The material wasn't too difficult, a lot of overlapping content from most sociology classes regarding theories - I would recommend reading the textbook.

Dr. Bellair is an excellent professor. He really cares about his student's success. His course is very well-organized and he does as much as he can to make a course of this difficulty accessible to his students. The only note was some of the readings were really long, over 100 pages, and could have easily been assigned with only the abstract.

Very, very boring lectures. Stays on the same slide for an hour. Attendance does matter because you do writing assignments in each class. Very boring and drawn out talks but easy class. Tests aren't too bad as long as you study.

Overall a pretty easy class if you do the readings and attend class to complete critical thinking written assignments (1-2 paragraphs). Lectures are extremely boring. I think this class could be really interesting if taught by a different professor. If you want to attend jailprison tours, don't schedule class after this one.

Overall solid professor. Class can seem a bit slow at times and he isn't the best with powerpoint, but he certainly knows his stuff. If you attend class, pay attention, and do the in class writings, it's hard to get a bad grade. Exams are easy, and he look like Tobias from Arrested Development without a mustache. Solid dude
Boring. Bad use of powerpoint.

I actually enjoyed this class with Professor Bellair.  His exams are pretty easy as long as you read the chapters and attend class.  Complete the critical thinking questions and it is hard to get a bad grade in this class.  He knows what he's talking about and invites you on jail visits with his higher level classes! I'd take a class with him again
Extremely boring teacher, speaks mono-tone the whole time. Makes harder to understand than it should be.

The previous two post say it well. He stands in front of the class and simply lectures from the book, he's more than boring, and he makes the class harder than it needs to be. He does provide his slides but not until a couple days before the test. He gives absolutely NO review and you're on your own for the tests. Very disappointed in this teacher.

He is unresponsive to e-mails if you need to miss class, so you don't even know if he received them. He doesn't give out study guides. He says read the chapters assigned & study the slides which are like 80 slides. He doesn't post the ppts before hand so you give up taking notes. He says you can arrange to change your final if needed but doesn't.

3 MC tests. Seemed to stretch for material on a few of the questions. Lectures were pretty boring. Had 1-3 opinion questions that you had to hand in at the end of each class. Just hand in something and you are good. These were worth a solid % of the grade and worth the effort.

Teacher makes students by his own textbook while just ranting in circles for class. He awkwardly laughs and circles around subjects without giving a clear opinion. He then tests students on his own book which he forces them to buy/read. Attendance is mandatory as you must speak and do in-class writings which tend to be asking for a spew. not worth

Dr. Price-Spratlen is great. He's passionate and energetic, he's incredibly kind and incredibly smart. He teaches you how to think instead of what to think. I felt moved more than once during his lectures. He's difficult to follow though. Don't be afraid to ask for clarification. And don't bother emailing - just knock right on his office door.

This man is a passionate educator, however his lectures are regularly rambling sessions where you're never sure if the things he randomly writes on the chalkboard are testable material. Good luck studying your notes, because his slideshows make no sense, aren't descriptive, and he unnecessarily abbreviates words. Do NOT take a class with this man.
Hes a little all over the place but overall he was inspiring and a cool professor. East class

Dr. Price-Spratlen is a really nice guy who teaches a pretty interesting course. I took this class as a GE and was really intrigued by the information. He is very passionate about the subject and keeps you engaged. Assignments and exams are pretty straight forward if you show up and review presentations that he posts online.

Dr. Price-Spratlen was one of the most passionate educators I had the privilege of learning from during my 4 years at Ohio State. The course I took with him was just a GE and had nothing to do with my major, yet it was one of my favorite classes. He is a truly inspirational teacher and one of the best professors I have ever had.

He is honestly a great professor! He is definitely very sporadic and tends to go on tangents, but he definitely knows what he is talking about and keeps you awake and interested during class. The first half of the class uses a free online textbook, but you need to purchase his book for the second half (cheap). Overall good class; I would recommend!

Great guy over all but I would never in my entire life tell someone to take his class. You'll want to pull your hair out every class. His intricate vocabulary and nonsensical demeanor will drive you insane. He makes you buy a textbook he wrote which pissed me off.  His slides make zero sense so good luck studying!

some of the worst lectures I have had to sit through in my entire life. He talks about the most irrelevant information. He is a scatter brained loon who should not teach a class. Makes you buy a book that he wrote, are you kidding me?  Do not take this class if you can avoid. He is a nice guy and it is an easy A, but will drive you insane all term
You just show up for lecture, and have two tests and homework assignments. Participation is a big thing. He tends to not be so clear, because he side tracks a lot.

Townsand is great, but you won't like his class if you're not serious. He's a passionate and vastly intelligent instructor that doesn't dumb his material down. He has a tendency to lecture in dense academic jargon that can make simple concepts seem complicated. However, he is very kind and helpful. Expect class participation and to work in groups.

He's very ambiguous. Gives you a group paper and group assignments with no real directions. Luckily, they're not that hard and you can kind of do your own thing. Every week we had an in class assignment (writing your opinion) that was for a participation grade. His lectures don't make sense. MCQ on tests are easy, but the short answer are hard.

Horrible teacher. He makes simple concepts much more difficult than what they should be. He is a tough grader, and his tests were kind of hard. He is always late to class and at the end he makes you write about a topic and it is graded. Also class participation is a must, even though he doesn't tell you it is. DON'T TAKE HIM!!!!

The nicest guy I've ever met and my favorite professor at OSU--favorite teacher I've ever had.  You won't find anyone who cares more about their subject and it shows.  Always takes time to answer questions and entertain the ideas of every student.  Couldn't recommend him highly enough.

Slept through lectures, was barely awake for recitations. still got an A. here's how: BOOKS never read it, go to lectures and wake up for in-class writings, also attend recitation, 3 real easy essays that were max 2 pages. boom you got 50%. 1 mid term and final average 87 on multiple choice exams

Very easy class. However, you need to attend lecture, or you miss information that shows up on tests. Only three homework assignments over the entire semester! And they're simple to do. He sometimes goes off on tangents or loses clarity. He's really goofy, and uses strong hand gestures. However, he's clearly passionate about what he's teaching!

He is the nicest guy in the whole world. He is really energetic and LOVES the subject on which he's teaching. He is passionate about sociology, and as long as you go to class and participate, you'll get a good grade. You have to pay attention, otherwise you might miss some key information because he moves quickly and is a LITTLE confusing.

He has very strong hand gestures. very difficult to follow. He basically turns a very simple concept into more than one whole lecture.  Slow on grades, does not email you back AT ALL, and very unorganized.  Difficult to succeed

Takes far too long to get grades in, which is inexcusable because his tests are Scantron with short answers. Has very awkward mannerisms that disrupt the flow of his teaching. His chosen subject matter has little relevance considering it's about pre-tweens that know nothing about the significance of sex and religion. Avoid.

Very enthusiastic and never stops moving. He's definitely smart, but too smart for his own good. He sees all sorts of connections between concepts but struggles to explain it to students. He tries to explain things but can't maintain a clear train of thought. Always late to class, but he tries to help outside of class if you can reach him.

Very difficult to understand at times, he uses a vocabulary fit for perhaps graduate school, not a 101 class. Class is mandatory and is graded by little writings at the end of every class. It was painfully difficult to stay awake during his repeated definitions time and time again

I found Professer Price-Spratlen to be a good teacher. He kept the class interesting, although was prone to going off on tangents. He was also really funny. He gave out multiple pop quizzes so attendance was pretty much mandatory. His class was pretty easy and didn't require much paying attention. The recitations were always kind of a drag though.

Focused on sex and religion within teenagers in America. He goes on random tangents a lot, but they are funny. I enjoyed this class quite a bit. Not like a normal soc101 class, but I still learned. I liked it

He is a very opinionated professor. His teaching style is strange and he never finishes a thought. Definitions are longer than they should be and he gets so worked up that he never focuses on what he's talking about. The lectures are very scattered and often times unclear. If you have him, go to recitation because that's how you will pass.
You have random quizzes worth 10 points throughout the quarter so attendance becomes mandatory because of it. He is a confusing teacher but exams arent too hard. Class is fine overall

going to this class was a drag. the professor just uses big words that are unecessary and talks about teens and sex. you have to go to class because attendence is taken on random dates at the very end by asking a simple question. the class over all is common sense and the exams were not hard or tricky. recitation helps
Yes he is repetitive, drags on, etc. But in the end the class is easy and you won't spend much time on it. Nothing wrong with taking him.

He's not the greatest professor at Ohio State but he's not the worst I've had. He would be better if he realized that everyone in the class was not a Sociology or Criminology major. Stay away if you can, if you can't then get to know your TA extremely well.
ehh
If you're thinking of taking this guy's class, DON'T DO IT!  Yes, he is very energetic, but he is so confusing.  I hated going to this class b/c all we talked about was teens having sex.

One of the worst professors ever. He was late to every single lecture and managed to spend an excessive amount of time over explaining each simple concept and still not make any sense. I went into this class expecting a broad intro to sociology and instead heard more than I ever wanted to about teenagers having sex.

I took the class to get my major going two years ago and he was the most awful teacher i've had thus far.  He takes a simple definition and turns it into something no one can follow.  I am deep into my sociology major now, and have found out that I learned nothing to prepare me for the other classes.  He talks about pointless things. He stutters.

He was very passionate about teaching, but his lectures dragged on.  He posts the lecture slides at the end of the week, and they are very incomplete or incoherent, so make sure you go to lecture.  The exams are fair if you study the notes and read the text.  I didn't really enjoy this class or his teaching style very much
Not a good teacher. he makes things that are easy difficult. he makes a 5 word definition a 15 minute speech. I don't recommend him.
Very repetitive.

LOVED HIM AND THIS CLASS! Very enjoyable and engaging; I took it as a GEC and loved it so much I'm considering a double major in soc now. He's an excellent teacher w/ great examples and clear lecture formats; very easy to understand and very approachable with any questions a student may have; offered several extra credit options for student success

Sociology 101 should NOT be hard. This prof is the WORST that i have had at OSU. He talks and talks and talks but never makes a point! There is no textbook just a novel and a collection of articles so there is no way you can use a book to get by. WORST PROFESSOR EVER! DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS.
easy class, read the book and you'll get an A. Looks like the book is for high school students. he was my prof winter 06 and was punctual and charismatic. you can see he teaches with passion

I am not exagerating when I say:worst professor I have ever had. Very unorganized, late, boring, lacks speaking skill, and can not explain things with out stuttering. This guy is one of the research professors trying to teach.
nice guy, but he has the worst lectures ever!!  The class is easy overall
Sucked
No Comments
Although he gets off subject, he's smart and always energetic about what he does.
This is one of the worst classes ever. You never know what he is talking about and he is incrediablly annoying.
Love the enthusiasm, great for someone who struggles paying attention to drawn out lectures.

HE SUCKS!!! He is rude, self righteous, and annoying.  He sweats his way through class like he is teaching aerobics, only it's nowhere near as interesting.  He is just plain awful and unhelpful.  I rather would stick a hot poker in my eye then speak to him again.  Get over yourself dude, you are not nearly as smart as you think you are.  peace out

I agree with the lateness, the obnoxious hand show, and the lack of time efficiency.  He is hard to get a hold of outside of class, as it takes him forever to respond to emails if at all.  He is incredibly repetitive to the point of nauseating.  And he is always "Let me retrack, what's my point?"  No time for class time for group projects.

This class was so unorganized.  The TA's were teaching different things than what he was teaching.  He is always late! and he skips things from the outline b/c he gets behind in time and tells you to get the info online.  If i didn't have a kick ass TA i would have been screwed.  (Amy Holiday)He is a smart man but a horrible teacher.
Very energetic, but sometimes hard to understand.  Very willing to call on people for questions however, to make up for any student that is lost.

He seems like he would be a great professor in the graduate department, but not for undergraduates. He seems like he tries to show off by using fancy words that just make me very confused. I dont feel like he take his job very seriously because he is always late, which is very unprofessional.
This guy is very animated and energetic, he is late quite frequently, but he has very detailed notes on the projector.
Boring...huge vocabulary.  sounds like he should be a baptist preacher.
No Comments

5 mins late for class every morning. Never puts his hands down if you're looking for a teacher who puts on a puppet show with his hands he's it. His hand show distracts the lecture, although the back of your eyelids will too. Advanced vocab GO TO HARVARD

He was late for class every single day. The vocabulary he uses is totally unnecessary. He would be much clearer if he would speak on the level of students takin an intro-sociology course rather than acting like the class was full of harvard grad students.
BORING!!!! Always late, soo unclear, did not enjoy it at all!
Always late to lecture, way too advanced vocab for that early of a class.  BORING.
No Comments
dr. townsend made an 8:30 lecture easy to tolerate because he's energetic and interesting to listen to.
No Comments

Dr. Price-Spratlan is cool.  Be prepared for a very energetic lecturer - the man never stops moving.  Still a good guy, though.  Loves student input into class and will always try to clear up any confusion.

Man Yao is very knowledgeable in her field and explains the material well. I could tell she is passionate about what she teaches and wants us to leave the class taking away something, which I felt I did.

Would have waited til the end of the semester to leave feedback but potential students of hers need to know how great she is. She cares to pass on her incredible knowledge, course work makes sense and is completely fair for the workload. An absolute gem of a professor, we are lucky to have. Great lectures, and always understanding! Take her class!

Professor Lovell was extremely educated on the topic of victimology. She brought in guest speakers and her own experience with sexual assault kits. Her exams are highly influenced by her lectures, so don't skip class.
