My math skills are minimal so this was a rough class for me. Rachel's outlines and her clear, orderly presentation of material sure helped. Plus she was always available by email when I had questions.
No Comments

I knew this statistics class was going to be hard going in but Rachel made it as easy as possible.  Her lectures were clear, her class outlines great and she was always available to provide extra help to students who needed it.  I have talked to students who took this from other instructors who were not so fortunate.
everyone says she ok...not sure exactly
Awful

This course was awful. Avoid if can. doesn't grade anything and barely provides feedback. Didn't provide lecture materials only journal articles for weekly reading response and Expected a final paper. The online course was the least of his priorities and had trouble managing his work emails. I have been to 2 colleges and this was the worst I had.

I'll be honest I didn't read the book. He tells you to and gives reading assignments and they make up 1/3 of exams. I got a B which I guess is fair. I studied but didn't read. He's a nice guy, boring lecturer and hard essay grader.

Worst instructor I've ever had at OSU. Late at least 10 minutes to class every single day including to both exams. Uses examples that no one can relate to. Grades major papers but doesn't give critiques. Extremely boring class. Rarely used the book. Dry material. Left class each day and couldn't remember what I learned. Avoid at all costs.

The previous poster is way off. He is very open about his love for teaching. He also takes his daughter to school in the morning before coming to class and picks up a projector, so occasional lateness is bad, but understandable. He does try too hard on jokes sometimes. Assignments are a lot of work, but he is helpful if you ask him. Supportive.

Just awful. Really boring, not funny, 20 minutes late to class every day and an additional 20-30 minutes of class time talking about his children/the Yankees/high book prices. Attempts to use Michigan/Ohio State rivalry to try and explain terms but fails miserably. Very subjective grader. Blatantly doesn't want to be teaching.
No Comments

I took 1101H. Dr. Roscigno is everything you could ask for in a professor. He is able to share his passion for sociology so well: lectures were always fun and engaging. All grades are writing based, though he does grade very leniently. Easy class, easy "A," yet I learned a ton in the process. Dr. Roscigno is amazing.
Wonderful Professor. Genuinely cares about your learning and growth. Highly highly recommend!
One of the best profs and classes I have had at OSU. I came in a little afraid of the writing and essay exams, but he prepped us well and was always available to us.

This course is graded by essays, I don't think I had one multiple choice assignment at all. That being said, if you struggle with writing I would think twice before taking. Prof is understanding and friendly. You can tell he loves what he's teaching and he wants students to be as passionate as he is.

Dr. Roscigno is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. Truly so passionate about sociology and I learned so much from his class. He assigned 3 essay exams and 5 short write-ups about interesting articles and documentaries. Reading the textbook helped with the exams too

Dr. Roscigno is really passionate about sociology topics and wants his students to really grasp the subject. With a couple of exams and about 3 writing assignments, it is easy to receive an A as long as you pay attention in class and do your work. Beware, some exam questions can be from the textbook!

Prof Roscigno was great this semester, which was really tough with the Covid stuff. He really cared and stayed in touch with us and did a great job with the online lectures. He was also super quick emailing me back when I had questions. Would definitely take again
He doesn't provide any curve. 3 writing assignments and 3 exams overall. Exams are not super hard but not easy as well. He doesn't share his lecture slides so you should attend the class to pass.

Dr. Roscigno is super passionate about his content. The class was based on 3 exams and 3 short assignments, and Dr. Roscigno was more than accommodating this semester. The exams are straightforward, just be sure to attend lecture and read the textbook.

He is very passionate about the material and you can tell he wants you to understand the material and enjoy it to. Grade is three writing assignments, which don't take long, and three exams which are easy. You don't need to read the book, but I recommend it because some questions come from just the book. Most of it is common sense.
This is my favorite class this semester. Topics are relevant and interesting, and I like his lecture style. And he is awesome and approachable for a prof teaching such a large lecture.

This is by far one of the worst classes Ive ever taken. I swear the words and vocabulary used by prof roscigno are not real. Literally just adds -ability and -ocracy to the end of any word. Be prepared to actually fall asleep every lecture, nothing about this class is profound or even slightly interesting. Avoid at all costs.

I wasn't sure about this class, but it turned out being my favorite class of the semester. Prof. Roscigno was enthusiastic and a great lecturer, and the grading criteria was clear. The tests were reasonably too, but required both reading the free text and attending lecture. I also appreciated the extra review sessions he offered before each test!

The tests are so hard and do not follow lecture/textbook. He claims that all the questions came from either lecture or reading. I never skipped class and I read every chapter. Many questions on all three exams were from neither. Way too hard for a GE, all my friends with him did bad. Other soc teachers are sooooooo much easier and give bonus.

Easy class if you actually do the work. As long as you go to class and pay attention and actually do the textbook readings, It is an easy A. But if you do not easy B. Actually try on the papers too because the class does not have very many total points so one mess up can ruin your grade. Good professor and he makes a GE somewhat interesting.

Dr. Roscigno is by far the best professor I've had so far and I would recommend him to anyone. His love for sociology and teaching is very obvious. I would recommend him over other professors because he is an actual sociologist and can give examples from his studies that he has done in lecture.

I learned a lot from this professor. The class is great and I would highly recommend it as a GE. It taught me to think about society in ways I wouldn't have without taking this course. It's a solid choice.
I wish every class was this good and every professor was so happy to teach such a large introductory course. He also really cared about us and seemed to always be available to me when I needed.

Prof Roscigno is a great guy who is very passionate about sociology. Lectures can drag on but he tells stories to keep it interesting. He's super approachable and reasonable. The class had 3 essays and 3 exams that are pretty straightforward if you pay attention and skim the reading. He provided the online textbooks for us which was great.

Weekly write-ups and he changed the class to now have 3 essay tests. Classes could get a bit boring but you could tell he cares and is passionate. Attendance isn't mandatory but in my opinion it helps you with your write-ups to have been in class to reference the material. Overall, this was a good experience with him.

Professor Roscigno is one of the best professors I've had so far! He's super passionate about sociology, which it makes it really easy to pay attention in lecture. If you go to class and take notes, you should have no problem getting an A in his class!

Professor Roscigno is caring, interesting and passionate about the course and current issues but his voice is too gentle to keep you focus during the long lecture. Weekly summary on readings, graded by his TA, I got scores either 89.5 or 100. Two essay exams and he provides possible questions before them. Class notes and readings ARE important.

Lectures were extremely interesting and easy to grasp! There were weekly readings and reflections that his TA graded pretty strict until the end of  the semester. There were 2 exams that were each 40% of final grade, however they were based on essay questions we got a week prior. Overall, I really enjoyed the class and would take him again!
Great choice of professor! Very fair and lecture and text are mandatory for exams. TA graders

Professor Roscingo can be a difficult grader, and you really have to put in your full effort for the class. However, he is extremely passionate about the material and cares about his student's opinions and experiences. There were only 2 exams (40% each) and some minor assignments, so there is little room to mess up. Overall, not a bad choice.
Loved this class and Prof Roscigno! Great stories that helped me understand the ideas better. Hope I can take more classes from him :)

For sure one of the very best classes I had at OSU and one of this guy is one of the most passionate professors I have every met.  It is an upper division class, with essay exams and weekly writing, so you will have to work hard for an A (unlike many of the textbook and multiple choice classes I have had).

He is a nice guy. However, I hated him as a professor. You had no room to mess up without getting a horrible grade. He was a tough grader and is major fan of giving the grade 89.5. His lectures are long and when I look around the room no one is listening. He is extremely nice but he can't captivate a room. I would not recommend taking this course.

I loved Professor Roscigno! He made the long lectures entertaining and really engaged me in the material. He demonstrated that he really knew his stuff. There were a few times that he even made the whole lecture hall laugh. If you take notes, and skim over the free reading material you should be in great shape.

Dr. Roscigno was very enthusiastic when teaching, but the lectures were quite long (1hr 20min). Most of the time, it was difficult to hear him in lecture (especially from the front rows) because he didn't speak directly in the microphone. The book is online, 3 assignments, 3 midterms, and no final exam. Exams were 1/2 attendance and 1/2 textbook

Roscigno is an awesome professor. Lectures were 1:20 long but he made them fly by. He was always encouraging students to come visit him for office hours and always told us stories about his family in class. He's one of those professors that assigns "having a great break" as homework for spring break. Awesome guy awesome class.

Vincent is definitely the best teacher i've had here so far. He's an amazing lecturer and is there for you whenever you need him. Tests are simple but some questions tend to be tricky. 3 papers and 3 exams. I would definitely take this class again, i learned a lot and he did a really great job.

Dr. Roscigno is AMAZING, I would definitely recommend him to everyone! He has easily become my favorite professor and my favorite class. There are 3 assignments and 3 midterms and NO final! Each midterm/assignment covers a 1/3 of the class. They are super straight forward and simple. An A will be easily achieved if you go to lecture and listen!!!!!

One of the best professors I've had at Ohio State. Interesting, engaging lectures and an overall great person. While the class is not mandatory, attendance is necessary for passing. So is reading the textbook. Exam questions come from a combination of both, but are not difficult. Would definitely take again!

Professor Roscigno made sociology very interesting. Lectures were engaging and tests were fairly simple. Roscigno curves the final grade according to achievement unlike other professors. I'm very glad I was able to take a class taught by him.

This was my favorite class of the semester by far. The prof was happy to be there, and was available to students after class and on email, which is pretty cool considering there were like 400 students!!  Glad I took it with him.

Easy class, Textbook is free, Topic is simple and easy, He does test on lecture, but it's not hard to get notes, or use common sense on those specific questions. Three EASY rubric-based papers . three NONcumulative midterms. No final. And he carefully analyzes everyones grades and curves accordingly. Easy A. Lectures are boring
Makes lectures as interesting as possible, considering it's a large lecture. 3 papers assigned are very easy, have to go to lecture to pass exams.

This is by far the easiest sociology class at OSU. 3 papers and 3 exams (no final). Vincent's lectures are really long and can get boring, but you have to go because half the exam questions come from lecture

Great instructor. He's willing to help out students, responds to e-mails promptly, and seems genuinely interested in teaching. The tests and assignments are pretty easy (but for the tests, attendance definitely helps). I would recommend Roscigno for anybody looking to take an easier, interesting class in the social sciences. Textbook is online.
i love this class!! and he makes it interesting and likes teaching!!

Roscigno repeats himself every. single. lecture. The first half of the class is literally him going over everything from the last lecture. Super easy class. 3 assignments and 3 exams that do not take long to study for at all.
One of the best Professors at OSU! Very passionate about sociology, which makes it easy to pay attention and enjoy the class!

Prof Roscigno is a very nice and down to earth guy. You have to study his notes and the text in order to do well, but if you do, you can get an A very easily. Very willing to help and easy to talk to. I highly recommend him to anyone who is taking this class!

Very nice guy, tries to keep the class entertained with jokes and life stories. Uses slideshow for notes but they aren't availible online.You have 3 article reports and 3 short essays along with some tests. Tests were all mult. choice

Great professor! He made the class actually very interesting, one of the best professors I've had so far. I never used the textbook, except for vocabulary (which you should actually do), but besides that, I only attended lectures, never studied, and got an easy A-. Great class!
Literally the easiest class ever. If you read the chapters in the book and memorize the vocab words for the exams you are golden.
Very impressive professor. He is a nice guy!
great!

I had a hard time staying awake in lecture sometimes. The information was pretty interesting. It's helpful to go to lecture b/c there are exam questions on the in-class videos and notes. The final isn't cumulative. There is a textbook, but I got an A without it b/c I used the internet to find my information. Overall, easy, but interesting, class :)

The class was pretty interesting when videos were shown but his lectures were kind of boring.  The topic was interesting, but he just wasn't great at keep people awake. Rosigno did seem legitimatley interested in what he was teaching. With the book and recitation, class attendence is not always necessary. However he does not put the notes online.
very very good professor! lectures are well integrated with text book, and interesting examples are given. Best prof I've had at OSU!
awesome class and cool prof
Very good teacher

Vinny's a really nice guy and he makes his lectures easy to understand. He does require some supplementary reading in the book but nothing extraordinary. Interesting lectures, and not a bad class at all.
THE BEST instructor I've ever had. He knows his stuff and communicates it very well to his students.

Great teacher. Lectures are very clear and he is very clear about what he expects students to know for the tests. Some buyswork you have to do that gets annoying, but if you take notes and study it should be an easy A
He is very nice and keeps class interesting with movies and stories. I had no interest in this subject, but i did enjoy this class. Tests are simple to prepare for and assignments are easy.
This is my favorite class this quarter. The prof is on the ball, organized and fun ... not too shabby to look at either :)
Great class! Exams are really easy to prepare for!
Very easy!! some of the stories he tells in lecture about his kids and info about videos played during lecture are on the exam..easy A. reviews are very helpful!
It was soo easy, and he was great.
He did a very good job, I thought :)
I just started his class and really like it. He is fun, seems to love it, and is really smart.
great
This guy is very organized!  I really got alot out of the class.
His enthusiasm in contagious
an asset to OSU!!! one of the very few that i would remember after graduating. make sure to go to lectures because they are more valuable than you can imagine. I feel privileged!! Thanks Vinnie!!!!!
great prof, enjoyable class!
VINNY IS GREAT!!
Great class. Very liberal, but I suppose you'll have that in sociology. Otherwise, entertaining and an excellent speaker.
great teacher... go to lecture and you'll do very well
Great teacher... exams weren't to bad, as long as you did your work. Very easy going class, but make sure you go to lecture... doesn't post notes on web
He's the best teacher on campus.  Should be given raises on a more regular basis.  Shout out to the homies from the Bronx!!
Show up for class, it will be to your benefit. Be prepared to write a lot (notes and essay questions).  Otherwise, pretty cool guy.

I didn't like the essay tests. He would give you something like 5 questions and you had to write novels for 3 of them. Also, theory is BORING. A lot of information with DRY reading. Maybe I am just not a smart man, but a smart professor though.
awesome
Decent
No Comments
His tests are to the point...No trick questions. If you read the chapters, you can get a good grade, no problem. make sure u go to lecture..he has questions on tests strictly from lecture
He was very knowledgable and just an awesome guy!
cool guy
awesome guy. period
No Comments

Syllabus week I thought this class would be a breeze but assignments were difficult and took much effort. Took weeks to get assignments graded and then you couldn't use feedback because the next was already due. TA was more approachable than prof. Prof did not try to help as much as she could have. Lots of confusion & not good enough explanation

The class was 3 days a week in-person only lectures with mandatory attendance, which is unusual for soc. The 7 assignments were honestly a lot of work and she grades fairly but harder than usual for a soc class. the readings are manageable but you're going to read 50ish textbook/ article pages per week. She is clearly brilliant and kind.

She is very nice. Three exams and two essays. Quit a bit of reading but bearable. You just have to do the readings on time and participate in the class discussion to get the participation credit. The exams are easy, you just need to make sure you completed the readings. Overall a generous grader.
Her projects are insane. Avoid if you have a heavy schedule. The midterm is all short answers that require a certain amount of words and references for all 20 questions.

1 group project, 1 solo project, 1 midterm, 2 reflective essays, and participation, each part worth 20% of your grade. Projects were excessive and took several days to complete. She told us "to allocate at least four hours for the midterm," but it actually took closer to 6-8 hours because it required citations. Content was good, but she was not.

Had some heavier readings and assignments, but she made sure to give us all the heavier stuff well before finals week so we were mostly done with class by mid April which I appreciated. I felt like I learned so much in class and her assignments and exams were all pretty straightforward and graded easy.

This is the only professor who genuinely puts his all into interacting with the students and tries his best to respond to as many student discussion posts as possible. As long as you do the assignments, he'll take care of you and your grades. The topics that are covered were also super interesting, so I STRONGLY RECOMMEND taking Dr. Hare's course.

Prof Hare's class was well organized and entirely asynchronous online. He had every assignment posted at the beginning of the sem so you could work at your own pace. He gave great feedback on every assignment and the coursework was very manageable. He was responsive and incredibly kind; one of the few easy and also interesting crim classes.

I enjoyed Professor Agbai. The class is pretty reading heavy, but if you skim the readings and pay attention in class its a pretty easy A. I really liked her lecture style, she's kind of hilarious, and she used visuals that were actually relevant. She is super on her email, I always got a reply within 24 hours. Would take her class again.

So caring and kind! Genuinely cares for students and is passionate about Criminology. Is understanding of circumstances as long as you communicate. Clear grading criteria. Class is composed of weekly (relatively easy) quizzes, readings, and 3 projects where you get to be flexible and express yourself. 4 days of missed class allowed.
One of the best professors at OSU hands down.

Prof Haynie is so sweet, obviously cares about her students and always responds quickly to emails. You have about 5 assignments per week but they aren't hard and you can get them done in about 1-2 hours. She doesn't grade strictly at all; as long as you put in effort you'll get full credit. Overall, I liked this class and would take Dana again.

The best professor I have had during this pandemic! Lots of little assignments, but the lectures are pre-recorded and she didn't give us a final paper like she had planned to help us out. Really cares about her students and their well being. We need more professors like this at OSU.

She is honestly the most caring person ever. Dont skip class and you will 100% get an A. The exams are pretty easy if you just read the textbook chapters before the test, but she structures the class so that even if you dont test well but come to class you will get an A. All the other assignments are crazy easy.

One of the best teachers I've taken! Great lectures and super easy exams. Noncumalative final, attendance points, and discussion posts are the only grades so not much work. Great teacher and interesting material

Such a great teacher. I took juvenile delinquency with her. She truly cares about what she teaches and her students. Very interesting class and makes it fun for the entire class. Shows a lot of video clips. Make sure to go to class because top hat is used. Writing assignments on carmen but easy and straight forward!

I took Juvenile Delinquency with her and it was amazing! She loves what she teaches and her lectures are very interesting. She uses top hat throughout the class and there are a lot of little assignments on Carmen but they are just reading questions and are easy. The exams are easy after you review the lectures and text book.

I took Juvenile Delinquency with her and it was awesome! She loves what she teaches and that comes across clearly in her lectures. There are a lot of little assignments on Carmen but they're straightforward and easy. The exams are easy after a quick review of the book chapters. Definitely take this class with her!!
This course was difficult but incredibly interesting and Jan cares a lot! I learned a lot from this course and I would say it is easier than 4420

I really enjoyed Jan in class and she was excellent at explaining things. She does not provide any powerpoints or other materials. The only graded things are the exams. The exams are all essay questions, there are no multiple choice, so you really have to understand the material. However, there is a huge curve for her class.
Passionate about what she does but provides no powerpoints or recordings of lectures.

Dr Jan is the most incredible professor I have ever had! She is so knowledgeable and really cares about her students. She makes sure your health and well-being comes first, which is rare in college. She also wants to make sure you understand the material and has no problem repeating information multiple times to make sure you get it!

She is by far one of my favorite professors at OSU. Her lectures are info heavy, but are presented in a way that really makes you understand. No powerpoints, so I recorded the lectures in case I missed any info or wanted to go back. She cares about her students success and will meet for office hours. Huge curve for each exam. I never used my book!

Dr. Weisenberger is by far the best instructor on campus. She knows basically everything about audiology. Her lectures are amazing, but there are no PP so you do need to write down basically everything she says. Her tests are hard and they are graded hard because she grades as if it were a grad level course, but there are enormous curves on them.

She was great! I learned so much from her class and she is very good at keeping her students' focus! She really wants you to succeed so don't be threatened by her crazy hard tests. The curve at the end was huge.

Dr. Weisenberger is a fantastic professor who will teach you a lot. Her exams are typically composed of essay questions, so you do need to know the material, and the easiest way to do this is to always attend lecture. This class is very hard and stressful, but it is possible to get a good grade in the class after she curves grades.
By far, one of the best teachers I have had. Dr. W was engaging and excited to teach the material. Learned a lot from this class. If you put in the work and attend class, you will do fine.

All in all, a GREAT professor! Explains things really well, just pay attention and don't skip (ever). She's more than happy to help you if you ask for it. She knows the material down to a T (which is probably why tests are so difficult) and she is excited to teach every single day. I enjoyed this class, and I highly recommend Dr. Weisenberger!
Before I took her class I was interested in going into Speech Therapy. Now that I've taken it I'm getting my PhD in Audiology. If that's not a testament to how good she is, I don't know what is.
Dr. Weisenberger was awesome! This class was not easy, but if you put the work in - you'll be fine.

Fantastic. Great at explaining things. Take really good notes as her tests are killer and all short answer... GO TO CLASS and DO NOT wait until the night before to study for exams. I used the book a lot to solidify concepts and have done really well on all the tests. I think she's kind of entertaining too :)
By far the best professor I have had to date. Knows the material so well and makes you learn it to. Fantastic Class.

I liked her but she is not very exciting to listen to - I fell asleep almost every lecture. She almost purely tests on her notes so I rarely read the book and it was fine. She's clearly a fan of research and graphs! Good class.

VERY fast paced but she does a good job of explaining things. She doesn't offer review sessions or review sheets which makes it very difficult to study for! Very willing to help you if you are in need.

For your own sanity I beg of you to reconsider taking anything taught by Professor Alston. I concede that he is very knowledgeable about the subject. However, he gives incredibly vague guidelines for his assignments, makes students feel bad for asking questions, and abandoned our class a month before finals because of his "personal schedule." RUN.
Bro went asynchronous last couple weeks of the semester
Acts like his class should be the most important thing in your life while you are taking it. Grades so hard for no reason. Actually just avoid this guy at all costs he is the WORST.

Professor Alston is definitely not AS bad as the other reviews make him out to seem. He is very equipped to teach this course and provides a lot of interesting information. My only problem with him is that he is oftentimes vague with instructions and will dock points accordingly. You definitely have to pay attention in class to do well.
Does not let me use any of my accommodations. Shows up to class late. Does not respond to emails. Would not let me take a test through slds .

This class is required for a minor and I have considered dropping the minor. Shows up late every class, even on test days. Is condescending to every question asked. Told his classes "personal schedule does not have time for this class". Changed the syllabus without informing anyone to 80 pages of reading a night. He is the exemplar bad professor.

He does not update grades when the syllabus is changed. Didn't have my test when I asked for my grade. He refuses to give homework or quizzes. The only grades are attendance/particpation, 2 tests worth 50% of your grade, one paper and a career memo. He never answers emails and has office hours but I have shown up twice and he wasn't there.

Do not take this class. He is constantly changing the syllabus to "help" students but doesn't change his teaching techniques. Often criticizes students if no one participates but gets frustrated when someone needs clarification. He comes in late to every class, will say we are behind but have us watch elementary-level cartoon videos. HARD GRADER!!

Not all difficult professors are automatically bad, however, Professor Alston provides both bad lectures and an extremely difficult class. He states that class discussion is what is emphasized, however a majority or lectures consist of him simply speaking at the front of the room and showing some videos that would be shown in an elementary school.
Avoid this at any time of your life. My life is ruined by this course.
AVOID AT ALL COSTS

There is a lot of reading assigned, but if you show up to class every day, pay attention, and take good notes, then you really don't need to read. Lectures are all over the place and somewhat confusing. There are 4 essay tests every semester, and he makes the TA grade all of them, so your grade really depends on how lenient your TA is.

Matt is a good teacher, lectures are pretty discussion focused and it is important that the reading gets done. Readings can sometimes be a little long, but overall very interesting. Exams are fair and a thorough study guide is given.

Lecture is the longest and most boring thing in your life. PowerPoints are basically pictures so have to take notes. A & Bs don't exist in his grading. Hard to listen to because he says "right" after EVERY sentence and just does not make lectures insightful or interesting. Worst class ever and I was actually interested in theory.

(Taken at NCSU) Prof. Schneider is nice and there are like 5 assignments including final/take home midterm. I am a stem student so SOC is not my thing but if you keep up with readings you should be fine. I have an A+ and I went to class 1 time a week. You get participation points by answering questions in class/taking notes as part of the grade.

EASY A CLASS. You just need to do the readings and participate and literally thats it. we have some pop quizzes that count for participation, no mids/ finals, as well as some essays. Also, Lesley is EXTREMELY nice and she cares a lot about her students. Shes very chill and flexible. DEFINITELY Recommended. Heads up, she makes the best brownies!!

Dr. Scott is a good professor. She expects the students to understand and learn by themselves. She is however, very strict and demands the students to understand beforehand. Easy course, just make sure to do all your assignments as early as possible!
I never talked one on one with Dr. ScottShes seemed scary. Overall it was a very easy and interesting class. Everything was SO clear and organized. I would definitely take it again!

This professor is very flaky. She bases the entire class on the tests so if you screw up, even a little, you're doomed. Some of the questions on the test are pointless (ie what year was the video released). There is also nothing but lectures all the time. She is very judgemental but wants you to like her. I would not suggest her to ANYONE. 2/10
This is a horrible teacher, she seems bitter and angry at the world.  Horrible experience, stressful, and not worth it.  I wish I had dropped her class.

Professor Scott's class isn't difficult if you do all the assigned reading out of the book, but it's hard to keep with her mandatory attendance policy since she never keeps class discussions on topic. Her pop quizzes ask picky questions and she is extremely biased against views that do not match her own. Avoid this class!

I liked Dr. Scott's soc 101 class.  There was a lot of class discussion(although not always on topic 100%).  In order to do well you have to show up and do the reading etc, but none of it is terribly difficult.  She was always willing to stay and help as long as you took the time to read and try.
I have Dr. Scott at CSCC, she is a wonderful professor. She makes learning fun and interesting.  I would recommend her for your professor!!!!!

An absolute disgrace to Ohio State. Michelle Scott is by far the worst teacher ive ever had here (im a junior). She tries to act all tough and hard but you can tell shes just bitter and weak. She makes comments that are rude and more than once she has outright laughed at students for their questions/answers. Bad idea.

I thought Dr. Scott was very nice and approachable, but the class was not very challenging. There were a lot of assignments, but none of them were difficult, and in class, we barely ever stayed on subject. Nice lady, easy class - but you won't get much out of it.

I really liked this professor. She seemed very professional and i like how she stood up for what she believed in no matter what someone says. She seems like a very strong person and i would definitely recommend taking this class! She is very opinionated but i think thats a good thing!

She really was not that bad, although she does seem pretty bitter about other people in general. In the end she turned out to be very nice. We did not have to take the final if we were satisfied with our average, which I thought was great, the pop quizzes were annoying though.
No Comments

Worse professor I've had at osu and I'm a graduating senior this year (B.S. in Chemistry).  3 pop quizzes that made up 15% of the grade.  very bitter and constantly complains about her personal life.  She has poor conversation and lecture ability. Very dull and boring.  Ironic how an anti-social person like her is teaching a subject like sociology.
vfr nhr vdbgt5 y

Prof. Bartley is a nice person and Statistics for Sociology was fine, but not my favorite class. The lectures were often dry and unengaging. He also went through material very fast and it could get confusing. It's not a difficult class though and he graded very kindly.

The amount of reading that is expected is extreme when you are taking more then a couple classes. (expect 40+ pages a night). quizzes on the readings make it impossible to get away with NOT reading... Exams are full of essays so make sure to give yourself time when taking them....
Terrible Professor. If you enjoy reading this is the class for you. I wouldn't take this class again even if I got paid. Worst class I've taken at OSU.

Reading the textbook and class attendance are CRUCIAL to passing, but the tests and quizzes are easy enough if you put in the effort and study. Really interesting material and he does his best to break up the material
He grades the papers somewhat hard, but the quizzes pretty easy.

The course wasn't difficult, but he made it more tedious than it needed to be. Attendance and participation are a sizable part of the grade, and he doesn't put notes on Carmen, so you're screwed if you're not there. The readings aren't too bad, but there are quizzes roughly every week and a half. Very picky when it comes to formatting on projects.

Dry material throughout the entire course. Doesn't make much that interesting during lecture either. I don't think he grades that fair, I've spent a good amount of time studying for this class (which is only a GE for me) and received questionable grades on the midterm and projects. There are probably way more interesting & easier ones than this!!
He is a hard grader and the class is so boring.

He split us up into groups which I felt were pointless. He is pretty strict about assignments but he grades very fair. Quizzes every other weak. His lectures aren't bad. Overall he is a good teacher. Just dont miss assignments

Treated us like we were in high school and put us into groups. Quizzes every other week on readings. If you missed class you had to contact your group to see what they did during class and to email him a summary of what they talked about in class. He does not put notes on Carmen. Midterm and Final both had at least 5 essay questions.

He has a no phone policy and policy where you must submit your notes to him by the end of class if you bring a laptop "because the lecture is so content heavy" but spends nearly a half hour every class complaining about insignificant and obscure things that were not done correctly in the homework even though he has a new rule every class

Mr. Espinosa is one of the best professors I have had! This class is really an easy A if you try. Sometimes his grading is a little tough but he gives you PLENTY of opportunities to make up for any points you might have lost. He will literally give you the answer if you meet with him and he's a great guy in general who really wants you to pass.

Wow where do I start, took an online race in America class, the work is absolutely ridiculous for it being a 3000 level class. Its way tooo much reading he nitpicks everything on each of your assignments, if you dont add a word count on your assignments which are 6 total due every Wednesday and Friday you will lose all points. RUN RUN RUN AWAY

It was a pretty standard sociology class. He did a good job and really tried to get the class to debate the readings. (He did a pretty good job considering our class was at 8:00am). I wasn't all that interested in the class because it was just a gen ed, but other classmates got more into it. He has a very strict no phone/technology policy.

You get as much out of this class as you get in. Most of the in-class lectures are discussions, and Victor loves letting the students share their opinions on the topics being discussed in class. He's always available for his office hours, and will talk to you even if you don't have any specific questions.

This class is an actual joke in terms of difficulty. Victor himself isn't a native English speaker so he pretty much gives everyone 100% on all assignments as long as they are turned in. While his lectures are fairly interesting and intuitive, the homework for this class is high school level. Enroll in this class for an easy break.

While Victor is a very nice man and a great professor to just talk to, his class really didn't add anything to my academic experience. He never really had a clear lesson plan and the purpose of the whole course seemed to just be one big workshop for the final paper. Basically everything was graded for completeness, an easy A, but a fun class

He can be pretty crass when leaving feedback on your assignments, especially essays. In my opinion, he lets his leftist bias show while teaching the class. For example, he asked us to asses where racial tension was in the U.S, but when he graded it he acted like there was only one right answer. There are many other examples of his leftist bias.
Engaging, informative lectures. Reading material, while often lengthy, is interesting. Requires a lot of writing. Overall excellent professor and I learned a lot from him.

Class had zero quizzes or tests. Had a reading with summary and opinion article due every week and two essays. Victor seems to be very smart and wants everyone to succeed. Class got boring at times but he recognizes that we have many more difficult classes.

This was a great class! You watch documentaries that cover many social issues that are very interesting. His accent did frighten me at first because I have had difficulty understanding him during the first two lectures but I grew used to it and he uses his experiences coming from a Latin American family which helps relay the material.

I took his online class and its the easiest A I've had so far at OSU. There was a lot of work, but he was a super lenient grader. The material was also really interesting. I would definitely take him again!

This class was an easy A. There were weekly assignments (about 4-7 per week) and 2 essays. No tests. Just had to answer 1 review question and a summary on an article for homework and write in the discussion board w/ other students. It's some work but didn't take up all my summer time.

Real nice guy but theres a good amount of work in the class. Super easy grader though, I've gotten 100% on the weekly homework. He's very flexible and really listens to students about the assignments. He lets you turn things in late, and there's a ton of extra credit opportunities. Nice guy.

Thought provoking and stimulating. Spoke w/ him outside of class & corresponded with him over email several times. Prof. Victor requires alot of work on behalf of the student.  If you assume equal responsibility for your education, everything you need to learn is provided. If you prefer, as many do, to be told precisely what to think, stay away.

Disorganized, making it very hard to track your performance. Non-communicative, making it a giant pain to resolve any issues. Prompts and instructions were contridictory. The subject matter was interesting, but he was so clearly dismissive about actually helping us that we all had to start an email group just to decipher the assignment prompts.

Great Professor. He genuinely cares about the class and the topics. You just have to read some online articles and write a page summary, one movie group project, and the 2 midterms (which were not hard). You can miss 4 classes but if you know you will miss more it will drop you 10% from your final grade automatically.

You'll be doing a lot of reading for the class, but the articles are pretty interesting. Presentations in class and discussions are interesting but can get pretty heated if a few people start arguing. He always wants to hear your opinion, which is pretty cool.

English is not his first language; has an accent but you get used to it. good teacher. Youll read a lot (20 page essays per week andthen write summary). Attendance is basically mandatory although you are allowed to miss a few classes. Tests are easy essays. This class was one of my favorites. learned a lot. Heated debates! never used the textbook

I think he genuinely wants his students to learn the material, but his lectures were confusing. Even though he is a non-native speaker, I feel like the language barrier was not the issue. He just had a really hard time teaching the material due to being very disorganized. We wrote lots of papers, and I don't think he really graded any of them.

Overall - He is a caring professor who wants his students to do well. Grading system is clear and relaxed, quick response time, feedback is given often, lectures are extremely short, and there are only two papers (personal reflections on material) which are informal. I averaged about 1-2 hour a week of classwork, including lectures.

Professor Kepes was an amazing professor. Sociology is not a specific area of focus for me, but I left this class with an amazing amount of knowledge regarding the topics we discussed. He thoroughly explains each topic in words that make sense to all. His lectures are amazing and not too long:) I definitely recommend Professor Kepes.
The best. simply put. she is the best.

The nicest professor you'll ever meet. I'm currently taking Soc 2202 with her. Her lectures are engaging and straight to the point. All assignments and exams are easy. She uses the "specifications" type of grading where you basically get a pass/fail on assignments and exams if you meet the specific criteria. Alex is overall a truly amazing person!

Alex is one of the best professors I've ever had. She uses ungrading, which means that at the end of the semester you grade yourself based on your level of participation. I thought this would make me pay less attention, but it was my favorite class of the semester. Her lectures are super engaging and she so clearly wants her students to succeed!!

I took Professor Kepler's class at Columbus State, and overall I can say she was an amazing person and professor, and was very lenient and kind. However, I think lacked some social awareness skills. Most of the lectures were boring, and being forced to discuss was not fun. But as long as you pay attention and do the work, the class is a breeze.
Alex is very caring. Also she did 'ungrading' my semester where we got to give ourselves our own grade which was awesome!

Ms. Kempler was such an amazing professor I had this past semester. She was so understanding with having other things going on in life & always was there to work with me. Her lectures were interesting and not hard to listen to. She was just awesome overall and I would love to have her as a professor again!! Highly recommend

They were a great instructor, and I really enjoyed the content that they curated into this course. The readings were at times rough, and I had some trouble getting assignments in on time due to work commitments, but they were extremely understanding and flexible. I really appreciated this class and the instructor (and the TA)!

Take her class if you can!! Amazing professor, she really cares about her students and all of the assignments/graded aspects felt really enriching. This was my favorite course I've taken in all of my four years. Awesome professor, awesome course

This GE was way more work than expected. The 55-minute exams had many questions and long written responses. The professor talks fast, expects you to keep up, and includes her political views in lectures. Most of the class is just listening to her talk. She is nice and understanding, but the heavy workload makes this a class I wouldn't take again.
Always engaging.  Interesting lectures.  Pretty laid back and funny.
Excellent Professor. Always fair. Always shows great knowledge and excitement for the course material.

Kim is a great professor. This is my third course with her. She always has interesting and engaging lectures and shows excitement for the subject she's teaching. She's also very supportive, although she is strict when it comes to deadlines. Either it's in or it's not. Rarely can you have extra time unless you have an approved excuse. Very Fair!

So as you have probably gathered by now this isn't a terribly hard class. It is just very tedious & annoying. The test extended responses take A LOT of time and normally it is during midterm weeks where you have harder classes & bigger priorities.This is going to be a class that you will have to put effort in for the tests. Tough grader, no rubric.

I love this class. I did not expect to enjoy a class about death and dying but Kim is so informative and intelligent in the topic that the class is enjoyable. If you pay attention during in class lectures and take notes this class is a breeze. The projects in the class were very interesting to me and the tests were a bit challenging but open note.

Super easy class but felt tedious at times. Exams (3) were open note and timed but very easy. Huge extra credit opportunity, easy assignments, random attendance sometimes so do go. Also rlly important to attend lecture as all info she says is important for exams. Kim is so super kind!

Overall Kim was one of the nicest professors I've had here at OSU and she is very caring. Her class is not that difficult as long as you pay attention and put in effort. The tests are decently difficult and do require review of material beforehand.

Kim is great. She is one of the best sociology professors I've had here at OSU. SOC3630 is definitely not a blow-off class, it is important to pay attention in class and study for the tests- they are online/open note but still quite hard. Regardless, lectures are engaging and she is quite understanding of personal emergencies.

Excellent, caring professor. Not the most engaging lectures but sometimes we would do fun activities. Study a bit for the exams and you'll be okay. 1 course paper but the book for it was very interesting. Grading was fair and there were bonus on exams and then bonus discussion board at end of the class. Would definitely take more of her classes

Kim is very knowledgeable. She cares much about the material that is taught, and I learned so much in the class. I would take her again in the future, if I could! Her class is weighted very heavy with tests, and with a paper. Make sure to study, pay attention, go to class, and spend a decent amount of time to have a good grade on the paper.

Loved this class and Kim presented the material really well. You have to work for it though as the exams can be tough and the course paper requires a significant investment in time to get a good grade. Great instructor overall and invites lots of guest speakers which adds to the application of the course material to real life.

Kim is literally amazing! She is such a sweetheart and taught a difficult class with grace, kindness, and openness. She does everything in her power to make the class stimulating, but it is on the lecture heavy side. I can't wait to take another class with her!

Although this was a very emotional tolling class, Kim made sure that everybody in the class was mentally okay with what we were learning. She gives out a study sheet before the tests and the tests are easy if you study and know the material. If you show up to class, you are more than likely to get an A.
Amazing instructor!

My familiarity with the content of this course made it easy in a sense but the format of this professors course was kinda wacky. There are two books used and one of them is an interesting/odd book about hookup culture in college, the other is a more traditional textbook. I comfortably got an A, but it did take completing some involved assignments.

I've taken 3 classes with Kim and I loved all of them. Her lectures are really engaging, and it is clear that she cares about her students. The classes aren't super easy, but the expectations are clear and there are chances for bonus points. She is really caring and very passionate about the subjects she teaches. Best professor I've had at OSU

Won't get an A+ unless your assignments exactly appease her rubric to her comprehension, unfair grading. However, passionate about her field and very educated. She will discuss with you if you have concerns. She does not care very much about personal circumstances. Tough class. Heavy material. Little compassion.

I honestly have no clue how Kim Lopez has a 4.9 / 5 on here. She lacks any sort of accountability and she is not flexible AT ALL. She also pressured a student into sharing something they were obviously not comfortable with sharing, which shows a complete lack of care for that student's feelings. The worst professor I've ever had by far.
Kim Lopez is passionate in the subject matter and inspirational as a professor. Easy classes, study hard for exams and read the materials.

I really enjoyed Kims lectures, they were always very engaging and she explained the concepts very well. She was also very flexible and understanding with students situations and had very sensible late work policy. In my class we were allowed to drop 3 assignments (except really big ones) no questions asked. Any class with her is one worth taking

Be professor Ive ever had. Shes very passionate about what she does and it shows in the class. She wanted to help me outside of the class and that was amazing. I recommend her to every friend!! I would definitely join her class again!

She is an amazing lecturer and you can tell she is passionate about the subject matter. This is one of my favorite classes but I would warn anyone who is SLDS or has a bad laptop. She is not flexible and a really harsh grader. My grade dropped a whole letter grade halfway through the semester because she refused to work wth me on a testing mishap.

Kim is a great professor. She is very clear on what she expects for assignments. Class is lecture-heavy so sometimes it gets boring. Tests are all open note and mostly based on the study guide. She is very easy to contact and sometimes puts out little messages regarding mental health, which are very appreciated. Overall, very manageable course.

Kim is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. She cares about her students so much and is very understanding. Although this class does require effort, the material and books we went over were very interesting and very important no matter your major. Kim is a great lecturer, and caring individual! I highly recommend this class.

Kim was the best professor I have ever had! I am finishing up her course right now on Death and Dying and plan on taking her course on Medical Soc, Fall '21. She is incredibly nice and is willing to work with you if needed. Her tests could be challenging but if you study you will be fine. She is a genuine person and truly cares about your success.
One of the best professors I had at CSCC. Dr. Lopez is caring, understanding and most importantly I like the way she teaches. If you do your work you will get an easy A class.

Kim is my favorite professor that I have ever had. She is flexible, communicates content clearly, and is always available for questions. Lectures are mandatory, but she makes lecture so interesting that I never wanted to skip. Her courses are reading-heavy, but it pays off to read them. I would recommend her for any class at the University.

She is clearly passionate about the subject and knows what she's talking about. The class material was very interesting. The tests were difficult but not impossible, and I always ended up doing better than I expected. The book for the class is interesting but I skimmed it, and I didn't use the textbook except for the final paper.

Kim is a great teacher that cares a lot about her students. She expects a lot out you, but it never seemed like an unreasonable amount of work. It may seem like there are a lot of assignments at first, but they are all pretty easy if you give yourself time and don't wait until the last minute to start. Tests aren't a cakewalk, but not too hard.

Kim was a great professor! I felt that she genuinely had a passion for her subject. She doesn't round up/give extra credit, which isn't an issue for many but for some it could be. Her exams were tough, but not "trick questions" if that makes sense. You'll have to study before the exams, but you won't be shocked by questions if you've read materials

Dr. Lopez is a great professor who clearly enjoys what she teaches. Discussion is a big factor of this class and is what makes it exciting. She gives easy extra credit and her tests aren't too hard as long as you do some decent studying. The book assigned for this class is super interesting and the paper due at the end of the semester is easy!

Professor Lopez shows real interest in what she's teaching and appreciates when students participate. Attendance is taken every class. If you miss more than she allows, you are not granted bonus activities, which is what left me .41% away from an A. ATTEND CLASS!

I learned a lot from this class. Not a tough grader--if you write the papers you get full points of them. You are going to study a lot for exams, and they are a bit hard, but no worries, the bonus is 5% of the total grade, so an easy A even if you don't do well on exams. Kim is very sweet and patient.

Kim is the best. Good stories, interesting class discussions, and genuinely cares about you as a student and a person. Most of the assignments are fun or at least interesting. Tests are a little challenging and look for very specific information, but there's a lot of extra credit offered (5% bonus for 3 discussions + other EC activities).

Kim was a great Professor and her lectures were always very interesting. I truly learned so much in this class, even about myself. Had 3 tests and other little assignments. Not hard as long as you study for the material! Did a lot of reading out of the book for weekly quizzes, definitely will need it. She really wants all to do their best!

I have taken Kim for her death class and her child/society class and they were similar. You have to go to class because the powerpoint aren't filled out with key words. You have to read the books to pass the quizzes and tests. Kim is really kind, but she definitely makes you do way too much busy work for a 2000 and 3000 level classes. Mixed opinion

Shes a sweet lady will try her best to help you pass. However, the work is entirely too much the tests are too difficult for this to be a 3000 level class. If you dont show up you wont be able to take advantage of the 4% bonus. Would I take her again? Idk

Easy A if you're willing to go to every lecture. Hardest part was 5-6 page paper (choose own prompt and deadline). Exams were very detailed but follow the study guide and you probably won't get lower than a B on them. At the end of the semester she gave a bonus assignment for a 4% bonus on final course grade. Don't need WL textbook need HW

Kim is super nice, however her class is very time consuming. Her exams were far harder than they needed to be and the quizzes were almost impossible to get a 100 on (but there's a lot of bonus in the class, so getting an A is def possible). Theres several hour long videos to watch and you have to read an entire book (60 page chapters then a quiz).

Heres the deal. Kim is very nice in person, but has FAR too high of expectations for a 2000 level class. The chapters of the book are long and boring, and quizes and exams rely a good portion on them. She needs to cut down on the busy work for the class. Far too many small assignments that take a lot of effort for little portions of the grade.

First class I've taken with her & it definitely won't be my last. There's 3 exams but she gives you study guides. There's articles/videos you have to do before class but they're not bad & you have to do a paper on a book. She makes you comfortable to speak out & the material is so easy to remember so exams aren't bad at all. 10/10 recoccommend!!

Professor Lopez is very kind and empathetic, and works to make sure that student's stress levels are low. Textbook isn't necessary, but there are reading quizzes on the book Medical Apartheid. Her questions can be tricky, but she has a lot of grades and extra credit. There are a lot of opportunities to get an A, and even a large bonus project.

Kim is the best professor I have ever had. The class itself was extremely intriguing and interesting. She was so relatable and chill, but the class was still structured and well executed. She is the type of professor I want to stay in contact with and take more classes from. Thisclass truly opened my eyes to a brand new world I didn't know existed.

Kim is amazing! I have taken her for four classes now, and would highly recommend. She genuinely cares about the students and is passionate about the material. She is also very helpful when it comes to life and school advice outside of her class. Incredible classes to take. 10/10
She is so nice. And she explains the questions so patiently. I feel so warm and relaxed when talking with her.

Kim is the best professor I've ever had! do the assignments and you'll get an A easy! She's not only an easy professor, she is so caring and understanding! TAKE HER CLASS if you get the chance, she's amazing!

I have taken this class (Medical Sociology 3630) and her Death and Dying class (2290) and 3630 was much harder. She is a very nice lady and cares about her students, but her exams are tough and have a ton of irrelevant and unnecessary info. Attendance is mandatory and she tests over specific numbers from guest speakers, so take good notes.

She's a very sweet and understanding professor. I would love to have a professional relationship with her, she is the best. Must come to class, attendance taken. Activities, online discussions, and quizzes, along with three tests. Very manageable, GPA booster and very different material.

Kim is an amazing teacher. I really enjoyed 3630 because of her. Her test style is different but if you pay attention in class and study the notes then you'll be good to go. She's accessible outside the class and truly cares about her students. Tests and papers but relatively easy as long as you know whats going on. Also enjoyed having presenters.

Kim is an amazing and inspiring teacher. I took 2290 and 3630. The tests are not hard. Just study -memorize- her powerpoints and you'll be good as golden. She's very helpful and gives out a good amount of bonus points. Make sure you attend class, she does take attendance & always ask for help if needed. She's very accessible outside the classroom.

Kim is great! Her exams are hard but you easily learn how she tests and she also realizes if the test was harder. With extra credit I got high A's on 2/3 of the exams. I had her for SOC of Death and Dying. Overall a great class. I actually had a family member die in the semester so the class was hard mentally but still good. Do the extra credit too

With such specific and confusing attention to detail, Kim Lopez appears to have not mastered the material that she is teaching. Be prepared to be extensive in essays and writing responses, because she is more that willing to deduct points for a minute detail missed. Also, let this be your warning; do the extra credit.
The only thing hard about her classes are the exams but she has enough bonus assignments and participation/assignments to get an A.
Definitely trying to get her again. I legitimately enjoyed going to class with her as my professor.

She's easily the most inspirational teacher I've ever had. I loved her class, although it was a little tougher than I thought. You have to put in a little effort, also know the vocab on the study guides, it's essential to passing her tests.

I love Kim, but some things do get on your nerves. There are lot of documentaries to watch outside of class with quizzes in class on the days assigned. Its a great and interesting class, but just be prepared for a lot of outside class work with volunteer hours and documentaries. Kim is a great professor and gives extra credit IF YOU SHOW UP.

Professor Lopez was amazing. She understands the material because she has experienced it first-hand. Never used the book, provided power points with fill in the blank, multiple easy extra credit opportunities. 3 mini papers that took under an hour, weekly quizzes over videos (easy to watch), interesting speakers. Genuinely cared about her students.

Professor Lopez is definitely one of my favorite professor she always made class interesting. Even though it was a death and dying class, she didn't make it depressing.  It makes you think about the future and the important things in life.

Best professor I have ever had! She loves teaching and helping her students, and her classes are very interesting. You can choose not to go to class, but she does take attendance and at the end of the semester she offers extra credit opportunity for those who did not miss more than 3 or 4 classes. I wish all the professors were like her!

Kim Lopez is such a nice professor. She's funny and we did some pretty cool experiments and watched some fascinating videos. The tests were multiple choice and definitions with no word bank but there were bonus opportunities. You only really needed the textbook for the papers. Final was take home. Which was awesome.

This class was one of the best/easiest I have taken so far. If you show up to class and do well on tests you will definitely get an A. There are also 15 extra credit points that can be added to your total grade. Kim is an awesome professor, and her lectures are funny and interesting. Definitely take this class!
She is nice and humorous. I like the interaction in the class. Participation is very important. It counts 10 percent and you can only get slides note on class.

Kim is one of the best professors I've had. She is extremely personable and she really cares about her students doing well in the class. Attending class is the best way to succeed in her class, as she does quizzes and class activities for points. Offers extra credit, and the tests are really fair if you go to class. Overall, awesome professor

Takes random attendance checks but the class is really interesting. Her tests are not difficult if you study for them. Going to class is the easiest way to get a good grade. She's very helpful if you ever need anything.

Very attainable A in this class as well as an enjoyable class. Professor Lopez makes it very easy, and she is funny, and excellent with helping you when needed. Tips for exams are easily know your terms perfectly and you are fine. Also read the book and go to lectures. Exams use questions found sometimes only in the book, and also only in lecture.
I definitely recommend taking her for any class. She is really nice and does everything she can to help students.

Best professor hands down! She has the best lectures and always finds ways to keep the class interested. I loved her class. I wish I could take it all over again. I would definately suggest taking any class she offers for GE requirements!

Kim truly wants to see her students succeed. She offers bonus points to students and obviously has a passion for the material.  Tests get progressively easier once you get a feel for them.  I was very grateful of her ability to accomodate entenuating circumstances, and she cares for her students as human beings.
She's so Niceeeeeeeeee
Study for the terms (not extensively) and do the extra credit to ensure an A.
As long as you turn in each of the 4 assignments you will get an A.
Great Teacher. Fun Class.

Mrs. Lopez is one of the nicest teachers I have had in awhile.Papers are short in length and deal with cool topics. Classes are fun to attend because she gets the class involved and makes the topics interesting. If you get the opportunity to take one of her classes Do it, def worth it
awesome professor very passionate truly cares about students
The deviance class was super interesting! A lot of discussion boards, and overall a lack of instruction from the professor. But it was super easy A, overall I recommend it.

This course was fully online. It was 2 exams, a project, and a few random assignments. About 10 total things. It is a LOT of reading and notes. Her carmen set up page was very confusing and hard to navigate, but she sent an announcement and message every week to the links of what you'll be reading and any coming assignments. This made it better
She's an engaging instructor who shows she knows the material and excitement to teach it.

Lynette is the best professor I have had at Ohio State so far. I have taken 3 courses with her and you can tell she wants all her students to do well. There are multiple opportunities for extra credit including extra assignments, bonus point attendance days & 2-3 bonus questions on each exam. I highly recommend taking a class with her.
I adore Lynette. She is able to take a required class that is decently boring and makes the lectures engaging. She keeps it real and is very gracious with her exams.

She's intelligent and I can tell I have lots to learn from her, but it's hard with how the lessons are structured. She uses fill in the blank notes and relies on students guessing the answers - 'who can guess what _ is,' for example. It slows the class down and makes it hard to retain as you hear five wrong answers before taught the correct one.

Lynette is a very kind and understanding person. I liked her for the most part. There was a situation where we had differing opinions, but once I explained myself thoroughly everything was fixed. Exams were lecture-heavy. There were lots of bonus opportunities throughout the class.

I loved dr. Martin & her class, but the grading rubrics could be confusing. attendance is worth 20/200 points, I usually didn't go to class even though it was mandatory, but still got a 100. There is a big project due at the end of the semester, but you work on it the whole semester so its basically done at the end. Exams are really easy too!

She is great! She lets you miss 6 lectures a semester, the TAs and very responsive and approachable, and her exams are very straightforward. If you come to the lecture and pay attention, you'll get an A.

This course was VERY disorganized. Clearly, Lynette cares about teaching, but the Carmen page was impossible to navigate. Even as someone who normally adapts well to adverse learning environments, I thought it was challenging just because of the lack of guidance/no clear expectations given to us. I would not recommend this class.

Easy class. Except huge catch. If you have any traumatic event happen in your life that prevents you from participating as much or asking for an extension, expect zero sympathy and an extremely insensitive response. Just tell student advocacy instead to avoid this issue.
Very easy class.  She was a good lecturer however could get very off-topic fast.
Super easy class and Dr. Martin shows that she cares about her students

Best professor. Chapter quizzes through Pearson (I finished all of mine in one day), 3 exams (all easy As), 10 discussion posts (easy), 1 final paper, 1 bonus paper, and bonus points on each exam. Really great class, you can work ahead, and will pass with an A. Genuine feedback and I highly recommend. I took it SU21, asynchronous and online.

This class was a joke. She sent out maybe a total of 3 announcements all semester of what we were supposed to be doing, uploaded only 1 lecture powerpoint, and left all the learning to us through a textbook. It was easy but definitely felt like a waste, and I was frustrated with the lack of communication. Readings, textbook quizzes, and one paper.
I took the four week class, and there was work due every day. It was incredibly interesting and there were lots of opportunities for extra credit. I would absolutely take this professor again!

Professor Martin is one of my all-time favorite professors. She's very knowledgeable, understanding, and inclusive to all students. If material ever gets too heavy or triggering, she's totally cool about letting you sit out of the lecture. She's very easy to talk to, and she grades fairly as well. Study guides make the exams pretty easy too.

Lynette is great, she makes the class material fun and tells you exactly what you will need to do in order to do well in the class. You have to go to lectures since the notes are not filled out online and she takes attendance, but they are a great time and even more fun if you participate.

Honestly love Lynette and want to take her again. You do a cool research project all semester and they walk you through it step by step by writing a series of papers. You have to show up to lecture to do well, but her exams were easy and she drops the lowest one. She makes the topic a lot more interesting!

You have to show up or you lose points after 2 absences and the notes aren't filled out online. The exams aren't hard as long as you go to class. She seemed really passionate but also came across as condescending when students didn't give the exact wording she wanted. I would take her class again and give her a solid 7/10

I find Lynette to be an incredible teacher with a thorough understanding of the world around her. She acts 'human' which goes a long way when it comes to learning the material in class. A little disorganized sometimes, but she makes up for it with stimulating lectures and the promotion of open discussions between classmates.

I took Lynette for 4508 and 4610, and she's definitely my favorite professor in the sociology department. The material is relatively easy but stimulating, she lays out everything for the semester in the syllabus, exams are fine as long as you study a bit and pay attention. Final projects in both classes were easy. Wonderful human, please take her.

Not very intellectually stimulating. She reads off the power point and is boring. Shes awkward to talk to and makes stupid banter in class. I recommend the class for easy GPA boost but only if you can stand to feel like you wasted an hour and twenty minutes of your life every class for material you could teach to yourself in half the time.

Dr. Martin is a great professor. I took both her 4610 and 4508 during the same semester which was great because they tend to overlap one another. Her class is easy if you show up and take good notes. If you don't show up, it's likely you won't do well on the exams. Both classes are super interesting and she teaches them well, I highly recommend.

Dr. Martin is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. Her 4610 class is graded by three exams (1 dropped) and a large final project. She's fairly easy on her grading and the exams aren't bad if you show up to class (she does take attendance). Outside of class, she is extremely approachable and funny. Highly recommend her to anybody!
I highly recommend her! I took three classes (Sociology 2330, 4508, and 4610) with her and she is an amazing professor. She cares about her students and her classes are very interesting.

Lynette is amazing! Her classes are interesting, applicable and easy to follow. Her teaching style is great and she really cares about her students understanding the topic and stretching their minds. I took her again the semester after I had her for a class and would take her again every semester if I could. Take a class with her!!
Show up, pay attention and take notes and you'll do well. Drops lowest exam and has tons of extra credit opportunities.

Very interesting class! Lynette is hilarious. She has a ton of guest speakers, numerous extra credit opportunities and the subject matter isn't hard to understand. I failed 2 out of the 3 exams in the class and still ended up with a B somehow. The lectures are really wordy and she goes fast, so make sure you pay attention. Would take her again

She drops your lowest exam score and if you do the readings and fill in her lecture slides, you can get an easy A in the class. if you dont do the readings you can get a B. if you dont do the readings or take notes you can get a C. yeah, pretty easy class for sure.

Highly recommend, she tells you exactly what she expects day 1 and how to get an A. She gives a lot of extra credit opportunities too, and her tests are pretty easy. Go to class, it's fun and you'll easily do well

Professor Martin is great! For such a boring and dreaded class, she made it completely tolerable! She used fun examples and you could tell that she actually cares about the class that she's teaching. She's also an extremely nice and caring person outside of class if you ever need help with assignments or your grades in general. Take her class! :)

I love Dr. Martin! She was friendly, had a good sense of humor, and the material was fascinating.  Brings in lots of guest lecturers and has cool field trips so you can tell she actually cares about her students learning the subject.  If you really study the study guide, you should do fine.  I managed to get an A without doing any of the readings.

She is so nice! The subject is boring and she tries to make it interesting. She drops your lowest score so you don't have to take the final if you've done well. The biggest issue I had with the class was my TA (she grades harder than the prof!) I would take her again. also textbook isn't really necessary.

Besides the beginning of the class which is about theories of violence, the rest of the class is fairly interesting. Good speakers such as the coroner and police. Exams are easy because she gives you a study guide. ATTEND CLASS! u can only miss 3, sometimes she gives bonus points if class is empty. Drops lowest exam so u may not have to take final

took her for research, deviance, and violence. SHE IS AWESOME.She basically gives you the material thats on the test. Attendance is a real pain sometimes especially her 9am research class.You can only miss 3 classes,after that your grade goes down by a letter. top 3 exams count and if youre satisfied with your grade you dont have to take the final
She is very nice and basically gives you exactly what is going to be on the test.  I highly recommend taking her class.

Very easy exams, very interesting material, she's funny and can get off topic easily sometimes.  Way better teacher than her husband. Take her violence class if you need an upper level soc--it's easier than my soc 101 class

This class sucks but is unfortunately required. Prof. Martin is definitely the prof to take for this class. Not necessary to buy the book as her class notes give you almost all the material you need. The required paper seems crazy the first day but really isn't too bad when it's all said and done.

Great class and great professor. Drops lowest test score, good mix of lecture/movies/guest speakers, and the paper isn't overly difficult. Takes attendance every day and keeps class to the last minute almost every class. Buying the book isn't necessary as her notes are adequate. Highly recommend this class with this professor.

Very helpful, provides lots of extra credit opportunities. Drops an exam with the lowest grade of three exams. Final exam is comprehensive, however if you do well enough on the first two exams you don't have to even show up for the final.
ONE OF THE FINEST PROFESSOR'S I HAVE HAD AT OSU. SHE IS EXTREMELY HELPFUL AND CLEAR. TESTS ARE STRAIGHT FORWARD. PAPER IS GRADED TOUGH.
she uses a lot of guest speakers, and most of the test questions come from her notes that are available online.  she also drops the lowest midterm grade and grades papers very easily.
Easy class. interesting but can be boring. field trips are cool. 1 paper. 3 exams(drop 1)

Fairly easy multiple choice/short answer exams. Just one essay (8-12 pages) but very strict grading on it. As long as you show up to class and print the notes from offline, it's easy to get an A with very little work.
Great instructor and the class is fun and interesting. Lynette Martin comes highly recommended.
Go to class, use her fill-in-the-blank notes and study them and you should do well in the class. End of the quarter means guest speakers almost daily. Field trips also make the class interesting.

super easy! take it with her. textbook is not necessary and it's very easy to get an A. Class is actually enjoyable and there are many guest speakers. Takes highest 2 out of 3 exams, so do well on the first 2 and you don't have to take the final. i am looking forward to another class with her.

She is wonderful. You must attend class and study hard to get an 'A' in the class. Attendance is NOT mandatory but gives out in unannounced in class assignments and all that is is your presence in class. 3 exams and drops the lowest one, so you dont have take the final if choose not to. One 8-10 page paper...grades easy.
Easy A. Get her online notes and at least go to class and yoru good. She has field trips, movies and speakers and is a very easygoing person.
Very easy going person, awesome professor.  Notes are fill in the blank, takes highest 2 of 3 tests.  Don't bother buying the textbook though.
