Great professor, fill in the blank notes, very interesting material.  Midterms are easy if you go to class and spend some time studying before class.  9-15 page paper required over a topic of your choice, not too bad because the requirements and topics are fun and interesting.  Gives easy points and only uses the score of your highest 2 of 3 exams.
AWESOME teacher! Her tests are easy as long as you read all of the articles and study a bit. Really pleasant to talk to out of class and very helpful.

she is so nice. class notes are online, then fill in the blanks as she discusses. class is not bad at all, actually interesting. take 2 field trips to the corrections center and coroners office. exams aren't bad, so long as you studied and skimmed the textbook. very good prof. would recommend.
Great prof.  Gives notes and just fill in a few blanks.  Tests aren't too hard.  Shows great videos.  Overall nice teacher, always willing to help!

The class keeps you busy because you work on a big paper all quarter. There are 3 tests, which are easy if you study. You get to drop 1 test, so you don't have to take the final if you do good on the first two. Professor Martin is very nice and extremely helpful, in class and in her office hours. If you need to take the class, she's the best!!!

Definitely take her. She's extremely easy...if you have half a brain, you won't have to take the final. While the lecture material was pretty boring, the research paper really helped out. I enjoyed doing my own research and learing the results. If you have to take 488, definitely take Lynette

She was a really good teacher. She wants to help the students. I do not think that her TAs were good, but she is willing to help. Even after class if you just go up to her and ask a question she will answer it. She is not one of those teachers that only wants to see you during her office hrs. I highly reccomend her.
Great teacher, everything is clear. Guided notes and minimal reading. Pretty easy exams if you just show up for class.
didn't actually learn anything in the class but if you want an easy A she's a good choice
Very good Prof!! Taught it very well.  Tests come right off the ntoes.  Easy A.

SOC 2300. This class was an elective for me, and had an overwhelming amount of homework to do. It kind of sucks when you don't like the topic to begin with. Heavy grading, 100 pts for basically everything. No formal lectures, so notes are scattered everywhere. What are we supposed to be taking notes on for tests? No idea.

Dr. Hernandez is a fine teacher if your class was taking place in the 2010's. Her Queer Theory class is one in which little feedback was given--specifically during the midterm. Get ready to read tons of readings that barely apply to the present day, since the most current was from 2010. She's very personable but prepare to leave the class confused.

Professor Hernandez was extremely enthusiastic about the material and about teaching it. She was sometimes a little naive about slang terms, but she definitely knew Sociology. She made herself very available to students outside of class and was wiling to work with anyone who had trouble. Easy class if you did all the reading and studied.
interesting course/prof helpful
I liked this class.  Prof was very helpful and theres no textbook but a little too much reading.

Do NOT take this class.  It is the worst class I have ever enrolled in.  I hate this professor, she assignes WAY too much reading that is not at all interesting.  It is a horrible experience; I would recommend it to nobody unless you are EXTREMELY interested in sociology and are willing to participate constantly.  It sucks.  Bottom line.
She's a pretty good professor.  I think she takes the 101 level course a little too serious. but she's very clear and willing to help.  tests are not too bad.  lots of reading
She is good at making the theories and view points clear.  Tests aren't too bad, and the readings aren't that boring.
She was really great, super engaging lectures. Class was difficult, lots of content to cover. Few assignments for a grade. Very clear grading, gave really good feedback.

This has been my favorite class so far at OSU. Professor Wilson was amazing at teaching and getting you to both understand and retain the information. You cannot miss a lecture or else you will be behind, but you won't want to miss them because they are so engaging and interesting. Be ready to take lots of notes and to learn a lot.

Professor Wilson was super engaging in her lectures and I learned a lot. The HW and quizzes are definitely difficult so be sure to study lots and take good notes; make sure to always read rubrics for assignments

This professor told the class that her ex husband left her and their two daughters for someone younger and more sane. Over the course of the semester, you could see how this affected her ability to perform well as a professor. As a student, I wish there was more separation of personal and professional life.

Most reviews were written by the professor themself hence the repetitive sentiment. Unfavorable reviews are removed. Seats are assigned on the first day because papers are passed out in a specific order so that certain seats can receive certain test/assignment materials. Graded materials aren't to be kept so that this practice is harder to expose.

I loveeeeed Professor Wilson. The course is composed of 3 units which are composed of a homework assignment, a quiz, and a test each. If you show up to class and take notes on what she says, not what's on the board, you'll be fine. She also posts study guides at the end of each week; I recommend you start studying each one as they are posted.
Very passionat

Deb is a challenging but engaging professor. The class requires critical thinking and attending every lecture. With effort and using resources like Unstuck AI, you can excel. Though difficult, it's a rewarding course that deepens your understanding of the subject matter.

Very good class, I learned a lot about the history and backbone of Criminal Justice. This course requires HEAVY critical thinking skills if you're hoping to get an A. I got a B, but I still came out of the class understanding the material, but it was about applying it critically that got me. Wonderful professor and I definitely recommend her.

Although this was one of the more difficult courses I have ever taken based (if you don't go to lecture, you absolutely won't do great, have to be able to type basically every word she says & exams were tough) Deb has been one of my favorite professors I have every had. She makes lectures interesting and doesn't sugar coat anything.

This class was very difficult and required a lot of studying. All of her lectures were very engaging and fun to listen to. She gets the class very involved in her lectures. Very few assignments that contribute to your grade- easy to fail class.

Attendance is not mandatory but highly recommended as it is a lecture heavy class. If you miss class you will miss out on major information, lectures are not ever posted. The class had a lot of dense information, but was super useful and I learned a lot.

Dr. Wilson was a great professor. I have no complaints. She is an amazing lecturer and makes the class very interesting. Make sure to put in effort in studying and note-taking, and you are guaranteed a passing grade. Take this class!

Deb is a great professor, she did a nice job keeping the lectures interesting. I took this class as a first-semester freshman which I don't recommend. She's a tough grader, and the exams and homework require a lot of critical thinking. Pay attention in class, take good notes, study at least a week in advance for exams, and ask questions.

Deborah was such an amazing professor. Even though I really struggled and failed every exam. I blame myself because I did not figure out how to study until too late. The lectures are so interesting and I was always engaged in the content. It is a pretty difficult class, but I have nothing but respect for her way of teaching.

I thought this class was really interesting, and Deb did a great job making it fun and engaging. I won't lie, this is one of the hardest classes I've taken at OSU, and Deb is a really strict grader. You have three assignments, quizzes, and tests for the entire semester so you basically have to do well on all of them if you want a good grade.

I love Prof. Wilson, and she is my favorite professor at osu. She is an engaging lecturer and very knowledgeable. Those who say that the class is too difficult are definitely first semester freshman who don't how college works yet or people who want gimme A's. The class takes a little (emphasis on little) effort but is so worth it.

I loved Deb so much. This class was not easy, but it was so interesting. You will have to put in a lot of work, but because of Deb I fell in love with the content and wanted to do the work. I actually changed my major only a few weeks after taking this course, it's amazing. Deb is probably my favorite professor I have ever had.

Dr. Wilson is not the professor you want to take for an easy A, but if you genuinely want to learn, she is perfect. Her lectures were never boring. This class is a lot of work and I would not recommend going in expecting an A because you'll likely be disappointed, but the amount I learned from this class made it so worth it!

I absolutely loved Dr. Wilson. Her lectures were interesting and engaging, but the class is graded by few things. However, if you go to class, take good notes, and put in effort on the homeworks/tests/quizzes you will do good. She cares about her students and is always willing to answer any questions I have. She is one of the best teachers/profs.

Do not be fooled by the other reviews. Deb is an incredible professor and gets a bad rap from kids who are not willing to put in the work to do well in her class. Go to class, take good notes, don't wait until the last minute to study or do the homework and you will do fine. She truly is one of the best professors in the sociology department.

The fact that this is an "intro" class is incredibly misleading. This was by far the most difficult class I've taken to date. Her lecture slides are basically useless, so you have to pay attention to every single word she says or you might miss something. Grades EXTREMELY hard on homework assignments and quizzes. Honestly, steer clear at all costs.
By far the worst professor for an intro class. Exams and quizzes don't match the presentations and lectures. Avoid her at all cost.

Professor Wilson was a great teacher. She is highly knowledgeable and enthusiastic during her lectures and seems to be very down to earth. However, if you are taking this class, please do not discount the homework assignment and quizzes. She is a tough grader, and lecture is not mandatory, it is highly recommended! Do the assigned readings!

Professor Wilson is knowledgeable on what she is teaching. The lectures will keep you interested and you will be able to tell that she knows what she is talking about. The issue that many people did have is that the course was too difficult for a 2000 level course. There was just a few assignments to be graded on and expected to know so much.

She is very knowledgeable on the topic and does a great job of explaining concepts. However, every class is a lecture and you cannot afford to miss one because she does not post them. I liked the class overall and would take it again, but thought it was a little difficult for an intro class.

The class is lecture heavy, however I found myself always very engaged. She's a great lecturer. I emailed her a question once and she emailed me back super quick with so much information and then came up to me in class the next day to make sure I fully understood. She cares a lot about what she is teaching and it shows! Loved this class.
Half of these reviews sound like they were written by the professor and do not match the reality of her teaching style/class experience. She also gets unfavorable reviews taken down so beware.

Hands down the best prof. Cares that her students understand the material, swears like a sailor, and puts 110% into every class. Midway through a class Melissa Shivers came in and congratulated her with a $5000 bonus and an induction to some prestigious teaching society, she's the real deal. Come to every lecture or fail, don't slack

I love her and her class so much. It's easy to get bored with some of these topics, but she really cares about what she's talking about and makes lectures interesting. It is a tough class, but if you enjoy the content and know what you're talking about then the quizzes are not bad and the homeworks are even easier.

Prides herself on how nit-picky she scores assignments and on how many students fail her course. She doesnt upload lecture slides nor offer zoom if ill. She is very performative during her ego-filled lectures. On the first day of class, make sure you like your seat because she makes those seats the assigned seats for the rest of the semester.

Dr. Wilson is by far the best professor I've had at OSU. Very knowledgable of the topic and every lecture is well prepared. She also spends time getting to know each of her students. Definitely a tough course and you really have to put in the efforts outside of class, but A is possible.
Grades so hard it doesnt even matter if you know the material

Though I think Deborah is a good professor, I think she makes the class way too difficult for an intro class. Theres only 3 hws 3 tests and 3 quizzes that count for your grade and nothing else. If you bomb one test theres practically nothing else to get your grade back up. tests are based on lectures and they arent posted. I barely passed

By far one of the best professors I have had. She takes time to know her students by name and is willing to assist them in any way she can. Also makes her class entertaining and has a good sense of humor.

The perfect professor. There are opportunities for extra credit on everything (quizzes, homework and exams) so I ended up with over 100% in the class. There are no surprises on the exams because every Friday she gives a study guide on what we went over that week. There is nothing on the exam that isn't on the study guide. Straightforward & fun too!

Deb was really knowledgeable and a great professor. Her exams were tough, but if you really pay attention and USE THE STUDY GUIDE, youll be fine. The class seems daunting at first, but once you get the hang of how to study, youll be fine.
Dr Wilson is a fantastic lady who is super passionate about criminal justice. She definitely makes you work for your grade, but as long as you study you'll do fine.

Deb was absolutely my favorite professor at OSU. She is super passionate about what she teaches and it makes it that much easier to stay engaged. She definitely talks quickly, and you need to take a lot of notes on lectures since they're not posted, but it's all interesting and clearly laid out what you need to know. Super supportive and engaging!

Only graded by 3 quizzes and 3 exams which are really hard. There are no slides or whatever for you to review, so your handwritten notes from lectures are everything. If you miss a word from her mouth, you would not even know that you missed it in your notes until on quizzes and exams. If you do badly on one exam, you can never earn it back.

Deb is my favorite lecturer I've ever had. She lets you know what is expected of you and actually knows what she is talking about. If you follow along and TAKE NOTES, you will do well. Every quiz and test has extra credit and she covers almost everything in class. Attendance isn't mandatory but you get A TON of extra credit for coming every day.
Great professor, difficult class but worth it

She is the best professor I've ever had, but this class is hard. You must read and take good notes and study. Lectures are anything but boring but are not posted online and neither are grades. Only graded on 4 quizzes & 3 exams, lowest quiz is dropped so you really have to know the material. She is very straight forward with what she wants from you

Deb is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. The class is difficult for sure, and you absolutely have to go to class to do well. Even getting notes from a friend will probably not be enough. BUT she is the most engaging and over the top professor and you will never ever be bored in lecture.

Professor Wilson truly cares about her students, but is an extremely hard grader. If you miss class, it's game over because she does not have detailed slides and posts nothing on Carmen. She is extremely smart and wants you to be aware of your rights. All around, she's a great person, but definitely makes you work hard for your grade.

Deb cares about the success of her students and is very knowledgeable. Her lectures are interesting and intellectually stimulating. She will make you work for your grade, but if you are interested in the subject and take good notes in lecture, you will do great.

Deb is by far one of the best professors I have had. Yes, the class itself if very hard because it is just a lot of material, the class itself i would not take again but her a professor i forsure would. She cares, and wants you to do well. Tells you exactly what to expect day one and isn't lying. Amazing professor, you'd be lucky to have her.

Do. Not. Take. This class. Maybe if youre one of those lucky college students whose parents are all your only job is school and you dont have ANYTHING ELSE to focus on besides this class, you could pass. But if youre one of many who has other classes, extracurriculars, and a JOB, You will SRUGGLE. Save yourself the misery, folks.

I do not recommend taking her class. She makes this way too hard for an introduction class. She treats it as a 5000 level course. Very few things you are graded on and doesn't post grades. Doesn't post notes online or in class so you must go to class and listen to every single word she says or you will become so lost on the exams.

The one struggle I had in this class is that I would sit in lecture and find myself thinking "that's not right" or "that isn't necessarily true" criminal justice is pretty complex and this is an intro class but it seems wrong to give students a misinformed base to build upon. Also she was a little over the top in lecture.

She's a fantastic professor. There are 3 tests, final is test three. 4 quizzes and the lowest gets dropped. You HAVE to go to class and HAVE to read and study your ass off or you will NOT pass. She's tough but it's a fantastic class. She really cared about her students. I would totally take her again.

Definitely the hardest class I have taken at OSU. Debbie is very passionate about teaching & knows the content thoroughly. Class grade relies on quiz and exams grade, which are not easy. Debbie does not clarify the main points well, which caused me to study notes that weren't 100% correct. I do not recommend taking this class unless you have to

Dr. Wilson was one of the best professors I have ever had! I loved her so much in the intro to criminal justice course that I took her policing class! She tells you what she expects day one and clearly loves the material. Be prepared to attend all classes and to take notes. If you pay attention in class you'll get a good grade!

Debbie is currently the hardest professor I've had to date, but she is also the best. If you make sure to read the book and take notes before class, you are pretty much set. Just make sure to not be afraid to ask questions and discuss things in class with her. Ask questions about what you missed on the quizzes and midterms.

Dr. Wilson was a wonderful professor! You have to go to class or else you will not pass. I got a solid A by studying extremely hard all the time. It was not an easy class unless you work for it. She is always there to help. I am very glad I had her this semester.

Professor Wilson was awesome! I had her for two classes this semester (2209 and 3410) and loved every minute of it! Even if the material wasn't the most exciting, she managed to keep students engaged and kept class interesting. She was extremely willing to help outside of class and tests/quizzes were very straight forward. Highly recommend her!

Debbie definitely makes you work to get a good grade, but lectures are incredibly interesting and she makes you want to go to class. 3 tests and 4 quizzes, but she drops a quiz grade. Seriously loved her lectures and was kinda sad when I slept through my alarm. Take the class, show up, and study and you'll be good.

She's not a bad prof. She's passionate about CJ and makes it interesting but her class is really hard. She doesn't post power points online so you better show up and take nots like your life depends on it. Her quizzes and exams are straightforward  but you have to study. She also won't give you the information you missed, so make friends.

Deb is super passionate about CJ and her lectures are pages of note taking but it really is interesting material. Don't take for an easy A because you need to know and understand the material from going to class and taking notes. Just 3 exams and 4 quizzes, lowest quiz dropped, so not a lot of room for fixing bad grades.

Unless you work really hard in school, DEFINITELY do not take an upper level course with her & waste her time. This class required laborious note-taking on my laptop (legit verbatim) and knowing chapters/readings well for exams and quizzes. You will not even get so much as a B on her test without. DON'T SKIP. But I absolutely LOVED her! Best prof.

BEST professor I have ever had. Makes class fun and fly by. Learn a lot of cool stuff. 3 tests and 4 quizzes w the lowest one dropped. As long as you take good notes and read, you'll do fine. Would recommend her any day!

Debbie is truly amazing. Although she seems erratic at first, her in-your-face teaching style helps drive in important information. Since this is a law class, there is a lot of reading material, which she does expect you to read and understand, however, she is an amazing women who obviously loves her career. By far my favorite professor at tOSU.

She is by far the best teacher I have ever had. If you are thinking about Law School or Law enforcement I would definitely take this class. However, you must be willing to work. Quizzes are short answer so you must take a lot of notes during lecture in order to be prepared. She is a great lecturer and will keep your interest for the entire class.

Extremely difficult person to deal with. She is just angry that she could never make it herself and had to become a teacher, unfortunate she has to take it out on students.  Absolutely reprehensible that a teacher would treat students as such second rate people. I got an A in the class but would advise to stay away!

Best teacher I've had at OSU. Go to ALL of the lectures, they're very interesting and you need good notes to do well on the quizzes because they're written responses. Exams are easier. Can get an A if you put the time in. Debbie's amazing3

This class was very tough. If you are not studious, do NOT take her classes. She is very energetic and willing to elaborate on what she is saying, and it can be very interesting. If you do not attend class, you will be lost. I went to every class, took notes, and still barely passed. Get ready for a challenge if you decide to take it.

Absolutely love her enthusiasm during lecture. It really makes being there fun. I know if I had any questions she would answer them in a heartbeat. Going to class is crucial as well as READING THE CASES. I had a 96 on my first exam and an 80 on my second because I didn't prepare well enough. It's all in your control how well you perform!

Debbie is awesome! Tough class but it becomes easier if your into it. Good examples and sailor's mouth lol. Easy to connect with and responses to emails within 24 hours. Questions are answered thoroughly. quizzes are harder than the exam because she wants to make sure you know the material since the exams are mc. Tells you exactly whats on the quiz
Best teacher at OSU. If you get the chance to have her in class, do it.

Debbie Wilson is a phenomenal teacher. Enthusiastic during lectures to the point where she's literally runningjumping around. Take this class if interested in law enforcement. HOWEVER, this is not an easy A class. You must attend lecture to pass, take notes, and complete the readings. Lecture info. is easy to absorb so I think it's an easy class.

Good luck filling in your notes accurately.  She jumps around without telling you where she is talking.  The quizzes are harder then the exams and this is the class I am struggling most with and its only a 2000 level.

Best teacher I have ever had EVER. Only way to get a good grade is to go to EVERY lecture and definitely read the book. People got by without it, but if you want an A, read. She definitely pulls information from the text as well as the assigned readings posted on carmen.

Best professor at OSU so far. She was very enthusiastic about the class, which makes it easy to learn the material. She tells you exactly what to expect in the class and on exams. Would recommend to anyone!

She's very passionate and made ever bland court cases fun, the tests aren't too hard but you have to pay attention. The quizzes are very tough though! Pay attention in class because her notes aren't going to hand feed you.

It is a lot of content. You really have to attend most (every) lecture to be successful. Didn't need to read the book/articles except for specific sections for exams and quizzes. Overall, she is a really good professor.

She really knows how to get you engaged in the material, even though really dry material like court cases. Do the study guides and you'll do fine on the exams, but be careful about the quizzes. They're harder, in my opinion.

I loved her! I'm taking all her classes that I can. She's so energetic and passionate about her subject. She also tries to get to know her students as best she can in a bigger lecture. Tests are hard but if you do the study guide she gives, study, and go to class a B is fairly easy to obtain. Highly recommend!

Dr Wilson has been a great help throughout the entire semester. I loved this class so much, that I plan to take my remaining Criminology minor course with her if possible. Her quizzes/tests were a little tricky but if you took good notes and studied well they could be cake. I would recommend her to anyone, by far one of OSU's best professors

Have to work for your grade, however she is my all-time favorite professor. You must attend class and take good notes. She is extremely funny and energetic. She tells you exactly what is on the tests/quizzes and very willing to help her students. She is wonderful. Highly recommended if you're willing to put forth the effort.

Her exams were very hard. I loved the lecture and the energy she brought every time she taught I LOVED THAT SO MUCH!!! I never went to sleep in her class. But, I was having some issues with my other classes and had to basically ignore this class because I was already failing in the exam areas. But overall , I will take another class with her again.

Where to start. Ms. Wilson has useless notes. She has multiple bulleted points that all have question marks instead of what you need to know. Filling them in is a task in itself with her random tangents she goes on and makes it garbeled information. Her "study guides" might as well not even be there. I fail to see how this professor is even here.

Great teacher, really engages the class. Makes the content clear and easy to understand. Must attend class and take thorough notes. Tests and quizzes are difficult but if you pay attention and take good notes you can do fine. Very funny at times, makes class really interesting. Hardest class this semester but definitely my favorite. Great class.

Dr. Wilson is honestly one of the best professors at this university. Every student is incredibly lucky to have her. Her tests/quizzes are difficult but I promise if you study enough you'll do very well. I highly recommend her to everyone in the sociology department.

I would have hated to have her for a 1000-level course, but Debbie is fantastic. I'm taking an unnecessary class next semester just because she's teaching it. Take notes in class. You can get away with not reading the book expect a few sections she'll specify are on the quizzes/tests. Exams are straightforward. lecture style is engaging.

I took as many classes with Dr. Deborah Wilson as I could.  She is a fantastic, enthusiastic teacher and I highly recommend her to anyone interested.  You must take notes in class to do well.  Her notes are thorough.  Her teaching style is wonderful.  My favourite teacher of all time.  I cannot say enough good things and how much I enjoyed class.
too hard very picky on test essays

She's not a difficult teacher. She tells you what to study and what to read for her quizzes. As long as you read exactly what she tells you to, there is no way you will not do well. She's not a hard professor, just expects her students to do the readings.

She is really a great professor. I learned a lot, but I would not recommend taking her if your gpa can not afford to take a hit. Again Dr. Wilson is one of the best at teaching but the test/quizzes are really hard.
This woman is spectacular. I've taken two classes taught by her and would highly recommend any soc class she teaches.

Dr. Wilson is a great professor, really passionate about the material, which can be a bit boring at times. Willing to go back/explain things that aren't clear. Quizzes/Exams are challenging but fair. If you go to class, pay attention, take notes and study you will do well.
I absolutely loved having this professor, I would highly recommend taking a class from her no matter the topic.

This is my second class with Dr. Wilson and just like my first class I absolutely loved her with this class. She keeps you awake and entertained with her energy and jokes. She provides the material in an efficient manner, quizzes and tests are a breeze as long as you put some effort into them.  You should walk out with an A with some effort.
Class was pretty difficult, lots of reading and she teaches really fast, but she is very nice and pretty entertaining
Class is very interesting. If you go to class and take notes, you will do well! She is extremely knowledgeable about the criminal justice system and I thoroughly enjoyed her class!

Very interested in her teachings, the class is not easy but if you learn the material (like you should do in college) then you will do great. The people who post that she's too hard probably do not pay any attention in class!!! Take it if you really want to learn!

Very difficult teacher. Extremely interesting lectures. You can tell she really loves what she is teaching. Exams were very difficult and her "study guide" was pretty much useless. A little too difficult for a 100 class.

You kidding me? I have never been so nervous going into a class after reading these comments. I got a 98 on the first midterm. If you have any common sense there's no reason you shouldn't get at least a B+ if not higher.

I took Wilson's Sociology 100 Class. She makes early morning class extremely entertaining. While attendence is not required you should definitely go, otherwise it will be hard to follow. Tests can be tough but if you go every day and put in a little effort you can probably get atleast a B! Her T.A. staff is awesome; they are very funny and helpful!

I thought Dr. Wilson's lectures were fairly interesting and comical at times. She really seemed to have a passion for Sociology. Notes provided in lecture can be a bit confusing at times, but other than that the class was great. Good professor.
She was not a very helpful teacher and when I needed helo she was not willing to help
She is very into the subjects and makes the class very very interesting!
This class is ridiculous. Unless you have hours upon hours to devote to it, I would recommend another course. She is however, somewhat interesting and sometimes funny.

I have taken about every class Debbie has taught at OSU and she is definitely one of my favourite teachers I have ever had in my life. She is really into teaching and the info. Her classes are right up anyone's alley, deviance, crim, prison, police.. Wonderful. I recommend her to everyone. One of the best teachers you could possibly have class with

Overall she was really good. I understand some students' frustration- the class was a tougher than a typical 100 level. However, the material was clear, the lectures were funny, and heaven forbid you actually have to apply yourself to get a good grade. I'd recommend her just for the sake of taking an interesting course with a great teacher.

absolute worst class ever. do not take sociology with wilson. you will not get a good grade. impossible tests and boring lectures. you have to listen to everything she says because she doesnt write notes, only an outline. its nearly impossible. not even worth it. switch teachers!

Earth to Deb this is a 100 level class! Switch professors while you still can cause this **** sucks!!! Her class seems so fun at first and then her exams are so hard its unbelievable. Ruined my gpa and more often then not I get A or B's!

Take this class if you have a ton of time to waste on your GEC. Way too hard for a general requirement class. Don't know who she thinks she is making her exams so hard! The wording of her exams is simply ludicrous, not to mention the grading criteria for the recitation is so hard you would have to memorize the articles to get a perfect score. BOO!!

One of those profs that makes things hard just for the sake of making them hard. Rushes through more material in class then she is required to cover, making it very difficult to keep up. Lowest grade I have received since attending OSU. I'm generally a straight A student and I received a C in this class. Extremely disappointed with this teacher!

i would have to agree the person below, her tests were impossible. the wording of the test are tricky. i never took a hard GCE like this one before. yea she is interesting and keeps the lectures interesting but a intro class should not be this complicating.

This class was very fun to attend, but in all honesty the tests were IMPOSSIBLE. I took it over a year ago so it may be different now, but it's the lowest grade I've received so far at OSU. If I could go back I'd take a different professor or a different GEC. Hardest GEC I've had so far!
Kept it real, easy to understand examples.

She keeps it very interesting and is willing to help. There's one paper with a topic of your choice. Everything she talks about in class is on the test so you need to go. You should also read the book to get you more familiar with the information. NOT FOR SLACKERS...

Great professor.  I actually really disliked sociology before taking this class.  She had a way of lecturing to over a 100 students and still be very personal.  She's never boring and pretty funny too.  I would recomend this professor to anybody who is looking for a fun and interesting class.  Tests we not extremely hard, but study is required

She is one of the best profs I've ever had! Keeps things intersting and is really funny. Read the book for midterms. Exams aren't too hard, just have to memorize stuff. Take good notes in lecture and read the book and you will get an A. Take this class!!
Awesome class! really easy midterms. made class interesting for every lecture. you MUST read the recitation readings to do well on the pair projects.

I graduated from Ohio State over 4 years ago and the only professor I remember is Professor Wilson.   She is a great teacher and I received A's in the 3 classes I took with her.  I would recommend any of the courses she is teaching.

Prof. Wilson's an engaging instructor who really knows what she's talking about and can keep you awake and listening in class. But her exams are absolutely brutal. If you do not have every subpoint of the lecture down pat, every seemingly offhand remark committed to memory, you will NOT get an A. So if you're watching your GPA, beware.
She had good examples, but the class was still difficult. Try not to look at her if you don't want her to use you as an example. Don't sit near the aisles.

Great lecturer and the class was awesome.  Helpful and enthusiastic about teaching.  I would also  recommend that you go on the trips to the prison and the jail because it is so much more interesting than seeing it on MSNBC.

She is hilarious... the class is easy, if you attened lecture and read the chapters. I got an A and only studied the night before for exams.. Recitation sucks and they grade those assignments pretty hard but other than that it was an interesting class!

I really enjoyed this class but I did not like studying for hours and still get a C+ in the class.  I knew everything on the midterm and still couldn't get an A.  This class was very interesting, maybe should have taken pass/fail or something.  Read the text and go to lecture, attendance may help you in the end!

very interesting in lecture. class seems easy but her exams are REDICULOUS. this class is a level 100 class and should not be this difficult. i would not recommend this teacher although i enjoyed going to class.
Great Professor and has great lectures, her material comes across easy BUT her tests are extremely hard and difficult.

Despite the difficult grade I received, I would reccomend any of Dr. Wilson's classes, primarily because she's an entertaining lecturer and extremely animated during class-it was actually fun to go to class. On the bad side, tests are really really tough and the TA graded disgustingly harsh. I'd take her class again but know that it's a risk

goog teacher overall but the exams were impossible and really hard, the way she words the test is just crazy, she uses examples to imply the concepts. the TA was harash grader, i hate those in writing assignments, good luck with this class..

Hardest finals and midterms ever, you literally have to know exactly what she is talking about. She taught good but for some reason the tests were impossible to perfect. The recitation teachers graded extremely hard too....make sure you read everything....literally
Her exams our insanely hard

Solid teacher. She is full of energy and always makes things pretty eaasy to understand. There is a decent amount of reading and note-taking required. The tests are manageable, but you do have to study to do well.

very educated and knows what she's talking about. teaches the information clearly, and enthusiastically. i loved her and her class because you can apply all of the information to every day life. quizzes and tests need to be studied for. test can sometimes be tricky so its important to go to class everyday. i did and got a b w/o TOO much studying

Amazing lecturer! exams were tough, not enough time in recitation and recitation is mostly writing activities that are graded harshly. MAKE SURE YOU READ THE TEXTBOOK & RECITATION READER and go to class!!

I've taken three classes with Dr. Wilson.  she is the best.  any course that she teaches will be both interesting and challenging.  Attendance is not part of your grade, but she takes it into consideration if you are borderline between grades. very fair, and fun! never a boring lecture.

Second time I've taken her class and I love it! I'm by no means an A student, but still enjoy the class. She's very passionate about what she teaches and knows how to get students involved in the class. Expect lots of notes and be on your toes in this lecture! This is one class you can't sleep through and still pull a good grade.

Great teacher! One of the best in the department. She really has a passion for criminology and it comes through in her lectures. It's not easy to lecture to 150 students, but she pulls it off perfectly. As long as you study for her tests and take great notes during lecture you'll get a good grade.
Absolutely fantastic lecturer.  Her class is easy if you go and take notes.  If you study, the tests are also easy.  One of the most interesting classes I've ever taken.

I really enjoyed class with Dr. Wilson. This was my second class with her and it definitely helped in knowing about how she tests, etc. The class itself was great, mostly because of Dr. Wilson's style of teaching. TAKE HER CLASSES!

This was the third, count 'em, third time I've had Debbie for a class. She's without a doubt the best teacher at Ohio State. Make sure you go to lecture and take good notes, her tests are fairly difficult, but if you go to class and study hard (definitely not like the night before), you'll be fine. I learned SO much in these classes.

What a class. She's a very tough professor but probably one of my best. I've never learned from a more enthusiastic individual. The writing assignments and writing portions are difficult, and although my grade wasn't good, I learned a lot in her class. Definitely recommended.

The only downside to taking any of her courses is that you have to take a ridiculous ammount of notes. Good thing is they are extremely clear and 90% of the test questions come from them. Overall, one of the best professors in the Sociology department.

Debbie was fabulous.  Her tests are difficult, but totally fair.  You do not have to use the textbook if you take good notes in class.  She is very willing to help, and her lectures are always a lot of fun because she is so excited about what she teaches (and the information is useful in every day life too).  3 tests, 2 short writing assignments.

Debbie is one of the best professors that I have ever encountered! It is true that she has very high expectations for her students, and therefore her tests encompass a lot of material and are far from easy. HOWEVER... She is very accessable to her students, and is always more than willing to lend a hand to anyone who needs help. Attendance is key!!
She knows exactly what she is talking about! But she goes really fast and the exams are kind of difficult. If you pay attention and read you should do fine!

Exams were tricky, writing assignments were involved.  Do not expect an easy class from this prof.  She is a nice person and is effective in her teaching methods, but may not be clear enough on expectations for exams and writing assignments.

My 2nd class with Debbie, she is without a doubt my favorite instructor at OSU. While her classes are by no means a breeze, you'll learn so much information and you'll be really glad you took her course. I hardly know a student that, after taking Debbie once, doesn't want to take her again.

awsome instructor, she keeps you interested throughout the class. You have to pay attention and go to class but overall she explains the information well with the use of helpful analagies. Tests can be a little difficult but fair.

NO. Had her 3 years ago and NEVER will again. Like other people have said: Tricky test questions, NOT helpful, in a bad mood, erratic lecturing. I am a Sociology major and as difficult as it is (because she teaches so many effing classes) I avoid her at all costs and advise others who want a good grade to do the same.
Worst professor ever that I had at OSU!!  Her test were very tricky and extremely hard.  If you want to get a good grade, don't take her.
Go to class, study your notes, and it's an easy A.
very interesting, energetic, and knows her stuff.  taking good notes is a MUST, but if you do, don't worry about reading the book.  tests are pretty tricky for a soc. class

She was hilarious. Her antics were what kept me going to class every day. her tests were ridiculously awkward and hard. I went to every single lecture and every single recitation and i got a high C. you have to work your ass off for a good great, no matter how much you pay attention in class. but a very very interesting class.
excellent!  very into what she teaches.  NEVER boring.

Her tests were totally worded to trick you, even though she claimed they weren't.  Her interpretations of the gay lifestyle were HIGHLY inaccurate.  She is energetic, but can't be bothered to have a one on one conversation.  Trust me, I tried tto talk to here twice, and she was obviously not there to help.

She makes you work, but if you show up and study, you should't have much trouble with the class. I can't say she was my favorite Prof., but she's far from the worst. I think most of the people that struggle in her class are the people who don't show up on a regular basis. Her tests suck, too long, but all multiple choice. Show up and do the work =

Ms. Wilson seemed to be in a terrible mood every time she came to class.  She had a good lesson plan, but was always so angry that you couldn't ask questions.  her tests were all multiple choice and worded to trick you.
Very help and willing to change tests to format which students want.  Very involved with the class. I've had three of her classes and would deffinently take another.

She is very energetic. she is willing to modify the format of the midterms if it seems that the students will perform better with multiple choice rather than essay. I would take another class from her.
Great Professor for crim students. Tests can be a bit tricky, but in general are fair.
great teacher. really made the information easy to comprehend. would definitely take her again!

Definitely did not like her in either class. Lectures were very hard to pay attention to because her teaching style is very eratic, tests were all scan-tron and extremely tricky, when most Soc. students would do much better at explaining what they learned in an exam with more essay questions.

She was probably one of the rudest teachers I have ever had.  She tries to trick you on tests rather than test you for knowledge learned in the class.  She is extremely hardcore to the point were it is harmful to the department
very fun prof. very interesting lectures. gives announced quizzes that are a bit intensive and tricky, but easy if you study- same with exams. very clear & very willingly to help. loved her class.

She's an awesome Prof!  All her lectures are exciting and she gives plenty of examples.  Always willing to go over concepts.  Give study guides for both the final and the midterm.  She's the reason that I love Criminology so much.  She's willing to help you out if you start to fall behind.

Her lectures are never boring and she is very clear. Don't hesitate to ask questions, and take very good notes. As long as you study you'll do fine in the class. The tests are multiple choice, but the quizes can be difficult if you don't review the material.

terrible.  would not help me when i approached her on several occasions.  you either get an A or fail, she doesnt care as long as the average comes out to be a C somehow.  Very boring lectures, and hard quizzes.  Anything possitive said about this professor is from people who probably received A's

Great professor!  i look for classes she's teaching.  Very helpful, but make sure you speak up and take notes in lecture. If you don't attend lecture she is less likely to help you when you're struggling. And a note to the athletes, because you're an athlete you are not guaranteed an A in Debs class

great teacher. if you go to classes and take good notes, there is no reason to ever read the book. take her study guides seriously cuz if you know that, then you are guaranteed an A. she knows a lot and her lectures are almost never boring.

Shes a great teacher, All of these people badmouthing her are the same people who skip the classes and never attend. I guarantee if you actually attended lecture you would love it. She's smart, funny, and very helpful.
She needs to learn how to put less information on an exam so people will take in more of her class. She also needs to not be so chipper so early in the morning it's annoying.
Great professor! All you have to do is take good notes and you're all set.

Almost an overview of her 209 and 210 classes. same basic teaching style. organized, clear, tests based on notes. take good notes. 209 and 210 classes are easy enough too... although quizzes can be difficult
Amazing Prof, probably one of the best at OSU, pair her up with Lundman, and you have the best criminology department in the country!
No Comments
She wasnt too bad.  Ended up with a B- in the class even though I missed the last two weeks of class.  Tests were multiple choice.
Awesome teacher.  Very interesting lectures.

terrible.  i took a different class with her and did not do well with her.  she was very unhelpful to students who do not do well.  the longest hour and 48 miunutes you will ever endure in your life.  extremely boring lecture style. dont take!

Holy crap, what a great class taught by an AWESOME professor, this woman knows A LOT! Very enthusiastic about teaching, tests are multiple choice, just study for the quizzes...I recommend this class to anyone!

Very confusing lectures, I had a hard time following her. Guest speaker topics didn't always match what we learned in class. Only one exam though, and a group project. Lots of reading of academic tests. You're better off taking notes off the slides than what she's saying during lecture.
Her lecture slides are straight paragraphs and she goes on long headache-causing lectures. Get your GE elsewhere.
Set up for midterm and assignments was very unclear at times.

SOCIOL3200 was essentially over an hour long video, 30 pages of reading and an essay every single week. 

She is very clearly biased & one sided in her beliefs and if she does not agree with you then you will lose points. She shows only one side to the immigration of America - and will protect her feelings over logic! Would not take again

This has been my favorite class at OSU so far. Content was well organized and interesting. Directions were clear. It's 40 pages of reading, a film, discussion post, and essay (400-700 words) a week. Very simple as it's just summarizing/short analysis. A little time consuming, but I took this as a 2nd session course. Overall, a great online course.

Class was very eloquent and well put together. About ~1.5 times/week, there's a reading response as well as discussion board, which means workload can get heavy, especially as summarizing the readings in such few words could prove to be difficult (though I get why we did it). Still, class was interesting and encouraged connections to today's world.
I like Dr. Schoon. She makes the online course very easily and interesting! I had fun during the summer and get a 3-unit A at last!

I like Dr. Schoon. She takes care of every student. Her course design is very interesting, and every article to be read is unforgettable. The only regret is that she didn't have in-person classes during the summer. I chose her summer SOCIOL 3302 since I had a great time on her spring SOCIOL 3200!
I like Dr. Schoon, she is very funny and kind!

She's a very nice woman! The lectures are very interesting, and the tasks are one discussion board and reading summary per week, plus two papers and three online quizzes in one semester. The in-person section is recommended.

Took this class for a GE and loved it. The professor is great. The materials were very interesting and assignments were not that hard. Lots of reading but I learned a lot and the TA's grades were pretty lax. Lots of opportunities for extra credit so your grade will be fine even if you miss some assignments. Was clear she cared about her students!

Schoon is a very good professor, she taught American immigrants very well, I as a science major only as GE to take her class, but she was deeply impressed. One reading summary and discussion board per week, two related papers and three take-home quiz per semester, very simple! Because of her, I chose her for Sociology 3302 again this summer.
took this class online which was not too bad 2 essays discussion/reading summary every week. Proffesor is very nice if you reach out for help and flexible

So much work. Each week you have 100+ pages to read (textbook and articles), full page summaries of readings, discussion post of 350 words on readings and a film, quizzes with 400 word essay q's, 6 page essay due for the final in addition to an exam. Super strict on formatting and details for each assignment too. not worth it, even if online.

I don't care if she's passionate about immigration She needs to turn that passion into something else besides making us read 4 essays and watching a one-hour film per week. The workload for this class was insane, especially for a GE. I thank god this was an online class I could not imagine this being in person. Don't take this class not worth it.

Danielle Schoon is a very amazing woman. She makes her course very interesting. Every week we have 1 reading summary and 1 discussion board, but these are very easy. There are 2 essays, and there are lots of chances to get extra points. Good experience, easy A! (Chooese In person,  2 less reading summary and 3 less discussion board than online one)

u can tell she cares about what she teaches and is passionate but this is the most work ive had for a professor. u have papers that have readings and films, discussion posts, and quizzes every week. if u are looking for an easy class would not recommend. I wouldve had a way easier time if it wasnt for taking this.

The class was interesting, and she was a good professor, but it is so. much. work. several readings, often a documentary, a paper and a 350 word discussion post and response for every module. I pride myself in spacing my work out well and managing my time, and I still struggled.
One of my favorite classes at Ohio State! Professor Schoon is so kind and genuine, and her lectures are fantastic!

Professor Schoon is very understanding and really cares about her students and the course content. The class was a comfortable environment and we had frequent discussions. She gives a lot of extra credit opportunities and is always flexible and understanding of your circumstances.

Dr. Schoon was honestly one of the best professors I've taken a class with. She made the class enjoyable, and for a 3-credit-hour class, it was pretty chill and she gave lots of extra credit opportunities as well.

Dr. Schoon was an amazing lecturer! There was a situation I had where I had submitted something late, but after explaining my situation, she allowed me to get full credit for it. 2 of the discussion posts and readings are dropped, and there are plenty of opportunities for extra credit. Make sure you don't wait until last minute to do the work!

Dr. Schoon is such a genuine human and professor! Her class is easy and straightforward, consisting of discussion boards and article summaries. I had an issue with COAM for another class as she and my other class had the same prompt of writing my personal immigration history. She was so understanding and even wrote a letter advocating for me.

Dr. Schoon is very passionate and informed about the work she does. Her lectures were interesting but not mandatory you can still get an A without them. The textbook was only for the quizzes and it is free online and there are weekly reading discussions and extra credit opportunities throughout the semester. Would def take her again,

Though this class did have a weekly reading and discussion post due it truly is not that bad. There is a ton of extra credit available and three discussions and a reading summary get dropped. This is an easy A class just don't wait till the last second to do the work.
I really enjoyed taking this class with professor Schoon. The workload was manageable and the course was super interesting.
Dr. Schoon is one of my favorite professors at OSU! Definitely take a class with her if you get the chance.

Professor Schoon was an amazing professor for Sociology 3302! This class was offered online over the summer and was seriously the easiest A I have ever received (plus, it's a 3 credit hour course). It is an easy GPA booster if you need an easy class! I recommend taking it online
What a waste of my time. Easy A though.

This is a very writing and reading heavy course. There are required readings weekly and each reading is around 15-25 pages long. Plus textbook reading and smaller readings. If I would have known this was a reading and writing course, I wouldn't have taken the class.

Dr. Schoon was a really engaging professor and had a very well organized course. However, she is very inflexible when it comes to formatting and submitting assignments. The content of her course is not very difficult however she makes things more complicated than they should be.
Dr. Schoon is extremely caring and exceedingly smart. Her class is engaging and expects engagement from students as well. Grading was fair and extra credit was abundant.

Dr. Schoon is inexperienced as a political science teacher, but I'm confident she will continue improving. The class was structured in a way that makes getting an A easy, Dr. Schoon is funny and willing to take feedback.. She gives opportunities for extra credit and she works hard to make sure the class discusses many points that may not be popular

Make sure you do the readings otherwise you wont pass (LOTS of reading). Her midterm and final are both part multiple choice/fill in and part essay turned in on Carmen. Class is very liberal and one-sided on topics. Lots of opportunities for extra credit. I wouldnt recommend unless youre very passionate about immigration topics.

Dr. Van Gundy is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. There were few assignments that held most of your grade; however, if you attend lecture and put in effort toward your responses, you'll be fine. It is a level 4000 course.

I would not recommend her. In lecture she often criticized our class stating we were one of her lowest grades and would make us feel like we were the problem. There were only five grades the entire semester which were two reflection papers, one legal analysis, a midterm, and a final. The exams were four questions, written, and worth 200 points.

Tough grader. Midterm was multiple choice/true false but very misleading questions (average 65%). Final exam was 4 written response questions (each 2 pages in length) + a final 5-7 page paper (both worth 200 points each). Takes a long time to grade. Not a terrible professor but definitely would not take a class with her again.

I had Alana a few years ago and am still impacted by her lectures enough to leave this review today. 
She will work in horrific, disgusting stories of animal abuse. Not only are these stories largely irrelevant to her lectures, but you can see a subtle smile on her face as she enjoys shocking the students. You cannot unhear these stories.

Professor Van Gundy is one of the best professors I've taken at OSU. She's very passionate about the topics she's teaching (I took gender & crime class.) Her lectures are intriguing and not boring at all. There are only four graded assignments in the class, but they're not bad.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF. She takes forever to respond or simply doesn't at all and is very rude. Trying to schedule office hours with her is very difficult. She is a very tough grader and makes confusing tests. Options on the test for multiple choice were the same thing but worded differently so it's hard to know which answer is right.
The BEST Teacher ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Dr. Kowalski is an amazing professor. He finds a way to teach you A LOT while not making the class difficult. He is extremely knowledgable in the field. Grades are 8 critical exercises that are interesting and not hard to get good grades, 2 online exams that are very easy if you come to class and take notes and 1 final paper.

Super nice guy and material is very interesting. There is no attendance grade but the lectures aren't posted and he goes through them SUPER fast so you have to be paying attention. Not many grades, but the assignments were simple. Exams were slightly easy but felt kind of rushed. Overall, you have to put in a good amount of effort for a high grade.

There are 8 critical thinking assignments (about every other week), 2 exams, and a final paper. I would definitely recommend attending lectures since that is how you get the bulk of information for this class. Dr. Kowalski cares about what he is teaching and makes it interesting. This is a great class and if you put in effort you can do well.

Dr. Kowalski is one of the best lecturers I've had at OSU. It's obvious he knows a lot about sociology and criminology, but he isn't arrogant about it. He genuinely is interested in teaching his students, and he also gives pointers for tests. As long as you show up to class and do the readings, which are interesting, you shouldn't have a problem.

He is the easiest teacher I've ever had and it's not even close. The hardest thing you'll have to do is take notes. Everything you go over in lectures is on the test. I did not study for two test and got out of the class with a B-. Make sure you are there for participation points(random when he gives them).  You learn and can get an easy A.

The professor taught well, although the reading workload was heavy. Sometimes the professor can be a bit confusing in how he teaches new concepts to the class. Overall, the class was good but due to the workload, I wouldn't exactly want to take another class from the professor.

Doug has amazing lectures and truly does get to know his students. He keeps the lectures in streaming and lighthearted. He does have 3 exams that are pretty extensive and require lots of outside studying. They are graded pretty tough too. Other than that, his quizzes are easy. It's definitely a class that challenges you, but it is honors.

Dr. Downey was a great professor. His class was hard for the 1000 level, but he learns every student's name, wants you to succeed, & sets up clear parameters for success. 

There are readings for every class, weekly online quizzes, 1 paper, 1 group project, and 3 essay-based exams. The final isn't cumulative, and he gave study guides for all exams.

He's a good professor but grades way too hard for no reason. If you have a different interpretation of the books or articles, you're immediately penalized. Gives vague explanations for his grading and requires you to study way more than you should for a 1000 level class. Take with any other professor.

Professor Downey is honestly one of the best professors I have ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and seeks to get to know every one. 1101H requires a lot of reading and preparation for exams, but the grading is fair and you will learn a lot from the course. The class covers a lot of interesting topics, with real-world applications.

Dr. Downey and this class are both great, but if just taking this for a credit, choose another prof. Significant readings for every class with a really easy quiz the night before. Group project (paper and present). Prepare and memorize 10 essay outlines for each of the 3 exams. Still, doing well in this class is straightforward, a lot of work.

Dr. Downey is an all around amazing professor. He does assign a decent amount of reading, but not more than other Sociology classes I have taken, and the readings are interesting. The lectures are super interesting and he incorporates activities into them. There was a group project, but it wasn't too difficult. Overall very helpful and caring.

He's really entertaining and a good lecturer, he keeps you engaged. My only issue is that he doesn't give a rubric for any of his exams. However, you can email him and set up office hours to go through your essay prompts and he will give good feedback. There are 3 exams, and he gives 10 prompts for each in advance. Prepare well and you'll be fine.

It's clear that Dr. Downey is genuinely interested in the material. And not only does he want us to learn from him, but he wants to learn from us too. It was a very comfortable and inclusive environment for intellectually stimulating conversation and I learned a lot. Had weekly 2 question quizzes, 1 group project, 1 paper, and 3 exams. Great class!

He doesn't give students feedback on exams and his rubric is based on what he thinks was important for the readings. Almost impossible to improve in this class. He talks about his favorite things about the class at the end of the semester and mentions some students by name and not others.

This class is not worth the amount of work he assigns. Every week you have to read two thirty-page academic papers and 4 or five book chapters. For exams, he gives you ten essay prompts based on these papers. you have to prepare your evidence for all of them and he'll ask for two. You basically have to write 30 essays for this class.

you will learn a lot of new things; however this class is not easy to get an A in at all. You can only loose 75 points to still get an A-. All exams are essays with no rubric or guidlines. There are ALOT of reading and weekly quizzes about these readings. I have friends who took this class with a different prof and said it was way easier.

Professor Downey is very passionate about the material and it shows in his lectures. Very interesting content but should attend class if you want to do well on the exams. If you take good notes, preparing for the essay exams is easy. There is a fair amount of outside work to do for this class but it was all interesting and informative.

This class is not an easy A for a gen ed. He is a harsh grader, but only because he wants you to learn. Content is interesting, but there is a ton of outside work. Go to class because there are pop quizzes that are 20% if your grade on the homework readings. You have to try hard in this class to do well and one grade can offset your entire grade

If you have the option to take a different GE or 1101H with a different professor take it! The exams are only essays and he gives you the prompts ahead of time. He is a very very harsh grader. There is no rubric and hes okay with giving a large amount of the class Cs and Ds. Dont take this class if youre expecting an easy A.

Dr. Downey is an amazing professor and extremely caring! The only bad part of his class was the harsh attendance policy - no makeups, even if you were sick and have a doctor's note. He was a thoroughly engaging professor with a strong passion for sociology.

Took this class to fulfill an honors GE. Requires A LOT of outside reading, & exams are in class essays. A little disappointed that I received a B in this class (was looking for an easy GPA booster) but did not regret the time I spent in the class. He's really passionate about the topics and cares for his students! Learned a lot.

Dr. Downey is a great professor who makes the subject very interesting both through what he talks about in class and the setup of the course. Lots of interaction with peers. You have to go to class everyday and do the readings, which are a lot, but the class itself is not too hard.

Dr. Downey is awesome. He is passionate about the material and his student's success. He makes a real effort to get to know everyone in the class and to offer constructive feedback. The class requires a lot of reading, but it is specific books that Downey picks out, all of which are pretty interesting. I really enjoyed this class and learned a ton.

Downey is THE MAN. One of my favorite professors here at Ohio State. Truly cares about his students and made the subject super interesting. Tests are challenging but he gives you the essay prompts before the exam.

Dr. Downey was one of the best professors I've had at Ohio State. His lectures really made me care about sociological topics and changed my worldview. His tests are pretty tough, but if you take the time to prepare for them (and meet with him to review your preparation), you'll get an A. Buy or rent the books, as the test is based on them.

While learning the content was interesting, when it came to the exams he was a tough grader. He gives you ten possible topics for essays relevant to the recent material, and then chooses two for you to write essays on for the exam. He really expects you to make them quality essays, so it wasn't as easy as I expected.

He was a fantastic teacher and really made me learn to love sociology! There is a good deal of reading in the class, and pop quizzes, but the pop quizzes are always just "give me the main theme or summary" so they aren't too specific. Overall, Dr. Downey is a great guy, and also a hilarious lecturer. He made going to class worth it.

Professor Downey was one of my favorite professors that I have ever had.  He is very entertaining, and makes the topic more interesting than it actually is.  He is a fair grader, but you do definitely have to work for a good grade. He is not intimidating and always there to help. Definitely take his class if you get a chance!

Favorite college class. He really knows his stuff & is super passionate. He presents the information in an interesting way that makes you want to pay attention. There is a lot of group work & you actually get to know the people in the class which made it more fun. Just do the reading & pay attention. Exams aren't bad if you put in the effort

Dr. Downey is one of my favorite instructors of all the teachers I have ever had. He's a character and says something that makes the entire class laugh every 5 minutes. Truly enjoyed his class. He assigns really long reading assignments for homework that can be pretty unbearable but you have to do them to pass quizzes and exams. Take his class.

Dr. Downey is an excellent professor. His lectures are interesting and he does an extraordinary job of including students in class. Lecture revolves much more around students than his abstract power points, which serve as guidelines for class rather than a script. He is humorous and sociable, and is very approachable. I would retake this course

Lots of reading required for this class in order to prepare for pop quizzes. His lectures but tests come a lot of readings not discussed much. Almost all points come from exam which are two essay questions that must be answered very thoroughly. He didn't like my writing style so even though I understood the material, my grade didn't show it.

I took this class my freshman year of undergrad and as a law student now I think it helped more than anything preparing for law school in terms of how you need to work to pass. Read carefully, read everything, make a good outline and you'll learn a ton about sociology and just how to study
Best professor ever. Take his class.

Dr. Downey is a really good professor, but for an introductory sociology course, this class is way too much work and preparation for tests. Save yourself the time for classes that actually matter and take a different professor. There's no reason to stress over a sociology class, so do not take Downey.

One of my least favorite professors that I have had in my undergrad career.  He didn't listen to student feedback and is a harsh grader.  When I asked how I could improve, he simply replied "breadth and depth" and wouldn't elaborate.  Some lectures were triggering for students in the class.  Would not recommend unless must take for graduation.

Nice professor, willing to help with exams during office hours or through email. Class was really interesting, lots of discussion and some group work. Reading is not bad if you keep up. Pop quizzes over readings in class. He gives you exam prompts ahead of time, so if you prepare and read the assigned books in this class, its an easy A.

Amazing professor and lecturer. Kept class very interesting and interactive through activities and discussions. The amount of reading assigned was a heavy but tolerable. Exam essays take quite some time to prepare for but prompts are given ahead of time so as long as you put in the effort, you should be able to get an A.

Downey is a great lecturer and a pretty cool guy as well. There's a little more reading than in related classes, but the subject matter is interesting. As for the exams, he gives you ten possible questions but you can always narrow it down to three or four with little trouble. Great class in general!
Great instructor. Just have to keep up with the readings and the studying

Doug is very interesting, but really rough.  If you want to stress out like hell is breaking lose before his exams then take him, but I found his tests miserable.  The class is fun, he's a great teacher, but those exams were a deal breaker for me.  For soc 101, this was a little ridiculous.
easy A if you keep up with the reading. there is a LOT of reading though, be sure to keep!

Class was interesting and interactive. There was a lot of reading which was sometimes hard to get through but overall, it wasn't bad. Tests are essay based but he gives the question to you ahead of time so there's no reason to be prepared. If you pay attention and do your work it's easy to get an A.

Great professor. The material was interesting and class is interactive. Exams are 100% essay based, but he gives the questions ahead of time so if you put the time into studying you will get a good grade. He is also very approachable and willing to help you prepare. Quizzes were easy points, the only complaint I have is there was A LOT of reading.
Great professor who both loved the subject and encourages student input. I will always remember the things I learned in his class and I can't say that about many!
Nice guy, good professor. Just make sure you are interested in sociology because there is a TON of reading, and class can be a bit boring if you don't like the subject.

The most interesting teacher I have had at Ohio State. Loved him. He even invited me to speak to one of his graduate classes 2 quarters after I had him. A genuinely great guy with an interesting class. Read Guns Germs and Steel on of the best books I have ever read. ~2-3 hours of reading per week but it was interesting. Take this class if it's open

Such an amazing teacher! His class is really interesting and he is such a nice guy and is so eager to help! He is very fair, the course is very reading intensive and there are a lot of details, but if you do the work and put forth the effort you get the grade you want. One of my favorite teachers this year!

Really helpful and friendly.  I spent a lot more time studying for his essay tests than I wanted to, but the studying paid off.  The lectures were very organized, but be sure to take a lot of notes because his questions are based off of each lecture. His pop quizzes are easy and straight-forward.

This is by far my favorite professor ever! His lectures were interesting; the quizzes are really easy; the exams are completely straightforward and he gives you ample time to study and is always willing to help. He uses many teaching methods and the class atmosphere is always lively! YOU will LOVE this class!
Very good professor, class was very organized and challeging, yet fun. Best professor I've had.

He is very organized and interested in teaching. communicates information well and the material is pretty easy.  If you read from the book the night before the class you will do well on his quizes and outline your essay responses and youll do fine on the tests. Really nice guy too.

It's true that his lectures are unbelievably organized.  He lays everything out in a perfect outline for you...the majority of your grade will come from spitting back word-for-word what he tells you in class.  Just write the outlines that he gives you in essay form and you will get a great grade!
Pedantic and rude.  Treated me like an idiot and refused to hear comments from me after a few weeks of not agreeing with what I had to say.

The friendliest and most helpful prof I've had in my four years at OSU. His class was also much more interesting than other Soc I've taken. I'd recommend that everyone take it regardless of academic interests. Also, he makes class fun with a diverse format encompassing lecture, group work, presentations, videos, games...you name it. I miss him.
freaking sweet

This guy hated me for some reason, so I got a B in the class.  Hope you are interested in Functionalist and Conflict Theorist perspectives because that's what the whole class is about. Guns, Germs, and Steel was probably the worst book I have ever wasted my time reading.

Prof. Downey was an awesome teacher! On our last day of class he had compiled a "10 Best Moments in Class" list a la Jay Leno. It was so funny and he remembered very specific things that happened with certain people. The essays test are very very long but if you plan out your outline, you'll do fine

I had lots of fun with the lectures. He really engages the class and makes it interesting. The essay tests are very challenging and amount to a huge portion of the grade. But he is more than willing to help you prepare before hand. Definitely a great class!

Great professor. Excellent lectures. Essay tests are challenging, yet studying for them is an excellent review, and the tests turn out to be not as difficult as you expected. Awesome class, highly recommended professor

He has a great personality, and this class was very interesting--and fun, too. Oh, yes, the reading selection was excellent. H101 totally changed my perspective on a few things and convinced me to study sociology. Awesome.

I LOVED Dr.Downey's class. As long as you keep up on reading and attend class, you will be fine on the tests, which are essays. Some view the class as hard but it is worth it and he will meet with you anytime to help you out.

I had this guy over a year ago. GREAT professor. i highly recommend him. his lectures are very well organized, the material he gives is interesting, and the tests aren't hard if you study the notes and listen in lecture.
If you have nothing better to do in life but memorize and spit back large amounts of information, take the course.  If however you want to do something usefull with your time, look elsewhere.
He is very helpful.  There is alot of information on his essay tests, but you can write them all before and e-mail them to him and he will give you feedback.  Overall a pretty interesting class.
His class is quite interesting and you can tell that he really likes teaching it. Good times.
Dr. Downey was always willing to help out when you ask him.  His essay tests were a bit tought.. but what do you expect for an honors class? Overall a great professor though!
I recommend that you take his class if you have to take Soc 101. He assigns 2 interesting books for the quarter and his test are easy if you do the readings and study the lecture notes.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Professor Edmunds taught a great class. There were guidelines for the homework and how she wanted note-taking to look. There were a couple of times when some of the assignments took longer than others, but it was still interesting.

This class was split into lecture (optional) and lab (required). He had a book for the class, but it wasn't needed information in a different way. You'll be doing research in this class, but it is quite literally hand held. First week thinking of a topic, second week researching, third week drafting, etc. If you pay attention, you'll do amazing!

Professor Vuolo is awesome! Lectures are entertaining (which is impressive for research methods) and he ties in his personal research which is cool to learn about.
