Attendance is optional, but attending lectures is important. He gives out midterm questions and answers in his lectures to reward those who attend! Notes are not posted, just outlines.

Dr. Vuolo is one of my favorite professors so far. He is very chill and extremely well versed in his material. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it is necessary since the powerpoints aren't descriptive. He gives excellent study guides, with easy exams and papers. He has a lot of information and is a very engaging lecturer, and he also plays videos.

Dr. Vuolo is great! He is funny and very intelligent without being condescending. I learned a ton from his class. DO go to class, since powerpoints only have bullet points, notes have to be taken in class. Tests are easy, great study guides, pretty much all 4 papers relatively the same. I would definitely take another class with him.
Mike was probably my favorite professor I've had at OSU. He's very engaging, his lectures spell everything out clearly, and he answers emails very quickly. You won't regret taking him!
Dr. Schoon was a great professor and I'd highly recommend his class to anyone at OSU looking to fill a GE!

One of my favorite classes in college so far! Despite this being an online class, the class was super engaging. Professor Schoon was really helpful in office hours. He also gives multiple extra credit opportunities.

Asynchronous online class. There's a module every week with a quiz and a short writing assignment, plus a midterm paper and a final project. I liked the flexible schedule, and the professor was really nice.
This was my favorite class this semester! The class wasn't hard, and he provides grace periods on most assignments where you can hand in work up to a week late without penalty.

I don't see sociology 1102 as an option for rating, but I took that class with Dr. Schoon this semester and loved it. The ideas we talked about in this class actually helped me in some of my other classes. I'm definitely going to take more sociology courses after this!

Even though this was an online class I really wish it was in person because I loved the professor so much. However, his lectures are interesting and not boring despite somewhat long and the reading is interesting. If you're taking this online, read and watch the lecture so you don't fail the quiz. Otherwise the class was relatively easy and doable.
Great class! I liked the self-paced structure, and the emphasis on applying the concepts. I particularly liked the final project where we applied stuff we learned in class to analyze music.

Great class! Every week there's a module that follows the same basic format (reading, lecture, quiz, second lecture, writing assignment), and then there are two papers and a final project. I really liked that the weekly writing assignments focus on applying what we learned in the lectures and readings.

It's an interesting class. You apply what you learn in your two essays and final project. Every week, there is a chapter to read, lecture, quiz, video, and assignment about the video. Extra credit is a final quiz, and from asking guests of the videos questions about their field of work/study.

This was one of my favorite classes this semester! Dr. Schoon's passion for sociology shows in the lectures and the class really changed the way I think about things. The quizzes were hard sometimes, but the essays weren't bad and I loved the final project. There was plenty of extra credit to make up for a few bad quiz grades.

Professor was very passionate about his course. Lecture videos were longer (~1hr) & reading textbook/taking notes took a while but not bad considering it was completely online. Quizzes every week were a bit difficult but learning to study for them & good notes helped. Had extra credit opportunities. 2 essays that weren't bad. Overall good!

Dr. Schoon's lectures were interesting and I generally really liked the course material. The quizzes were hard at first, but once I learned how to prepare for them, my scores went up. There was a lot of extra credit, so it was easy to make up for a few bad quiz grades. I really liked the final project.

Prof Schoon seems like a good person and the lectures/reading materials were interesting. Weekly application assignments were straightforward and easy. The quizzes can be hard to prepare for because they have kind of specific questions, but they are open-book. The instructions on course projects were a bit vague but they weren't graded harshly.
This was a great class! I loved Professor Schoon's lectures and he was extremely helpful and kind in office hours. I definitely recommend taking Soc 1101 with him!

I took Professor Schoon's asynchronous online class and it was great. The workload wasn't too bad and the grading wasn't too tough. Even though the class wasn't in person, his personality comes through in the video lectures and he was really helpful and nice in office hours.

Took this class because it fulfilled a couple of requirements and wound up really liking it! The lectures are interesting, and the assignments aren't too hard. Some quizzes were difficult, but none of them are worth a lot of points, so it didn't hurt my grade. The flexibility of being online was nice, but I would have liked to meet in person.

I took the online and asynchronous intro to sociology class. I wish this had been in person, as Prof Schoon's online lectures were very interesting and well thought out. This is definitely an online class in which you need to pay attention to well, the online quizzes are difficult and they're even open note. Otherwise, I have no complaints.

Professor Schoon's online class was one of my easier classes. It was asynchronous and consisted of weekly readings (25-30 pgs.), video lectures with slides (about 1 hr.), an application activity (1 paragraph), and short quizzes that are open note. It may sound bad, but there's a one week grace period and multiple (a lot) extra credit opportunities.

Prof Schoon was a great professor. Lectures averaged about 1 hour long. There was a weekly quiz and discussion. There is a one-week grace period. Overall this was a straightforward class. Some of the TA's grade harshly but not professor Schoon.

Took his asynchronous course and it was perfect for my busy schedule. Each weekly module consisted of a 30ish page reading, an hour long pre-recorded lecture, an (easy) quiz, and a 2 paragraph application assignment. Just take notes on the readings and lectures and you will be fine quizzes are open book, too! The man is also very funny.

Overall this class was no too hard. Doing the readings were a must and taking very detailed notes on book and lecture videos. He makes questions a little too specific sometimes but overall and easy class. Schoon was very passionate about this course and gives lots of extra credit.
He is an amazing professor. He gives lots of extra credit. Would recommend.

I took Intro to Sociology online with Dr. Schoon and his class was very well organized. 1 quiz and 1 small writing assignment were due every Sunday. The TAs are more likely to respond faster than the actual professor.

This class was a great course for getting feet wet into classes at OSU. In my personal opinion, this asynchronous course allowed plenty of time to finish coursework throughout the entire semester. Professor Schoon was amazing in how much extra credit that you received during the semester. The textbook is an easy read, the assignments are easy.

There were multiple times I reached out to Prof Schoon and (if) I got a reply, I legit said aloud, "well thanks for nothing." I cannot express how impersonal this class was. I understand it was asynchronous but I literally felt like I was 100% teaching myself. It was so hard to keep up with the lengthy readings and long lectures. Do not recommend.
Pretty chill teacher overall. Watch the lectures and read the textbook and you'll pass just fine.

Honestly a really nice guy. His class was completely asynchronous and every week there is a quiz and application. I did struggle with some quizzes because of the amount of reading and lecture notes to write down but he offers a lot of extra credit opportunities! Overall, good class just watch and study the content. Also give grace periods!

One of my best professors so far! The only reason I got a B in this class was because I had a few missing assignments from being lazy on my part. Two assignments per week, the quizzes are super easy and open book. The essays are fairly easy as well as long as you understand information. Dr. Schoon was super understanding with the pandemic!

Wasnt my favorite class but dr. Schoon was very kind and helpful. I took this class online and there were weekly readings, lecture notes and quizzes. Then there are 2 essays and a final project. Everything was fairly easy and theres a lot of extra credit. If you think you deserved a higher grade on the essay, just ask him to look it over again

Classwork is done on your own time. There was one assignment and quiz a week along with 2 papers for the semester. No midterms. There is a final project but no final. TA is very helpful and responds quickly. Lectures are iffy sometimes but usually helpful. Sometimes the quiz questions were a little specific. If you read, quizzes aren't that hard

Three open note midterms, two papers and one course project, so not a lot of work outside of class, but you have to do well on all the exams/projects. He is accessible outside of class to go over exam questions that were missed. He also gets rid of questions on the exams if a significant amount of people miss the same question. Great guy!

The essays dragged my grade from a A to a B, which was a bit annoying because they were graded by the TAs not him. As a lecturer, I had a hard time keeping focused during class, I feel like he went on a tangents. Otherwise, he's a funny guy. He could stick a mic under your face during class, happened to me once and I just said "I don't know."
Super nice guy, very caring of the class and students and it shows. Attendance isn't mandatory and exams are open book and online. Super easy class.

Dr. Schoon is a wonderful and funny professor and I very much enjoyed his class. The exams are open book, open note, and do not have to be taken in the classroom. He has very few grades, but if you put in the effort, you'll get a good grade. He posts all the notes online and reading the book isn't necessary, but helpful. Positive and happy guy.

Dr. Schoon is awesome! You can tell he cares about his students and sociology. His exams are all open note, open textbook, open google... and he ends up taking questions off that were commonly missed. The two 3 page essays given throughout the semester are the only work that you will have to do for this class, but youll still end up learning a lot

he is a great professor but the exam is really hard although it is an open book exam. The paper instruction is not clear at all so a lot of people ask questions in-office hours. Prepared to wait for at least 30 min for the office hour.

Tbh I literally didn't go to class, went the first week then never showed up again. He posts all his slides and the exams are online so basically I just had those up while I took exams, ended the semester with an A- so I wouldn't say you have to go to class. Also never used the textbook so I wouldn't recommend buying it.

Dr. Schoon is a great professor. Genuinely cares for his students and is super passionate in his lectures, making the content more interesting. The tests are all online and open note. The tests are solely based on lecture content so as long as you attend lecture and pay attention you should be fine.

The lectures are very long and he says a lot of information that arent on the slides he uploads that show up on the tests so if you dont go to class you wont be prepared. Tests are all open book and online so are easy to pass. Theres only 2 papers and 1 semester project other than the tests
This was my favorite class this semester! Great lectures, reasonable amount of work, and he really cares about his students. Definitely recommend!

I liked this class a lot. The lectures could drag on a bit, but Dr. Schoon seemed to really care about the material and worked to keep things interesting. He was a super easy grader on the essays, and the tests were pretty straightforward.
I loved this class! Would definitely take a class with him again.

Three exams, two essays, and a course project. Takes a long time to grade but easy grader. Exams are easy as long as you take notes but you don't need to show up to lecture to take notes. Boring lectures but an easy grade.

I took intro to sociology with Prof Schoon so I'm not sure if it is just because it is a intro class but it was super easy... Online tests, no homework, canceled 1 of 2 papers, no attendance... If you're looking for an easy A he is great. However, exams are weighted heavy and very few grades so don't mess up any exams.. could wreck your grade
Excellent class and professor.  He cares about the students and unlike most Gen Ed's this class is super useful in real life.  Take his class if you can!
Loves group discussion. Very set on his grades (won't change even if you argue for it)

Dr. Schoon made this class very interesting and I enjoyed it.  His lectures were great and he really cares about his students.  The only grades in the class are quizzes and exams (on Carmen) and a group project, which is nice because it makes it a low workload class, however if you mess one up then it can really affect your grade.

Good teacher and easy class. However, there are only a few assignments so don't mess up on any of them. All quizzes and midterms are open note and online so you do them at home. The 1 group project we had was easy. Learned a lot of cool stuff. Make sure you show up to lecture because he says some things there that will be on the weekly quizzes.

He takes random attendance, there are in-class discussions based off of various reading. Exams and quizzes were all online  and were based off of discussions. Quiz/exam questions based off of in-class discussions. We also had to write two papers.

Honestly was not expecting much of this class, but the way he taught it made it very interesting! Only a few grades, but you can do well if you know what he expects and show up to class! He's a really nice guy and wants to get to know his students... definitely would recommend taking his class!
Take anything he teaches. Great professor.

He is a good guy, and I feel like he really wanted people to succeed in his class. His tests and quizzes were hard at first, but got easier as he realized people weren't doing well. Extra credit offered at end. Lectures were pretty interesting, even though I generally don't like sociology.

Cynthia Coles was one of the worst professor I have had, if not the worst. The exam averages were a C and the final paper that students worked hard on all semester had a B- average. She often took forever to grade so you were left wondering what your grade was until the very end of the semester. This class was overly stressful for no reason.

She is the worst professor I have had at Ohio State. She is extremely disorganized and should not be teaching if she can't balance responsibilities. The class is graded on a paper, two exams, a group presentation, and participation. The exam averages were in the 70s and she didn't seem to care at all. It's a shame you can't avoid taking her class.

Dr. Colen is very disorganized when it comes to this class format. There is a class participation grade that she says is based on discussion and not only attendance, yet she said we would see our participation grade in week 8 and still have no clue what I have. Took a decade to grade our midterms and the course is unnecessarily stressful overall.

This is the worst class I have taken at OSU, as a senior. Professor Colen is very unorganized. Took over a month to grade midterms. She laughs it off in class whenever people about it but it's really just annoying and unfunny. She changes guidelines last minute for assignments. She says it's her first time teaching this class so that's her excuse.

Amazing lecturer, made class interesting. Heavily reliant on readings but as long as you do most them, attend lectures, occaisonally participate, you should get an A. Everything on tests is covered in lecture. Would def take her again. Only thing is I think she bses the participation grade considering I doubt she knew the names of 95% of students.

I took SOCIO 3549 and even with the textbook, it like did not help, if anything it made it more confusing. She did not test us over things that we actually learned. The tests were extremely hard. Other students and I would spam her email with questions before and after the exam and we would hear nothing. Like absolutely BEWARE!

Great professor! She knows her stuff and is passionate about her students. There are multiple articles to read before every class and some book chapters, but you really do better in the course if you read yourself beforehand. The information is really in-depth but the exams covers MAIN POINTS of things. She's a fair grader too. 2 papers & 2 exams

Dr. T is who I want to be. He's so passionate and very experienced in the field. There are lots of readings but the topic is very interesting. I wish the class wasn't hybrid because only having that class once a week was the worst. He brings in guest speakers from different jobs and leads a prison visit. Very adamant about getting out there.

I've taken a couple classes with Dr. T. He is knowledgeable on what he teaches, but I don't connect with his teaching style at all. Feels very unorganized and repetitive with the class really only being taught through the readings rather than through the lectures, which everyone treats as optional. Definitely take OPEEP with him if you can though.

Dr. T's class was awesome. He's an awesome professor & you can tell he cares about what he's teaching. He has experience in the field and is very knowledgeable. I loved the guest speakers he brought in since I felt like it really nicely supplemented the info from class. The weekly workload is very manageable. Dr. Hinton is always available to help.

Dr T is an impeccable professor , not even being biased he's one of the best professors you'd ever take. You will actually immerse yourself into the content with real life experiences not just reading and work he genuinely cares 100% about his students, well being after school and he's very kind and helpful. One of the best hands down. Id rate 10/5

This dude seriously deserves a raise or more recognition by far the best professor at OSU. He brings in people from actual careers or previous felons to talk about opportunities and their life experiences. encourages his students to reach out to him outside of class to help them succeed. So long as you read or attend the lectures, u should get an A
Dr.Hilton is my professor so far! He's very caring and understanding. He also helps with internship opportunities. His lectures are never boring, overall, the best professor out there!!!

I LOVED this class. He always answered emails, and is a great professor who cares so much about the material. Only a few tests, a final paper, weekly small quizzes, and easy discussion boards. All were extremely easy. Gives a study guide for the tests, just look over the PowerPoint(s) for all assignments and tests, and you will do great.

Dr. T is truly one of the best professors in the sociology department at OSU. He is very knowledgable and genuinely cares for all of his students. He is a fair grader and his course material is very interesting- he knows how to keep a class engaged and his classes have always been my favorite.

Dr. Hinton is a great professor and professional. He is very supportive of his students while keeping an engaging course. He continues to support his students even after they have moved on from his course in professional matters.

Dr. T is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. His lectures are super interesting and he constantly tells first hand stories that keep the student super engaged. He is also very caring and will gladly help any student outside of class with career opportunities or class work. He is very passionate, which causes students to be passionate too.

Dr. T was a great professor and taught me a lot. Lectures were only once a week, but they were great and I learned a lot. There were discussion posts every week, 3 exams, and a paper. I really liked this class and I really recommend.
A great professor who relates to the students. His Sociology of Gangs class was intriguing and he presented the information in a way that everyone could understand.

I've had Terrance for both Soc 2310 and 3315. His class format is pretty easy to follow: A lecture mixed with an article or two per week, a discussion board and a four question quiz. There is a mid-term and final which are mostly multiple choice with a few short answer, as well as a final 4-6 page paper. It's clear he cares about his students!

Professor Bowe was great. She responded to emails quickly and graded quickly. The class consists of discussion boards that are 1/2 point. Her projects and paper were fun to do. Her lectures were engaging and she tied in personal points, which I enjoyed. Her exams were open book. This class is an easy A.

Literally impossible to not get an A. Exams are so incredibly easy, discussion posts are mostly opinion based, and research papers are also comparatively easy. Jaclyn is so kind and caring and truly will help in any way she can. Recommend her for any class!

Highly recommend as an easy gen ed for Race, Ethnicity & Gender Diversity. Fully online with 2 easy weekly discussions (basically just have to do them for 100%). 3 online exams - all answers can be found in notes or in textbook. 1 research paper at the end 4-6 pages but wasn't bad at all. I barely read textbook or notes and got 100% in the class.

This class is pretty interesting if you care about the law/justice system. Professor Bowe gives good lectures, is extremely kind, and crystal clear on what you need to know. The exams were also all open note and online, with one 4-6 page research paper towards the end. If you do poorly in this class... abandon all hope.
Quite possibly the most free A at OSU

Very easy class. 2 discussion boards a week, 2 research papers, and 2 open note exams. As long as you do the work you will pass the class. She is also very fast with answering emails and cares about her students.
Professor Bowe is great. The course is well organized and assignments are very manageable.
Easy class

I enjoyed Dr. Bowe's class, I thought it was very clear what she wanted us to know and I did not have difficulty on the assignments. We did need the textbook but I only used it to study for the quizzes and tests. Overall this class was really easy.

This was a really easy class. Discussion posts were simple and the 2 papers were graded fairly. The prof was very accessible and material was posted consistently on time. not too much reading was required.

One of my favorite professors at OSU. Dr Bowe is super nice and she is willing to help students. She knows the materials well and assignments are straight forward. I took two of her classes and I'm taking GENE 4001 with her next semester.
I didn't watch any of the lectures. I did 20% of the additional readings and did not read the textbook once. I got an A.

This course is super simple. If you have a basic understanding of the US legal system this should be a breeze. Just weekly assignments, three exams, and one 4-6 page paper. If you just complete all the work you should get an A.

I took this class as an online Diversity GE, and it was very interesting! workload is quite manageable each week as well. One thing I will say that exams make up a large portion of your grade, but those are hardly challenging. Other than that, just weekly discussion posts and 1 paper. Great choice for a GE.
Easy class. Workload consisted of no more than a weekly discussion post. Book is recommended but not necessary for the class. Midterms are online and open book and not too hard.

Class was informative but super easy. You get out what you put into it - the lectures and readings are long and interesting, but you really don't need them to do fine with the weekly work. I probably spent like an hour on class each week, plus a couple hours for the final paper. Would recommend.
There were 2 papers, 2 exams and 2 discussion posts every week. Class was easy, but I learned so much! I enhoyed professor Bowes lectures and attitude.

There was one required final paper and 3 exams. There were 2 disscussion posts every week. All exams were extremely easy and open book/note. Professor Bowe was extremely nice and understanding. I enjoyed listening to her lectures.

Professor Bowe was amazing! She's an attorney, so she's very knowledgeable about the subject matter and it shows how much she cares about it. Her class is low-maintenance, just a couple short discussion posts a week, one paper, and non-cumulative open-note exams. Easy A and she was engaging even in online lectures.
Online class so I didn't interact with her much.  However she seemed nice and the class is easy.

Such an easy A and she is honestly the best! Her lectures are so interesting and there is an extra credit assignment worth 3%. The 2 papers are relatively easy and she is very willing to help and give feedback if you need it. Definitely recommend!!
An easy online class. Her lectures were thorough and she made sure everything on the quiz or exam was covered in her recorded lectures

I really enjoyed this class! The readings and assignments were helpful and interesting. The small group discussion posts were nice. Everything was very organized. There are weekly discussion posts and quizzes, two essays, and an op-ed. She does give some extra credit too..

I've seen a lot of negative reviews I disagree w. Class was super easy, just read and watch all of the videos. She specifically tells you what to take notes on for the test. Got 100% on all the essays, and quizzes always consisted of material from class. Lots of group discussions for easy points. Simple class for GE credit. Lots of extra credit!

For an online class, Claudia was a great professor; however, the materials presented did not help that much in terms of quizzes and assignments, and she is a harsh grader on papers done in class. I did learn a lot in the class, and our discussions with peers were enjoyable and informative, so I appreciate her implementation of that.

Great professor. Short papers to do sometimes; re-read them before turning them in. 

Only a little to do weekly. SHE OFFERS EXTRA CREDIT, TAKE IT. The class has very few points. Take advantage.

Go through lectures and readings for the weekly quizzes and discussion boards. It will help you out because the answers are always there!

If you can avoid professor Buchmann, DO IT. A ridiculous amount of work for no reason. Extremely harsh grader. I was literally.5% away from an A and she refused to offer anything. Which isn't the end of the world, but overall her class just feels like a bunch of busy work and like she takes off points just cause she feels like it.
Would not recommend taking this course. Very boring and graded harshly. Learned nothing

Grades pretty difficult and is a very petty grader. Makes assignments due on a Saturday instead of Sunday. Not the most difficult course, but is not a fun one. Most of the assigned work feels like busy work
Class is clear and easy to follow. Variety of material so it doesn't get boring. Quizzes aren't too difficult. Opportunities for extra credit. Would reccomend.
Very knowledgeable professor.  Assigns a lot of reading.  Papers and exams, especially, are graded strictly.  A great GEC overall.  Would recommend to a friend!

This was absolutely my favorite class taken @ OSU so far.  She knows her stuff and I learned SO much from this class.  The midterm (for the Honors version of the class) was a take-home, which was better because it's a really subjective class, not an objective class.  I forgot to fill out my student evaluation for her, so I'm giving her an A+ on her

This is a fantastic class.  If you put in the time to do the readings, and pay attention in class, you'll succeed. 1 Quiz, Midterm, Final, 2 papers, and few other assignments.  Attendance is mandatory, but it really isn't that bad because you'll learn about interesting material and are really forced to think critically.  One of my favorite classes.

She is a good teacher. Likes to talk a lot and gets everyone involved. She is a tough grader on her exams but easy with the papers. You have to do a ton of work in this class and must show interest or she won't give you the grade you deserve. She is fair, but if you don't like to read and write, avoid her class. Lots of discussions (10%) of grade.

I did not care for Professor Buchmann one bit. She didnt really seem to know what she was talking about. She was quite ditzy at times and laughed at the mistakes that she made often.She assigns too much reading for the amount of assignments she expects you to do.

Great Class. Fair teacher. Really cares that the students are understanding the lectures. Uses a lot of media and visual aides. Exams are combined of essay and mutiple choice. Her multiple choice questions are tricky. Essays are generally on the topics you spend a great deal talking about in class. Attendance is required. Study guides are used.

This was my favorite course as a SOC major.  Her lectures are organized, easy to follow, and she makes great use of multimedia and visual aids.  You can get by on the exams without doing the reading...however the reading material is actually pretty interesting and dare I say...enjoyable. TAKE THIS COURSE!

attendance was mandatory but lectures were boring, the pace at which we covered material was slow.  Most of the exams espeacially the multiple choice questions on exams were over trivial statistics instead of overall ideas. I do not recommend this class for upper level sociology majors as nothing new will be covered, it seemed to be a broad review
Love her! Very understanding, and helpful.
very ethusiastic about teaching
The readings are very necessary and are on the exams. She is very picky with her grading. Her review sheets are very helpful. Study those and you're good to go.
No Comments
Easy as hell as long as you go to class. Reading isn't even neccessary.
Class material is very easy and obvious.  A bit picky about grading on tests, but overall an easy course without much work.
One of the worst grades I've gotten. But then again, it is Stats.
Just overall not a very good professor, teaches like you already know the content and moves very quickly.

I used to love statistics before I took her class. She will dog on her students for not getting the material but she's terrible at teaching! She gives you less than 1 minute to solve the problem & enter it into TopHat which is not enough time. She goes on 15 min long tangents, then says “this won't even be on the exam”. Not worth the frustration.

Dr. Reanne Frank was one of the most passionate and amazing professors I had ever had. She made me discover a love for a topic I never thought was possible, demography. She encourages students to have open discussions and is ok with going off track if it means have a good in depth conversation. She is truly an amazing soul and an awesome professor!

I loved Dr. Frank! She removed a lot of material that gave students trouble in the past and constantly went at a pace she felt the class was understanding. Very straightforward of what is required and a fairly easy class if you just show up and pay attention.

Dr. Frank's lectures were extremely long, but since it was only once a week it isn't too bad. She is always considerate of whether or not students understand the subject. The class is simple for a statistics class, and is easy if you can comprehend the material. She gives tons of extra credit, and it's composed of 4 assignments and 2 exams

She seems to be better than the reviews before me. She really seems to try hard to explain things & she is helpful if you ask questions. The lectures are really long and boring though. There's 4 HW assignments that aren't too bad and a midterm and final. She also takes attendance and gives extra credit every class. All the grades were graded fast.

Extremely boring. The information is easy to grasp, but she makes it more complicated than it needs to be. I'd highly recommend if you have to take this class, take it with a different professor. Even other professors in the Sociology department warned me of taking this class with her as a professor
She has been here a few years, people say she is getting better. I wish she was organized (even a little bit).

Good professor. Does not post notes on Carmen, must attend class for notes. Two easy papers to write, 3 pages at most. Studying is required, but it isn't hard material. Mostly common sense. I recommend Frank if you want an easy A.

Of all instructors that teach this course, Dr. Frank is among the best. She has taught the course more than five times, so basically she has a grasp on it. The best quality about her is that she wants you to succeed, so she makes the exams/assignments/policies fair and offers extra credit. She is extraordinarily bright and rents clickers for you.

Dr. Frank did a great job relating introductory demography with world pop trends/issues.Easy enough if you show up to class, pay attention and study a little bit (imagine that...)The info should be thought provoking to those interested in global demographics.I recommend this course.You're unlikely to encounter this material anywhere else, so LEARN!

this class was SO easy! gives extra credit in every lecture, and attendance is mandatory. she makes the material very clear and gives many examples. i thought stats would be my hardest class but ended up with an A very easily. 4 assignments and 2 exams. i think our class had 18 extra credit points given over the quarter. take her!
She made everything pretty clear. Especially when learning stats it is easy to be confused, but she explains it very well and has many examples which helps!

Whoever says she is bad is wrong. Dr Frank is a really good teacher and her class is easy unless you are an idiot. She explains everything very well in class and anything you dont understand can be found in the book or you can ask and she's very helpful.
Very easy on the eyes
No one ever knew what she was talking about. When questions were asked, she only repeated herself and did not give us a good explanation
A little unorganized at times, but overall not a bad professor. If anything, the TA's will prevent you from understanding the material by making things more confusing than necessary.
She seemed to be confused about what she was talking about at times, and she spoke in the same bored tone the entire lecture. Take a different professor!

Dr. Frank was young, and it showed. While her class wasn't too bad, and she did a good job or giving a lot of examples, I got the vibe that her lectures were really disorganized and some of the assignments were really unclear about what she wanted on them. Not a terribly difficult class, if you have to take 549, take it with her..not bad to look at
Enjoyed this class.  He's engaging and shows interest in his students.

I absolutely loved the lectures from this professor. Additionally, what we go over in class is usually discussed on the weekly quizzes, final exam, and papers. However, for this class you need to prepare for a lot of reading, impossible quizzes (they're easy at first), documentaries, and a bunch of other stuff. If you don't like sociology, then NO

She is such a great professor and truly cares about her students. The quizzes are not difficult. There are two essays that you would have to write. However, there are guided questions that are provided to you to secure a good grade. I would highly recommend this class to fulfill the citizenship for a just and diverse world requirement.
It's a difficult subject that she does all she can to make understandable/easier to digest for students, and makes herself very available if you need her help!
She was great!
He is a very funny, kind, and understanding professor. He is fairly new so I think that adds to it, I've taken him for two courses now and have thoroughly enjoyed both semesters.
Best professor

I'm really glad that I took Professor Kleps's class, you can tell that he cares a lot about social justice and his students. There were no exams for this class but there were two longer papers. I wouldn't say that he's an easy grader, but he is a fair grader. If you participate in class and do the readings you'll definitely get an A.

I HIGHLY recommend professor Kleps to everyone. There were only two tests for the whole semester, and they are very straight forward, open note. Show up to the lectures and you'll learn a lot. Genuinely wants students to succeed and he is always happy to assist. One of the most caring professors I have ever had! I looked forward to this class.

The 1 star rating for him is not adequate. He is a awesome professor with constant office hours. He grades hard due to the class being needed for the major of criminology. But its for the best. His assignments are straight forward, and always is open to hearing peoples sides. Take this professor for Soc Theory if you can. 100%.

Christopher is one of the most passive aggressive professors I have ever encountered. He hates it when people disagree with him and loves the sound of his own voice. He often talks about his time as an attorney and honestly I wish he would just go back to it. He grades the papers very harshly. Take this class with literally any one else.
Easiest online class. Professor Ng is very straightforward with the assignments and grading.

Super easy class. You write a 150-word discussion post and do assignments (max 1 hour) each week. Exams had no time limit and were open book. For the exams, skim through the PPTs and you **MUST** watch the exam review video. I didn't watch any of the weekly lectures or read a page of the textbook and was fine. Take the course and get your A.
Really easy online class

I'm sorry but this is literally the most disorganized class I've ever taken. She had to actually have students request that she post lectures before she did it... she was just gonna let us work through the material with the textbook on our own? Midterm exam was so stupid it wasn't even about sociology it was literally just random facts.

She is a caring person but gives out SO much work. Most of the time the grading criteria is pretty vague but she is a nice grader. Expect to be spending an insanely long amount of time on her classs work

If you are taking a sociology course for the first time I recommend not taking a virtual class from her. She might be better in person but virtually she is so disorganized. Lectures were like 15 minutes long and sometimes just audio with no accompanying slides. If you can navigate a crim/soc classes based on prior knowledge this class will be easy.

Amy is a great person and very reasonable and her online class was an easy A. There are 3 exams, a few DB's and a powerpoint presentation so the work load is pretty small. However, if you enjoy organization, don't take this class. Amy is extremely disorganized and her lectures tend to be short and confusing. But, I guess the A speaks for itself.

Really like her as a person, but she can be a little unorganized (probably due to the pandemic) and I had a hard time reaching her outside of class. Sometimes lectures weren't always posted, but the assignments are easy enough to do without really listening to the lectures anyway. Shes really nice and fun though!
Literally, she is the best.

I had her for this course and Prisons & Jails, both really easy classes with clear expectations. 3 exams, small assignments (1-2 pages) and one presentation (powerpoint) of your choice. Easy grader and she's really funny.

Genuinely love her so much. The exams were very easy and she has review sessions and study guides for them. The material is interesting and she makes the class enjoyable. We did a super easy partner project at the end of the semester.

I took a conversation course ARTSCI 1137.16. He has prefaced that it was his first (and last) time leading this course, but this has by far been my favorite course thus far. He is incredibly knowledgeable and is a great sociologist. He is also very personable and seems to have genuine care for his students and their understanding in his course.
One of the worst professors I've ever had. If you don't know anything about statistics good luck. He's not helpful in the slightest.

Do NOT take if you haven't taken an introductory statistics class beforehand. While not a requirement, I have no idea how anyone passed if they had no prior statistics experience. Go to lab; he essentially gives the homework answers (just with different numbers). Does not give partial credit (getting one part wrong = zero for the entire question)

Literally the worst Professor I have had a OSU. He is so condescending and rude. The online place where homeworks are conducted is so difficult. They would take me three hours sometimes just to get the stupid programming to work! He doesnt give much feedback, but his TAs do. Two good things about him: didnt have to go to class, quick responses.

The homework assignments are very difficult and he tried to flip the class so he could do less work in my opinion. He made things political that didn't need to be political, especially for the type of class that it is. Just overall, not a good class. 10/10 don't take unless you absolutely HAVE to.

Dave was the best teacher I have had in a while- always accessible outside of typical hours and really cares about his students. He tries so hard to help his students and is really flexible. He is super knowledgeable about what he does and I respect him a lot. Lectures are kind of boring, but its not that interesting of a class to begin with aahah

I can't say enough good things about this professor. Truly one of the kindest I've ever had and I'm a senior. Very easy grader and respects his students. Replies fast and ready to help with any questions. Really just a phenomenal professor and person; can't recommend his course enough.
I just love him. I am taking his asynch class right now and it's so interesting which makes it easy (imo). The work is very manageable and he is just so kind. I cannot reccommend enough.

Charlie is a great professor! I throughly enjoyed this class and learned a lot. His experience in law enforcement gives a unique and memorable point of view. Grading was clear, tests were straight-forward (multiple choice/T or F), and the textbook reading was not mandatory to do well in the course.

Charlie is an AMAZING professor. Criminal Investigation is the most interesting class I had this semester, and he did a great job of making it easy to understand. He always gives personalized feedback if you miss points, and assignments are straightforward and easy. Overall great class and even better professor.

Professor LoFaso might be one of my favorite profs on campus. He is so understanding about if you need to turn in things late, and his quizzes and tests are easy if you just copy the notes from the lecture videos. Super sweet man, and he really cares about what he teaches! Overall amazing class.

I LOVED this course, by far my favorite course I have taken. I loved this professor, he was very helpful and easy to reach, and also a great instructor. There was a lot of information covered, but it does not feel overwhelming. The quizzes and assignments are easy as long as you watch the lectures. I would highly recommend this professor!!

Charlie was incredibly accessible outside of class and extremely helpful. I emailed him on numerous occasions and always got a response by the end of the day.

Very interesting guy who loves teaching his material. The class is quite dependent on reading the textbook though, which is slightly unfortunate.

Class structure was easy to follow and very clear. Portrayed the lecture material very well and was very understanding. I didn't even the buy the book as the lectures were good enough I didn't need too. This is the second time I've had him, and I would take another class of his if I had the chance.

Charlie was a great professor who made the course very easy to follow. I always knew what was expected of me and never felt like the workload was unbearable. His lectures are very interesting due to experience in this field and he gives his real life examples to help connect the information in the course. Tests and assignments are straight forward.

This class was easy and so interesting. Charlie is very passionate and caring about his work and students. Despite the class being online, I felt it was very easy to talk to him when necessary and he was very quick with grading and making accommodations. Genuinely the nicest professor I've ever had.
Charles is such a good professor, who is understanding and kind. He goes out of his way to make sure us students are successful in his class! I recommend taking him!!

Charlie is a great professor and I would take every class taught by him if I could. He is very understanding and is willing to help with anything. I missed a few points on a quiz one time and emailed him to ask for an explanation. He gave me 2 points back because I am a good student and he hates to see me lose points. Great guy!

I have taken one class with him so far, about to be in two more for my senior year and I wish he taught every class I've had! His lectures are amazing and he applies real world experiences to almost every lesson, he makes everything comprehensible and fun to learn, and he also gives amazing advice for those looking to further their career in crim
Dr. Lofaso is marvelous. He is passionate and knowledgeable about the material and genuinely respects his students and their time. I would highly recommend him as a professor.
He is so understanding and flexible! This course is particularly stressful for many people because of the content, but he makes every effort to keep everyone safe.

Ryan is one of the best professors I've had. His expectations are clear at the start of the semester, and as long as you show up, listen, and take halfway  notes, you'll do just fine. He also has some nice stories and jokes to make lecture time bearable. I'd absolutely recommend taking this class.

Fantastic professor. I took his class last summer and it actually changed the way I look at the world and has had an impact on what I have been researching. Very interesting and knowledgeable. The books are worth reading.

What a joke of a class. The easiest A of my life, not just college. Hardest part is he assigns a 10-page paper but says it's not like he's really going to read it, and I seriously doubt he read mine. He clearly does not care, he wastes half of the time showing tumblr or the Colbert Report. If you're into being treated like a preschooler, take him.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Terribly depressing subject matter but Ryan somehow manages to get you through it without wanting to kill yourself. He's a really impressive lecturer and his manner is strangely attractive. I would highly recommend any class he teaches.

Ryan made taking a GEC worthwhile. As an engineering student it is not often that a professor can provoke thought on a subject and maintain a high interest level in the class. Easy A if you go to lecture. He will not test on anything that wasn't in lecture. Paper is the most significant grade, but grades it based on if he thought you read the books

Going to this class was literally the highlight of my week. Ryan is the realest and coolest prof alive. If you have the opportunity to take his class, do it. Also, he gives extra credit and will always verify that students know exactly what is going on. Also, he is hilarious. Ya just take his class, go bucks.
Kind of interesting, though provoking material.  Only assignments were a few readings, a paper, and midtermfinal.  Grades fairly. Is bald.
Very easy class with lots of extra credit opportunities. Final and midterm was very straight forward. If you go to class, you will pass.
Awesome

Ryan is hilarious, fun, and informative.  Even when the subject matter is dark or bleak he keeps it light and interesting. You learn a lot about the environment and the interaction of technology and society. We both have a strong affinity for American Eagle, but I think his belt-buckle is stupid. Other than that great guy.
Also comes prepared to class and is a lot of fun to talk to. Brings up very interesting points and is very laid back. He is always willing to help and will do anything for his students!

Keeps the lectures interesting. Uses modern examples. Gives you all possible exam questions and will even answer them in review sessions. He will break from lecture to blog about his cat or tell a story.

Awesome, laid back, writes key terms on the board, draws pictures, gives you a review sheet, posts video links & articles from class on Carmen, essays' format/organization/focus are up to you, has an unexpectedly interesting background/life experiences that make awesome examples for the stuff he explains in class, references cats a lot. :)
Best class I have taken at OSU so far and it is entirely because he was the best professor I've ever had. I looked forward to class. I learned so much.

Ryan was awesome. He is super passionate about what he teaches. The material we covered is very interesting and important to know in this world.  There are 3 tests (short answer/essay). They are easy though. His lecture style is great. He is super helpful and accommodating/understanding too.

Best prof I've ever had at OSU. Soc 597.01 with Ryan is a class I would recommend to everyone - he teachers very important topics that are have real-world implications and relevance. Very important to know this stuff. 3 exams and a research paper. Exams are easy if you study, the paper isn't bad either bc you get to choose your topic. Awesome guy.

He's obviously very passionate about current events and social theory. Sometimes his lectures get rambly or digress, but the connection is there. Very well-informed, very energetic. Lots of reading, but it's all relevant and important to the class. I found him an engaging and invested lecturer/TA.

Not the most interesting class I've ever taken. Ryan seems to ramble alot about material that is not necessary, and lectures very little it seems about what we actually will be tested on. Lectures tend to me long, and there is none to little class participation. He is very helpful and thats a plus.

Biased in his teaching, but overall he is decent. Gives weird examples in lecture that don't always apply to material being taught. Would like to have had more open discussion in class instead of his ranting about economics. Essay tests are manageable as long as you support well with examples.
His tests(all essay) do not have a whole lot to do with his lectures, nor do they have much to do with the book. He makes this class much more difficult than it should be.
Ryan was an excellent instructor. Anyone would be lucky to have him as an instructor.
Ryan has a...colorful vocabulary.  If you don't want your ears tainted, don't take his section/class.  We had some fun in the class, but I personally didn't like it due to my distaste of sociology.

Doesn't make powerpoint available to students, assigns a lot of reading, but rarely explains it thoroughly. Really boring lecturer who reads off the powerpoint. Gives vague and dense review sheets that don't help much, and will tell you to go ask a classmate for notes if you approach for help. Harsh grader and poor lecturer, would NOT recommend.
She is very clear, concise and helpful! Yo must ask if you have any concerns. Meeting with TA's helped alot

Review sheets for the tests help a lot. If you take your work seriously and show up to class and take the notes you should do just fine. Grades papers very tough. I also have a feeling she grades minority students much easier than white males, but that's just a feeling.
She is very helpful and easy to approach. She explains the material well and gives examples and in class exercises!

Krivo is a great teacher for this class. My friend took same class, diff. teacher and said our notes were much easier to understand. She genuinely cares if the class understands the concepts and will take time IF U ASK for help, she moves very quickly. I would rec. her for SOC549 over the other profs. Try to get Reese or Costello for TA's.
it is important to go to class although her notes are vague. her discussions can get very trivial.

dido the other persons comments.  she does a really annoying smile too, that gets old, and will call on people randomly when the same people keep talking.  i thought this class was extremely difficult and boring. if you have her, you must go to class though, i skipped alot and barely passed (C-), but i passed, my TA was really helpful

Her voice is really annoying.  If she senses people are drifting off she raises her tone of voice and it gets old very fast.  She makes a ton of mistakes on her slides and even managed to mess up the formula sheet she had on the exam.

if you want to fail this course, take it with paul. He is not lenient on grades. He is a very tough grader. He doesnt do a good job of clarifying assignments. One big thing i had with paul is getting back to the student in a timely manner, if you e mail him, dont expect to hear back, if u do its in a message addressed to "all" in the class.
Terrible teacher. Does not care whether the students pass. Makes material way harder than it should be
Rude and inconsiderate.
THE best professor I've ever had in college!

Good orator. Seemed enthusiastic about Sociology. Overall rather laid back, straightforward testing. Low points are that the book really isn't necessary, I haven't even unrwapped the plastic from it. Also late work is not accepted.
Totally awesome! All the other people are lying. Assignments are pretty easy and tests are straight forward. Engages class in discussion and really cares about his subject
Each class was rushed. Paul must've made some GREAT improvements over the years. OK on grading. He never sparked any interest from anyone on the class.

Made us read his dissertation, which is completely ridiculous in my opinion.  He thinks everybody in the class should care about the subject, when its just an ethics requirement.  Really obnoxious with a big final project.  Take the other ethics class if there's room.

Paul isn't a personable professor whatsoever. His grading is tough and asks random questions on the midterms and final that weren't covered in class. My biggest peeve with Paul is that he will ask a question and will demand that someone answer it before he continues the lecture. Note taking is impossible. Five papers, two midterms and a final.
H eis not as hard as some of the posters nake him out to be.  There was alot of work but overall he wasn't that bad.  If you keep on top of the reading and go to class you should be good to go.
There was a lot of information covered in this class, but if you read the assignments and studied I found getting an A not too difficult. Just don't be lazy.

There was soooo much info covered in this class that made it extremely hard, but overall I learned a great deal about globalization. He did not seem very personable in class, but I think he did alright.

if you are not majoring in sociology, do not take this class. I went to class every day, took notes on every word he said and it took me 8 hours to complete the final exam --- 35 multiple choice, 25 matching, 10 fill-ins, 15 short answers, and 2 essays. A BIT MUCH?

One of the most ridiculous graders you will ever meet. His questions are not only worded poorly and unclear, he is inconsistent about relying the information that you will be tested on. Note taking is impossible to follow. Chances are, you will dislike this teacher greatly, i suggest staying away.
Any paper or test taken took at least 3 weeks to get back. The class moved slowly, and he didn't seem experienced.
Requires a ridiculous amount of work.  He must think the world revives around him and his class.
Not too bad-class a little difficult. Take home final is really hard.

Wasn't as bad as other responses make him seem.  Hopefully you'll have some eager Poli Sci kids to fill in the awkward pauses after he asks questions.  He just Really expects All of the reading to be Done when you come in to class.

Very educational class! Paul does a great job of discussion and educating you on the topic. The test is difficult but if you go to class and take notes, you shouldn't have a problem. Warning- this class isn't for slackers! You do have to put some descent work into it but will learn a ton about world issues!
Boring Class.  Did not make the topic interesting at all

He has major short man syndrome. He was on a power trip all quarter and his grading was extremely unfair. He did not understand that the class is a GEC for seniors. Ruined my GPA for the quarter!!! He makes you write two 7 pages papers that it is near impossible to get an A on. Also he expects answers on tests to be veer bedim or you loose points.
paul is beyond unfair. there were no quizzes, it was a writing class, and the final was a real test. this class sucked and i would not recommend paul as a teacher. and mandatory attendance for a gec?
paul really knows his stuff - you just have to bear with him at times.  buth his lecturrs always have a larger point.  tough but fair grader with good style
He is all over the place in lecture, taking notes sucks. When it comes time for the tests he hand out some lame general guideline that's not even helpful. He hard on the grading.
not that interested in the class before taking it, but paul makes things extremely fun and interesting.  he is willing to help and a riot in class.  do yourself a favor and take this class!

Paul was my TA for 487. He's a nice guy and willing to help you but watch out for his grading. He's really really picky and tough. Even rough drafts are graded as if it were life and death. Watch out!
good TA, picky grader though. verrry laid back and willing to help.
I turned in two papers to Paul and I got a perfect score on both.  The man is cool and reasonable.
No Comments
Paul grades things too harshly.  He gives out F's on hard worked assignments.  If he wasn't good looking I would be pissed I had him as a T.A.

Marty totally made a hard subject doable. He really breaks everything down and works to make sure everyone understands. There were 4 hw assignments and he would check them before we turned them in to help us out and boost grades. He is a GREAT professor.

I took this during summer semester. The class was very condensed & I'm pretty sure the entire course was crammed into 7 weeks. Test are fairly difficult & his class notes stem completely from verbal lecture. 3 books w/ 3 papers, 2 difficult test, daily in class points, & oral presentation. No text book. Marty is very friendly & the class is doable.

Marty is very eager to help you understand course material. He provides many assignments for extra points. Homework is worth more than both exams which helps trust me. If he notices people struggling he will offer extra points to help out. Work with others in class on hw assignments and you'll be okay.

Very nice and funny. Makes all kinds of joke graphs and examples to help you learn things. Some confusing sections of the ppts, but I think it was his first time TAing for this course. Very eager to help, and always responds to emails super quickly for HW questions, even late at night before it was due.

Lectures a horribly boring and long. If you pay attention in class you'll realize that some of the things he says is flat out wrong. Tests are based off the book and outdated references that he assigns. He rambles on about things that really aren't related to the topics. Avoid him as a professor.

As long as you read the book you'll pass. Lectures have some information not covered in the book, so you should show up if getting an A is a top priority. He's an easy grader. The only thing I don't like about this professor is that he is unbearably boring and monotone. I literally play on my phone during half of class to keep myself awake.

He really doesn't teach you anything, he just rambles and rambles. There's no point in going to lecture except for the in-class quizzes. You have to read the book to do well on the exams but other than that, as long as you care somewhat about your grades you'll be just fine.

He really doesn't teach you anything, he just rambles and rambles. There's no point in going to lecture except for the in-class quizzes. You have to read the book to do well on the exams but other than that, as long as you care somewhat about your grades you'll be just fine.
I do not recommend taking soc 101 with Jenkins. Boring, boring, boring!

I would not recommend taking this class with Jenkins. His lectures do not really teach you much and he jumps around from slide to slide too much. He does not give you any notes/outlines so you have to attend class to know what's going on. In recitation, there are quizzes every week over articles that have nothing to do with class material.

Talks fast. Spends a few minutes on a slide so you can't copy it all down but yet on other slides he'll stand there and talk awhile. Ih he is using the wireless mic he walks back and forth in front the screen so it blocks part of the presentation

Poli. Soc looked so interesting to me that I passed up other classes (like 635) to take this horrible class. A lot of grad students. He rambles on&on & not in a good way;leaves you lost.i didn't understand anything & got A's. So that is completely disjointed. Most students thought the class was a waste of time.
Boring class. Go to sleep there are don't even bother to go to lecture. All you need to know is in his given lecture notes and in the text. Just a boring lecturer but it is so easy though.

He has the amazing ability to put even the most perseverant person to sleep. If you take his class, enjoy the nap! He gave us all the lecture notes too, but he didn't really follow them all the time. Tests are pretty much all definitions.
Jumps around way too much, cannot put all the material needed in one lecture, outlines didnt always follow the lecture

The lecture is so hard to get into as it is because of crowdiness and he just never seemed to me able to organize himself enough to give a good lecture...he jumped around to much and sometimes didn't make to much sense...he had trouble jamming everything into one lecture
He's an average teacher...but definitely better than most

Ridiculously easy.  I read the book and took notes in lecture and got an A.  Hands down easiest class I took this quarter.  He spent 15 min at the start of each lecture playing with his microphone and telling himself jokes.  Looks like Steve Martin from a distance.  Makes for a great nap and easy A.
No Comments
This guys laugh will drive you up a wall. He laughs at himself and hes the only one in the room who even thought it was remotely funny.

I did nothing in this class and got an A-, never read, just showed up to class.  He is all over the place with his notes, but its not to hard to learn if you have his lecture outlines.  tests are easy and he makes up for his bumbling w/bonus points
No Comments

This guy is a joke. He skips around in lecture and I am not entirely sure he even understands the concepts of sociology. He jumps around the notes a lot and he laughs at himself all the time. He isn't funny for that matter and his laugh is really annoying

I thought this class was easy, pay attention to what he highlights in his notes.  Read the book because some things on the tests he doesn't cover in lecture.  He usually didn't finish his lecture online, but I didn't find that to be a problem.

He means well and seems to be excited about what he does.  He's sometimes confusing and his tests aren't the easiest, you have to pay careful attention to statistics because they show up on the tests.
buying the note packet is a very good idea... but his notes are a little confusing

Intelligent guy but he is all over the road and so are his notes. Goes back and forth during his lectures its so confusing!  Always late and showed up to midterm with inadequate amt of tests, so gave extra points.  Use his absentmindness to your advantage

She gives reviews for exams but they're way too long for the short multiple choice exams that she gives so basically I studied everything in the lectures for nothing because I still didn't do well on exams. And there are so many random readings you have to know for the exams too that it's impossible to know what will actually be on the exam. Dumb

Attending class is necessary because of the random attendance checks and she does not post her notes online. Otherwise she is a great teacher and an easy grader.  You can tell that she is passionate about her subject and wants her students to do well.

Classes were very organized and productive.  They didn't feel like a waste of time, and she really stressed attending the classes as she had unannounced attendance checks.  Papers were graded pretty easy, but the two multiple choice exams I thought were difficult

She is a great rural sociology teacher. Very easy to get along with and genuinely cares about her students and their success. The book is not used in class, but can be helpful for studying. As long as you show up and take notes, you will get an A in this class with ease. She is very fun and easy going for the most part
She is very easy!  You go to class and take the notes and there is no way you will not get an A!  There are attendance checks worth 20 points, so it is your best interest to go to class!
One of the worst lecturers at OSU.

Worst professor I've had at Ohio State; sad to believe they hired her. She is a terrible communicator: of in class procedures, project requirements, and work expectations. She expects students to read her mind and laughs at students when they can't. She's demeaning, unclear, and blatantly confused about what makes a quality educator.

The material is interesting, but she's very confusing as to what she expects from you and grades you tough based on her unclear expectations. I wouldn't recommend her, but if you do take a class with her, be sure to ask a lot of questions regarding grades and assignments. She does assign a lot of reading, though.

All of her lectures seemed like a bunch of jumbled words- the things she said in class rarely ever made sense. It often seemed like she was trying to "sound smart", but was just nonsensically speaking. Half of her lectures were just her asking rhetorical questions. The broad topics of the class are interesting, but she made the information so dry.

Worst class I've ever taken. Everyone in class told me it was the most difficult sociology class of 5-6 they had taken previously. You read a LOT in short periods of time and she doesn't confirm understanding before making things complex. Not willing to meet with me outside of office hours that conflicted with another class. Had to drop it for a W.

Matt is a fantastic teacher. I am not particularly interesting in the subject, but he made Sociology enjoyable. His enthusiasm and dedication are inspiring. I would recommend taking Soc 1100 or any other class with Matt. But, beware, there is a lot of writing involved.

I loved this class! Took as a GE credit and ended up picking up a minor in Soc. He was helpful, conversational, the exams were completely essay based and he graded very fair. I loved having him and I'm sad to see the semester end! One of my favorite lecturers at OSU. He definitely cares about all of his students. Took the time to know my name.

Matt is an amazing teacher and always finds a way to present global problems in an interesting way.  There is a decent amount of work, but it's not difficult if you go to class regularly.   But he's a energetic and passionate lecturer who will keep your attention.  Also, Matt's pretty hot!

I took this as a summer semester. 3 papers based off supplied articles and 3 take home essay exams. He's a very good teacher and puts on a good class. Papers and tests are easy as long as you know the material. I would definitely recommend taking this class with Matt.

I absolutely loved Matt. He was not only super passionate about what he was teaching, but he also was genuinely interested in what students had to say. I learned a lot in his class and actually ENJOYED attending it. The midterms are essay format but as long as you put some thought into it, he'll respect your writing style and give you an A.

Matt is one of the best teachers I've had at OSU. He is incredibly knowledgeable, and delineates global problems in a fascinating manner. He's also really cool and I genuinely learned a ton from his class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I found myself attending anyway (this is saying alot). I highly recommend him and his course.

I took this class as a Gen Ed, but it ended up being my favorite class of my spring semester! Tests were not super hard, but they were completely essay based. Also, had to write four short reaction papers to articles assigned. Matt is also super attractive, which helped me to pay attention in class :) You can also tell he genuinely enjoys teaching!

Class isn't mandatory. she takes attendance for extra credit at the end of the semester. There are films for credit also. Quizzes are okay. Tests are fairly tough. The essay portions are hard despite her giving the essays in advance. She just expects a ton of details. She is also probably a communist. Not a big deal, just know she's biased.

Attendance will make or break your grade so try to go to every class. Group assignment every week. Lecture is super super boring so bring cpu or something to keep your attention. She loves ALOT of details so with any assignment just write/type everything you can find about the topic/question. Exams are short answers no matching/multiple choice

Grading is ridiculous. You always need to explain more, and you'll lose points on essays for things she doesn't tell you to include.  And when she throws out 'bad' exam questions, she only gives partial credit to the answer she deems second best. No one in our class can get an A...and I haven't gotten lower than a B on anything all semester. AVOID.

Way too much busy work for a class that should be easy. The content is not hard but she is a hard grader and there are way too many unnecessary assignments in this course. Especially have a big research paper due a week before finals week and making us give a presentation on it on top of submitting a powerpoint to her.

This class was impossible. I went to her office hours so many times and still ended up with B's on all exams and papers (so far). Even if you describe eveything word for word from the book you will stil get a B. I definitely do NOT recommend taking 2 of her classes in one semester (medical sociology and health disparities together).

A ton of work that is graded harshly. Assignments are redundant, and her essay exam questions are unclear and confusing, along with the assignments in the syllabus. It's possible to get an A if you regurgitate everything she says in class, but you'll spend so much time reading and doing extra work because of the way she sets up assignments.

She definitely knows the material, and her lectures are clear; the problem is, while you learn a lot in the class, it doesn't match up with the tests.  Her essay instructions are absolutely horrid.  She's kind of a niche taste (she's funny, but it takes a while to come out), but I have come to like her as a prof.

Be detailed and make clear points on your essays and you'll get a good grade. Quizzes are multiple choice and she makes them tricky, but throws out ones that everyone did bad on. Theres a weekly group project that's easy and the same as whats on the exam. Go to class only on those days, read the book, and you'll get an A.

Extremely harsh grader. On the exams, make sure you put a TON of details about everything you talk about or else you'll get a 50%. I would highly recommend not taking a class if you're hoping for an easy A.

Very good professor who knows her stuff. There is a written assignment every week and all the essays on the essay exams are taken from these prompts. If you are able to memorize your responses(and as long as she gave you full credit for those) youll get an A. There is a big group project that isnt as nearly scary as it initially seems.

One of the most interesting classes I've taken at OSU! I would definitely recommend her! Just study the key terms, know the essays, and take your time on the online quizzes and you're sure to get a good grade! She's also hilarious!

Such an intelligent, helpful, and awesome professor. Easy to talk to in class & in office hours. I've had her in two classes and you have to be willing to put in the work and effort in her classes. It's not a easy A but as long as you read all the material you can get a good grade. She likes to call on people in class so be ready.

Honestly....stay away. Requires a page summary of the assigned readings every class and she actually grades them pretty tough. Also 3 papers and 3 midterms, i dont think she realizes that its an undergraduate level class.

I really liked her. She is very passionate and keeps your attention throughout the lecture. If you are looking for an easy class then your looking in the wrong place. She requires a 250 word essay every class on the assigned readings and 3 other term papers AND 3 exams all in the span of 10 weeks. A little overkill.

Took her for intro to sociology, class was only boring cause I wasn't interested in the subject and my class was almost two hours long. But she is extremely nice and good teacher. Easy points as long as you just do it. Online quizzes right from the book and she gives you study guides and drops like every low score per category. I would suggest her.

Attendance was not a percentage of the class grade. She is EXTREMELY organized, both in class and with online material. Weekly online quizzes straight from books, 4 three page essays over quarter based off books. Very comprehensive exam study guides. If you stay on top of the readings and are a good writer, it's an easy A. No attendance necessary.

weekly online quizes are kind of ridiculous. Asks very specific questions from textbooks and have to search for the answer.  she tells you exactly what will be on the midterm so its not terrible, but she is a hard grader.  She's a decent teacher, but basically just tests you on the book, pointless to go to class if she didn't take attendance.

She's truly one of the good ones. As she says on the first day, her mission is to be a good instructor. She is an adjunct so she doesn't do research -- her job is to be a good sociology teacher! And she is really great. I just think she could rely on the text definitions a little more and speak from her vast experience and knowledge.
Very knowledgable, makes class interesting.  Very helpful and understanding.

Weekly quizzes on readings, one hour long with 25 questions or so. Like trying to find a needle in a haystack. May have to read over four or five paragraphs to find one answer. Apparently the books know everything about inequality and social stratification, that's what the lecture about. Alot of small assignments, is not an easy class by any means.

I dislike complaining in general but it's important to get my feelings off my chest. First of all, if you disagree with him do not let him know because he will grade you harder! Second, if the class you're apart of rubs him the wrong way again he will grade very rough. I just didnt like most of what he had to say and or how emotional his grading is
Great teacher, as long as you go to class and pay attention will do great on test! He is an amazing Teacher and really knows what he is talking about. Makes class interesting and fun to go to!
He is bad but can be funny. I actually laughed at his jokes but he made my GPA go down! Very hard grader and when he is mad he makes things harder.

Easy class in the begining but then he turns it up. we had a few students i guess made him made becasue he grade very very harshly! ok teacher but i am upset with him because i put all this effort into his class and it wasnt enough
Very interesting class. Professor is very versed on subjects, well prepared. Very funny, and keeps class interactive.

He is alsome I was grateful to have him as my last teacher at osu. He cares about His students and knows what he is talking about. He also makes jokes from time to time that are normally pretty funny. I would so recommend him to everyone!

Best instructor I've had at OSU and he's only a PHD student! Genuinely cares about EDUCATING his students, which I think is wonderful considering the subject. I wish every class I had were taught by him because he makes it so enjoyable with humor and open discussion. He is a bit of a tough grader, but that doesn't take away from how amazing he is.
very funny and entertaining. makes the subject fun
Absolutly amazing! I'll miss him terribly!

Freakin amazing! i seriously couldn't wait to go to class every day. Lectures were fun and entertaining and he genuinely cares for his students. He's funny as hell and I'm devastated i only have him for one quarter. love him and his class!

Leigh is amazing, take whatever class of his that you possibly can. Soc 605 (Sociology of Sexuality) was a lot of work but completely worth it. Best instructor and class I've ever had! (And I'm not even a Soc Major)

LOVED going to class... As long as you keep up with the readings and work, it's not bad. He knows what he's talking about, and makes you want to learn. Such a fun teacher, who was SO helpful. Would recommend this class to anyone who needed it, or just wanted a fun class :)
Great teacher.Class went by really fast.Slightly hard on the grading but other than that I definately recommend him.  I looked forward to going to class!

Just a great guy in general. If you can, take the night class if its offered. He knew all of our names and made it one of those classes where you dont feel stupid contributing a little. I actually looked forward to going to class because it wasn't boring at all and he is just a funny guy. He is the best teacher ive had here hands down.
Wonderful guy, hilarious, organized, clear and approachable. Meant to teach! If only OSU had more like him.
TAKE HIM!! He is so funny and makes a class that you will actually want to attend! He is a little strict on the grading, but he is a great guy and professor!
Great teacher, makes sitting in a chair for 2 hours easy.  Would always take the time to revise your essays and make sure you understood the concept.  Would recommend to anyone.
i LOVED this class!
Very funny guy. Willing to help students out when they need it. Kind of a harsh grader, but I definitely recommend him to anyone taking Soc 101.

alot of work but the class is fun and prof is really funny. prof was helpful and easy to talk to. i liked this class and heard that soc 605 isnt as good with other profs so make sure you get leigh fine.
