Best class at OSU. Teach is funny and approachable. No book, just articles to read. Two papers, 2 essay exams (but you know all the prompts a week in advance) and 1 group presentation (pass/fail=easy). You will laugh alot, learn alot, and will prob end up recommending this teach & class to all your friends!
SUCH a great passion for teaching! Took her Spring 2014. She's such a dedicated professor, we need more like that! Highly recommend her!

Very good professor. A little full of herself at times but she really does care about her students and want them to learn. She curves the test grades and the bulk of the grade is based on the final project.

What a GREAT teacher! She has amazing dreadlocks and a lovely personality. She is very organized and gives extra credit! I took her winter class and it influenced me to change my major to Sociology. TAKE THE CLASS!

Dr. Southgate is now teaching at Los Angeles Valley College. I took her for the winter '11 semester and her class was so interesting that it had me thinking of changing majors. She gives extra credit but you won't need it if you pay attention in class and do the observations. Very cool and humane; best professor I've had so far. She makes class fun
An image of what ever teacher should be
Hard assignments
Very open minded and able to relate to and understand different perspectives. Darby has the ability to have a laid back atmosphere, but yet still be intense in terms of topics and conversation.

Perfect instructor. 1)Interesting material that she applies to our lives, 2) instructor that REALLY wants to you to succeed and grow, 3) instructor that LOVES to teach and values your input on how the class is going, 4)instructor who will do just about anything to help you get an A - extra help, tons of extra credit, attendence, etc. MUST TAKE!

AMAZING teacher...i really enjoyed everything that we had to read for the class...there is a lot of reading but its not bad at all because its actually interesting material.  Easy to get an A because if you are interested in doing extra credit papers she is more than happy to offer you the opportunity if you actually go to class.  Strongly suggest!
Darby is by far my fav. teacher at OSU. She love to teach. She is so helpful and will go out of her way to help you even when it doesn't have to do with her specific class. She is amazing.

I have not had a class with Darby. However, she has been a mentor to me for quite awhile. She is one of the most helpful profs as long as you show the desire to improve yourself. She is genuine and knowledgeable about many subjects and can be an assest to your educational experience!! ~K~
Great class - Southgate is an enthusiastic teacher who communicates her passion for her subject.

She's my favorite teacher, which is very rare in college, who actually cares what kind of grade you get! She wants to help you to earn a good grade as long as you do your work and try hard in her class.
I LOVE THIS TEACHER, SHE IS THE BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD 100% THE BEST TEACHER I AM AN INTERNATIONAL STUDENT AND I LOVE DERBY SHE IS THE BEST OF THE BEST

red suit and dreds! she makes her students feel like they are worth her time. she goes above and beyond to help out. fair, lenient and tolerant, but not that easy (though you always have a second chance with her). go to class, do your work. you'll see that she is worth your time as well.
Darby is a great teacher.  As long as you do your part (read and discuss in class) she will do everything she can to help you out.  Her Soc 463 class is the best class I have had at OSU.

Darby is an awesome prof! She is the most understanding teacher I've ever had. She is fair and doesn't try to trick you on exams. She knows her stuff though! Keep up with readings (you can slack a little though!) and you will do great.

Darby was a very cool teacher.  The only problem was that she was extremely unclear about what she wanted from us on the midterm essay questions.  She also got *really* pissed, started yelling and took it personally when a lot of the class skipped and went to the Chris Rock comedy show instead.

Darby was so cool, she's 40ish and has dreds! Very helpful and gives some extra credit. Loves politics and music. I would take another class from her in a heart beat! Very laid back and understandible. Buy the books and do the readings = at least a B.

Always seems distracted. Often is late to class and always cancelling. You can tell she's on tenure. Absent minded. She knows a lot about the material obviously but I doubt she knew any of our names or cared. Doesn't take attendance, but if you're absent on a class participation day you'll lose points.

Dr Gray is my favorite professor at OSU! Her classes are always interesting since she has had a ton of first hand experience in the criminology field. She isn't out to make things difficult either, I've taken 3 classes with her so far and they've all been really laid back and she really understands what it's like to be a college student.
Awesome prof.  super interesting, clear and concise, easy to understand assignments.  and total hotty.

Fantastic professor! Her class is extremely interesting and she does a really good job presenting the material. She's concise and blunt, she really doesn't go off on many tangents, and if she does they relate to the material being covered.

I've taken more than 5 upper level classes with Dr. Gray and I think she's phenomenal. She's your typical get out early, easy grading, movie showing professor that most college students can appreciate-plus attendance isn't mandatory. If you know how to read and you put in some effort before exams, you'll get an A. Good material, good classes.

I can't comment on how she teaches criminology-related courses, but I had a gender/sexuality course, and was dismayed by the lipservice paid to socialization and everything else attributed to genetics/evolution/biology. This was a soc class, not a biological determinism class. Content bordered on stereotypical. "Easy" class, but

For a female criminologist, she's really insensitive to potentially "triggery" films she may show in class - y'know, films about sexual assault that are very dramatized and may be upsetting to survivors of assault. She gave no warning before showing one such film. Not a very interesting lecturer either.
Got out of class early, advance notice on pop quizzes and assignments. Really easy!

She was really fun and nice. I learned a lot but the class wasn't hard, which was nice. The tests were multiple choice and there was one research paper. She was able to make the class interesting and engaging for us and I would take another class with her.
Dr. Gray is an amazing professor! She is funny, smart and really hot. I learned a lot in her class, and I would take another one with her in a heartbeat.
She's pretty good at what she does but clearly doesn't want to be there. It's good sometimes because she likes to cancel class or le the class go early if it's really good weather outside.

Dr. Gray is very nice and interesting to listen to, even if you don't love Criminology. She doesn't require attendance but there are in-class assignments you need to be here for. Tests aren't bad if you go to class, she always tells you what is on it beforehand. If you go to class on a regular basis there is no reason you should get an A.

My last class ever at OSU and she is the most laid back teacher I have ever had, also pretty good looking. No attdnc.required but 5 random in class assignments worth 100 point total that are easy. Tests are quite a bit ridic. though, drifted away from the review, The class averaged a 74% on the midterm, I mean come on, that is flat-out ridiculous.

This is my second time taking a course with Dr. Gray. She is a very bright woman and always provides a great and entertaining lecture.  She?s very cool and down to earth. Her tests are very clear and straightforward.
Very laid-back... Very professional yet knows how to have a great discussion and take the edge off of class. Attendance is not mandatory but she does give in-class exercises for easy points!

Dr. Gray was extremely nice and cordial. On the downside, the entire class was strictly about 'theory', which makes studying for such tests a monumental challenge. However, she did offer extra credit ( full points given) and simple in class exercises for points.  If you can manage this style, Dr. Gray is worth a try.
Dr. Gray is one of the best professors at OSU and knows her stuff. She is extremely helpful and easy going. I would definitely take another class with her in the near future.

Amazing professor.  This is my second time with her, and I love her.  VERY friendly, VERY helpful (if you even need help), and VERY fun!  2 exams--multiple choice and short essay; a few in class excercises for easy points; and an 8-10 page paper on whatever you want to write about! I'll be taking Dr. Gray for the third time next year!

She was great! Attendance wasn't mandatory and really you can get by without going but come on! The class was a sex class! It was awesome! I highly recommend going on the "field trip." Let's just say, Prof Gray knows how to have a good time.
This class is a waste of time. The professor has no idea what she's talking about.

This class is ridiculous, apparently the answer for everything is evolution. She claims that she will present both sides of a debate, but we talk about evolution the whole time and then she mentions everything else as an afterthought. if you are a sociology major or know anything about sociology, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

Very interesting class.  2 all-multiple choice exams and a few points for a few in-class activities.  ***NEW*** Just this quarter, she added a (minimum) 12 page paper since it is a 600-level class.  She did not used to have this, and it makes the class a lot tougher if you are not a good paper writer like me.  However, reading and exams are easy.

This was a great class!  Just go to lectures, take notes, and read the course packet.  She doesn't try to trick you.  Test are very straight forward although you do need to memorize some obscure percentages and age ranges.  Focus in on any numbers in the readings and you'll do great!
Great class, explained everything well.  Multiple choice midterm and final.  Gave easy points for showing up too.  Great upper level Soc. class to take.  I will be taking her Soc. 635 class.

Classes are unorganized and a lot of time is spent watching her figure out how to turn on lights and work the computer. Readings are good and way more informative than lecture.  As a member of the GLBT community I actually found some of her lectures offensive. If you are looking for a sexuality class based on fact and not opinion take psych 333.02.
Amazing class and awesome professor

This was an awesome class for people who actually GO to class. The tests were not easy, but were fair if you watched the movies in class and were there for the guest speakers. Readings were easy and she always explained everything well. She gave a lot of free points just for showing up. Liked this class so much I am taking 635 this quarter.
No Comments

I loved this class. She is an excellent professor. She doesn't lecture all the time like most instructors. We watched many interesting movies and had a few guest speakers. She's not big on text books, she assigns articles. She's cool and laid back, and has reasonable expectations from her students. I highly recommend her class!!

To the students that did not like her they probably never went to class.  Dr. Gray is one of the best teachers on this campus.  Her teaching style is unique to her.  In Soc 635 all we did was watch movies and a group project, got an A. In Soc 605 we talked more I got a B.  I recommend these two classes to everyone!

I have never enjoyed going to class so much in my life! Even on days when I skipped all my other classes, I looked forward to going to Dr. Gray's class. The readings were even interesting. Highly reccomended!!!

She was a very nice teacher, but completely unorganized!  Her lectures were very hard to follow, and she would tell you a bunch of information and then say, after you wrote it all down, that you didn't need to know it!  The subject matter was very interesting however, and you will get a good grade in the class if you go.

Ok, so we watched a lot of movies. We loafed all quarter then she dumps two effing 5 page papers on us for our final in the last week of the quarter. I don't object to the papers just the timing. Like we don't have enough to do for finals week. The woman is very unorganized and aribitrary.didn't even have proper audio equip for group projects!chaos
No Comments
No Comments

THis is the best class in the world. If you dont mind watching movies. having discussions about life, laughing, joking, and eating during movie days, take this class. Its like a dream class. Its been 3 days since registration and her class is almost full of 100 people
Who knew the explanation to everything sexual is biological? Do not take this course if you actually want to learn anything worthwhile
This class is great. Dr. gray allows you to do your own problem solving. She is funny, fun and interesting. Her class is continously waitlisted.

Great Class. I highly recommed Dr.Gray. She's there to help you learn and not play games. She has a very lively class room and makes class fun. You actually enjoy going to class! Don't be fooled by her easy going manner though she does expect you to perfom and won't put up with BS excuses. Class will be fun. And she grades very fairly1

Lauren is a very easy going, understanding professor who truly cares about her student performance. She is very accommodating and makes the lecture/material easier to learn about with real world examples (lots of Simpsons and The Office examples). If you follow her powerpoint and put in some studying, its extremely easy to get an A.

Lauren is probably the best professor I have ever seen.  This material would have been complex and, honestly, boring except we had her!  There is no textbook for this class but there are readings.  She's very reasonable as far as the course load and the exams are manageable if you took notes.

Lauren is so awesome. We do not need to write any papers in her class! She manages to make the whole class understand the point of the lecture. She will give hints for exams and more likely to tell you what will be in the exam if you focus enough. All exams are online and the windows are open from 12 am to 12 pm. Oh, Lauren's jokes are hilarious!

Dr. Sri was my favorite professor at OSU so far. She's absolutely hilarious and she always encourages group discussion. Exams are straight forward. She gives so much extra credit. Just make sure not to miss the group activities she has during lectures

She is very rude and hard headed. She will tell you the midterms will be only multiple choice but then when you get into the test you will be surprised to see that there are only 50% multi choice and then 50% essay response questions.
Full of humor and seems to make the course easy. Focuses on application of the ideas. Easy class as long as you put time and effort into understanding the concepts.

I don't think she actually has any idea what she is talking about. Her grading is awful and multiple choice questions are poorly worded and contradict her own power points. Tests straight from power point. Reading the text is a waste of time. Attendance isn't mandatory but she does unnecessary pop quizzes and activities.

Sri is a great person in terms of personality. Unfortunately, the class was kind of boring. She attempts to have students participate, but there is usually a lot of silence. The class, papers, and exams are extremely simple and the only reason to go to class is that she has blanks in her slides. She gives a good amount of extra credit.

She's laid back and tries to get class discussions going but she doesn't phrase her questions well so it can be a struggle. Assignments and papers were all super easy, lectures can get boring sometimes but she lets us out on time. Tries to relate what we are talking about to current events which is cool.

Took her Sociology of Gender class. The course was pretty easy, you just have to study for the exams. Sometimes she does surprise quizzes in class, but sometimes she tells you beforehand when she'll give them. You also do one presentation during the semester which isn't difficult. Discussions are interesting sometimes. I would choose her again.
Sri is charming and very helpful. The articles we had to read were interesting and much better than some outdated textbook.
I thought Sri was a good teacher. She kept class discussions going pretty well. I found her very approachable, too.

I liked her. She was very approachable which I think extremely important in professors.While she would get off topic occasionally, it kept class interesting, and I didn't find her grading unfair as many others have said. I always looked forward to her class.
Very boring lecture. Class goes the full time but only about 20 minutes of each class is material you need to know.

She was a nice person, but the class was boring. We always ran out of time in lecture - she got side tracked and talk about important things. She posted the power points on carmen, but you had to come to class to fill in the blanks. She was an inconsistent grader - sometimes being generous/fair other times taking points off for nothing.
graded way too hard... i hated those usless in class assignments.

Worst TA ive ever had. She graded these easy in class assignments way too strictly. I got A's on all 3 exams but was brought down to a B+ because of her terrible grading, and it wasn't just me, she hardly gave anyone in the class a decent grade. As far as recitation, she never seemed to understand the material and talked on her cell phone in class.
No Comments

Eye-opening look into the often misunderstood and greatly under studied world of Criminal Justice.  I will take every class Dr. Rhine teaches that I can.  If you're serious about The Law and the Criminal Justice System, he is a professor you need to learn from.

Professor Rhine was one of my favorite professors. He truly cares and as he lectures, you can sense that. He welcomes you to his office and is willing to go over any material. I personally did terrible on the exams but that's because I am a bad test taker. He has a lot of knowledge and work experience in the Criminal Justice Systems!

I thought Dr. Rhine did a great job teaching this course. Although if you're not used to taking notes without a powerpoint you may want a different instructor. You just have to be super focused the whole lecture and make sure you write down everything he says.

I would recommend the class to anyone that is a crim or soc major or interested in the justice system. Professor Rhine definitely knows his stuff. Be prepared to take a lot of notes and you'll do just fine in class. If you get distracted easily or are a slow note taker, this class is probably not for you.
He's awesome, if you attend class and take notes you will do fine, probably one of the better classes I have taken at OSU, he really knows his stuff

Dr. Rhine's penology class was very insightful. I am a criminology major and taking his class gave my degree an extra pop. True, he doesn't provide powerpoints, but taking notes by hand helped me remember the material tremendously. His tests are cake if you study your notes. He requires students to read 5 textbooks. I highly recommend Dr. Rhine

I would reccomend taking this class from anyone else if possible. Lectures are scattered, there are no powerpoint notes, you just have to keep from getting distracted. The notes are almost never correlated to the books. Expects everyone to read all four textbooks within the quarter's time for tests. He also repeats EVERYTHING about 5 or 6 times.

Absolutely loved this class! To say Dr Rhine is knowledgeable about course material is an understatement! Two visits to area prisons was extremely useful! Dr Rhine goes above and beyond to help his students. I loved his passion for teaching!
this was a good class, be prepared to write a lot during lecture. he is very knowledgable and very interested in making sure we understood the concepts.

You would have to be an idiot to not get an A in this class. This guy has such a general interest in what he does, and he thinks of ways to make things interesting. Seriously, the quizzes are freaking multiple choice, T/F, and matching. Come on. The class was great too. We had tours of local jails, which was sweet. Take this class.

Not helpful when it comes to actual course. Rambles for lecture (no powerpoint or overhead notes), notes rarely relate to book, and he expects you to know EVERYTHING in book(s) AND notes. Quiz and test questions are tricky (many get thrown out). I Would recommend another instructor if at all possible. If not, eh...

Mr. Vaughn is by far the best professor I've ever had. The way he organizes his lectures and information is easy to understand & very interesting. His exams involve only 2 or 3 short essays. He is very clear what he expects from students & is very helpful. He's caring, personable, friendly, and very funny, which makes lectures fun.

If you do the work, youll have an A. Theres 16 reading summaries on articles ranging 35-55 pgs, a 308 page book summary, and 2-question essay exams based off of reading assignments, so read thoroughly and know EVERY detail. Most busy work I've ever had. Professor is a good guy, class structure sucks. Not worth the effort if you don't need the class

Absolute great caring guy and a very cool teacher as well. Class discussions were always interesting. Exams were very reasonable. Pretty flexible guy. Not only did I learn a-lot of things, I also enjoyed the class as a whole. Definitely recommend everybody to take his class.

I've never enjoyed a class more than this one with Jon. He's very knowledgeable about the subject matter, cares greatly about each student, encourages discussion, and is downright hilarious to boot. His tests are fair, & through readings I was prepared for everything. One of the few classes I've looked forward to going to every day. TAKE THIS CLASS

He can't teach - period.  His notes are disorganized and his tests are unfair.  When I went to office hours to talk about my midterm, he couldn't tell me why I missed the points BECAUSE HE DIDN'T KNOW! You would think that he would since he graded the tests.  If you want your GPA to free fall, take his class, otherwise avoid at all costs.

He was an awesome professor! Thought provoking conversation/debate rather than straight lecture. Tons of readings and reading summaries to do each class which are a pain, but made studying for the exams easy. Lots of padding points. People who complained obviously didn't do the readings/summaries. Lots of work, but worth it! Cheap textbook!

Every engineering student should take Sociology 464. Why? This class provides balanced, comprehensive, and thought-provoking perspectives on work and employment to which most people have not been exposed. If you'll ever manage people or be managed, the tools from this class are essential to have. The class isn't easy, but it's worth it.

Jon is a great teacher!  He is passionate about what he teaches, and really brings about some thought-provoking points.His enthusiasm is contagious.  I thought I'd hate this class, but was pleasantly surprised! Take this class.Jon will make you think.He's definitely a fair grader, and is available to discuss the material so you can get a good grade

Had the hardest time understanding the message he was trying to get across each lecture.  Would not recommend taking one of his classes.  Often distracted and spoke to students during exams. Had a hard time deciding what to study for the test because the material he provided was so spread out and random
Wow.  Jon is a very good teacher.  I highly recommend his class.  His lesson plan is smooth and very thought-provoking.  By the end of the quarter you're so shocked, it's humbling.

John is a very wonderful TA. He cares each student, so he is always laid back. He uses his own theory of work, employment sociology, so he creates his own reading for class. That's the way for him to minimize cost of textbook. After the quarter, or even after graduate from uni, you will remember what you learned from him as a member of society.

AMAZING T.A. EASIEST CLASS I HAVE EVER HAD!!! JON IS A HILARIOUS GUY AND MAKES RECITATION GO REALLY FAST. EASY/FAIR GRADER. REALLY HELPS CLEAR UP CONFUSION. SO LAID BACK ITS AMAZING. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND TAKE HIS CLASS!!!
he is an ok teacher when he stays on topic. When he gets on a rant watch out or better yet just leave the class becase he will ruin your day with his depressing outlook.
He is great! I would always go see him during his office hours and he was always so helpful! He would edit my papers and give lots of helpful feedbacks! Best TA ever!

Agreed- no one beats him. You'll lose out if you go w/ anyone else. He's the coolest, most helpful, most dedicated,& most sincere T.A. @ OSU.                                                         I've been disappointed w/ every T.A. I've had since- Jonathan Vaughn truly sets the bar.
The best T.A. ever!!!!!
You do need to go to lecture and take notes, but the class is very interesting and not too hard. Prof Reczek is nice and pretty personable.

This class was engaging and interesting, and Dr. Reczek is very accessible and passionate about sociology. Her grading is extremely fair, and she created a fun classroom atmosphere and listened to students.  She'll push you to expand on your answers, but she's receptive to different perspectives.

If you ever need clarification, will spend as much time as you need to understand the concept. It's theory, so it can be dense and boring to some (I love theory), but he tries to make it interesting with in class activities every once in awhile.  Tests are super easy and there are three short papers that help if you aren't a good test taker.

This class was by far my favorite this semester. I am so glad I decided to take it. I've learned so many useful and interesting things throughout the semester, and Tom is an EXCELLENT and very helpful professor. I would say he is a fair grader. The class is not exactly hard, but effort is required.

Awesome professor!  I learned a great deal from Tom, and all the information is extremely useful to know. Wait to read the articles until you get the review, it tells you exactly what to read. I suggest using a laptop in class for notes, they tend to be long and he goes kinda fast. I am NO Sociology major, but I studied hard and got an A. Good Luck

Everything that the Soc 101 students said was right - Tom is a hard and slow grader. He is, though, also extremely helpful - so helpful that sometimes he explains things to much and makes them more ambiguous. I enjoyed the class immensely, though, and learned a great deal. Anyone who calls Kim Jong Il "totally awesome" makes me laugh any day.

Okay, you can tell he tries hard, but he DEFINITELY graded papers, quizzes, and exams wayyy to hard. If the textbook is clearer than your teacher, that stinks. He takes FOREVER to grade, too, and his midterm and final were mostly written and took a full hour and 48 minutes.
He is an okay teacher. He teaches the material well and has good class discussions. Many people in my class thought he graded too hard.
Tom was a great TA, if there was something I didn't understand he would review it until I did.  He is the only reason I got an A in this class. Very helpful with everything. Highly recommend him.

Very cool TA and down to earth guy. Will explain everything twice if need be and is very helpful when you email him. He also emails reminders about tests and quizzes coming up. Highly recommend this TA.

Took this as a summer semester. Daily homework assignments that take about 30-45 minutes based on the required reading which usually is 10-20 pages. 2 papers based off theorist and a social issue. No exams or quizzes. His syllabi looks scarey but the class really isn't. Do the work and you'll get an easy A. I highly recommend this class with James.

This man is a sociological fountain that everyone should drink from. He is great with the material and also a very inviting person. He's a genuinely nice guy and you won't ever have problems getting help. He makes very fun and interactive ways for students to get involved with the sociology concepts. Exams and quizzes are based on short readings.

He will change the way you see society!!! You will enter not knowing and leave as a sociologist. One of my best teachers ever. He makes the class extremely interesting and I loved the materials/documentaries that he used!
He is AMAZING! Made Sociology may favorite class and is the best of the best at OSU
Helpful professor. Predictable but not always easy to understand, sometimes speaks over his students heads. He cares. Has a hot ass.
Carlson loves what hes teaching, he's easygoing, and the material is interesting. Go to class and do all the work required; you'll get an A
Easy going, fair, great teacher
great professor! He made the material very clear and it was actually interesting class. His examples made it easy to understand the material and the papers were helpful. Great class and teacher!

Really great professor. Class is very interesting considering it a major requirement.  In class activities/papers pertain really well to what he is teaching about.  Midterm and final are very fair, he tells you exactly what to expect.  I have no complaints about him.  Great guy.

I absolutely loved this class. I was dreading it at the beginning of the quarter but Dan made the class fun and interesting. He also gave us very comprehensive study guides and made it fairly easy to pick out what questions he was going to use as essay questions on the exam
epic! was supposed to be a very dry class, but Dan does excellent job

AWESOME professor. I thought this class would be dreadful and boring since it's required but it was awesome. He's super clear about all material and he's extremely helpful telling you what will be on exams and what you should focus on for your paper. Awesome guy I would take other classes with him and I STRONGLY recommend.
Very good instructor. He really packs a lot into each class, but he's really good at stressing what will and what won't be on the exams. I'd take other classes with him.

Dan was awesome!  Highly reccomend him if you have to take the class. He made the material interesting and tests were straightforward as long as you studied the study guide. Papers were graded fairly and he was willing to provide tips if you asked. Only one tip: don't bother to buy the textbook
He tries to make things fun. You have to study for this class no lie. It's tougher then it seems.

Very boring theory class, but nevertheless required for sociology minors and criminology majors. Dr.Carlson does a great job of making the class as interesting as it can be, and most times entertaining. It's not an easy class, but with studying and attending the lectures it's not hard to get an A. Highly recommended to anyone taking this class!

This is a great teacher! The information is a little boring (but who like theory?) but he makes it an enjoyable class to attend! He's really funny, and as long as you go to lecture, you'll do fine on the tests!

Taking 488 is required, but taking him is not, and I wouldnt! He is so boring, his tests are hard, and his papers are even harder! He is such a strict grader, I would write everything he asked for, went to class every time, and yet still got a C- in the class!! Urgh, I am not a C- student!

Dan is great. He gives points for attendance, so its mandatory, but he makes class interesting and enjoyable. He's not a hard grader, but its not a cake class. The tests aren't bad and the papers are interesting. Take him!

Socio 488 is a core requirement for sociology majors/minors, I would recommend people to take another person's 488 class. Mid-term and final exam comprise of multiple-choice questions, short essay questions and matching questions. Exams were pretty fair, but he is a hard grader when it comes to writing papers. Lectures are extremely boring.

Very rude and arrogant.  He really likes to hear himself talk.  If you like taking classes where the prof stands at the front of the room and drones on for 2 hours then this is for you.  He is the worst professor I have ever had.  His grading is even worse than his teaching skills.  If you get on his bad side you will never see an A or B.

pretty cool guy- all the comments on here are right on. Take him in the summer because he doesn't assign a research papers. Didn't buy the book and just studied and wrote analysis off his notes (which are fill-in). I would take him again. Says "right" a lot. It's like a verbal tick.

If you want to learn about how people work, take this class. It's a great class to learn about society and how it all works. Very interesting class, great instructor, tests are straight forward, papers aren't too bad, and lecture is fun. He makes class enjoyable if you want to learn about people.
Wonderful teacher. He makes class interesting and fun!

Don't need to read any of the articles except the two you're signed up for; don't need to read the textbook if you attend class.  The study guides essentially tell you exactly what is on the test.  Funny guy, easy class.  I recommend.

Notes are fill in the blank but are very well layed out and helpful for exam prep.  Exam study guide is also very helpful.  Overall the class is not difficult as long as you put forth the effort.  I am very happy I took 488 with him, I dont think i could have found a better teacher for this class at OSU

Class was boring but you have to go because he takes attendance. Exams are straightforward, research paper was kinda rough, breaching experiment was easy and the reading responses are easy to get full credit on to. Put in time for the exams and you should be fine. Cool professor, you'll think he's a student the first day. Got an A.

tests are easy and VERY straightforward-questions are straight from the review sheet and even they're easier if you go to class everyday. class consists of 2 tests, research paper, 2 reading responses. dan gives lots of extra credit opportunities, fair grader, easy class, notes are long and boring though
Class is very boring. Notes are soooo long. Tests are not too bad. Carlson is alright.

Dan was a great prof. the tests were very straight-forward and if you attend class they're even easier. he also posts all his notes on carmen which is nice for review. he's also a fair grader and sexy!
No Comments

Dr. Wright is very knowledgeable and hard-working. She expects the same hard-work from her students, if you can provide for that, you will get a good grade. I did not read the text at all and just applied myself in writings and note-taking (since she does not provide her power points and tests are derived partially from them).

I really enjoyed her teaching method. she taught really in depth and used great examples and metaphors. was extremely helpful and responded back to emails quickly. if you dont wanna learn shes not the prof. for you other than i loved her class. her test was over the notes. bt u gotta be able to take notes fast.

Class wasn't as bad as I originally thought it to be. Some of the people on here make her out to be a bad professor, but its probably because they didn't do well in the class, and are just having to repeat it or barely slipped by. She makes numerous examples how the theory is applicable to modern life. The class was pretty good.

She's terrible. She's a criminologist and barely has an understanding of Sociological Theory. She just flat out said things in class that were INCORRECT. Really? A 400 level class and the teacher doesn't know what they are talking about. Yes, you get that here. Thank goodness the textbook was pretty good.

Horrible. Avoid if possible! I had to read the book word for word to study bc she doesnt put her slides online. The slides she gives during class are IMPOSSIBLE to read, the text is SO small and blends in with the background.  Also, she yells instead of talks. i had to take an advil after every class.

MS. WRIGHT IS ONE OF THE BEST INSTRUCTORS I'VE EVER HAD AT OSU.  Very enthused about teaching and held high expectations for her class  Assignments were graded and returned promptly and assistance was frequently offered to students.  She  keeps the course fun by inviting guest speakers and arranging field trips. STRONGLY RECOMMEND THIS INSTRUCTOR!

Be prepared to devote your entire quarter to this class as the essay is ridiculously long, will require at least a week to type, and isn't worth enough credit to justify it's length. Exams are easy since they're multiple choice and true/false, but she flies through the slides and doesn't give the opportunity the finish writing what is on them.

"Ms" Wright is the worst teacher I've ever had. She is very combative to students. She has a bad attitude and is extremely rude. I had high hopes for the class and wish I'd taken it with a competent instructor. She spent more time trying to get respect by demanding to be called Ms Wright instead of Valerie than she did teaching. STAY AWAY!!

The people who posted bad comments about this teacher either didnt go to class or weren't prepared for their presentations.  I loved this class! Ms. Wright comes off as being a hard teacher but over the quarter she softens up.  just have your things together and you will do great in her class. she offers a lot of extra credit too!!

If you're reading this and you still take her class then your FOOLISH. DO NOT TAKE HER. She doesn't teach, she dont check e-mails, and is VERY RUDE! If she runs behind she makes you learn on your own. She does not teach anything or add anything to class. I don't even think she will be a teacher for long because the class collectively failed her.

She is still on a kick from when she worked with offenders in the jail and treats us like we are one of them.  She gives us more work than SHE can handle, if that makes sense We had so much work to do this quarter that we did not have time to go over what material was really important for us to learn and know for the upcoming exam I could go on 4ev

stop whining about length of papers your in college earn your f&cking degree other than that she is very disrespctful to students, doesn't teach and still makes you learn it on your own her final consisted of 5 chapters and only lectured on one of them the rest you had to learn on your own she has no business teaching in a proffesional setting
HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE teacher.  Requires way too much work for a 500 level class.  Two papers, two tests, and a presentation....all worth only a few points each.

I have never had a teacher that required you to type a 6-8 or a 8-10 page paper with 1 inch margins at 10 point font.... that almost makes them 8-10 and 10-12 page papers.... she can be very rude to students during their group reports and seems to be more concerned in getting her voice heard on topics rather than teach the subject. Poor teacher..

This instructor was consistently arrogant, disrespectful, and uncaring. If you enjoy having your emails repeatedly ignored, being chastized for calling her "Valerie" instead of "Ms. Wright," and being generally bored, take a class.
No Comments

Horrible instructor. horrible multiple choice exams with vague questions. she seems not to care about the class, her power points were straight from the book. If there weren't group presentations you would get graded on, everyone should have skipped her class. do NOT take a class with her!!

Decent instructor. She seemed to not be insterested in the subjects in 511 so the class was not all that interesting. Goes far too fast through slides for 511. Relies too much on book. For 210 she seemed more interested and the class was much better.

its only the third week of classe and i already don't have a good impression of this instructor ( PhD student.) she never sent in a book order to any of the bookstores and expected us to go on a search for it. we'll see how the quarter goes, but i wouldn't recomnend her unless you have no other option.

The class had potential to be very interesting, but it was not. She flys through slides and expects students to simply get all information from the book. Exams are not easy, although they are multiple choice.

This class seemed like a lot of review of previous Soc classes, until test time came and the test was all multiple choice and very vague questions that could have been answered with multiple answers. She lectures straight from the book and expects you to know every statistic presented in class and does not help you prepare for the test.

If you don't go to class, then prepare to for a totally different professor (even if doing well in the course). Can go off on personal tangents, & not totally prepared for class (lectures to hair). If she likes you it has been known to show in grading and considerations... unfortunately for me it was my only college 'F' I ever had. be careful
I really enjoyed her class. She is very fun and always happy. She is always willing to help. As long as you go to class and pay attention you will do good.
Prof. Myers is a very helpful teachers. She makes class fun and there are a lot of documentaries, which is always a plus.
She's fun and enthusiastic.  There are quite a few readings, but it's interesting material and not very dry.  I'd take another class from her.

Rural sociology was such an easy class, especially since I had professor Donnermeyer.  He is very clear, only two midterms (all multiple choice). The final was also multiple choice.  All exam questions are directly from his notes so if you just pay attention in class and read over the notes before the exams you should be able to get an A.
the funniest old guy ever to teach. he always offers so much help to anyone who needs it even though it is the easiest class ever. take it!

Great professor. Always willing to help students. Lectures got a little repetitive sometimes.  Grades were based on three essays.  Go to her office hours beforehand and she will help you improve your paper to get a good grade on it.  Put in a little effort to get a decent grade.  Definitely recommend this class!
She lets the class teach the class... I did not learn anything from this class. She is a nice person but sucks at teaching this class.

I found this class to be kind of boring and dry even though the topics were interesting. All we did was read a bunch of articles then talk about them, the class never changed in any way. She weights her grades more than any other teacher I have had, so if you do bad on the tests you will do bad in the class.

Prof Sayer is amazing!  She is intimidating at first but visit her during office hours and you'll be amazed at how articulate and helpful she can be for class material and anything beyond.  This class was very interesting, lots of reading, and 1 group project, 1 paper, and a midterm and final.  She lays out a study guide to aid your studying.

Sayer is a great instructor! I would say definitely one of the better professors in the sociology department when it comes to gender related subjects. She definitely knows her stuff and her lectures are very precise. Yes, she uses Powerpoints, however, she doesn't read directly from them. She's very generous with her time during her office hours!

I loved the class and can't see how anybody wouldn't find it interesting-it's all about sex, gender, and love!Covers homosexuality to hook-ups to infidelity.Just uses a bunch of journal articles.She has quizzes almost daily, but you retake them at the end of class to correct any answers lecture cleared up. 1 presentation,1 paper. Tests(2) are easy.
feminist teacher, not helpful at all. Didn't respond to my emails, most boring worthless teacher i have ever had, if at all  possible don't take her class.

I really enjoyed her class.  It is a lot of reading, but the information is interesting as well as eye opening.  I feel like I left this class with a new view of the world, as well as some valuable skills.  She is also really helpful when it comes to  questions and comprehension, and her door is always open.

She actually appears to be a nice person overall even appearing reserved initially in her own judgments on a topic in class but you will soon find out that she's very opinionated and doesn't seem to tolerate alternate points of views. Being opinionated is one thing but as a teacher nobody should ever be close-minded. It's not good for learning.
As long as you go to class everyday and pay attention, you'll do fine in her class.  She does lecture power point, but I think she grades fair and is willing to help anyone who asks for it.
Very interesting and obviously knows what she is talking about.  Have to read, do the work, and participate to do well in class. I definitely learned a lot in this class.
Very nice prof! Was extremely helpful and was very quick to respond to any of my emails.  Only complaint is she uses powerpoint for every one of her lectures.
so dry, so boring.  she is way to opinionated so don't even bother to try and voice your opinion during class she will just shut you down.  i hate teachers who read straight from powerpoint.

AWFUL PROF!!!  SHE SHOULDN"T BE TEACHING!  Boring and dry, reads the powerpoint with little explanation.  Uses her own article in the class and asks students to critique it... um of course we're gonna say nice things even though its totally irrelevant info.  Directions very unclear on assignments!!

The beginning was a bit rough because he seemed a little bit nervous. But, after the second week things became cool. I never wanted to skip class because all the lectures were very interesting. The book was pretty lame. I think the book was useless. The exams are a bit challenging but most questions are from class discussions SO BE THERE ON TIME!

Chris started off on a rough note but realized this & took a class survey on how to improve his teaching. The class took his survey & corrected his teaching style accordingly.He gives good examples and goes through them in class. He did tell a student "It's in your notes  sho&uld be obvious" when asked a question. That bothered me.Decent TA though

Chris is a really nice and professional TA. He is a very fair grader and tries his best to make the recitation section go quickly. Even though a lot of people don't enjoy the class, he makes it easier to get through by posting helpful slides and practice problems.

He's the worst. I'm non-traditional student, always get As & I always put in lot of work to ensure I understand material. His lectures unclear & he only writes w/ chalk & charts he puts up are not explained so it's difficult to connect meaning to lecture. He's definately egotistical & if you don't spit out exactlly what he wants you get no credit.

Horrible all around. I went to his office hours and he told me he didnt have time for me I swear on my mothers grave. As well as your final is 80% of your grade he wont let you know whats on anything and if you dont spit out what he thinks is the right its wrong. Avoid him like the plague I got a C- in his class and I am a 3.5 student.
all around awful

Dr. Jacobs makes you earn your own grade. Unlike other professors, Dr. Jacobs does not spoonfeed anything to you. Just because he is difficult does not mean you should not take his class, r gve him horrible rating (see below). If you ask me, these bad ratings came from lazy students, who are used to easy soc professors, classes, and easy A's

Professor Jacobs communicated very well in class. He is stimulating and responsive to students. Although this makes class entertaining, Professor Jacob's style of grading seems to be a bit discouraging. His test questions are not communicated well, and students are left confused to what is expect of them and the proper responses. Professor Jacobs s

This is by far the worst prof you could ever have. I am begging you to stay away from him. He is unfair, egotistical, hard headed and just down right, a jerk. His class could have been interesting and insightful, but due to his lack of preperation for notes, and stubborness, it was a recipe for disaster. STAY AWAY!
How can the university let this guy teach? We are paying to get an education, instead of having to pay more tuition when repeating the class for the second tim e

As hard as math 152, but worse because the rules are totally subjective and he makes them. The good: make up for bad midterm grades with a great final and he uses that as your grade, otherwise good luck. Also the recommendation thing but that's like blood money, I think.

I would not recommend this Prof.  Tests are all essay and uses an unclear competitive grading style. Talks about other schools alot.  Talks alot of smack about the University.  One bonus though is that if you get an A or A- he will give you a letter of recommendation. If you take him make sure you do the reading and show up for every class.
Not very clear in his teachings, hard grader

Uses a blind-grading system when there are only 5 grades in the whole class. Gives false hope to those not doing so well, telling them that if they do better on the final he'll help out (FALSE!!). Arrogant, old man..don't take at all costs. He is a complete jerk.
Class was relatively interesting, but the notes are all over the place and with no actual book...this class is hard.
makes you attend class.   do the readings, attend and interact and you will pass easily.

Took this on the tail of a wonderful soc 101 class to satisfy my second writing course req and was unbelievably disappointed. There were no grades until week seven, which was after people could drop, and nearly everyone failed. Talks about himself, tests are unclear, lectures abstract and even if you go to his office, he is no help. Avoid him!!!!!!

Honors version.  Lectures were interesting, I guess he does talk about himself a lot but it's funny and a lot less boring than most profs.  Very easy, I only read half of the assignments and skipped several classes but easily got an A.  He also made the second paper optional so it was just 2 exams and a paper for a second writing course.

Don't take his class if you arent willing to do A LOT of work. But his class is valuable. If you try, and participate in class, he will help you all he can. If you get an A (and I swear it is possible) he promises you a good recommendation. His bad reputation is exxagerated.
Jacobs was unclear, a horrible lecturer, and never answered the questions asked. Paper assignments were abstract, his criteria changed daily, and there was no grading scale.

He respects honors students; he likes to talk himself up, but not that much.  He always made himself available to talk.  He's big on anonymous grading (has a staff member coordinate a # so he doesn't see names).  His class changed some of hte way I look at poli.  Nice guy...if he thinks you're nice.

He is AWFUL, AWFUL, AWFUL. Only cares about the fact that he has tenure, not teaching. Also a horrible speller, bragger and a loser who couldn't get into law school, so he's happy keeping others out as well. Lawyer wannabe who settled on sociology because he can torture others. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!!!
Horrible speller but good lecturer. I found this class fair and interesting.

Yes, it is a hard class. But all you have to do is do the work and pay attention. Don't take his classes if you aren't a good writer. He is interesting and knowledgable and a very well respected and published.

AWFUL, AWFUL, AWFUL.  All the bad things you hear are not exaggerations-they are TRUE!  Avoid this guy.  He's egotistical and has NO problem letting you know he's got tenure (so he has to REALLY mess up TWICE in one quarter for anything to happen to him.

Has a very narrow view of what constitutes "good sociology." Also seems to have a disturbing habit of deciding early on who the "good" students are. Just very narrow-minded, in general, belittling anything (or anyone) that doesn't conf
Degrades students, braggs about keeping people out of law school.  In general he is just a bad teacher.
Avoid at all cost.  He just talks about himself for a quarter.
Great teacher. Uses the most modern methods currently available. Tests can be difficult if you do not study much. Lots of discussion and enjoyable projects.
She was really friendly and under standing but her tests had nothing to do with what we learned in class.

The subject material sucks but unfortunately it's required. No book required & all information is in the notes. ALL the notes are slides. I'd prefer being shown examples on the board. Homework sucks but she lets you skip the lowest grade. Exams are tough! STUDY the slides. Show up to EVERY class, get the extra credit, do HW, & study slides. Reconme

Great teacher. Gives so much EC that I went into the final with a 98! Lots of examples, easy to follow notes, very nice and ready to explain things. No book. Attendance is mandatory, but you get 5 skips btwn rec and lec. Lots of in class EC so show up. I think I ended wth 25pts of EC in a 400pt class.
great prof, take her if you can

Maggie was a very good professor for this class. She did a very good job explaining the concepts and equations. For a statistics class it wasn't so bad. First midterm is a breeze, if you don't get an A or B there is something seriously wrong. Final is unbeliveably difficult. Class average was a D. She curves the grade so the class doesn't suffer.
She is a good lecturer and she is very helpful. I agree with the other comment; she is cute.
Her class is fun and informative.  And she's cute (which is why i never skipped class).

Even as someone who failed this class, I think he was an awesome teacher. I failed because I didn't go and therefore missed quizzes and such, but I think he taught the material very clearly and I enjoyed class discussion more that I have in any other class. I would (and probably will have to) take him again, haha!

I think that he is a really good teacher. However, when you write your papers and your short answers for the exams, he takes off random points. I honestly don't know what I got wrong half the time. Other than that, not too bad of a class.
Great Professor

I transfered here from another school where I have already gone over this material that was covered in this class. I thought I knew it, but for how this professor taught, I felt that he thought he was talking to grad students already. I would say it was a very hard/intimidating class. He does give pop quizzes but gave us hints to when they were.
Very tough professor. Gave helpful hints for the final and two bonus points. Only one paper toward the end, but he grades it hard. Teaches well.

Very technical about final paper, even about how many lines he wants on a page.  Almost impossible to meet his expectations when writing.  Overall a hard class.  People who have never gotten below a B in college received C's. Didn't give full bonus points we were promised for some things.  Overall, a very disappointing teacher and class.
Extrememly helpful teacher. Helped when you asked. As long as you put in the time and study, you will get a good grade.
awesome teacher.
Great Teacher
Overall a hard class. This prof. made it easier to understand and was very willing to help during office hours. GREAT TEACHER
Open mind person

I loved Deniz!! She is so full of energy and always willing to help students. Grant it she did cancel class for the first week, but she made up for it by being a great lecturer. The book she chose was so hard to understand that I gave up reading it the first day. Just use lecture notes to study for test and the study guides she gives you. Take her!

Deniz was very helpful. If you go out of your way to ask for help, she will usually help out. Although her grading is hard, she was always fair. She talked about the topic and based it on some personal experiences and got the class involved. She also understood when there was something big going on campus and end class early. Great Teacher.

Her lectures are boring. She makes you either take a quiz or do a paper every class meeting so expect to turn in something every class period. Her tests are vague and unclear. She is a hard grader on papers and essays. Her accent is hard to understand sometimes. I would sugguest another prof if possible!

She is very boring with her lectures and makes you do quizzes and writting assignments every week. The quizzes are just busy work and her promises of helping us out with bonus points never were executed.Watch out with her tests, they are vague and unclear.

She's the cats meow. I went to class everyday just to see her. Actually, she's a great TA that loves to help you when her busy schedule allows. If you are looking for a lax class maybe you should look elsewhere. She's tough but she's fair. No worries about the accent.
Deniz is very outgoing and very willing to help out with anything that you need.
She's an alright teacher. Watch out for her accent, though...it gets hard to understand at times.
Her online classes are extremely intriguing and she is exceptionally fair about things. The layout makes it quite simple compared to other online courses.
Dr. Mika is AWESOME! As long as you keep up with reading assignments and don't put off writing assignments, this class is a breeze.

Marie was great! VERY approachable and understanding. Grading is extremely fair and although the class required little work, I was still able to get a lot out of the daily discussions. Interesting topics, discussion format, and a truely interested and enthusiastic professor. A wonderful GEC.
Best Psychology teacher in the world!!!

Professor Mika was absolutely fantastic.  Her seminars were engaging, her readings interesting, and she was constantly sharing additional materials with the class.  The best instruction I've ever had in an introductory course

Marie was one of the most helpful and attentive teachers I've had. She was very flexible. Be prepared to discuss the material in class - she loves participation, but if you make yourself known class will be a breeze. She isn't overly demanding; I would recommend the class to anyone.
Excellent teacher! I learned a lot and she didn't just give busy work. She grades fair and let's you know what she expects. She is also really understanding. Take anything she teaches!

She is really nice, and very understanding. There are a few papers due, and see is fair when grading them. There isn't attendance...but there are 'pop' quizzes, but the lowest one is dropped. Highly recommend her as a teacher.

Marie is great.  She encourages you to think for yourself and defend your opinions through class discussions and the papers.  Our tests were open notes (but you still learned a lot by compiling your answers).  She is younger, very helpful, and really wants to get you to learn in her class.  I would definitely recommend her!!
Marie is Great!  The tests were easy and mainly common sense.  I enjoyed going to her class and would definately recommend her if you want an easy A.
She's great!!!  Super helpful...
she is very nice with a big heart she enjoy student interaction and the material is easy. i recommend this class to anyone that wants an easy A.

The overall format of teaching is not the greatest.  The first half of the quarter was interesting, but the second half of the quarter was spent discussing (entirely) the opinions and personal experiences of the students.  I would have prefered to spend my tuition studying more factual information.
Awesome class and great teacher. Readings were very interesting and there was alot of discussion and friendly debates. Paper was long but not hard.
Marie is an awesome teacher! You can tell she really really loves what she teaches and is willing to help any student and is very understanding of their issues!  Great instructor!
No Comments

Definitely a very nice professor, easy grader, very passionate about what she does...But man that class was boring. Attendance was mandatory, and sitting through that class was usually worse than watching paint dry. Dr. Schoenfeld is awesome, but this class is boring as heck. I'd love to take a more interesting class with her, maybe with research.

The course was amazing. I was interested in the material so boredom was not an experience of mine. Attend every class because though she doesn't seem to be taking attendance, she is. Other that attending, reread slides and you'll be fine.

She is such a nice person. Like the nicest woman you'll ever meet but I find her lecture style kind of boring. She was interesting at the beginning, she would have us do group discussions and participate but now she just lectures on boring material. I have taken 5 soc classes and this material is by far the most boring.

Doesn't actually take off for missing class; however he expects you to know the material if you miss one. Although exams are somewhat difficult if not tedious, he's extremely understanding if you do less than desired and helps you out extra credit wise. He's also hilarious.
Interesting class

While writing the paper for his class is making me reconsider, I LOVE TODD! He really helped me think about things in a way that I had not before. Also, he is really great to students and his cynical attitude makes me laugh. Also,Todd is hot, and as we learned in his class I can say that without it being offensive because he's a dude.

I think he's a great T.A, genuinely interested and captivating for those who don't take themselves too damn seriously, all of my friends who have taken him love him.  He's not brainwashed all of these people into thinking he's a good T.A: he's witty, tells fantabulous stories, likes good music and quote's Dane cook! Come ON NOW.
No Comments

Todd is the unfortunate TA of a student who has no sense of humor and probably does not contribute to the class in any way, so therefore Todd is the one that sucks.  At first, Todd did seem odd, but his wife is named after Spiderman's gf, he's gotta be cool.  who cares if hes conceited and has comical attacks on people? arguing is fun, loser

I like him. He is funny, helps when you ask questions, clearly wants us to learn a lot, and is very intelligent. I also find him very respectful of students. I would take another class and recommend him to friends.
No Comments
There seems to be some debate whether this guy is a jerk.  He is.  Class was a total comedy routine, but not funny.
No Comments
OVERRATED!

his class started out fun and energetic now, it's just rambling. he talks excessively, most of the time about unrealated stuff (such as him self or taking person stabs at students.) if he were not so conceited the class would be much better.
Took him a couple of quarters ago. He is "ok" at best. Don't believe the hype!
No Comments
What a great, guy/teacher comedian.  Todd rocks.
this guy is so hot... i love how he makes everything so interesting. it's so easy to learn when you're staring at his cute face. i love his class. believe me girls, his class is so worth it!

Todd has made a class that I took for scheduling reasons one of my favorite classes at OSU. He is energetic, funny, and interesting and I am just really appreciating his class and the effort that he puts in for his students. BONUS, his personality and looks make him very "spongeworthy".
Todd is a great instructor. His class was the only class that I have ever looked forward to going. He has a great teaching style and he constantly makes you laugh.

Hilarious, Intelligent, Nice, and HOT!!!! If Todd were not married I would pursue him until the end of time! He makes boring topics exciting and effectively covers all aspects of a topic. You should take a class from him if you ever have the chance!!!
HOT
Great class

Todd is by far the best professor I've ever had.  He's great with his students and his classes are interesting.  His hilarious comments and lectures keep us coming back.  I would definitly recommend taking all of his classes!
best..teacher...ever. i've laughed so hard i've cried in his classes. it's like having a really hot friend teach an interesting class. tests are lengthy, but easy, and his notes are thorough
Really good teacher!! he's absolutely hilarious. Only class i've ever gone to because i WANT to. definitely would recommend.
He's sweet, HOT and very good at teaching.  I learned so much from him!  Take him if you can.

This class was awesome. Todd is a great professor who knows how to keep students interested. As long as you go to class, you can earn bonus points. His exam reviews kick ass. A great professor who caters to the students need.

Mr. Shah is a good lecturer and very interesting to listen to. He addresses many current world issues and discusses them in an unbiased and informed manner. He tends to come off as a bit of jerk and self-important though.

One of the best professors I've had at OSU by far.  Very interesting lectures and keeps students engaged in the class.  The topics were eye opening and he tried to get students to tailor the class towards their own major to make it even more interesting.
I loved this class! Shah made it very fun and interesting.  Really neat in class activities and assignments! I would definitely recommend him!!!
Great teacher! It was a great 597 class, very interesting and eye-opening. Great lecturer, his classes were rarely boring. Got an A by attending classes, taking notes.
Shah is an awesome professor. Print out the notes, go to lecture, read the articles, listen, and you will get an A. Textbook use is very minimal. I got an A without the book.

I was expecting a dry class, but I felt like I could sit in class all day and listen to him lecture. He really opened up my eyes to the rest of the world around me. Class discussions really got me thinking, but keep them factual - he's not too fond of opinionated ignorance. It's an upperclassmen class and he definitely expects that of his students.

He knows the material and this is reflected in his lectures which he keeps interesting.  It is important to attend lecture becuase the power point slides only summerizes the lecture.  The readings he assigns are interesting and build on what is covered by lectures.

I have to say, I wasn't looking forward to this class but I like it!  The topic is interesting and he is great at explaining the subject matter.  If you come to class (like you should) and ask simple questions when you are confused, he will clarify anything you don't understand. The assignments aren't bad either.
hate
show up to class and pay attention.  do the reading and you will do fine.  behave like an adult and you'll have no problems with him

Overall an ok guy... He gets pretty verbose and often catches himself making up words in lecture, so be prepared for that. Otherwise, he's thorough in explaining details that are crucial to understand research methodology. If you can manage the boring material, you'll learn a lot from Mr. Shah

Extremely interesting lectures. Go to class to get the random participation points. Take good notes & read the chapters and you're golden. Fun paper topics [experiment & reflection]. If you don't like to participate then I wouldn't recom. taking this. You will speak in this class about your opinions!

Great teacher. I took this class at night, and expected to be wanting to get out of there as soon as possible, but Shah always held my interest until the end of class. Great lecturer, and really gets everyone involved in discussion. I would recommend taking his class!
Keeps you interested. Go to class. Helpful, be sure to talk to him after class.
I really liked him. He made class interesting, and did not make anyone feel dumb for voicing their opinions. He did a good job of relating information to real life.
Great teacher.  Made class interesting and fun.

Very good teacher, makes sure everyone fully understands books and topics before moving on... helped to make some sense out of Lundman when we started getting confused about his methods. Very enthusiastic about teaching, you can tell he really loves being a Grad TA... I recommend getting into his recitation, you will get an A if you pay attention

There's a decent amount of reading but it's not too hard.  Many classes will have a quick writing assignment (3-4 sentence reaction to a concept) that is your "attendance" grade.  I don't get how she's a 2.7, I showed up about 50% of the time and got a B.  Her tests are scantron and not that hard if you pay attention and read.

She takes random attendance - so go to every class. She talks really fast & studdars so I recommend you record her lectures. Her lectures are 90% graphs that will be translated to 50 or 100 question multiple choice. No curve and only 4 assignments (2 exams & 2 papers) for the whole semester.
Great professor. Really loves to teach. Loved the class. Grades the papers harshly and you definitely have to study for exams because there's a lot of content. Overall though, enjoyed the class.

She is a very enthusiastic and supportive. Lectures can get very boring very quickly, but that tends to be the nature of college classes. She does talk pretty fast, but will ask to make sure you understood the material. One midterm and final (study guides given), group project and participation. Do the work and studying and get the grade you want.

Professor Dwyer is a thoroughly outstanding instructor who took a real interest in my success.  She strikes a careful balance between imparting information and allowing free discussion.  If I could repeat this class every quarter, I would (and I'd bet I'd learn something new every time!)  I cannot speak highly enough of the overall experience.
She is incredibly frustrating to listen to - she tends to stutter and ramble a lot. Ridiculous amount of reading assigned, and her grading is tough despite unclear expectations. Not recommended.

Honestly, I have nothing but positive things to say about this teacher.  She was very friendly and approachable.  The class was generally interesting and her expectations were clear most of the time.  She allowed me to move my final time to a more convenient time, which I greatly appreciated.  I would definitely recommend taking her course.
She was hard to follow...maybe needs to update her technology use in class. She doesn't like to give A's on her papers.

EXCELLENT PROF! She is SO smart! Talks very quickly, and is easy to zone out so bring a snack or soda to class. Go to class every day and take detailed notes (try to write everything she says) and you will do okay. Promptly responds to emails and is understanding of personal problems that conflict with class. Highly recommended(esp 4 soc majors)!

I took this as a GEC course and while she is helpful, responds quickly to emails, and is enthusiastic and funny, she graded hard, took bad notes on the board, and got off track and confusing sometimes during lecture. I worked really hard for a poor grade, so I'd advise taking this with another professor or a finding a different GEC.

The discussions we had were very interesting for the most part--Dwyer takes input from a lot of people which is important. A lot of the readings are DRY, and sometimes she grades as if we were sociology majors (I don't think think one of us was). Sometimes she made the material really interesting, and sometimes I couldn't help but bring sudoku.
Extremely helpful and kept the class entertaining.

This professor was very enthusiastic, she was willing to help and very easy to talk to. She doesn't make it mandatory to come to class but if you do majority of what's on the exams is talked about. The first exam was very easy but the final was kind basically to get the slackers.....
I was really inspired by her! She makes things really interesting and she's really easy to talk to!  I want to look into the social stratification minor, that's how interesting she made the class!

This class was my favorite class ever at OSU (and I am a science major!) and she was probably the best prof I have ever had either. 2-5 pg essays,2 exams, and participation determine your grade. Fair grader...more than willing to help on essays. I didnt think tests were hard if you had good notes and of course studied! AMAZING! Take her class!

Wonderful lecturer, keeps things interesting and fun, and loves to have debates/conversations among the class.  She is a very fair grader, but don't expect to be able to slack off.  Just pay attention in class, read the book, and do your work, and you'll be fine.  Highly recommended.

Very interesting lecturer.  Kept most students interest.  Made subject matter interesting and easy to understand.  Creates her own exams so they went along with what was learned in lecture.  I had two 5 page papers to do for the class but they were nothing super difficult.

This was a really hard class, but she is  a fair grader and very intelligent. You can tell how passionate she is about the subject matter just by how involved she gets into her talks in class. Her lectures are really concise and, at times, even stunning. I hate sociology but I would take another class with her anyday.

love love love this prof.  her lectures are interesting and she knows with extreme detail what she is talking about.  she makes classes interesting by addressing relevant issues.  always willing to go out of her way to help students if they need it.  take her!  friends had her for h101 and they liked her too!

She's a great teacher, and she made H101 extremely fun, interesting & relateable.  She's a bit of a tough grader, but it's nothing unreasonable.  I agree though, if you take H101, take it with her.  And make sure you speak up.  She likes people who talk a lot.

Great class, great prof. Talks a little fast, but you get used to it after the first week. Good discussion, and very interesting class. She knows what she is teaching and how she teaching it well. Great sense of humor. If you're going to take H101, take it with her!
Tends to go on and on just to make the lecture last the full class time. Tests are insanely hard no matter how hard u study, notes can't even save u! Goodluck staying awake in her class!

She's one of the best professor's I've had at OSU so far. She's incredibly helpful, gives lectures with amazing clarity, and you can tell that she's really interested in the subject and passes that on to the students. Her tests tend to be essays, but if you pay attention in class you'll be fine!

Be sure that you can attend before enrolling. 3 misses= failure. NON-NEGOTIABLE. "tell your grandparents not to die"-type non-negotiable. Other than that, the class is great. You learn much about how to apply for various agencies, FBI, NSA, ATF, etc from agents themselves. Very inflexible, but VERY instrumental for those looking for careers in gov

He is a polite jerk!! Heaven forbid if you were not 15 minutes early and you wore something that was not appropriate in his eyes for example a hoodie sweat shirt, gym shorts, sweat pants and anything else that wasn't business attire. " You are young professionals take some pride in the way you look."

If you are in the National Guard or Reserves you will not be able to take his class. His course policy is that is you miss 4 or more classes for any reason you will fail. He doesn't care if you get called up to service during the semester or you can't get away from drill weekends. He has no regard for the Serviceman Relief Act at all.
recitation was mostly spent working on the research paper. this part was fine because she basically went through how to do every part of the paper. but the exam reviews were useless.
wasn't willing to help outside of office hours. really harsh grader never helped guide you on what you missed.

GREAT guy, not so great professor. Doesn't grade materials throughout course so no idea regarding what you're going to end up with. Stuff on midterms that wasn't in class but its a pretty easy course so the midterms are easy. Weekly readings with easy pop quiz each week. Read the articles, you'll pass. He takes attendance for participation grade

Paul is probably one of the best lecturer I have met in OSU (up there with Jim Talamo from MATH) He gives really good feedback and advices for the paper ( I was taking a second year writing class). He is funny in class and really do care about his students. He greets students at the beginning of the class by high-fiving them! Take him if you can.

Passionate about the material. Has a very dry and sarcastic humor which is funny. Takes the time to give feedback( A LOT). Lots of long readings and pop quizzes. Material in class does not go into depth but overall a good class.

Paul was a great intro professor, and a pretty cool person too. He is super helpful, and always available if you need help. The  lectures can be kind of boring sometimes, but it's quite easy if you go to class. Opens every class with a high five and loves demonstrations and in-class activities.

I loved this class and the professor. He is willing to help you whenever you ask or don't as for it. I was having trouble in the beginning and after meeting with him once I got an A on every in class paper and passed all the test. TAKE THIS CLASS!

Professor Carruth is probably one of the best sociology professors on campus. He is there to really make sure you get a good grade in the class and is very approachable and friendly (he opens the class by giving every student a high five!). There is definitely work to the course, probably because I took it over the summer. Would take again!!!!
He is awesome!
He was a very interesting TA, and even though it was rough getting up and going to in the morning he made it worth it.
Random participation points. Tests are straight from the powerpoints and multiple choice. The class is laid back and generally easy to sit through.
She's alright. Her class is easy.Sometimes counts attendance, occasional pop easy quizzes. 2 exams, 2 novels to read and 1 paper. Go off topic a lot during lecture so you'll laugh often.
Awesome teacher

Ryan is a good TA. He sometimes over explains the material and gives too much information but he's definitely a TA worth having. He's very helpful, quick to answer emails, willing to meet after class, and happy to explain things further when asked.

Terribly boring. Tests on trivial knowledge from lectures, readings, and videos. Takes an interesting topic and bores you to death with it. Avoid his class if you are interested in learning anything, but take the class if you have difficulty sleeping. Two things are certain with this class; you will regret ever enrolling but  sleep like a baby.

I cannot believe I paid for this type of instruction. Just because he is easy doesn't mean he is good.

He is super easy.  He gives you the choice of a multiple choice or essay test and he gives you possible ?s that will appear on the tests.  His lecture were verbatim from the textbook so i just slept through class and read.  SUPER EASY!!! and he is HOTT

not proffessional

Good guy for not being affiliated with the material he was asked to teach. He really tried to relate course material to the real world, which is outstanding considering gangs is not his forte.
