james is very nice and very cute. laid back, really prepares you for exams. the only thing i didn't like about him was how he grades; seemed like no matter how much time and effort i put into write ups, i never got full points. it was very frustrating that he was such a subjective grader.
He is nice and keeps recitation fun. He goes over exam reviews pretty heavily which was great.

He talks REALLY fast but is willing to repeat himself.  Plenty of extra credit offered, although it was wasnt really needed.  It wasnt all that difficult but it might have been watered down a bit since we had seniors and kids taking  their first college class ever.

The pace made it hard to keep up but he did provide a review sheet.  He talked REALLY fast but was willing to repeat things whenever necessary.  He changed the format of the class a bit based on midquarter reviews...like putting basic power points on carmen.  Not an easy A but offered plenty of extra credit.  He def liked teaching.
Oh my god, this class is really easy to get A. I am still taking it thou. So far, I got A. If you attend a class, you definitely will get an A. There are 2 midterms and 1 final. all multiple choices.

he's amazing!! loved him

Read the book and take notes you'll do fine on his exams. He's very helpful if you need it and offers extra credit. Stopped giving reading quizzes. Exams are really easy as long as you show up and read. Very entertaining as well.
Very good teacher, gives entertaining lectures and usually gives good indication of what the test will be like, also, much of the test questions come from the book so make sure to read!

Good prof. Tests are very specific at times, but if you do the readings you'll be fine. Has frequent reading quizzes almost every class, takes attendance, but gives extra credit once or twice in the quarter. Very knowledgeable and intellectually stimulating professor.

This subject is kinda hard. She does a good job of trying to make it understandable but the test are kinda hard to study for. Make sure you go to class and read the assign reading and you will for be fine. She's also good at grading papers.
easy material and super helpful. she's really interested in the subject and will do her best to help you understand anything. definitely take her classes if you have the chance!

great teacher. you have to write 3 of 4 writing assignments but they are all really easy and 2-4 pages max. the tests are very easy also. she takes attendance so you have to go but lectures usually end early (like 30-40 minutes). i read the book but i guess you dont need to. the book is really easy to follow though and reading assignmets are short.

She is REALLY good - probably the best choice for this class by FAR. Fair grader, good, relevant lectures. She gets the material and presents it well without purposely making it hard or boring. Awesome teacher

ugh.  part of the problem was that she is unorganized and does a difficult project.  does not do 487 like most teachers.  avoid if possible.

very nice guy, trying to make stuff easy to learn! very helpful!
Very helpful and approachable.  Explains things well.

She is a fantastic teacher! She will do anything for her students to help them understand the material.  I personally thought the tests were hard because they were almost all multiple choice. But the papers were easy and graded very fairly!  Great teacher, wish I could have her again.
sweetest prof ever! So nice and helpful... had a great time in class and she really helped us understand the material. Wish i could take her again~

Lindsey is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. She does anything for you to understand the material. A couple papers were required, but not hard at all. Exams were super easy. Come to class and take notes and you will get an A for sure. Her smile and humor will bring you to class;)

Lindsey is really nice but the worst part about her class is how she just reads the power points to you.  You can always ask a classmate for the elaborations, so you don't really need to go to class.  There aren't very many points in the class, so the tests and papers are worth a lot but she grades them very easily.

She is one of the nicest professors i have EVER had. She is always willing to help you. There is no need to buy the book bc all of the tests are based right off the notes. You have to go got class though, bc she leaves blanks in the notes. Very easy if you study. Easy A
Lindsey was great!  Always willing to help and layed out the guidlines for research that made it easy.  Anyone who needs this class should definitely take it with her.  You will learn a lot!

Probably one of the nicest, most helpful, and caring professors I have had at OSU. She makes everything crystal clear and explains things so anybody could understand. If you are looking for a good professor take Soc 487 with her!
She was really interested in teaching and the midterm were really easy the in class assignments were also easy.  She allows you to design your own research.
Lindsay was very helpful! She made the material easy to understand and was always very enjoyable! Take the class with her if you can!

Lindsey is super nice and really easy going.  She's laid back and enjoyable as a professor.  I don't have an interest in sociology, but it wasn't too bad.  She's not strict about class attendance and usually lets us out early.  Overall, I would recommend her to others!

She usually reads her lectures right from the powerpoint, but I think it's because she's nervous. She's adorable and helpful. the class was interesting and actually opened me up to some other fields that I hadn't thought I would enjoy. The assignments were actually fun and related well to the material. I'd take this class again.
She was very good and understanding. plus the class was very easy as long as you attend.
Lindsey was really nice and always willing to help us with questions. The class was interesting and the books weren't bad either, even though you really don't have to read them. Take her if you can!
Really nice and helpful to students.
I lvoed this class and this professor.
Easy class, nice professor.
Very nice T.A. She is always willing to help students and tries very hard to help students understand the information even when the instructor sucks.

I love Lindsey! She gives you the powerpoint slides and then elaborates on them. You do have to take some notes because essay questions on tests sometimes go off of her elaborations (she gives you the essay questions before the tests). Tests are easy if you study, papers are very easy, and she's a nice person. Go to every class and pay attention!

Nice Lady, but  terrible teacher. She just reads the power point right to you. She doesn't give many examples to explain theories. It think the class was pretty boring. I would not take this class again. I lierally had trouble staying awake.

A nice lady, truly interested in teaching; but she seemed very nervous.All of the topics are  mildly interesting, but the whole darn class is based on study after study and theory after theory. It's hard to find a connection to everyday life.
This class was so easy.  She gives you the essay questions before the exam.  Enough said.

She was the TA for this class and did a much better job than the instructor.  She was extremely willing to help and read rough drafts.  Plus her explanations were so much better.  And her grading was very fair.

She was the rec. leader for my soc 549 class. I aced the class with above a 100%, but Xin is worthless. Her English is incomprehensible, and she just DOESN'T get teaching- the closest thing to "teaching" she did was doing the homework problems on the board...I would avoid her at all costs. PLUS- she was never EVER in her office hours...
Xin was very helpful with her students. If you had any questions over any of the assignments she was more than willing to make sure you got the material down.
TA for Dr. Carr for soc 487.  Xin was very friendly and always willing to help, but her english is very rough and she is often difficult to understand.  Great girl though.
